When I called Cuisinart they said that I have to send it to their wear house “for evaluation “. They would not cover any shipping/ handling and there were no guarantee that it will be fixed because it is not clear if the cattle has “manufacturer defect”. It does not make any sense to pay for shipping/handling because I would buy a new cattle for the same price. Newer again!!

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot to like, but could be better
reviews.reviewText:
I made the leap and purchased this item because I enjoy a nice cup of loose tea leaves from time to time. I had been keeping my eye on this and finally decided to use some christmas money to make the purchase. Don't get me wrong, this is a great product and it heats water in no time. The stainless steel color is great, and really makes it look fancy.

Pros: This heats water very quickly and maintains the temperature if you leave it on the preferred temperature. Though there are a few buttons, it is easy to use. Even selecting the boil temperature setting and placing cold tap water in the product, it took no more than 5 min. Easily attaches into it electrical base.

Cons: Hard to clean, and difficult to fully allow to dry. SInce the lid pops up and is the most narrow part of the item, not a lot of air can get in to dry the product. Even worse, the filter is an awesome feature, but gets in the way of using a cloth to dry it.
The heating tray at the bottom actually discolored after only the second use. I don't believe this is a problem as it is similar to a stainless steel pot discoloration, but it is annoying for how much I spent.

Conclusion: Worth the money, but the design could be better. You should consider it if you have no issue leaving it on your counter to air dry for an extended period of time.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's only pretty when it comes of of the box
reviews.reviewText: It's only pretty when it comes of of the box. It's virtually impossible to clean it, your fingerprints will get all over it, and you wont be able to get it off. So it constantly looks like it's dirty. Everyone in the household has already got a burn from this kettle, we used to have a different model that did not get hot in the jar, so maybe we were just used to that, this one instead gets really hot and we got burns by touching it... be aware if you have children in the house. Also, after 6 months it completely stopped working... the lights turn on, but the water remains cold, and after a couple minutes t starts beeping until you unplug it. DO NOT BUY IT! I am literally shopping for another kettle right now, the last think you want when you spend $100 on a kettle is to be back in the market 6 months later looking for another one... i wish i had kept my cheap looking kettle, it worked for over 10 years, and at least i would have hot water now. Thank goodness for Amazon and their outstanding customer services to get this resolved!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty reliable, but kind of pricey. Good features, if you want temperature settings.
reviews.reviewText:
This has been a solid performer in my kitchen for over two years, but it finally gave up the ghost. It has been a solid performer, and a couple of it's features are very nice:

1- it can be set to stay on, so you a continuous supply of boiling water available
2- the temperature settings are reasonably accurate
3- it is good about not letting you start it if the water level is low

Downsides- the water level is not easy to read until you lift the pot, or push the buttons. After this happens it lights up and is very clear.
The values wear off the buttons after a lot of use
It is hard to clean. The matte finish is easy to get dirty and it does not scrub down very easily, so it can get stained.

Overall...I am considering buying another one to replace it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hope I don't regret this review! I DO, NOW UPDATED.
reviews.reviewText:
I love this kettle. Green tea is fantastic now. My french press coffee isn't scorched. Easy to use controls. The 30 minute temperature hold makes it very convenient for the morning couple that have different schedules. I have only had this kettle for a few weeks and having read many of the reviews, I only hope that mine keeps working for a good, long time. This would make a great wedding present. Recommended.

Update: April 16, 2018
Well, after having owned this kettle for 5 years, I will now give you the reasons why I would never purchase it again, and why anyone considering purchasing it should look elsewhere.
1) Temperature regulator does not function correctly. For example, I set the temperature every morning for 205 degrees. The kettle beeps when it has reached that temp, but according to my thermometer, it is only 194 degrees. That makes a real difference when brewing coffee. The machine then immediately kicks back on and goes to a boil. BAD.
2) The indicator buttons labels have long worn away. If I didn't know what they were, no one would have a clue. CHEAP.
3) Spout is not conducive to a coffee pour over AND the ergonomics of this machine are out of balance.
My next kettle will be the Bonavita 1.7L Digital Variable Temperature Gooseneck Kettle I purchased this for my friend in November and have had the chance to use it. FAR better in EVERY respect.
Stay away from the Cuisinart.

Update: D.O.A. 09/14/18

reviews.reviewTitle: Warrenty is useless. ship it back yourself & pay them $15 ...
reviews.reviewText: TWO of these units lasted JUST BARELY ONE YEAR. Normal use. Turned on maybe 2 X's / day. Warrenty is useless. ship it back yourself & pay them $15 to ship one that works! HA! I am going to Target for a $12. pot. No headaches.

reviews.reviewTitle: a bit expensive but a good kettle!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this just on the reviews/comments from others. this is the quietest metal kettle I've owned. for some reason metal kettles are louder than glass. I had a popular glass kettle that was so quiet you didn't even know it was boiling from the other side of the kitchen. when the handle was starting to make crack noises when lifting it up I got nervous. I did my homework and this is where I ended up. this is pretty darn quick and what's more, it keeps reheating the water FOR you till you shut it off or it senses the water level getting too low. it beeps when the water if ready to the temp setting. I like the different temp settings because I DO drink green tea. I really had no idea green tea should not be put into boiling water and yes, it does make a difference in the flavor. green tea is not bitter when steeped in hot/not boiled water. I also use this to boil water for my morning oatmeal which is not necessary to have boiling water, just needs to be good and hot. this has a nice wide handle that is a good shape to grip even when this is full/full weight. I also like being able to see the water level with out having to open and look in. the lid pops up with the push of a button and flips back plenty far enough to easily fill. it's a bit "star trek'y" with all the lights and the flashing but overall definitely a good purchase if you want a good versatile kettle.

I didn't know how much I needed one of these until I got it. It's so much more convenient than heating water on the stovetop or in the microwave. And it looks cool on the counter. Water heats up fast, and it's at the perfect temperature for whatever tea or coffee we're drinking at the time.

The only thing I'd like would be a larger capacity, since my husband and I like to fill two French presses with his coffee and my Teecchino on the weekends. We have to do two batches of hot water for that. If you overfill the container, water will get all over the counter.

One tip for new owners that I would recommend is to make sure that the light is blinking after you press start to get the water heated. Sometimes I forget to check this, and when I come back, the light is on, but no hot water.

Despite the four star review, I wouldn't trade this kettle for any of the other ones that I've seen for sale. I did a lot of research on electric kettle before I settled on the Cuisinart, and I believe I made the right choice. Our food processor and blender are Cuisinarts too, and I'm very happy with their performance and simplicity, so perhaps there's a bit of brand loyalty at work here also.

I had one of these that lasted for 10 years and it just bit the dust so I re-ordered. Best electric kettle on the market. I like the auto turnoff feature, and how I can tailor the water temp to my desired level. Since I make a lot of oolong and herbal teas, I like being able to heat water to below boiling.

This is the best electric kettle that anyone can own. With the keep warm and no boil features this kettle is a must for anyone who has ever had cold water or burnt up a kettle. The water is boiling regardless of the temperature that you set the kettle at and no need to worry about filling it as the open button makes it easy to fill.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great little kettle.
reviews.reviewText: This is a great electric kettle. The water temperature settings work great. It has a keep warm setting that will keep heating up the water for 30 minutes, if you're someone that forgets to make your tea or coffee when the water is finished boiling. I did notice things sticking to the bottom of the kettle where the heating coils are only after a few uses. This should be ok because even after a couple months of use it has still stayed about the same. Just have to clean it with a water/vinegar mixture every couple months and it will be like new.

Compared to less expensive Hot Water Kettles, I like the ability to select the temperature of the water. I've used it daily for a few month, without a heating problem. I did notice that the water did not pour smoothly and determined it was the filter screen, by trying a friend's filter screen in my kettle. I contacted the company and they promptly sent me a replacement screen - problem solved.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like it, but here's why you might not
reviews.reviewText:
Overall, I like this. It heats water quickly, provides no-nonsense controls and looks very nice in our kitchen. I'm rating it 5 stars and used it every day for the past month.

Still, reviews are all about discovering those little nitpicks.

- The water gauge is a little finicky, and even if you hold the pitcher straight vertically under the faucet, sometimes the gauge will not fill up and accurately show the water level. A bit of tilt one way or another will force water in there, and then it's accurate but there has been once or twice when I wondered why it wasn't filling up.

- Secondly, the spout doesn't have any sort of cover on it. After walking into the room and finding our cat rubbing himself on/around the spout, we decided that it ought to be covered. Be aware that there IS a filter between the water tank and the spout, and this filter looks high quality and removable for cleaning so none of that dust would actually get into the water. It's just the area which is made for pouring is open to the air, which we don't like. My wife was learning to knit, so she crafted something just the right size to cover the top and keep the dust/cat fur off.

So that's the full disclosure review, and the positives (listed in other reviews, I'm sure) outweigh the negatives so much that I can't even ding it for a star. But other folks might be more picky than us. It really does heat water quickly, and looks great.

It looked very good out of the box. Beautifully crafted stainless steel.
However, part of the reasons why I wanted this was the built-in filter. That one didn't work too well. I still needed an external filter on my cups. That was the first blow.
Then I overlooked that because I really liked the kettle.
But today, it's completely dead. Yep! Stopped working after a month, and I have to go back to using a kettle I bought for 20 bucks or less over 7 years ago!
That's a shame.
That! instantly strikes out other Cuisinart items I had on my purchase list.

I didn't even know that different types of tea require different temperature water. This kettle is the bomb! I have an electric stove so it takes way too long to boil water. With this kettle, I turn it on and by the time I take a mug out of the cupboard, get a teabag out of the pantry, and walk back to the kettle, it's boiling!

I have used this kettle for 4 or 5 months now and i have to say i'm very impressed. I've taken a liking to loose leaf tea, and when one goes down that path one finds that the water temperature starts to make a difference with some of the more delicate green and white teas. This thing works quickly and allows you to set the temperature to common settings needed for loose teas. I can set it to boil for black and herbal teas, and i can set it to cooler temps for greens. Overall i'm very impressed with this unit. I have used it probably 200 times or so since i purchased it, and it has worked consistently the entire time. I have found that it runs best and most consistently when you keep it half full.

If you like a high quality cup of tea in the evening without all the prep work, this unit will serve you well.

Actually liked it very much until today when the heating element stopped working. It was only 21 months old, yet outside warranty. I paid $84 for it in 2015. Way too expensive to get less than two years out of it. Planned obsolescence?

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Kettle to Serve All Your Needs
reviews.reviewText:
I have had this kettle over a year now and noticed that I hadn't reviewed it yet. I use this kettle on a daily basis. When I make tea, it is really nice to get the water to the exact temperature. I set the temperature of the kettle and then add it to my cup or tea pot and let the tea steep. I have a coffee pot but on mornings I just want one really good cup, I use the French press setting. This kettle is also useful for things outside of drinks. It's great to heat up water for oatmeal. The no drip pour actually works and I've never had a problem with it. The stay warm will keep the pot at the desired temperature for awhile in case you need to make more than one cup of tea.

There are two minor quirks. The first is if you turn it off, take it off the plate, then put it back on, a blue glow will appear on your last setting. It won't actually heat the water up but the blue glowing light is on for no reason. The other is you want to clean it out when you see buildup. I use 1 part vinegar to 4 parts water and set it to a boil. I pour it out and then fill it with water, boil it again and its good as new.

I've owned a few different kettles over the years and this is by far the best one. It's been almost one year, so I wanted to write a quick review addressing the lettering durability issue. After reading several complaints that the lettering rubs off, I was sure to always handle the kettle with clean, dry hands. In almost a years worth of daily use, the kettle still looks brand new. No issues with faded lettering. This kettle is quick, accurate and reliable. What else do you need? Just buy it.

This hot water kettle from Cuisinart is a well made, high quality device that easily exceeds the quality and performance of others I've previously owned. Although the device is a bit large in height for my taste, the unit is fast, is fully 100% stainless steel on the inside, and even has a series of buttons on the handle that allows you to bring the water to a series of pre-specified temperatures (for white tea, green tea, oolong tea, etc.). The unit also has a nice blue back lighting feature that automatically turns on when you set the kettle on the electrical contact pad (allowing you to easily see how much water is in the pot), and the buttons themselves light up when depressed so you can verify which temperature you have selected.

As with most stainless steel kettles, be warned that the exterior can become quite hot after a full boil. Use the handle for all your contact, though, and you'll never notice it.

The balance on the unit is good, although not as good as some of the smaller, more roundish-shaped kettles which have the center of gravity directly below your hand at all times. However, the balance is fine, particularly considering the amount of water you can boil in the unit.

The kettle does get loud for about 30 seconds during initial warm-up. This is part of the price you pay for a fast boil. For the rest, it is quiet. The beep upon reaching the set temperature is pleasantly smooth to the ears.

THe kettle is a bit more expensive than others, but I've owned many over the years, and now wish this one had been available before, because I would not hesitated to buy it. Five stars.

Since the birth of our twins six months ago, this kettle has been running for a good portion of every day. We love the various temperature settings, as well as the keep warm function and the clear water level indicator. Excellent quality - highly recommended! Update: May 2017 the kettle stopped shutting off and now just boils continuously but we would still recommend this product and we just purchased a second one. It withstood 10 months of running more than half the day (and night) to make hot water to heat bottles and tons of tea.

Update: After a thorough scrubbing just to be sure, we found that the old kettle just had gunk in the button panels. (Probably baby food!) As of July, the old kettle is still going strong! The new one is waiting in the wings just in case. What a great product!

Just got my ne Cuisinart kettle and have used it once, so this is just a first impression. Even though the weight is stated as 1 lb., I found this heavy to lift, particularly with water in it. Now that said, I have a right shoulder rotator cuff injury so I've lost some muscle power in that arm temporarily. I'm in PT so I expect to gain back strength in that arm. Also the handle, as has been noted, is a bit wide. I guess that's to accommodate the different temperature displays, but really, Cuisinart needs to fix this. Also, the beep that tells you when your water has reached the right temperature isn't very loud. You really have to be listening for it. A.M.'s are busy at my house and unless I was standing near the pot I didn't hear it. That was a disappointment as it was one of the features that convinced me to buy it. I wouldn't suggest buying this to a person with small hands or weak arms.

All that said, it is attractive and does just what it says it does. I used it for french press and the temperature was perfect. So for now, 4 stars because the handle is too wide.

I like the quickness of this kettle. I have tried many brands so thought I would splurge on a new one. Has lots of settings but I am skeptical about the keep warm feature. I also have to make sure I press start after selecting the setting I want. It seems a bit complicated sometimes. I have not had it long enough to clean it but it looks and works great so far.

I've had three of these kettles now. Between the three of them, I would say I've had less than one year of use. Continuously, none of these kettles lasted more than ~4 months before breaking, with the last one breaking after about 2.5 months of use. My use case is a little heavy. I make about two pots of tea and my roommate makes about two pots of french press coffee each day. We did everything to maintain and take care of the device in regards to cleaning, but it still broke.

While it worked it was great. Capacity is right. Temperature is usually where you want it. As others have noted, the bell is pretty silent. I have sharp hearing so that didn't affect me too much. It heats the water fast and keeps it there to my satisfaction. It even looks good, though the numbers are easy to wipe off if you're not careful.

I would not recommend this device though. While it has a 3-year warranty, Cuisinart makes you pay a $15 return fee. I'm done paying it, and I'm looking for a new kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coating flakes off on the inside!!!
reviews.reviewText: Only had for about a month and the bottom of the kettle (inside) started flaking. Called customer service and they want me to send part of the unit back (for proof, I guess) and a $15 check for them to send me a new machine. What a pain and disappointment. Hate I missed my Amazon return window!

Pros:
-It looks great on my counter!
-It is not very loud.
-It heats up contents quickly.
-It heats to specific temperatures accurately, which is GREAT for tea-lovers.
-It holds the heat for quite a while (even past the 30 minute "keep warm" period).
-It swivels!
-It comes off the stand/is reasonably portable.
-The water level is visible from the exterior display strip.

Cons:
-I wish the "keep warm" feature could be set to last longer than 30 minutes, to keep it at the set temperature.
-Condensation builds inside the water level display.
-The filter at the spout is a good idea, but it is not integrated very well. Some of the water goes to the side of the filter instead of through the filter. This is annoying because a) some of the water isn't being filtered and b) the water comes out of the spout unevenly.

Overall this is a very nice product, and I doubt I could find a better electric kettle for the same value. A fix or two here and there would make it perfect, particularly with the filter.

I purchased this in April of 2013 and it is still works as expected. I'm not a daily user of the boiler. However I use it in spurts. Come winter it is used often, 3-4 times a week. In the summer I use it maybe once a week. It has performed admirably under this less than strenuous schedule. The letters are still black, the screws are still shiny and the boiling times are still quick.

My one fussy habit is using distilled water in the pot as the city water taste comes through the brew.

Mike

It is difficult to overstate how well designed this kettle is.
Despite the ample 1.7 Liter capacity, it's tall narrow shape takes up minimal counter space. The stainless steel finish is elegant and easy to keep clean. A soft blue light illuminates the window and button panel to let you know the kettle is working or in "keep warm" mode.
Six temperature settings ranging from 165 degrees to full boil make it a breeze to brew different styles of tea from the delicate greens all the way to black. (all of which are also labeled on the buttons right under the temperature).
The lid pops open at the push of a button, and closes tightly with a reassuring click. There's a small screen on the inside between the body and spout that slides out for quick and easy clean up. They thought of everything!

At full capacity, the kettle will come to a boil in about 8 minutes, yet the handle stays remarkably cool.
While it gives off a soft beep to let you know it's done. If anything could be improved, it would be to make that beep a bit louder. (It's hard to hear in a different room over a TV or conversation with guests.) But this is such a minor point, it's hardly worth mentioning. Even if you don't hear the beep, the kettle will hold the temperature for 30 minutes then automatically shut off. It even has a sensor to prevent it from boiling dry.
As I said: they thought of everything.

I have had this kettle for six months now, and I use it everyday. It has become my favorite and most used kitchen gadget. I highly recommend it to anyone.

I've had one of these for a couple of years now. It's been working fine but there are a couple of things to be aware of. First, it holds quite a bit of water and can be a bit heavy when full. If you only make tea for two, it may be more than you need. As is, I usually run it less than a quarter full. Second, the printing on the controls started to rub off almost immediately. The "Start" disappeared within a couple of months and the other common settings are largely gone. Fortunately, by then I knew which buttons to push without looking at them. And finally, keeping the exterior looking good can take some work, but that's true for most thingss that are stainless steel. I find that boiling some vinegar a couple of times does a good every few months does a good job of keeping the interior in reasonable shape. That's simpler that trying to find a descaler to use and I expect works just about as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats up water, but extremely wasteful, with poor user interface and useless "features"
reviews.reviewText:
Heats up water pretty fast, has easy to use base.

But I find it INCREDIBLY FRUSTRATING that I can't permanently disable the auto-reheat "feature" which I sometimes forget (or a guest doesn't know) to manually defeat, thereby using up many times as much electricity as needed. VERY WASTEFUL! I consider this an extreme example of poor user interface engineering, and certainly not environmentally friendly.

Also, it will sometimes switch by itself from the "boil" heat setting (the only setting I need, or ever want) into 160 degree "delicate" temperature mode, and if I don't catch that error, I end up wasting a batch of beans.

Had this for about two weeks now and am so enjoying this electric kettle. The Cuisinart CPK-17 electric kettle comes with all the features tea lovers need, adjustable temperature settings for various types of tea, a fill level, a keep warm setting and a gentle beeping sound to let you know your water is at the right temperature for your tea. Purchased this to replace a Krups brand electric kettle that was not working as well as it did after 2 1/2 years. Besides having two more temperature settings and four more fill level markings than the Krups, I chose this because we have four other Cuisinart appliances that serve us well.

reviews.reviewerName: For Such a Time a This
reviews.reviewText:
I am rating this 5 star, so far! After reading some of the reviews, however, I'm a little nervous. BUT! Cuisinart has GREAT customer service so even if I have an issue I have no doubt they will make it right.

Aa an avid tea drinker of every type of tea on the market, from delicate Japanese green to heafty Chinese Blacks, I purchased a Utilitea hot water pot. This item has a dial that you turn to go from low temps to boiling. It didn't hold much water, so for larger amounts of tea I had to refill and continue to infuse.

When I came across this model, the Cuisinart CPK-17, I couldn't believe anything like this existed. I didn't hesitate spending the money. And I am not sorry in the least.

There could be no easier way to brew tea! With all the temps and types of teas listed on the buttons, easy to read, it's perfect! No more taking the temp of the water, 'just to make sure' before infusing my teas. I purchase some very exotic and expensive tea, so it's nothing you want to fool with. This unit takes ALL the guesswork out of brewing perfect tea, as far as the water temperature, that is. The rest is practice and knowledge of types of tea, from delicate whites to hardy black.

My girlfriend saw me use this during a dinner at my home one evening and she couldn't wait to purchase her own.

Yep, 5 stars.....my experience so far is excellent!

I bought this product on 12/27/17. My wife and I have used it exclusively ever since and we are very happy with it. Our main use is to heat water for tea and/or coffee press. It has met our expectations with one exception: the sound signal that the water has been heated to the expected temperature is so soft that, it is often missed by us. Granted, we are both septuagenarians and may have some hearing deficit. Nevertheless, this is an extremely soft beep, so much so that it is partially buried by the noise of the boiling water. Sadly, when I called support today, I was told that there is no way to make the alarm louder. I do not want to go back to the piercing whistle of the kettles of yesteryears, but a louder option would, in my estimation, a valuable choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Affordable Cordless Electric Kettle for Tea Lovers
reviews.reviewText: I’m a lifelong tea drinker and have used electric kettles for years. My experience has been that, whatever the brand, they stop working after about a year. I have had this one only for a few months, so I’ll have to wait and see how long it actually lasts. Regarding the way it works: GAME CHANGER. Day 1: used the same organic green tea teabags I’ve been using for many years, chose “Green” setting, and the resulting cup of tea tasted more flavorful than ANY I’d brewed over the years. Kettle brews very quickly and keeps water very hot. Without question, the best cordless electric kettle I’ve ever used.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, fast, easy, no mess coffee. Here's how:
reviews.reviewText:
2 YEAR UPDATE:
After two years of daily use the kettle finally died. I don't know if I will buy the same thing again. It cost me about $100 two years ago and at $50 per year, that is a pretty steep price for a kettle. Being able to select the temperatures was very nice though. My AeroPress may get a new partner.

OLD REVIEW:
Using this Cuisinart PerfecTemp Stainless-Steel Cordless Electric Kettle with the AeroPress is like a dream come true for coffee lovers.

The AeroPress makes great tasting coffee. It is fast and easy with almost no clean-up.

The Cuisinart Electric Kettle allows you to have a fresh cup of coffee at the perfect temperature in less than a minute. With this kettle you can select the temperature at the push of a button and it will maintain that temperature.

Here is how I have quick and easy coffee all day:

Start the day by filling the Cuisinart Electric Kettle with water and select temperature of 175 or 185 degrees which ever you prefer.

1. Insert a filter in the AeroPress and add two scoops of your favorite coffee.
2. Add water from kettle to the "2" mark on the AeroPress.
3. Stir the coffee grounds for 10 secs. and press in to a cup for 20 secs.
4. Pop the coffee grounds in a trash can and quick rinse the AeroPress.
6. Fill your cup to the desired level with water from kettle.

Less than one minute per cup. No washing pots or coffee filter baskets. It is that easy.

Aerobie 80R08 AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaks Water Just After 10 mnths & Terrible Cuisinart Customer Service
reviews.reviewText: Product is leaking water and we've only had it for 10 months. Worst of all is the customer service from Cuisinart. This kettle comes with a 3 year warranty, however, the customer service is terrible!!! I was on hold for over 1/2 hour just to get through to a customer service rep. Then I was told I had to pay to ship it back to them and also pay an additional $15 to have them ship me a new kettle. Terrible, terrible, terrible, customer service!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: sometimes twice a day and it's holding up beautifully. I love that I don't have to put ...
reviews.reviewText: I've had this kettle for 5 years, yes 5 years! and it's been used most days, sometimes twice a day and it's holding up beautifully. I love that I don't have to put a lot of effort into getting the water temp just right on my own. I just hit the button for the type of tea I'm brewing and there's no guesswork. It's a good looking kettle, heats up fast, and I love that it lifts off the base for easy filling and pouring, no attached cord to get in the way and make the kettle cumbersome to deal with. If you're an avid tea drinker, then you need this kettle! It's wonderful.

Although this electric kettle has some nice features, there is a huge problem with it: The water tastes like plastic because of the plastic inside the kettle. The plastic should be changed to stainless steel.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lightning fast heating- the keep warm feature is awesome.
reviews.reviewText: Granted, I only make one cup of tea at a time so I heat two cups of water (one to preheat the mug), but this brings the two cups of tap water to a boil in under two minutes. It beeps to let you know it has reached your set temperature, then it keeps it there for up to 30 minutes. The elegant design is a frosting on the cake.

Temp sensor broke in less than a year.
I used it everyday. I would need to pay to ship it.
I’ll try the bonavita.

reviews.reviewTitle: Two Defective Kettles in One Year - Beware!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this tea kettle from Amazon in April of 2014. About four months in, the touch pad on the unit failed and I sent it to Cuisinart for replacement. That cost $35 plus shipping, which I felt was not terribly consumer friendly but it was cheaper than a new kettle, so I had it replaced. Now, in March 2015 the lid of the unit has completely failed and come apart, rendering this replacement kettle useless. I am going to contact Cuisinart again, but I don't believe I'll succeed in getting it replaced at no cost (other than shipping), so it will likely end up in the dump. I would not purchase this product, even though there are not a lot of really good choices out there (I miss my Braun kettle - they don't make them for the US market any longer, sadly), please don't waste your money on this item.

I purchased this unit in June of 2015.
We still use this daily, a family of 3, Coffee, Tea and cooking, all day and night.
My wife and I like French Press Coffee - my daughter likes Tea - it works perfectly for both.
I was looking for cleaning instructions and checked Amazon for the model number - saw some negative reviews.
This unit has already surpassed expected life - I will purchase another when it is needed.
I use Amex on Amazon for purchases that a need long warranty - they give you an extra year warranty.

This kettle cost alot more than some of the other models, but in my mind it is worth every penny. I brew loose tea in a bottom drop tea diffuser and it makes a perfect cup every time. You can set the temperature depending on your tea variety on this kettle so it brews perfectly. I keep this at my desk at work and can pour in the water into the diffuser, then place the diffuser on my cup within 30 seconds. This way you get the perfect strength of tea instead of the time it normally took to walk from the coffee station with the hot water in the tea diffuser which generally makes strong tea. I also find since it brews the perfect strength, the tea leaves last quite a bit longer. I can generally get 7 cups instead of 3-4 out of each scoop of tea leaves (approx. 2 teaspoons). You also do not have to worry about the tea kettle from boiling over like the other models. Once the kettle reaches temperature, it goes into a warm cycle. No worries about boiling over since you generally do not need to set it to boil for tea leaves (there are 5 temperature settings below the boiling point).

3/2013 upate- I have had this tea kettle over a year and it still going strong. All the alarms and funtions are still running perfect. I highly recommend for anyone who is a serious tea drinker

reviews.reviewTitle: Great unit, you wll begin using everyday
reviews.reviewText: While this is the only heater pot I've purchased(based on reviews) I've got to say, works extremely well. First, it heats FAST. Second, the controls are well laid out, labeled for different teas and is intuitive. The quality of the buttons and flask are first rate. Also, the OPEN button releases the lid, that then opens with a controlled motion. Must have cost a few bucks for that, but it is sure worth it. With something this easy to use and so simply laid out, tells me Cuisinart did some serious engineering on it. I'm getting another one just for work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 3 months. Cuisinart claims the warranty is void.
reviews.reviewText:
This was given to me as a present to use in my office. Not the office kitchen, MY office for MY personal use. I loved it for the three months it worked. When it broke (it simply beeps and turns itself off) Cuisinart informed me that use of this kettle anywhere outside of a personal residence immediately voids the warranty.
For a ~$100 kettle to break after 3 months of personal use is not cool. Being informed that the warranty was voided the minute I plugged it in at my office is absurd. I am unimpressed with a company that fails to stand behind their products.

This is a very nice kettle. I like the separate housing of the element and the whole look of the kettle in general. I went ahead and got this kettle based on the reviews I read.
It heats water very quickly, as mentioned, and the different, lower, temperature settings are great for making hot chocolate and tea for my children so it doesn't burn them. There is no strange taste like I have heard there is from plastic kettles and the easy flip up lid is so convenient- I use to have to wrestle the lid off my other kettle. The water level indicator is wonderful- clear and precise and the blue light is an fun addition as is the cute beeping that signals the heating process is finished.
My biggest disappointment is that it is NOT quiet like some of the plastic ones are. Hence, only 4 stars. My kitchen overlooks the family room and when the kettle is in the middle of the heating process it is so loud that no-one can hear the telly ( TV ). The children turn the telly up very loud to hear it over the kettle. It is only for a little while, perhaps 30 seconds, but it is a nuisense none-the-less.
However, since the telly isn't always on when I am making tea and it is a very nice looking, easy to use and efficient kettle otherwise, I will keep it and I am happy to do so. In fact, if I had read that it was not quiet I would not have gotten it and going on what I know now, I would regret not having it.

I have this since Dec 2015, so it is 3 months short of 2 years. And it is now leaking, and it makes random beeps when it is boiling water.. When it worked, it was wonderful. I could set different temp for different teas. It was absolutely awesome. The color is beautiful and goes with my kitchen decor. The construction seems to be great as well until it broke. Paying $75 is a lot for the kettle, it should have lasted longer, not just 20 months.

I've been using this for almost a year now and it works like a dream. My tea and coffee taste so much better now that I can adjust the temperature depending on the blend / roast. Friends and family all agree now that getting the temperatures right does make a difference. (Although now I am ruined and becoming a snob that thinks the Keruig at work makes nasty coffee).

I haven't had trouble with rust or calcium buildup. We only pour in water that has run through our filtered brita pitcher, and if I'm done using it for the day I empty any exccess water so nothing sits in it for long.

I was concerened prior to purchasing seeing how buttons were wearing out on some of the other reviews. Again, its only been a year of use (probably averaging about 4 times a week) and my buttons are looking fine. I guess those other pictures were from much higher levels of use.

I bought this electric kettle after looking for the perfect electric kettle to buy for my boyfriend, who absolutely loves making himself hot drinks and food and uses this thing constantly, but never really had a good kettle.
I wanted the best for him.
I waited for the right price to come along, it did and I just went for it, and I'm so glad I did.
My boyfriend couldn't be happier. I couldn't be happier.
This just makes us want to make more and more hot drinks for each other.
He keeps giving me hot cocoa and tea. I feel pampered. Yay!

No, but really. This is really good stuff.
It's so innovative, it goes to the perfect temperature and it keeps it warm if you're in the middle of something.
It turns off when it's ready so the water doesn't over-heat, it looks so futuristic, even, with the blue led.
It's really amazing stuff.

reviews.reviewTitle: Internal base disintegrates/flakes off and leaves dangerous/unhealthy sediment
reviews.reviewText: Beware of this product as the internal base will slowly disintegrate and leave dangerous/unhealthy sediment that you will not want inside your body. It took a little over a year for this to occur with ours and I sent a note to Cuisinart and their answer was to perform the recommended cleaning (i.e. use vinegar and go through several boil cycles). This worked only temporarily as the internal base continued flake and leave sediment. Obviously a design flaw with respect to the materials. Will definitely not buy this product again and will try to determine if there's a safer alternative manufacturer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had some issues but still going strong over a year later
reviews.reviewText:
Very nice kettle and the options for tea lovers are amazing. The perfect temperature settings are very convenient. It's obviously made very well and is definitely worth the money spent.

#### Update: 2012-04-16

I've had this unit for almost 1.5 years now and know a bit more about kettles and tea making as well. I still agree with the five star rating.

Pros: It's durable, almost seamless, stays clean almost without intervention, heats quickly, leaves no plastic or chemical tastes, and heats quickly.

Cons: Twice now I've been able to turn the unit on when it's been below the "min" level. I thought the sensor was supposed to prevent this. When I did it this time, it seemed like I had broken it for good. Out of desperation, I took the bottom apart and the first thing I noticed is one of the electronic cables was jagged and probably loose. I removed the glue they used, which wasn't holding the connection in anyway and was rather stopping it from snapping into place. I had to use a flathead to push the connector in while the bottom was almost closed--there is very little slack on the cable, put the screws back in the bottom, and to my own surprise it worked again. I tested the temperature at boil and it was right on. By the way, the screws on the bottom are special triangle types. I used a very small allen (hex) which has six sides, so only three of the sides make contact but they are at the correct angles.

I use this kettle at work in between classes to make tea. Having the different temperature settings is absolutely essential as green and white tea both taste very bitter to me if they are brewed with water that is too hot.

I use this kettle every day to make tea or to boil water for ramen noodles or soup. It heats quickly and to the perfect temperature. It does get a tiny bit loud as it reaches boiling, but it is not a big issue. Otherwise, it is completely silent until it gives you three beeps to let you know your water has reached the appropriate temperature.

I also love the hold feature. If something comes up while I am waiting for the water to reach the appropriate temperature, I can simply press the hold button, and it will hold the water at the requested temperature for 30 minutes.

I am very pleased with my purchase. So are several others in my department who often request to join me for tea. =)

There's no denying that this kettle is high; there are plenty out there that are cheaper (the best seller on Amazon right now is $14), and you don't need a fancy kettle just to boil water. That being said - this kettle is worth every penny.

My husband drinks French Press coffee most mornings; I drink tea occasionally, and we make a lot of hot teas and hot chocolates during the colder months. Since we both use it for different (and very specific) things, this kettle is perfect. He uses the French Press setting, and I use the black or chai tea. You pick your temperature, hit start, and walk away. It is a little loud, but not annoyingly so, and I like that it helps me to remember it. The beep definitely is quiet. If you are in the next room, or watching TV, or just humming to yourself, you won't hear it. But since you can choose 'keep warm', it doesn't bother me. Next time I hear it warming back up, or walk into the kitchen and spot it, I can take it off the base and it's just as hot as if the beep just sounded. The base is another bonus - no cords to mess with, and you can spin it on the base to tuck the handle out of the way, or pull it back around to grab. And make sure you only grab the handle- the sides get HOT. Not warm, not a little hot. Straight up hot. I have brushed my arm against it a couple of times and quickly yanked it back. If you have small children, you will need to be careful with it.

Despite the price, and the occasional arm-scalding incident, we couldn't be happier with this kettle. One kettle works well for our individual needs, it has a stainless steel interior (less plastic is always better in my book), the 'keep warm' setting means you can set it and forget it, and let's not forget that it just plain looks pretty sitting on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loose screw after 4 months of use, Cuisinart not helpful in resolving issue.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this unit 4 months ago from Amazon and it worked great (and maybe still does). I use the unit once a day to boil water for my newborn so the use of the unit is very light.

My issue is simple, I just found a loose screw bouncing around inside the kettle and after calling the customer service I was told that I have to pay $15 to have a new one sent to me and cut the cord of the original unit and send it back to Cuisinart (at my own expense). To me this is waste of resources, time, and money to handle it the way Cuisinart requires me to proceed. I simply want to find out where the screw came from so that I can put it back where it belongs. Its most likely a very minor thing.

Looking at Amazon, I don't think I can return it for a replacement so that does not make me happy ether.

I'm attaching image of the screw in case someone dealt with the same issue and can help.

I never knew I needed this tea kettle, but now I can't live without it! It make the perfect cup of tea every time. Heating my water in the microwave was a crap shoot...3 minutes but that never took into account the starting temperature of the water. Love the fact that you can choose the brew temp for the different teas and your water is heated accordingly.

This is a simply amazing kettle. There was one thing I should have considered when purchasing this kettle. The fact that I live at a high altitude. I currently live at around 10,000 feet above sea level. The boil feature on this kettle must be set to the temperature at which water boils near sea level. When using the boil setting it simply will continue to boil without turning off until I notice it or all my water evaporates. A little research helped me calculate the temperature at which water boils here and using the correct temperature setting it works great. The build quality of this kettle is wonderful, it feels solid and well put together. When pressing the buttons there is that satisfying click that lets you know you've done it correctly. The cord is a good length for almost any counter top. The finish does collect fingerprints as you would expect from stainless steel and the water level seems to be a little inaccurate at lower volumes, but nothing that most people would notice or find annoying. Overall a great product.

The lid sometimes sticks in the closed position and the mouth is narrow making it difficult to pour in water from a wide-mouthed pitcher. On the other hand, I appreciate the six temp settings and have found that on highest setting, freshly boiled water does seem to make my English Breakfast tea taste better than our last water boiler.

7/21/18 Supplemental review
So, it now leaks. After the first six months, it seemed to leak only when I overfilled it so I made sure to only fill it to near the top of the sight glass. But now (July 2018) it leaks all the time and we have abandoned it.

reviews.reviewTitle: My tea tastes better because of this kettle
reviews.reviewText:
I use this a lot for green and white teas because it boils to the perfect temperature. If you over boil water for green tea it will taste bitter and using the temp control feature on this kettle makes the green tea taste so much better, every time. This kettle is good looking, easy to clean, fairly compact and is great when I have guests because it heats up so quickly and just very versatile for different uses (coffee,ice-tea, oatmeal, regular tea, keeping water warm). I also have a stainless steel kettle I use a lot in the traditional way on my gas stove, but this boils water faster when you have a lot of people around. BTW, for traditional tea kettles with no temperature control, I've heard to boil water and wait three minutes before steeping green tea, and it is approximately the right temperature at that point (but timing it just right is challenging for me as I get distracted, so I just prefer the kettle that does it for me).
I have had this kettle for almost a year and would buy another one if it wears out, but I doubt that will be anytime soon.

We had a much older version of this a long time ago and chose to replace it. We use it several times a day easily and seems to be a workhorse. The water boils extremely rapidly, and although I'm not sure about the accuracy of all the different water temp settings, I can guarantee that it is EXTREMELY fast.
CON: While the option to keep re-heating the water (if you set it and then have to go brush your teeth, shower, etc., this thing will keep boiling it back to your desired temp. several times) is a definite plus, on one occasion, it wouldn't stop. It would boil to a the preset temp., stop, then after it cooled, re-boil to the temp. This went on and on until all the water had vaporized.
I'd say that's a definite potential heat/fire hazard, so these days, my wife and I absolutely do not use the automatic "keep warm" setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you drink tea, you need this kettle.
reviews.reviewText:
This is my second kettle. The first one lasted 7 years and then the lid stopped functioning properly. I toyed with using a stove top kettle, but since I drink green and white teas, I needed more control over the water temperature. This provides it.
Easy to use, water levels clearly marked, tea temps clearly marked and easily chosen.

reviews.reviewTitle: I expected much better performance than this
reviews.reviewText: The appliance sits on my kitchen counter. I use it once a day to heat water for my morning coffee. I don't think I've have the item for a full year, but it has begun to leak all over the counter top. I expected much better performance than this. Especially at the price!

This is great because I can heat the water to the right temperature for the type of tea I am making. I love that I don't have to worry about it boiling dry and getting ruined. The keep warm feature is great, I can start the kettle and take the dog for a walk and when I get back, the water is ready or just needs a minute or two to get back to temperature. My main issue is being able to see how full it is - the window is inconveniently behind the handle and rather narrow; it can light up when on the base, so I just use a pitcher or nalgene to fill the kettle so I can actually see the water level.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Kettle! Worth spending the extra money over cheaper brands
reviews.reviewText: Bought another brand kettle trying to save a few bucks. Leaked on first use so I returned it and bought this Cuisinart. VERY happy! We drink a lot of green tea so its in use all day long. Love the pre-set temp selections. Heats quickly. Only suggestion is that on the next model they make the little beep (and I do mean little!) that lets you know your water is ready be louder. Unless you’re standing right next to it, its hard to hear. I’ve read other reviews reporting problems. None for me so far. If that changes I’ll report back

Heats water quickly, much faster than my previous electric tea kettle (Black & Decker) that failed. The different temperatures for different types of tea is a nice feature, although I'm not sure if I could taste the difference between green tea at 175 degrees and green tea at boiling. Handle is a bit thick, but I haven't found it to be a problem (and my hands are fairly small). No rust so far (I've had it a few months). I appreciate the short cord as less chance of catching something on it and knocking over the kettle. Overall, I recommend it and would buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stay away from this typical short lived Cuisinart garbage.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased on the 17th of December, 2016, and died last night 7 August, 2017. R.I.P. Used twice at night to boil water for tea and couldn't stand the strain. Typical Cuisinart crap. I filled the carafe with water, placed it on the pad, and heard a snap and the smell of something electrical burning. Now junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle until all the rust appeared
reviews.reviewText: I really like this kettle, so much so that I own two. One day I was drinking tea and wondered what was floating at the bottom of the cup - long story short, the complete bottom of the kettle had rusted and so had the pouring spout. I called customer service and was told that rust is not a warranty issue. It must be in the manufacturing because the other kettle, which gets the same water source, has no rust whatsoever.

I love this thing. LOVE IT. I know it's pricey: when I saw how much it was I think I laughed. But honestly it's the best kettle this side of the pond (the british electric kettles are MUCH faster). It's sort of a pain to clean but it's worth it. We move a lot, so every time we'd move my cheap water kettles would break (don't ask me how, it was inevitable though). So I bought this one when I'd finally decided to buy a better-made model. Great decision! Plus the blue glow is such a nice thing in the dark hours of the morning. It's perfect for multiple types of tea (it has presets for the perfect temps), and it boils pretty quickly for oatmeal or whatever else you'd like it for. I've had it over two years and it's still going strong. Yes, it even survived our last move!

reviews.reviewTitle: Best electric kettle I've ever used
reviews.reviewText:
**UPDATE**
I brought this thing into my office and it's been in almost constant use for a number of months now, without any problems. I guess the only difficulty is a few different people wanting to set the water temperature differently for different teas, but there's nothing to be done about that. ;)
Anyway just wanted to update my review to indicate that months of relatively heavy use haven't been detrimental at all to the function of this kettle.

-----------------

Just used this thing for the first time. Finally! No more guesswork with water temperature when I'm making my green tea. Also worth noting that the ideal temperature for making coffee is lower than boiling as well.

Pros:
- Lets you set the temperature perfectly for your beverage of choice
- Cordless kettle
- Mostly stainless steel
- "Keep Warm" function keeps your water the correct temperature for 30 minutes

Cons:
- Mostly stainless steel (still some plastic inside -- really? They couldn't have made the inside all out of glass and steel?)
- Obnoxious lights (I personally hate this fad for everything to be blue backlit)

Purchased this kettle a few months ago, we needed a new one due to an overseas move, so our old Sunbeam kettle had the wrong voltage. I have been a bit disappointed as it was certainly not a cheap item. I think that the boiling the water at different temperatures is a bit of a gimmick, we didn't like our tea not made with boiling water (what we are used to after 40 years I suppose). The feature of bringing the water back to boil has been irritating, as I make tea, sit down and then the kettle boils again, some may find this useful, we have switched this feature off, which thankfully you can do. The main thing that is really disappointing is that the lid is quite small, so the opening to fill the kettle is small, which may not seem a big thing, but if you want a full kettle, it gets quite heavy and having to keep it in a very exact position, is a nuisance. Other than the fact that I have paid for features I don't use, it is reasonably quick to boil, isn't too loud, and has no plastic inside so we have no issues with the water being tainted, which I know is a big problem through friends' experiences.

Update to the update:
I have now had this kettle for 6 years and it looks like new! I use it almost daily for loose leaf tea. No issues whatsoever!

UPDATE:
I have had this tea kettle for 4 years now. It still looks like new and works perfectly! I continue to use it all the time. It is absolute quality. It is expensive but has been very well worth the money if you are a hard core tea drinker and need to steep different kinds of tea at different temperatures.

This was a birthday girt to myself! I ordered it on a Tue and got it on a Thursday! That was with FREE shipping! in less than 48 hours I had myself a wonderful electric kettle. It works like a charm and is worth every penny. I am a big tea drinker and drink many different types of teas so having the option of 6 settings is awesome! No more using the microwave and trying to get the temperature correct for different teas. It does indeed make a difference in temp for different teas. Anyone who drinks tea on a regular basis would love this item. Yea again to Amazon for quick shipping!

reviews.reviewTitle: Have used this model kettle at others houses and been very impressed by it so assuming you purchase a non faulty model you should be very happy. Next time i will purchase this product within ...
reviews.reviewText: Purchased a faulty model and the water wouldn't boil. Am in progress of returning for refund. Have used this model kettle at others houses and been very impressed by it so assuming you purchase a non faulty model you should be very happy. Next time i will purchase this product within Australia so can return more easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but with a minor glitch after a few months of use.
reviews.reviewText: This is a very classy water heater. I have used a few in my life and finally broke down and bought this fancy one. My wife is a tea freak and I'm a coffee freak so this is heavily used. We have used it a few months now and its worked great. My only minor gripe is I wish when you put it back on its stand you didn't have to hit the start button again to turn it off. There have been 2-3 times that hitting the start button didn't turn it off and we just had to unplug it. I can only imagine this is a glitch that will get worse. But for now, it has only happened a few times that we couldn't turn it off. Other than that its a great machine!!

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this as a Christmas present for my wife because I wanted one (I'm horrible, I know)
reviews.reviewText: After a trip to Ireland, I bought this as a Christmas present for my wife because I wanted one (I'm horrible, I know). Between us, we use it almost daily, and so far, it hasn't shown any sign it's not up to that. It's a great replacement for a traditional teapot, sure, but it's also nice to speed up things like boiling a pot of water -- we cook noodles a lot, and now we put half the water in pan and half in this, and it's boiling in half the time. It's also pretty good about the temp settings, although boiling doesn't seem to be quite boiling. That said, I suspect if this died tonigh, I'd be ordering another one tomorrow.

The idea and interface of this kettle are great, but it went on the fritz pretty quickly. It will heat a bit, then start beeping and stop. Poor quality overall.

I forgot to leave a review on this when it first stopped working but I’m tired of seeing review sites who clearly have never used the kettle rate it highly. It’s not a good kettle.

We are serious tea drinkers in this family, and always guessed at getting the temp right or sacrificed by using other makers! I drink yerba mate, and brewing the water at 165 DOES make a huge difference... no more bitterness, just smooth and delicious! My daughter drinks mainly green tea, but does drink some of the other special kinds, and she also fell in love with this tea kettle. My mother, who likes orange pekoe, will turn on the stove's teapot and forget about it, and we will often find it dry. With this new tea kettle, everyone feels safer.We also brew specialty ice teas, rarely using orange pekoe. So today, I am packing away my stovetop teapot, my iced tea maker, and my brew station that I have used only for tea (brew station heats at185). I am saving a lot of space and we feel like royalty with our drinks.

reviews.reviewTitle: worked to expectations for 18 months, warranty is a pain
reviews.reviewText: I love tea, but only drink it about once a week. So in the last 18 months of owning this water kettle, I've used it about 76 times. Last week, it stopped working. I called customer service ;since it is under warrenty still. They were friendly enough, but I'm annoyed that my limited warrenty is "limited, meaning you need to pay all shipping charges". I live in Utah (not antartica) and they are charging me 15 dollars for shipping a new machine to me. and then I am responsible for shipping charges to return the old one. Seeing as I have not mistreated the machine in anyway, being told I have to spend another 25+ dollars to just get another machine that might not last another 18 months is very frustrating. The only reason a company would have a warrenty that asks the consumer to pay the return shipping is if their merchendise often breaks down. If they make quality machines, then the few consumers needing replacements would be easy to accomodate. annoyed.

reviews.reviewTitle: so how come we are paying for their poor workmanship.
reviews.reviewText:
My wife and I purchased this kettle just eleven months new from Amazon. We are black tea drinkers and use the Kettle approximately three times a day. During those eleven months of use the inside started to rust, the lid was contrary as whether it wanted to open or not, then this past week it ceased to function. Period.
This latest malfunction started with a few crackles from inside the base followed by the kettle switching itself off then on, then finally giving up altogether.. We contacted Cuisinart Customer Support in Glendale AZ, who gave us instructions on how and where to send it to get it repaired, but what surprised both my wife and I was that, WE had to pay for both the shipping THERE and BACK . This item supposedly has a THREE year warranty from Cruisinart, so how come we are paying for their poor workmanship..
From a design point of view, the kettle is OK, but manufacturing control is somewhat questionable .

We bought this to replace our well loved Capresso kettle (http://www.amazon.com/Capresso-259-03-Kettle-Polished-Chrome/dp/B000BY4ZHO/) because we've started to get into loose leaf tea and wanted to be able to heat water to different temperatures for different teas. While this doesn't heat water as fast as the Capresso, it does heat the water fairly quickly to the desired temperature and the keep warm feature is really nice.

The lighted water level window turned out to be surprisingly useful instead of just the gimmick I thought it was. It has many nice features for the price, including a screen to prevent any hard water scale from ending up in your cup when you're between cleanings. We have very hard water, so I have to de-scale it about every two weeks. The smooth stainless steel exterior cleans up with a quick wipe (not too many nooks and crannies to worry about) and the interior can be made sparkling clean with a few minutes and a little vinegar. The scale screen lifts out easily so you can clean it separately. The base has storage for the cord, so you can keep your counter tidy. We've used this kettle every day for months, and it's just as nice as the day it came out of the box.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a good device when it works
reviews.reviewText: I hoped to be one of the lucky ones but no such luck. The device stopped working 45 days after purchase. That is 15 days late to return to amazon so I contacted the manufacturer. They charged $15 to send out a replacement and I am responsible to pay for return shipping of the old unit. So at least $30 more out of pocket and without a working unit for two weeks. It is a good device when it works, I can only hope that it lasts more than another 45 days!

Bought this for a Christmas present. Have barely been using this product for two months and now we can't get water to boil. Also there were rust stains all over the bottom of the pot(on the inside) right when we took it out of the box. Despite paying full price for this, it seems like we got sent a used product.

This is great! I already had a glass kettle, an electric one I use at work as well as a glass stovetop kettle (cool, huh?). The variable temps on this one makes it worth the splurge. I love being able to make different teas, hot cocoa for the kids with a cooler temp, and even ramen noodles. The water boils quickly and beeps just loud enough. The warranty makes me feel good too. I'm very pleased with the Cuisinart products I have, as well as this new addition. Just be careful, the outside gets HOT!

reviews.reviewTitle: Replacing after four years with same item
reviews.reviewText: I love this kettle with auto shut-off and the multiple temps, ideal for teas as well as coffee. Yes, the label on the button I use constantly wore off, and it quit working the other day after years of daily use, but I ordered a replacement immediately. Easy to keep clean inside and out, fast, handy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product probably won't last longer than the warranty
reviews.reviewText: I am disappointed that this product suddenly stopped working, apparently just as the warranty expired. (The pot still turns "on," but the heating element doesn't heat at all). Nothing happened to cause this, it just suddenly stopped working. I called cusinart and they told me to descale the pot using vinegar and water, which made no sense to me, but I tried it anyway. It sounds like this is common. Basically they told me that I can't just buy a new "plate" for heating, so just throw it away and they'd give me 20% off the purchase of a new one if I bought it through cusinart.com. Sigh. I hate this throw-away culture. I expect electronics not to last, but a kettle? At this price? It seems to me that it should last more than 3 years. So I bought a cheap $20 kettle at Costco instead of replacing it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Also bought one got a friend
reviews.reviewText: I owned the same model for about 5 years and accidentally ruined it. (don't ask) Immediately ordered a replacement because the first one heated water with no muss or fuss and did so for many years. I like the fact that it can keep the water at temperature for a time as I often use it several times in a short period. If the second is equally faithful, I will be pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: somewhat disappointed given this is Cuisinart!
reviews.reviewText:
Update on original review: the interior of the urn has turned brown - no amount of scrubbing will remove the stains (I have hard water but also a water softener). You can see brown thru the window. Has anyone else encountered this problem, and if so, what if any solution have you found?

Print on settings is very light, and (I should have read prior reviews) I can see how the black will eventually fade. It heats quickly, and the tea brewing guide is useful, but the cord and plug itself get very hot, so be sure to unplug it after use!

When this works it is wonderful. Neat, clean and perfect for coffee and teas. BUT, in just over seven months I have gone through three of them and each time, even while under warranty, it costs you $15 to have them ship you a new one and another $15 at the post office to send back the old one.

Same issue as other posters here. After a few months it starts to work, and then shuts off. Starts to work, and then shuts off. Starts to work. Then shuts off a minute or so later.

So with two replacements the cost for this had now doubled, plus leaving me without coffee or tea making for weeks on end.

Do not buy this. They have to figure out and fix the issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product and great customer service from Cuisinart
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased because of the different temperature settings. Even my husband loves it, especially for making ice tea. This electric kettle is used every day in our household.After 2 years, it began to leak, which might have damaged the power base, and the kettle began boiling longer than necessary and making noise. An email to Cuisinart from their customer service website link resulted in a new one shipped within 7 days since the product has a 3 year limited warranty. My new one is working fine. I have to send a $15 check for their shipping and processing, and send the damaged one back at my expense. Also, the warranty does not start over for the new kettle. So, my new kettle will only have warranty for 8 months. So, I gave it 4 stars because of the warranty program policy - additional money and short time new kettle will be covered.

Customer service was excellent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well except for boil detection
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this as a Christmas present for my wife, who drinks a lot of green and herb teas. I am a coffee drinker and use both a French press and a Melitta pour through filter. Hence the need for a product that can heat to various temperatues. The item works well for all temperature settings except boil. After about a month of use, we noticed that it would often boil vigorously for quite a while before detecting that it had reached a boil and shutting off. Long enough that we feared it would not shut off and had to shut it off ourselves. I have a different brand and type of kettle at my workplace that only boils, and it is several years old and still works flawlessly, so I know that reliable boil detection can be done.

I suspect that the hardness of our water might have something to do with it. There is a lime buildup forming. But the problem began such a short time after we got it that I can't believe that a small amount of lime would be enough to affect its boil detection mechanism.

Even though this kettle is a little heavier than most I'm very glad we chose it because of several of its features:
PROS:
Love the fact you can choose different temperatures, this is very handy for different types of tea and coffee and also, if you cook a lot as we do and need some quick hot water for a sauce or to add to a dish. The stay warm feature is also very useful as I often put the kettle on then get distracted with a phone call or something then have to re-boil, but not with this one, the keep warm feature keeps the water at the temperature you want for 30 minutes.
The blue color is cool and looks great, it add to the feeling that this really is a quality product.
The lid is easy to open and close and unlike other kettles it does not need to be removed, it simply flips up.
The kettle has a high capacity.
CONS:
Sometimes when you choose a high temperature setting the kettle takes a while of serious boiling before it shuts itself off.
The beep it makes when it is ready is very quiet and you don't often hear it
As mentioned earlier, its a little on the heavy side

All in all though, we love this kettle and highly recommend it.

I LOVE this hot water kettle. It saves me a lot of time since I love tea and hot miso. I can crank up the kettle and make a cup faster than I could do it on my gas stove - YES!! - I have tested this theory. My kettle heated the same amount of water 1.5 minutes faster than my stove. The really great thing is that if you get side tracked and forget the kettle it just shuts off when it's done. There is no fear of boiling dry and wrecking the pan or teapot you were heating water in on the stove. There is no fear of starting a fire either. My office is in the basement of my house and this just puts my mind at ease. Hot water, convenient, safe and a good looking design, what more can you ask ? It has a great grip feel and it pours without the drip. It is stainless inside so there are no plastic parts worries. This is a quality, elegant appliance.

We have had this electric kettle for about a month. We are very pleased with it. I especially like the "keep warm" feature. The various temperature buttons is convenient for occasions when you don't need boiling water. The exterior is easy to clean and I like the base that allows the pot to swivel around. I would definitely buy it again. It was more expensive than others but it heats quickly and lives up to its reviews.

UPDATE: We have had this kettle for 18 months. All of a sudden, it started to leak profusely from around the bottom of the kettle. I called Cuisanart and was able to receive a replacement since it was still under the three-year warranty. BUT there is a cost of $10 for the replacement and I need to ship the broken one back to Arizona so that will be more cost for postage.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Finally Know What Tea Taste Like
reviews.reviewText:
I debated for months and months about whether I even needed an electric kettle. After getting reprimanded by my English friends I finally decided on this one for the stainless steel construction, temp options and price. It's been at least two months since purchasing it and I'm still 100% happy with my purchase.

I've always purchased higher-end tea but didn't realize I was burning it every time until I purchased this kettle. The flavor is so much more subtle and just pleasing overall. I actually get the complexity instead of burnt leaves. Not that I'm uppity about other tea now, but I notice.

In regards to other reviews I've read: I've had zero issue with buttons wearing down or print coming off. I leave the base plugged in all the time and simply set the kettle next to it until I use it.

Works perfectly. This seems to be the Cadillac of hotpots! I would say the only drawback is the balance.. it does require a bit of arm muscle to lift it when it is full. I suppose they all do, but I had the Capresso 259 H2O Plus Glass Water Kettle before: it takes a bit less water so I don't know if its fair to compare but I never noticed the weight lifting a full pot with the Capresso. That said, 2 of my Capresso pots from the last 1-2 years broke down, so I didn't want to re-buy that one.
The most important thing is that the water taste good out of the hotpot, and the Cuiinart is good that way: no change in water taste. It is handsome on my counter top, and enjoyable to use: a nice object that works.

Works beautifully. I love it. I use it every day, numerous times a day. It's a wonderfully quick, easy and elegant way to heat water for tea. It also looks quite elegant sitting on the counter. This kettle is the best possible way to get the perfect temperature for tea and the most quickly. And having the perfect temperature is crucial for good tea. I drink a lot of black tea and the kettle lists boiling as the temperature to use for black tea. I disagree. I don't like my tea that hot. I use the white tea setting (185 degrees) for my black and my white tea and it's perfect for both. 185 is plenty hot to achieve a perfect infusion of flavor and then not be too hot to drink. I love tea, it's one of life's greatest pleasures. Having this kettle makes tea time that much more enjoyable.
I love this electric kettle. The keep warm feature is pretty amazing. It’s the second one i’ve had and use it several times a day. The different heat temperatures is fantastic.

This is a great electric kettle so far. My old kettle wore out and it seems that a lot of the newer kettles on the market no longer have a ding or whistle to indicate that they are done heating up. I need a ding! I also have come like the keep warm feature on this kettle - it will keep the water heated to temp for 30 minutes after heating up if you have the feature activated. I have not explored all of the individual heat settings so far but, I will say my husband using the french press setting for his coffee and it does make a difference compared to when he used the old kettle and just used boiling water for his prep.

The only thing that knocks it back a bit in stars for me is the higher cost, but if it proves to be durable I can forgive that.

I use this everyday now and have retired my stovetop kettle. It heats very quickly and keeps the water warm if I am having a second cup of tea. I love the settings and the temps on the handle, especially when I need the water to be just under boiling for my French press or green tea. Best Christmas present that I gave myself!

This is a really fancy looking kettle with blue lights behind buttons lighting up every time it is plugged. I use it every day and love it. What I love about it is the differing temperatures which I knew as I placed the order, but also the feature that allows the water to be kept at the same temperature, although I do pour the remaining water out after each boil so as to not reheat water. It does take its time to boil water which would be irritating if one needed hot water quickly, but otherwise it works well, looks wonderful.

I've been using this for about a week now. It does heat water to the temperature profile you set it to and holds a good amount of water for a 2-person household. it seems to be durable but 1 week isn't enough to judge that.
However, it's very loud while heating the water. So loud that we can hear it 3 rooms across with the doors closed.
Given that it's not a shrieking sound and more of a "White noise" kind, we're not that upset about it.

Overall, a good very loud boiler :)

Not sure if my unit is broken out of the box or what is going on. When we set it to boil it never stops cooking. The only thing I can think of is that at our elevation of almost 9000 feet above sea level, water boils at 194 degrees. So in theory the CPK-17 will never shut off as its sensors will never get hot enough to tell it to stop. If this is the case I wish that fact was included in the literature that came with the unit. Especially in the troubleshooting section of the manual.

Worked great for 6-months and then failed. Water leaked out the bottom of the kettle. I tried to return it but Amazon won't take it back since it's more than 30-days. Buyer beware, and shame on Amazon for not standing behind the (defective) products they sell.

reviews.reviewTitle: right now I have the perfect temp depending of the type of tea or infusion ...
reviews.reviewText: I used to warm up the water in the microware or the stove for doing the tea... since i'm using the the cuisinart electric liter the taste improves a lot! right now I have the perfect temp depending of the type of tea or infusion I want to prepare. Besides, the liter looks very nice over the coutertop, it's very comfortable to grap and works very fast (I mean much faster than I expected). The blue light helps to know the exact amount of water it contains and the retroilluminated buttons are just great. If you enjoy a good tea, definitly you must have one of this liter.

Doesn't last. Bought two, first lasted less than two years. I like it so we tried again (don't know why) but the second lasted seven months. That's less than a year. Bought in April 2017, and it's dead by Dec 2 or the same year.

I bought this as a Christmas present for my boyfriend since he loves to drink tea. I bought this particular unit because it looked sleek and was much fancier than an older discontinued Aroma electric kettle I own. It worked great for a few days, and then it stopped working for no reason. Now all it does when turned on is make a few clicking noises and then turn itself off. Pretty disapppointing when the sole purpose of the product is to heat water.
