After looking at reviews on various websites, the reliability of this product isn't worth the price as it will inevitably break within a year. Furthermore, Cuisinart's $30 return policy ($15 shipping and handling each way) for an exchange is absolutely absurb for such an unreliable product. Definitely returning this product (vs. exchanging it). I would not recommend this product to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Machine broke after a few months of use ... 2nd replacement broke ... 3rd replacement broke. Enough said!
reviews.reviewText:
The first machine died after about 6 months. Just stopped heating. We perhaps use the kettle about 3x per day ... no more than the last kettle we had, which BTW lasted for about 4 years!

Called Cuisinart and they sent a replacement (shipping costs on me) ... this broke also in about 5 months. They sent another replacement ... broke in about 5 months. They sent a final replacement - with specific instructions about "descaling". So I descaled as instructed. This one actually died after 2 months.

Either this is a crap product, or the Universe does not want me to own this machine! I'm going with crap product ... the Universe has more important things to worry about.

After extensive research I purchased the CPK-17. Great design, easy cleaning, made with dependable materials and the functions are unlimited. I use it for various kinds of tea, instant oatmeal, or hot chocolate with great success (10 yr old uses it more, no stove involved).

I did a lot of research on these kettles, and I found that the one thing to avoid was kettles with plastic insides. This one, while not cheap, offered a great feature set, accurate temperatures, stainless interior, good controls, unobstrusive base, and pretty nice aesthetics.

The kettle is easy to fill, solidly built, and heats water very fast. It finishes its heat cycle with an authoritative BEEP that I can hear from the next room as I watch Sports Center. Another bonus is that even once it has reached temperature, it will keep the water at that temperature for up to 30 minutes, so if I'm busy doing something else, my kettle can wait until I get there, and my water isn't too cold or too hot! The most important thing about a good cup of french press coffee, besides the beans, is the temperature of the water.

The base is very minimal and you don't even notice it when the kettle is sitting on it, it looks like one piece of the kettle. The controls are easy to reach while holding the kettle by the handle, and the little LED light on the water level indicator is bright and helps you see the water level in a dimly lit early morning kitchen. It also automatically shuts off after a bit if the kettle heat has been turned off. The kettle will turn off automatically after a certain amount of time, but it also is easy to turn off once you've poured out your needed water by pressing the "keep warm" button again.

5 STARS! Look no further!

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the keep warm feature because I use this at ...
reviews.reviewText: Works well. Heats water quickly even from cold. Has lots of heat settings. If you are a tea aficionado then you will use them. I find I am just using the full boil. I like the keep warm feature because I use this at work and often get busy so the water is still hot when I return. It is nice to have because I don't have to heat my water in the microwave. I keep it near my desk and bring filtered water from home.

When making purchases I include Amazon reviews as a part of the decision and that is why I am writing today. The Cuisinart CPK-17 was purchased in April of 2016. Loved it until last weekend when it ceased to work. Yes, it came up quite short of working for an entire year, almost three months short of a year. Called Cuisinart to find out how strict their the limited warranty was. Customer service calls (I had to make two calls since they hung up on me after the first 30 minutes of waiting) took over an hour of waiting to find out that yes, they would send me a new one after I gave them my cc number for the $15.95 handling charge, then I had to send it to NJ and pay the mailing charge. I live in Oregon so who knows how much I would have to spend in shipping cost not to mention more time. I spent $99.95 for this appliance and it is not worth the return in time and money.

Had this kettle for a few weeks now - very happy with it. Everything seems to work as intended but do agree with other reviewers that boil time is a little long. Not a big issue for us but definately seems to take longer than our old plastic one. Do love the looks - really matches our new kitchen which has all stainless appliances and also the blue lighting. The 30 min keep warm feature is handy though haven't used it that often as expect it guzzles electricity in this mode. Beeper to signify temp has been reached is not too loud - quite easy to miss actually. You definately learn quickly that the exterior surface gets very hot - much more so than our old plastic one - you would not obviously want younger kids to have reach to this - no more than any appliance with boiling water in it. Overall we love love this kettle and believe it's worth the extra money. Proof of the pudding will be how long it lasts of course - but we are very happy with our purchase which we use all the time morning till night.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't always work, replaced first one, customer service a nightmare
reviews.reviewText: The first kettle I received worked for a few weeks, then the blue LED refused to turn off while the unit was plugged in. I called customer service and was initially told that I was wrong and that the blue light is never supposed to turn off. I called back and the second rep confirmed that I was indeed correct, that pressing the "Start" button twice should turn the unit off completely, LED and all. She sent a replacement and requested that I return the original, and that I pay postage myself for the return. I have never been lied to by a customer service representative and I have never been asked to pay to return a company's defective product before. I will never buy another Cuisinart appliance ever again. The replacement unit works better than the first, however occasionally when I turn it on to heat up water and walk away I return several minutes later to find that the unit has turned itself off. This is frustrating when I am on a tight schedule and sometimes I have gone without tea because I did not have the time to turn the unit on again and wait for it to warm up before leaving the house. I give it two stars instead of one because the replacement unit does work 90 percent of the time.

Love it, bought another, one for the office and one for home. I've had the first one about a half year. If it lasts less than four years, I'll come back and downgrade it. But if it holds up well, it is otherwise perfect. We have hard water here and I did soak the first one in warm vinegar overnight after about 5 months. The instructions said to boil vinegar in it and I thought that sounded funny and just heated it to about 190. That worked like a charm and it was like new again.

It does work as advertised. It really depends upon what you need. If you have use for all those different brewing temps then it's probably for you. Basically I need boiled water for black tea. If the pot has been unplugged it will default to 160 degrees. You have to be on your toes to change it to boiling. Kind of a pain for me.
I'm going to get a plain pot that just boils water.

Wow, I can't believe I've had this thing for almost 3 1/2 years! I can say that I've boiled this thing at capacity at least once per day and most times twice per day over that period and it hasn't failed me yet. I can't speak to the problems others have noted (I read a bunch of reviews before I bought it back in 2013) but I've been fastidious about not opening the tap to fill it until the opening is beneath the faucet (i.e. no water running down the outside of the appliance) I did try to descale it once but it didn't seem to make a big difference and I haven't bothered after that. The text on the buttons that I have used the most ("Boil" and "Black Tea" I think they used to say) have worn off, perhaps recent models have protected the lettering in a better manner but I do not know. Still going strong, can't ask for more from this useful appliance.

I make a butt-load of tea and I was concerned about what the microwave might be doing to the water. I don't like to use a microwave if I can avoid it, but this kettle boils water in just about the same amount of time and is way faster than a kettle set on the stove. I like also that the insides are all stainless steel with the exception of the plastic around the edges on the mesh screen at the top of the spout and the little window which lets you see the water level. It's sturdy and I like that there are multiple heat settings.
The one thing some people might find of concern is that, because the body is stainless steel, the exterior does get very hot after it's boiled water. It's not a problem for me because I know not to touch it anywhere but on the handle when I'm using it, but it's something to keep in mind if this is something kids might be around.

I absolutely love it EXCEPT I had it replaced within the 1st few weeks of using it. A few spots on the inside, Under the inside lid and hinge were rusting!! :( and we use it daily
Got the replacement and unfortunately it’s doing the same thing!
For an $80 kettle — I’m disappointed 😞

I love this electric tea kettle. I have used it with no problems for 5 years. I read some of the reviews and noticed some people complaining about the writing rubbing off. I did have that happen, but it doesn't interfere with the functionality in any way. I am very happy with this purchase. It is hard to find things that actually work that long.

A great kettle for making tea in the office or at home. The detachable base is a flawless design that allows you to pour your water without the concern of a cord tipping anything over or getting in the way. The "Keep Warm" timer is a great option for when you start to brew a pot and get distracted and don't have to worry about turning a burner off or unplugging the kettle. The options for different temperatures cover all potential teas and about any application for hot water. I've purchased 2 of them because I liked the first so much. I keep one at work and one at home. I had to return the first second kettle because when the kettle was hot, the top wouldn't open using the button. Amazon replaced with the item with no questions asked! Great deal. I fully recommend this kettle. I'm a daily tea drinker and enjoy a variety of teas; black, green, roibos, herbal, and oolong.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for white, green and matcha
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a tea kettle that made stopped the "guess my temperature" game that happens with a whistling tea kettle, when making green and white teas. This works wonderfully on doing just that. It is very easy to clean, fill and pour. My formal roommate is getting herself one after using mine and loving it as well.

Would have given 0 stars if this was an option. Broke after 1 month of use. The alarm that sounds at the end of the boil started sounding continuously and would not stop until unplugging it. Then kettle completely stopped heating the water. However the alarm still sounds until unplugged. Thought the extra price of the brand name made it worth it. My last kettle, a cheap plastic one, still works after seven years. Only bought this as an upgrade. Now I wish I had saved the old one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets a bit annoying when there's no off button
reviews.reviewText:
Gets a bit annoying when there's no off button.. I would need to unplug every time or keep it off the stand, or it just keeps beeping and flashing. It boils fairly quickly, only been using it for a week, hopefully it doesn't start to rust. I try to maintain it and take out the water immediately after every use. It's started to get a little discoloration on the bottom which is normal with most electric kettles.
Edit: Discoloration went away after I started using purified water.

This product failed well within the warranty period. I have attempted to contact Amazon for support and received no support.

The product leaked significant amounts of water from the base after about 3 months of use. I am guessing this has something to do with the thermal cycles and perhaps CTE (coefficient of thermal expansion mismatch). Regardless I would not recommend buying this product.

Soon after purchase we had problems with the button that opens the lid. It sticks down and is very hard to get back up, and thus the lid won’t close. It’s cheap feeling, and it’s quite large and takes up room. Look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little machine for making tea and coffee
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my mom for Christmas so I'm not reviewing the one that I just purchased. However, I have had this machine for many years. The temperatures have worn off due to use to try to push it with the pad of your finger not with your nail. But other than that this is a great little machine that has served me very well for years. I hope that my mother's will be just as good and long-lasting for her

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect hot water maker for whatever you need!
reviews.reviewText: This is the best hot water heater I've had in awhile. I had the Cuisinart with the digital dial where you could pick your exact temperature but the top of that unit stopped opening all the way and it was annoying to change the temperature all the time based on what tea I was drinking. With the different buttons, you can get your desired temperature very quickly, the unit looks great on the counter, is easy to clean and has lasted multiple daily use in our apartment since May of 2014 when I bought it. If you're looking for a hot water maker and are particular with the temperature you steep your teas at (as you should be), stop here as you won't find anything better.
The stainless steel top feel off after 1 month.they will fix it , if I pay to ship it and ship it back.😧

This is ,to second kettle from Cuisinart, I dropped the first one and broke it. The kettle is very ergonomically friendly, and the controls are in a good position on the handle. There are 6 temperature selections for different teas and one for French press coffee. The water heats up very fast, and the keep warm setting is a plus. The one downside is the kettle has to be emptied after each use, or the inside bottom will stain. We have city water in our area, not well, and the stain developed over time. Nothing I used seemed to make any difference,the stain remained.

It arrived 2 days ago and I love it. I've been using electric kettles to heat water to use in my Melita One-Cup coffee makers for years...this is the best I've ever owned. Select your water temp, decide whether you want it to _keep_ the water hot, hit start and it produces for you in minutes. Hit start a second time to shut it down. Easy-peasy. Yes, the exterior becomes hot, they all do, but the design is sleek and well balanced, most people should only need one hand on the handle to pour. I am right handed, but because I broke my right wrist 12 years ago at the age of 54, I use my weaker left hand to pour from kettles. (Although weaker, it is more reliable than my right which will, since the break, lose its grip on things)

Thought this kettle was going to be the Cadillac of kettles based on reviews, and it did have a lot of settings for different teas and temperatures. However, it was so noisy! Like a kettle is going to make some noise but this was super loud. Definitely can hear upstairs through a closed door clearly loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tea Drinker? Yep. Used for more though...
reviews.reviewText:
If you're looking into spending some money for a electric kettle and you like tea or are looking to try it. You should definitely get this. I've been using this daily, 1-3 times daily. It's just a trooper. It's a beautiful piece in my office and it makes tea taste better than before.

Update: I've been using this kettle 2-3 times daily for almost a year. I love it. It's still solidering on. No spots of rust. No signs of fading on the buttons. It just works. I've cleaned the outside once since I'd had it. Just to clean up the scuff marks from fingerprints but other than that, it's still beautiful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Costomer Servis of Cuisinart so bad
reviews.reviewText: Some batons of heating water stops work in 3 months. Costomer Servis of Cuisinart so bad and it’s on warranty and you in charge for to sending and handling

I only got 6 months out of it, using it only a few times a week. What a waste. Cuisinart used to be a great manufacturer, but lately, everything I buy with the Cuisinart name (coffeemaker for example) fails in less than a year. No wonder the planet is getting buried in garbage....

reviews.reviewTitle: Forced to pay $25 to get a warranty repair! OUTRAGEOUS!!!
reviews.reviewText: Broke after three months! Flashing lights but no heat. I filed a warranty claim and Cuisinart wanted $15 upfront to ship me a new one and then made me pay $10 to ship the defective one back to them! I know of no other company that requires a customer to pay for the manufacturer's defective products. I will never buy another Cuisinart product.

I have never purchased anything that I have been more pleased with than this Teakettle. It is so easy to program and keeps the water at the correct temperature for 30 minutes. I use it to heat water for my French Press coffee maker every morning and the water is almost ready by the time I grind my coffee beans. It is sleek, looks nice on my counter, easy to clean and the only plastic part is the filter that can be removed if you wish. It is so well made I think it will last for many years and, therefore, worth the extra money it costs.

My only caveat is that if you have arthritic hands it might be too heavy to lift. I does weigh more than the cheap ones, but that's to be expected since it is stainless steel inside and out. I have small hands and I am very old and I can lift it so I don't think that would be a problem for most people.

This does what is say. It heats water to varying degrees based on what you want to make, whether coffee or different types of tear. The one annoying point is that the lid leaks when you are almost done pouring so you either cannot empty it or you have to leave water in the jug.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor reliability for a near $100 kettle.
reviews.reviewText: Like many other reviews, my kettle started leaking at the base after the 3rd month of near daily usage. There is nothing to try adjusting to see where the leak is coming from but it's dangerous to use at this point so we are in the process of working through warranty support.

Excellent invention! I love having the option of temp degrees. Since we got an induction cooktop making my old teakettle obsolete, I have suffered through making tea through my partner's Keurig. I finally have my water heated to the appropriate temp for the type of leaves I am using. I like the "keep warm" feature for those times when I'm busy in the kitchen and can't get to the pot right away. Convenient controls, good design for filling and pouring. Easy to see water level. Have used this multiple times per day over the past 4-5 months, without incident.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not all it's jacked up to be...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle in 2014 and have owned it for about 18 months. I really liked it and paid what I consider to be above the usual price for a kettle. I have a Cuisinart coffee pot that I love and have owned for 5 years. The last kettle was a Braun, and it lasted 8 years. I loved it. Of course, it wasn't a new fangled contraption that was cordless and lit up with variable temp. control! It was a plug in kettle that isn't produced any more.

So, I bought a new kettle. It's not a Cuisinart! If it breaks in a year, I can replace it 3 times before I end up with the same cost and it looks a lot like the Cuisinart, which appears to represent quality, but apparently only if you can afford a replacement every 18 months to 2 years. Sorry! If I pay around $100 for a kettle, it should last slightly more than 3 years.

I'm looking to make a cup of tea, not refinance the company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spout could be better, but brews great beverages.
reviews.reviewText: The Cuisinart PerfecTemp Kettle seems to do a very good job of achieving the proper temperature for brewing different beverages. I got it primarily for French press coffee because I was sick of monitoring the stovetop kettle to make sure the water didn't boil; the coffee comes out with a full flavor and now I can turn it on and walk away. Green and white teas are also much more enjoyable now; the bitterness I always ended up with heretofore is gone, leaving a much cleaner, smoother flavor. My only problem with this kettle is that the filter assembly in the pour spout doesn't allow for a clean pour with the last of the water. It sort of dribbles from a number of places when you try to get the last bit out. I wish it poured more cleanly, but other than that, I really like this kettle.

This replaced an old Krups that I had. What I like about it is it isn't plastic, you can clearly see how much water you have in it, it has a keep warm feature and it looks nice. I'd give it 5 stars if it also had the ability to program it - set it to go on at a certain time. Maybe that will come in the next version. But so far I'd definitely recommend this for any tea drinker.

This was highly rated on lots of sites. Had a Braun that I really liked but it was at least 10 yrs old and time to replace.
Love the variable temperature. Have been drinking loose teas and really nice to brew at the right temp.
It gets really hot though. My Braun was plastic and was not so hot. I have to remember not to touch anything but the handle when using.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke too soon, not worth the risk
reviews.reviewText:
I splurged and bought this expensive kettle because I was routinely burning out those cheaper kettles sold at Target. It stopped working after 2 months. Since I could no longer return it to Amazon, I had to go through Cuisinart. After several emails, I was told that they would be happy to replace the kettle, but I would be responsible for shipping and handling both ways. They would charge $10 to ship the new one to me, and I was encouraged to send the defective one back via an insured route.

I found this kettle heated relatively quickly. Like other reviewers, I found the "keep warm" function difficult to turn off each time I used the kettle.

I decided it wasn't worth the $25 or so I would pay in shipping charges to risk getting a second Cuisinart kettle. With a coupon I was able to buy a Calphalon stove top model from Bed Bath & Beyond for only $10 more.

reviews.reviewTitle: The English give it rave reviews and they like their tea
reviews.reviewText: Big hit!! My boyfriend is from England and he casually commented about this stove top kettle one day saying that in England everyone uses electric ones. I didn't even know what that meant so after some research, I bought this one as a gift for him. He loves it! It gets used daily. His family came to visit him and they were so impressed by the different temperature settings for various teas. The English give it rave reviews and they like their tea! (He makes his coffee with a French Press so he loves that setting as well)

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks nice on the counter, and very fast!
reviews.reviewText:
Love this ! Use it a lot! We are living in a small studio (not hot-water heater) while our
house is being remodeled and I use this to heat up water for dishes.
Very FAST! If it was a little bigger would be great. Takes a few full pots for dishes,
but with the temperature control you don't need much boiling water for dishes!!
We are on week 9, its been great.
We also use it for quick oats in the morning, and my new love of Dandy Blend
I call my coffee. (organic and no caffeine) I wish they made a smaller one for
the office, and I can stop using the microwave. This would be my next step!
This kettle lasted 15 months and start leaking. It was used 2 a day that make total usage less than 900 times. I will recommend try an alternative and advise to avoid this produc.

Works wonderful. Heats up and boils water very fast. It also has a button to keep the temperature constant. Love the fact that you could control how hot you want the water.
Cleaning is a little hard when you have large hands.

I'd always been a stovetop kettle kind of girl. But a few months ago, we decided it was time to retire our grungy old kettle, and I decided to make the leap to an electric model. I did a lot of research and was surprised at how many complaints these appliances generate. Finally I decided on the CPK-17.

And, after three months, I have to say it's pretty much perfect--compact, great-looking, fast, and reliable. I use it most mornings to make French press coffee, but it works equally well for tea or speed-heating water for the stove. I don't detect any metallic flavor in the water, and I'm not noticing any scaling inside even though our water is pretty hard. Another nice feature: When you turn on the kettle, the button for the temperature you've selected flashes blue; after the water reaches temperature and the kettle beeps, the button glows a steady blue--so you can tell whether your water is hot enough even if you were out of the room and didn't hear the beep.

If I wanted to cavil, I guess I could say that the stainless steel tends to show fingerprints. But quite honestly, I don't care. Bottom line: The CPK-17 has converted me to the electric kettle team for good.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was great while it was working cause I can boil water ...
reviews.reviewText: I have this kettle for 22 months and only used couple times a week. It dies now. No light turns on. It was great while it was working cause I can boil water at different temperatures. It is not worth for what it costs. I will go back to the basic electronic one. The more whistle things have, the more issues things come with.

Easy to use and clean. I have had better tasting tea since trying this kettle. The keep warm feature is great if you want multiple cups but if you forget about it, as I have, it will turn itself off! The kettle holds heat well, allowing you to use the water to make a cup even if it has shut off. The 360 degree rotation is a plus if you have a small space. The boil function is very useful, I have used this product several times when I was making things other than tea that required a small amount of boiled water. This is the best kitchen appliance I have bought this year!

Mine was great, I got in in 2011 and it just died today. I used it at least once a day the entire time, worked reliably until it's sudden death this morning. Loved the different settings, perfect for the exact right tea (or coffee) brew. I ordered a new one to replace today.

I was looking for an inexpensive water kettle to boil water for tea and oatmeal and the like and had tried several cheaper brands with only lackluster performance. I looked at this kettle because I like the brand and then fell in love with it when I learned I could choose the temperate I want the water to be. What a great idea!! I can't imagine having any other kettle now. I am completely spoiled by having 6 choices of temperatures to choose from. I have used the kettle now for about a month and it works flawlessly as I have come to expect from Cuisinart. The only down side I have found is that it is a little heavy and big due to a large reservoir. I will add that it is quite pricey and I don't know if I would have initially bought it due to its price without having had a gift card to help but it has been absolutely worth it!!

Received as gift. Works great and has option for different temps. I don't use daily, but for tea or other hot water needs it heats quickly and works great. I have a Keurig that we have owned for several years and usually use hot water out of it. This is a good addition if you don't have something like that or want to have more control over the temperature of water for certain teas.

reviews.reviewTitle: This has been a super reliable little kettle
reviews.reviewText: We use this kettle a dozen plus times a day. We drink a LOT of tea in my house (and coffee). This has been a super reliable little kettle, but there's one issue that knocked it down one star. As other reviewers have mentioned, the labeling on the buttons rubbed off. Completely rubbed off. We use it so much I just know by heart which button is which, but at this point they are all completely blank. We have been using this kettle daily for over two years now and it's never let us down. We have even turned it on dry numerous times. It will beep and complain when it over heats, but it's never broken anything. Also we don't have the rust like some reviewer photo's. So, an excellent highly rated kettle, with one issue, the button labeling.

This item is very well designed. It does what it is supposed to do and operates exactly as shown. I like that the lid swings up and totally out of the way for filling; some kettles do not open so widely. Very high quality and very easy to use. I bought one of these years ago and it gets multiple uses daily. When I decided I wanted a kettle for another location I looked at less expensive ones, but finally bit the bullet and paid for this quality item instead. I'm very glad I did.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick, easy to use, and versatile for various types of coffee and tea
reviews.reviewText: I love this kettle! We purchased this and use it every single day for both coffee and tea. The various temperature settings work great with lighter and more delicate herbal teas, or you can get a hotter temperature for french press or black teas. The kettle heats up very quickly and the window to show the water level is clear and easy to read.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice kettle with good temperature accuracy.
reviews.reviewText: Temperature is accurate. 200 degree setting water measured 199 degrees measured with electronic probe thermometer. Kettle looks and feels great. The base is low and only the diameter of the kettle making the entire thing compact for the amount of water it will heat (1.7 liters) I usually use it on the 200 degree setting for pour over coffee with a Chemex. The Cuisinart's spout design is perhaps not perfect for pour over purposes but I can get a good result with it. I am very happy with this kettle!

Love this kettle and have enjoyed using it daily and many times per day for the past 3 years. It works just as perfectly today as it did when brand new. Have given this kettle as a gift to friends and family who love it as well. In fact, I am purchasing another one today to take on my travels. Hate the coffee pots in hotels where the hot water tastes like coffee when trying to make a cup of tea. Yes, the numbers fade after some time, but it is no big deal to put a small sticker or piece of tape on the button with the temperature. I originally purchased this after major disappointment with the Breville which sometimes turned off automatically and sometimes did not (mostly did not).

So far I really like this kettle. It boils reasonably quickly, is not too loud, and I really like the versatility of the different temperatures. I also like the feature that maintains the temperature for a while.

This compares very favorably to the Breville kettle I was using.

This is the best kettle on the market and I plan to buy another one this weekend. It takes all of the guess work and regular work out of trying to determine what the right temperature is for your tea. I love the look of it and it looks great sitting on my counter. I love just being able to press a couple of buttons and having my water get to just the right temperature for the right tea. You will be hard pressed to find a kettle any better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, reliable, easy to clean
reviews.reviewText:
Have had this about 6 months - we use it every day and it continues to work without problems. We've verified that different settings are indeed the labelled setting (we bought an IR temp gun for another use and tried it on this out of curiosity). Easy to use - once you get the hang on remembering to push START after selecting the temp.

Heats water quickly enough that I often heat water for boiling things on the stove in it instead of just turning the gas on the burner (it calculates out to about the same cost per BTU between propane for the stove and electricity for the kettle, and the kettle is much faster).

We had a clear Capresso we liked, but the glass spotted and scaled and could not be cleaned. No problems like that with this one.

I love this electric kettle! It has buttons for specific temperatures, and each button is labeled with the temperature and the corresponding type of coffee or tea brewed at that temperature. Just as with a traditional stovetop kettle, the length of time it takes for it to heat up depends on the water level. When the water is ready, it beeps twice, then stays hot for a little while on its own, but will remain at the indicated temperature for 30 minutes if you press the keep warm button. Although I haven't checked the water temperature with a thermometer to see how accurate the temperature gauge is, I've always had a good cup of tea with this kettle, regardless of the recommended water temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: keeps boiling even when empty, lasted exactly one year, not good quality for the price
reviews.reviewText: This kettle lasted one year and 5 days - just long enough to not be able to return it. We drink a lot of tea and have tried a lot of different kettles (it seems none really last long). I was so excited about this one initially, but ergonomically its terrible - very awkward and hard to hold. Also it doesn't really have an auto shut off - if you put it back on the base with no water in it, it will still boil and potentially destroy the element. Also the keep warm setting is too easy to press accidentally so its trying to boil water when its empty (when we've just poured the boiling water into the teapot and putting it back on the base). I'm really disappointed, this was expensive!!!!

I am in love with this kettle. It's quicker and no louder than a coffee pot, but with the added bonus of multi temperatures. I read some reviews that said that the numbers wear off, which I've used other products that have done the same, so I just painted over them with clear fingernail polish. Bam, now they won't ever fade away.

Love the keep warm functionality. Works great and I found it consistent with different temperatures and pretty fast too compared to my old kettle.

I only have a couple of minor issues so far based on a week's usage:
1. The measuring scale is hidden beneath the handle unlike a few other kettles which makes it a bit difficult to use
2. The Open button does not open the lid consistently, not sure what the issue is, it works if I press 2/3 times.

It was great until it wasn't. After 18 months, it now starts beeping and blinking all the lights whenever it's plugged in. The manual says that's because the water level is too low, so perhaps the water sensor is broken. Not worth the effort and $30 to send it in for warranty repair.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hipsters won't admit to owning it, but....
reviews.reviewText:
I think I just tracked an SFO bound flight on this thing. It's got settings for every kind of tea, and most importantly (sorry you tea-drinking mutants) a setting for 200 degrees (labeled as french-press), which every coffee hipster worth their beard will know is the optimal temperature for separating the artisanal coffee brew from the pleebs' mass produced swill...I kid....wait...no I don't. Pro: You can gloat about your perfectly heated water...Con: you'll be a pretentious ass.

But hey...small price to pay for a knee-weakening good cup of coffee.

This is my second one I've ordered. The first one, I've had for almost a year without a problem. Use it daily for tea and seems to keep the temperature it states on the buttons. It only a tad off most times with the lower temperature teas but that shouldn't be a problem if you get it when it beeps. Use it for cooking instant oatmeal and instant ramen. Built solid and doesn't disappoint at all. Lifting it off the charging base and do not have cables attached as you pour your water out.
The first one I got, I use daily at work and the other is for home.

This is my second pot. Used my old one for 6 years. Love it. Someone tried to pull the lid open without depressing the button. It is out of wack now but still works like a champ. I'll use it in my basement and use the new one in the kitchen.

I'm trying to decide whether to return. It's temperatures are off. I only make green tea and chemex coffee. So 175 is actually 150. 200 is 175. So I can make the green tea if I set it to 200. But I can't really get 200 for coffee. I can boil and let it cool for a bit. But I can also do that with a cheap kettle on the stove.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect attractive electric kettle with temperature control
reviews.reviewText: LOVE IT! Was looking for an attractive electric kettle with temperature control. Looking far and wide just led to awful AWFUL reviews of really ugly designs. After seeing this one recommended in Oprah recently and noticing fairly good reviews and simple design, I got this one. Worth the extra $$ compared to others! Only other ones that were equal in my opinion were over $120 and not great reviews. If you need one that JUST boils, move along and by something more basic. But if you like making tea and not guess-ti-mating (sp?) the temp then get this tea kettle! Will update review if I find any issues after longer use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle. Heats up quickly, keeps the water hot for 30 minutes and it's quiet.
reviews.reviewText:
My mom loves it. It went perfectly with her kitchen and the extra button options for tea is fantastic. It's also very quiet.

However, whoever packed this order when I originally bought it didn't do a good job of packing it. I worked in a warehouse. This product had a small piece of packing paper on the side and nothing on top to prevent anyone from cutting on top of it (which no one did). If the product could have slid around it would have as it hardly had any protection but it never affected the quality of the product. I'd definitely buy it again.

I bought this as a Christmas present for my wife. She loves it. It is much more versatile than her old one which broke after 3 years. She loves the ease of use and the lights and settings for whatever drink she might desire. Not complicated at all according to her.

This is a change from my Japanese made water boiler/heater and while it doesn't keep water at the desired temp at all times, or have the push button dispenser, I still like it. The temperature range/selection is excellent and allows for more optimal water temps depending on the tea I'm drinking. Also went with this model due to the stainless steel construction. So far so good and is used daily. It is also aesthetically pleasing to look at.

I love the look of this, easy to clean, holds a terrific amount of water, different temperature choices....I really love it. My only complaint is that It only lasted 1.5 years. Even so, I bought a second one because the pros outweighed the con
After 3 uses the "Open Lid" button became stuck and would not open so I am unable to use this product. Was excited for it and the construction but let down but this defect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaked and plastic chips in bottom
reviews.reviewText: Worked superbly for about 13 months, then as others mentioned it leaked all over the counter. Upon inspection, inside the kettle contained what appeared to be "paint chips" which was likely the plastic that broke apart in the interior of the kettle. Customer service worthless, plus I wouldn't want a replacement after this experience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very poor quality, after just a bit over a year ...
reviews.reviewText:
Very poor quality, after just a bit over a year it just stopped working no heat no light nothing, after lengthy negotiation with the Cuisinart customer service they replaced it, that I have no complaint with that part.
Now another year and a half later the kettle become a total fire hazard smoke came out of it, I had to pull the plug in a hurry before the smoke detector went off.
Will never buy Cuisinart product again, must be made in China.

reviews.reviewTitle: right in the middle for a perfect cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText:
There are certainly cheaper kettles available, but along with paying less you also get less. No only do you hear to the proper temperature for everything from delicate green teas to rolling boils, right in the middle for a perfect cup of coffee.
The lid opens slowly and with a controlled motion that eliminates splashes or the realse of too much steam at once. The handle stays cool for safe pouring, and the spout's curvature ensures a smooth steady stream.
The only concern I have is that the buttons have silkscreened temperatures which might run off with time. But that is a bridge that will have to be crossed when the time comes for it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed after 10 months and Warranty Repair is not worth the costs.
reviews.reviewText: As other have stated, this kettle is prone to failure after several months and Cuisinart demands that the customer pay for shipping if they want a replacement. This is far too much for an appliance such as this. I replaced this with a different brand that cost about half as much and has more options. I am far less likely to purchase Cuisinart products in future as their warranties are useless.

Bought this as a gift for my mom for her birthday in may, and 2 days ago it just stopped working, all the lights just flash when you try to turn it on, and the only way to make it stop is unplug it. Tried calling customer service, only to sit on hold for over an hour, with no response. Tried emailing them, we'll see how that works out. This Kettle didn't even work for 3 full months. Do yourself a favor and look at other brands. Cuisinart may have once been a go to reliable brand, but no longer!

Works fast, easy to use.

Lets face it, we're not really awake in the morning until after coffee. This makes the coffee-making process easier. And if you like tea, this helpfully has presets for various kinds of tea (they're supposed to brew at different temperatures).

reviews.reviewTitle: The lid is unable to open after 9 months used ...
reviews.reviewText: The lid is unable to open after 9 months used. I tried to contact manufacturer to claim the issue. Although they are able to do an exchange for me, but I need to afford shipping fee bi-directions $30. I also see many users are having the same issue. I will give the product for 5 stars at the first few months, but it's not worth to spend $70+ for using it less than a year.

This was my first electric kettle and I really liked it - heats water quickly and sleek appearance. Being able to select precise temperatures is a nice feature, if not critical. Water pours easily without dripping, and the viewing window shows how much water is in the kettle.

The kettle worked fine until just after the 3-yr warranty period. Disappointing that products often appear to be engineered for a finite lifespan, creating the need to re-buy the product. This time around I am opting for a basic range top stainless kettle and insulated carafe to minimize of electronic components (Oxo and Zojirushi, respectively).

We had an older Hamilton Beach electric kettle that began to leak after about 6 years of good service. I searched and compared electric kettles in the under $100 category. This was the only one with a 3-year warranty that turned up in my comparison. It has great features that include multiple temperature settings at the touch of a button and keeping water warm for 30 minutes. I was pleasantly surprised at how much better my green and herbal teas tasted when brewed at a more correct temperature than boil. Also, the kettle is quieter than the old HB unit. It's not super quiet, though. We used our AMEX card as we do with all electronic purchases to enhance the warranty, a program that really saves you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Superbly awesome. I love the slick look
reviews.reviewText: Superbly awesome. I love the slick look, and the functionality. I work in an office with people who love tea, and this was perfect for their different types of tea and for those who love French press coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Over a Year of Use, No Problems
reviews.reviewText: I've used this kettle and one from Breville and Hamilton Beach. For the price this one feels much better than the other two. Although the Breville pours more smoothly, which is nice. Aside from that this kettle has more features and works faster. I've never had an issue with it. You'll have to clean it with baking soda or vinegar from time to time, but other than that there's barely any maintenance. I use it mainly for my espresso, while the lady uses it for tea.

My wife loves the looks and I love the function. Easy and quick to use. Keep warm setting and memory are nice touches. Different temperatures is not an issue for us but may be for some. I would have gone with something less expensive (but, as my resident expert put it, much less elegant) but I am completely satisfied with this. I thought I would regret retiring the old put-it-on-the-burner kettle. But I don't.

Purchased March 2014, it’s now Nov of 2017 and this still works perfectly and looks great after 3.5 yrs of 2 hrs of daily use. It’s used constantly throughout our morning routine for coffee with the Aero press. Awesome temperature control. I also use it to bring water to a boil for cooking and then pour into a pot which is much faster than waiting on the gas range to bring it to a boil. Great product.

At last! Finally an electric kettle with temperature controls that actually work. Comes to temperature quickly. If you want a quick check, flashing light means still heating, solid means at temperature.

Buttons are easy to push and feel solid. Others have mentioned that the labels wear off, and I suspect that will still happen, although not very soon.

I will say that it is somewhat awkward to see the level of water when you are filling it since it is underneath your hand, but that seems to be the trendy (but stupid) location for the window.

Very pleased with it so far.

Worst problem is that measurement is in liters. But no big deal. I just pretend a liter is a quart. Close enough. Oh, if doing Via, 185 is more than hot enough. But use 200 for pour over or French press

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything is good, but it has one minor issue - it ...
reviews.reviewText:
We use it about a year day to day, boiling a lot of water. Everything is good, but it has one minor issue - it switches to the auto-warming mode automatically by default. Would be great to find the way to disable this mode, because there is a danger to burn it out without the water inside.
All the rest is pretty good, and we are quite happy.

I've had this kettle for almost a year now and I am glad I have decided to buy it despite the bad reviews. For me, it is working great and I love it. I use it several times a day. I have an electric tea maker from T-fal that I bought in France but if I don't want to use the tea maker, I can just make the perfect cup of tea using the right temperature. Also, I have a coffee French press and if you want to make a good cup of coffee, you need to be able to heat the water at the perfect temperature. This kettle has a French press setting. I have nothing bad to say about this kettle and I hope it last for a few years. I really recommend this item. It's worth the price if like me you make coffee in a coffee press and if you love different kind of tea.

We really like the features on this product, and for the most part are pleased with the performance so far. We have had this for three months and it has started to make strange noises when heating up on the highest setting, which is what we use most often (for a coffee press). Other than that, it has worked fine, and is a nice fast way to have heated water for tea or coffee. We never have to worry any more about forgetting the teakettle is on the stove and burning the bottom. This is a safe product and easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: like snow to the eskimo, so is hot water for the tea person
reviews.reviewText:
Wow, this thing exceeded my expectations! I read all the negative reviews just to see what I was getting into and decided to take the plunge (sort of like my tea bag).

I didn't even give the kettle a chance for off flavors, I treated it to the 1 part vinegar/ 3 part water boil, cool, add 1/4 cup salt swish and let sit, rinse, 1/2 cup baking soda/water boil, rinse, scrub with my wand scrubber with light liquid detergent for dishes, rinse, rinse and voila, no added flavors that I don't want! Granted, there was a bit of a stainless steel odor when I first opened the kettle up, but I do think this is just what one deals with when getting a brand new stainless steel cookware item. I thought of it like a new fry pan, scrub down in hot sudsy water and rinse well.

The settings are a ton of fun to play with. And there is definitely a huge difference in the way my herbal teas taste at the proper temperature, no more icky bitters! For the tea drinker who drinks a variety of teas, this is the kettle for them! No more waiting around the stove for the kettle to whistle, this watched pot definitely boils quick!!

There was a commentary about how there is not an auto off feature. I didn't consider this an issue, as I do believe that electrical appliances should always be monitored. The kettle will stop boiling when the selected temperature is reached, then will reboil as the temperature drops. I figure that when I pour the cup I want, I just turn it off if I don't want another. If I do want another, the kettle keeps it going for when I get the second cup. Or I just turn it off, period, I am not that lazy that I can't monitor my own kettle! This little gem is so speedy, I already feel spoiled. Am going to try it for things like instant oatmeal, soup, etc. seems like it would work well.

I love that this pot has a specific button to get the right temperature for French press coffee, which I make every morning. Now i don't have to wait near the kettle to listen for "almost boiling". The kettle beeps when it reaches the right temp and keeps the water at that temp for 15 minutes. I can feed the dog, make my breakfast, take my vitamins, etc at my leisure...little things like that make life seem less rushed....

reviews.reviewTitle: high price for extra features which not perfect
reviews.reviewText:
pros:
quick boil, keep warm feature, can combine with a external timer switch to turn on at specific time
interior is metal which better than plastic, handler is plastic which is ok
cons:
- if use coffee bean, tea, it's hard to clean the waste, the mouth is not wide enough for the hand in or way out
- water flow out narrow and not smoothly to fill the glass

cons may over weight pros in term of price is bit high end here

I don't know why I didn't buy this kettle years ago. It is amazing!

I drink French Press coffee every day. I know not to use boiling water and I got to the point where I could hear when the water was ready. It is great to be able to hit the French Press button on this kettle and walk away knowing the water would be perfect when I got back.

But tea??? That's a whole 'nother story! Again, didn't boil my green tea but after making a cup of green tea with this I realized I was still using water that was too hot. It really makes a difference with the flavor! We drink all different types of tea so now we know we're going to end up with a great cup.

Also, it heats up quickly. The only time I had a problem was when I overfilled it a bit and it wouldn't turn on. Once I realized the problem it started right up.

The only con is the bottom of the kettle gets very hot. Make sure it's out of the way of little fingers and make sure you only grab it by the handle.

This kettle has been carefully treated and simply stopped working at the one year mark. No response from Cuisinart when we contacted support. Excellent kettle when working, but little use if it won't turn on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect teapot for the tea lover
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased this teapot before and it worked very well. Until it didn’t. But i bought it again because it offers the different temperatures for the different kinds of tea. And other features that I didn’t see on other teapots.

This kettle is amazing! It heats up water very quickly and does a great job of staying at the right temperature. I suppose a gooseneck would be more useful for my pour over coffee, but obviously I knew it didn't have one going into the purchase. That hasn't really been a problem anyway, you just have to tilt it gently when pouring.

It looks great on our counter. The buttons are easy to read and press. Sometimes I forget to press the start button, which can be annoying, but that's a user issue. I don't really have any valid complaints about this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing product, worth the $$ even with the few minor flaws.
reviews.reviewText:
I love this kettle! It has completely changed my tea drinking experience. Using appropriate temperatures really brings out the taste of different teas especially green and white. I also like the easy-to-read measurements. 0.5 L = 16 oz. (ok. 16.9, but close enough!) which helps me match up how many scoops of tea to infuse, based on how much water I've poured without over-complicating the process.

I also like the keep warm function for days when I'm busy doing something else while the water is heating up. However, something that's taken me some getting used to is the fact that if the "keep warm" was on, then when I pour the water and place the kettle back on the stand, it starts to heat my empty kettle! I know there is a safeguard but when I hear the empty pot boiling and alarming, I get a pretty big scare that I've burnt out the kettle. Be sure to turn off the "keep warm" button before lifting the pot if you plan on using all of the water. Overall, even with the hefty price tag, this kettle is so worth it! Using the kettle helps to make a perfect cup of tea, every single time. If you drink tea regularly (or french press coffee), you must buy this!!

This is my third CPK-17 this year that has failed. At only 4 months old, it has managed to last longer than the other two, but it is now dead. Cuisinart did replace the other dead units, but I had to pay for shipping and am really not interested in wasting any more money on this product. I know they will replace this again under warranty, but I feel that my money will be better spent elsewhere.

While it worked, we really enjoyed this water heater, but it is much too unreliable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good price over my other top choice
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle as a gift but I get to enjoy the tea made with it and see it in action almost every day. It's been a really good purchase so far; at the time I was considering buying this kettle or the Breville One-Touch Tea Maker. Below are the reasons why I chose this product:
1. At the time this kettle was a whopping $175 LESS than the Breville Tea Maker. Big difference there!
2. The Breville seemed cool with its "one-touch, brew the tea too" option, BUT if you like to make different teas then you can easily switch temperatures with this kettle to go from black to green or oolong, etc without having to clean out the pot (which, with the Breville, would have all your steeped tea inside) to change teas. This works well because I rarely drink the same tea as the owner of the kettle (they prefer stronger flavored teas while I prefer sweeter, flowery notes in my tea).
3. Did I mention $175 less? :)

Other nice things about this kettle:
* It's really sleek looking with the steel and blue backlight.
* The buttons are easy to read and I like that the temperature and type of tea are on the same button, for those who may be forgetful about what temperature goes with what type of tea.
* Reaches temperature within minutes. Very fast and easy to pour/refill.
* Doesn't take up too much counter real estate
* Doesn't have a million pieces (to lose/break)

I don't know how loud other kettles are or if any are whisper quiet so I can't really compare the noise. This one only makes sounds when its reaching a boil and even then I think it's just the water boiling. The sound stops after the water reaches its temperature. The kettle's owner brought it in to work and said the sound is not too loud (and this is in a quiet, cubicle environment). The beep when the tea is ready is not too loud, but since the kettle keeps the water at temperature, it's no big deal. Just see if the temperature button you set has stopped flashing, and if so, your water is ready.

You still need a mug and brew basket or tea bags or whatever you use to steep your tea, as this is just a variable temperature kettle.

I have owned this kettle for a few years and had no problems at all with it. (Note, it's important not to fill past the water fill line so that you don't have a boiling water hazard from the spout.) I make my morning coffee with a French Press, and the french press water temp on the kettle makes a perfect pot every time. I use this kettle 3-4 times per day. The inside looks as clean as when I purchased it. I use filtered water from an R/O system so there is no need to remove any build-up. I like that it has an auto shut-off feature, as I tend to be forgetful about unplugging it sometimes. It is fast heating and so much more convenient to use than a pot on the stove.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought this in my quest for the perfect cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this in my quest for the perfect cup of coffee. The temperature settings seem to be accurate, although I haven't not measured them with a thermometer. I love that is has a specific "French Press" setting that heats the water to just short of a boil. This has taken the guesswork out of letting the kettle cool down before pouring it over the coffee grounds.

The outside of the kettle does get very hot! But the handle does not conduct any heat. The "keep warm" setting also works very well. Often I heat water for coffee and go off to do something and forget about it and when I return the water still seems to be the right temperature.

I love this water pot. It is much quicker than heating water in the microwave or on the stove to make a mug or pot of green tea. Choosing the185 degree temperature is perfect for green tea, and I was never sure what the temp was when using the microwave or tea kettle on the stove. It keeps the water at the proper temperature long enough to make a second or third cup of tea sequentially if you want. I've been using it daily for nearly 6 months and it performs flawlessly. I highly recommend it.

this was to replace Breville SK500XL Ikon which had a broken electric contact in the pot itself. Cuisinart seems to work as described. For some this pot might be too smart since it has bunch of options. All in my household like the new pot. All stainless still with only removable screen made out of plastic. Boils fast, keeps warm, ring at the end....no plastic scent/smell in the water (I have very acute sense of smell). We like it so far. The only cons: Cuisinart is more expensive then Breville but you get what you paid for....

This tea kettle functions perfectly. I love the temperature flexibility, the cordless feature and the keep warm function. My one and only complaint with this product is the lettering disappearing from my buttons. It would be great if I didn't have to memorize the key pad and/or supervise guests using the kettle. I would probably still buy this kettle even knowing what I know now, but it's disappointing to have such a glaring flaw in an otherwise perfect product. If it were a less expensive product, I might be able to overlook this; but at this price, it's inexcusable.

I was really skeptical about an electric kettle. I was surprised by how fast it is! Use it daily, love the temperature control for making different kinds of beverages. But it's my go-to for pour over coffee.

When the product arrived, the top lid would not open when it was hot. The product started leaking out of a bottom seal after about a month. It is now completely useless. This indicates either the product was fragile and damaged in shipping, or that the design and build quality was faulty.

Sprung a leak after 6 months. The warranty is worthless, as it costs approximately $30 for shipping. I'll just buy a new pot and this one goes in the trash. May be the last cusinart product I ever buy.

My wife uses this several times a day to make tea and also to heat water for the way she does our cat food. The cat food use is fairly straight forward: boil about 2 cups of water, pour half in a large bowl with a small bowl of raw ground rabbit in the large bowl. Keep the other cup of water hot for 10 minutes and then replace the water in the bowl. That warms the rabbit to body temperature without cooking it. She also makes tea to drink during the day and uses the temperatures depending on the tea she has chosen. She often drinks green tea but sometimes oolong and others. So having easy choices on kettle is great.

It has a clean stainless finish, heats up water very fast, love the different tea temperatures and the keep warm feature is very nice for when you have guests and need to refill the teapot. I like this kettle.

reviews.reviewerName: Just a way to pass the time
reviews.reviewText: My Mom has this item. I wanted to get it for that reason. I love tea. We are a tea-loving family. I love that there is an option to keep the water at the right temperature, because if I hear it re-boiling, once I've gotten distracted with other things, I am reminded that I forgot to make my tea. Once I've made my tea, I turn the kettle off, of course. The blue LED is just cool, a bonus feature which I find unnecessary. I like it. I haven't unpacked my special green teas, so I've been using the black tea option, hottest water possible, and it's great, particularly for my "tisana", the Italian word for non-caffeinated teas in the evening, popular all throughout Europe. I make iced tea with this too. Love it. Highly recommended.

I had been looking for an electric water kettle with variable temperature options and found this. I bought it and have tried it out several times now. I am extremely pleased with it. It heats water quickly and to the proper temperature. It makes a beeping noise to let you know the water is heated, but it is pretty quiet, not too noisy or annoying. It also comes with a feature to keep the water heated to the temperature you select for 30 mins or so. Overall, I am very happy with my Cuisinart PerfecTemp kettle!

UPDATE- I have been using this kettle for a while now, and I couldn't be happier! It still works perfectly! I have had no problems with it. It is my favorite appliance in my home! If it ever dies, I will definitely be getting another.

I've bought this kettle September of 2015 and it is still going strong. Water for coffee or tea is always the perfect temperature. I want to buy another one but I need it as a gift and don't want to wait 4 weeks for it to be shipped.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee ready in under 4 minutes; tea is always ...
reviews.reviewText: Coffee ready in under 4 minutes; tea is always just right, and it is so much faster than boiling water in a pan or even a regular kettle. Push a button to open the top, push a button to select water temp and press Start. Press start again to turn it off. A very efficient and elegant tool for the kitchen, and it also turns of automatically after reaching boiling point.

I purchased the Cuisinart electric kettle in December 2011 and have used it practically every day since it arrived. I use the kettle almost exclusively to heat water to make coffee each day in my French Press. I had not used an electric kettle in the past and was hesitant to spend money on one. However, the convenience of being able to get the water up to temp and keep it there while I am busy getting ready for work has been well worth the purchase price. My first impression of the unit left me a bit concerned about the durability of the temperature buttons, as they felt a little squishy to me. Since the unit is almost always set at 200 degrees, it's really just the start button that I put to use and it has worked fine.

My only grip with this kettle is that I wish the water window was offset rather than being directly behind/under the handle. I guess it would look odd from a design standpoint, but it would make the water level easier to see while the kettle is sitting in the sink under the RO water spigot. Once the kettle is on the base and turned on, the water level is very easy to see. I won't take a star away for this issue though as I have been extremely satisfied with this product and it could just be my aging eyes that are the problem.

I only use filtered water from our reverse osmosis unit in the kettle, so I haven't had any issues with scale build up. I would definitely recommend this kettle to others.
Love this teapot. No metallic taste that other pots tend to have. Boils rapidly and keeps hot for the time stated. This is my second one. Hard water is not as kind for as long.
I bought this for a gift for my daughter in the marines who is overseas on base. She just received it and it burned up the first time she used it! I would definitely not recommend it this brand

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice features, but pours out in a sprinkly mess
reviews.reviewText: I love the one-touch temperature select, the look of the kettle, and how fast it heats the water. I HATE that the last 2-3 oz. or so do not pour out in a nice steady stream. It turns into a sprinkly mess at the end of the pour, I think because of the sediment filter. This is not a characteristic that an $80 kettle should have. Would not buy again.

dangerous. stupid. wasteful. i have a hard time understanding why anyone would like this. I've spent more time dealing with this dopey machine than I ever did on my previous electric kettle (and older Krups). The buttons are small and easy to accidentally trip. It's possible to unintentionally have this thing boiling water on and off all day long. It often stays on for no reason at all, with no way to turn it off other than to unplug it. Even working properly, it's no more convenient than it should be. When will someone make an electric kettle that just works?
Love this. Heats up very fast, easy to clean

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible Customer Service for Defective Product
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using this product for 1.5 years, but then it stopped working recently. Cuisinart’s customer service has been unresponsive to my requests to file a warranty claim. I’ve tried calling, emailing, and even using social media in attempts to resolve. Please do not buy this item or any Cuisinart items if you expect any kind of customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Designed for my entire tea collection, does the job nicely!
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle is attractive, with its stainless steel carafe, updated shape, and pretty blue display - it should be, for its price. It's extremely easy to use, as the temperature, start and hold buttons all do exactly what you'd think they would do. And the fact that the kettle itself is cordless (the cord connects to the heating base) optimizes freedom and comfort of use.

I have an extensive collection of teas of all types, so the various temperature settings take the guesswork out of heating water in a stovetop kettle. (I regularly use every one of the temperature settings!) Although my ear was becoming fairly well tuned to the sounds of my stovetop kettle, nothing takes the place of absolute certainty!

Besides the various temperature settings, I am happy to finally have a kettle with a volume window. Before, if I wanted to use my larger teapot to make a partial (not full) pot of tea, I had to use a measuring cup to ensure the proper amount of water for the quantity of tea leaves I was using - a big pain. Although this is a common feature of electric kettles, I'm happy to have this feature combined with the various temperature settings this kettle offers.

I'm not crazy about the way the Cuisinart pours, however. The somewhat irregular flow is probably due to the presence of the removable filter at the inside entry to the spout, but this is no excuse. It could have been better designed. It's especially annoying when I am pouring the last of the water out and, in order to get the last ounce or so to pour, I have to return the kettle to upright and then pour the last bit out.

The half hour hold feature is nice, but I'm finding I need a bit more time. An hour would have been better. As it is, I find that many times I need to manually turn the kettle back on, once its passed its half hour hold time, in order to finish up the remainder of the contents.

All in all, this product was thoughtfully designed and appears to be the only kettle on the market that truly satisfies the needs of the consummate drinker of a wide variety of teas.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... 3 months of light use and we are very disappointed in Cuisinart Warranty & Customer Service
reviews.reviewText: The pot lid quit opening after 3 months of light use and we are very disappointed in Cuisinart Warranty & Customer Service. Yes, they will replace it, but we must pay $15 shipping for a new pot AND pay additional shipping to return the faulty pot. We went for a more expensive pot, thinking we would get a quality product that would last a long time. We would have given this 5 stars for quick heating, ease of use (prior to lid malfunction) and preference over a whistling tea kettle on the stove. But malfunction brings it down the rating. A company that charges customers almost $30 to replace a faulty product that has a 3 year Warranty will not get our return business.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working less than two months after purchase
reviews.reviewText: This kettle was great until it stopped working completely. I receive it in mid October 2014. Today is January 11 2015 and it stopped heating the water up - the light turns on and it appears to be working but the water never heats up. This is the THRID one I've tried, as I love the ability to chose the different temps and it does a great job when it works but all three have stopped working a month or so after using. I use filtered water and take great care of my kettles too - it's not like I'm mistreating it. Best of all, they only have a 30 day return policy now, which I just missed. I will never buy another one. That's $100 down the drain.

This was my Christmas present to myself. I am a stay at home mom/designer and I am constantly forgetting I have put a kettle on in the kitchen. I have boiled dry one too many kettles over the year so I looked into other options. This seemed to be the best choice due to stainless steel vs plastic element. I fear the chemicals that leech out of plastic after repeated heating so this is just perfect for me. My one tiny complaint is that the beep is so faint you can often miss it and the heating "roar" can drown it out altogether, but the feature that keeps it from boiling dry is a life changer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but get an insurance
reviews.reviewText:
I like this product so much that purchased 5th already in 8 years duration.

It looks great and works great but unfortunately, breaks quiet often. I purchased 5th one in my 8 years.

If you buy one, get an insurance but only if it has reasonable price, under $8-10 dollars. Otherwise, It is very expensive.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2nd one in two years to stop working
reviews.reviewText: I love the features of this teakettle, but this is the second one in two years to stop working. I use it about 3 to 4 times a week to make green tea or pressed coffee. I am very gentle with it lifting it on and off the base, no hard water or other liquids, etc. It lights up as normal, but never heats up, makes three beeps and shuts off. Same symptoms as the first one that died. For $99 I expect it to last more than a year. I think I'd be ok with it if it lasted 10 years. I think that's a reasonable expectation. At 4 times a week for one year, it costs me 50 cents each time I use it.

Unfortunately, my review is limited as my kettle arrived damaged and I will be returning. The spout appears cheap and attached with glue to the main body. Hopefully the electronic components outlast the flimsy exterior. I'll update my review once my replacement is received and tested.

It takes this kettle exactly 6:55 to bring the full 1.7 liters to boil. My non-electric kettle took around 15:00 minutes to boil the roughly same amount of water on a gas stove following which I'd have to wait a few more minutes for it to cool down to the 200F recommended for French press coffee. Setting this Cuisinart kettle to 200F with just the amount of water I need saves me around 15 minutes per pot of coffee compared to the stove top kettle. And no more annoying whistles; just a series of electronic beeps and the water is maintained at whatever temperature you set for 30 minutes. Excellent design.

I wouldn't suggest this item or anything from this same manufacturer. This item is an every day use in our house and it's been a little over a year and has stopped working. It does have a 3 year limited warranty. But in order for them to replace the unit, they require us to pay the $15.00 shipping and we have to cover to ship the unit back. Why as consumers should we have to pay money for a warranty replacement ?

Do you drink tea every day? Do you like all different kinds of tea? Then you need this hot-water pot. It lets you select what type of tea you are brewing-- everything from "delicate," "green," "white," and "black," to "french press coffee (boiling)." Always check your particular brand of tea, since every tea is different and may need a setting other than what it says on the pot. The only thing that would make this kettle better is if you could specify the exact temperature, instead of just having 6 settings. But, I can't complain, as it has come in very handy and is much better than my former "boil, wait, and guess" method of brewing tea.

reviews.reviewTitle: Less than one year old and leaking
reviews.reviewText: Never imagined it would fail in this way... it's leaking water from the bottom seams. I don't even understand how this could happen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy and quickly heat water to brew your choice of tea or for any recipe or beverage you need.
reviews.reviewText: My second Cuisinart Electric Kettle! Use this product several times each day and our first one lasted 5-7 years. My husband was able to repair the first one also. With the different easy to choose settings I can brew any type of tea at the correct temperature. Easy to clean and I always take it with me on vacation. You can quickly brew ice tea for a crowd. Highly recommend this product.

This kettle is attractive, heats quickly, and has a good selection of preset temperatures. The stylized handle took a bit of getting used to, but once we got past that this kettle worked well for us. Well, until it failed. It started leaking (through a crack in the water level indicator) after 16 months. Our last kettle lasted 10 times as long, so this is very disappointing durability. I'm returning it for warranty repairs, but having to pay for in-warranty product service is also disappointing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality, easy to use, looks nice, heats quickly
reviews.reviewText:
Does what it says, very well. It looks very nice in our kitchen, doesn't take up too much space, fitting on the counter with cabinets overhead (but don't point the spout under something when it's heating or you'll steam your cabinets).

It heats quickly, even when filled pretty full. It holds a lot of water. We can fill our 2-4 cup french press with only about a third to a quarter of this teapot's capacity. There is a clear and audible signal when the water is ready. Buttons are labelled with the tea/coffee types so you get properly heated water for each, without having to figure out degrees.

I bought this because I constantly was putting the kettle on the wrong burner and creating a dangerous home and my nephew started to tell me about the environmental benefits of electric kettles, so I figured why not, let's try it. Good choice!
It is beautiful, it is easy to use and it shuts off by itself. My partner is a foodie and a geek and he is smitten with the fact that it heats up to the best temp based on the type of tea you are brewing. Perfect for us!

Purchased this thing in Oct 2016 and it is now dead. As some other reviewers have stated, this thing was not built to last. It began to fail about a month ago, then started leaking water and died. After several years of purchasing electric teakettles and finding them all to be garbage, I'm going back to analog.

Broke after only 6 months. The buttons beep and light, but the kettle does not heat. HOWEVER, I did notice that several people had this problem and so I called Cuisinart. I was on hold for 35 minutes. But customer service was very nice and efficient. For $10.80 they are sending me a new kettle, and I can return the old one in the box it comes in. Since the kettle was $90, I think it is worth it.
Nicely has idiot-proof temperature controls for certain teas, but its spout must be deformed because the pour always splatters on the way out.

Been using since 12/2018. Working well, the complaints of it being loud almost put me off, but honestly... it’s not that loud, and the fact that making tea is a pretty quick process makes it even less of an issue.

I really love this. I searched for quite a while for a stainless steel electric kettle without harmful plastics in it. The temperature control that allows you to choose a temperature depending on the type of tea you're making is fantastic. I can definitely taste a difference in my different teas now that they are prepared at the right temperature. This kettle works quickly too. I've let water sit in it a few times to ensure that it doesn't leak. So far, no leaks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Got it for about 6 weeks. Works great.
reviews.reviewText: "keep warm" feature is very handy, as well as light to see water level. Not so sure about that many different temperature settings if they are really needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: been better at a lower temp
reviews.reviewText: So handy, and it has cut down on the competition for the microwave (since I no longer have to heat my water for tea there). I am only beginning to learn the difference it makes heating water to the right temp for the type of tea (which is harder to fine-tune with a microwave). So far, green tea has, indeed, been better at a lower temp.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fast and Well Designed Electric Cordless Kettle
