reviews.reviewText: I wasn't a fan of cordless electric kettles but after switching to green tea drinking at home I saw I need something more convenient then heating water on the stove every time. The Cuisinart CPK-17 is solid in it's construction and has just the right temperatures to select from for my needs. The stainless steel finish coupled with the blue lighting make this look cool in any scenario. The speed at which this heats up is much improved from other kettles I've seen and used in the past. If you want an electric kettle and you want one of the best, this is it.

I've purchased two of these over a 8 month period and they both stopped working after a couple of months. I don't know what is going on because I've followed all their operating instructions but I will purchase a different brand next.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! I was wary, but have had no problems after one year
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle a year ago, after spending way too much time reading the reviews and wondering if I would regret the purchase. I'm happy to say I do NOT regret the purchase. The kettle has worked perfectly for the whole year. The labels on the buttons are not worn off, there is no scale build up, and a wipe of the outside makes it shine like new.

I purchased it specifically for the option to heat water to different temperatures for different kinds of tea. It has proven very useful for this and made drinking green tea a pleasure.

I recommend this kettle without reservation.

Was looking for a new electric kettle as we drink a lot of tea. Wanted something that is not plastic, bigger (at least 1.5 liter) has a few extra features and looks ok. Did a lot of research and this kettle seemed like a good choice. Had it for 3 months now, works fine.
The pros: looks good; stainless steel so no plastic parts come in contact with water; large - up to 1.7L, comes handy for parties; has several temperature settings that are marked by the type of tea you'd like - black tea, green tea, white tea etc; has a "keep warm" feature.
Now for cons: takes a while for water to boil- up to 5-7 min, I had a really cheap kettle before and it took like a minute to boil, with this one it takes long time even for a small amount of water; the "keep warm" function is crazy - it's automatically on all the time and unless you turn it off - it keeps boiling! It probably sounds ridiculous but it's really annoying that every time you pick up the kettle and put it back - you have to press 3 different buttons to turn it off! Otherwise, the kettle keeps turning itself on and keeps boiling water.Also, recently the kettle stopped turning itself off automatically on "boiling" setting at all! I can get around it and either use a different setting or manually turn it off but for the price - I would expect a bit more reliability!
Bottom-line - if you often make different types of tea, including "delicate" and "oolong" and need a larger kettle - this maybe a good purchase for you. If you don't care about settings and just want a quick cup of tea - this is definitely a completely overpriced product.
Nice looking. Works great. Nice features

We love our new kettle. The various settings are helpful for the kinds of teas we've come to love. The hottest setting is definitely HOT, and fast too. We're curious to see how it will "age"; we do presently have the firm resolve of descaling it regularly with vinegar to prevent mineral buildup. Great job getting it to us quick and easy. Thank you.

I PURCHASED THIS ITEM ON MAY 1, 2013. ON APRIL 27, 2014 I NOTICED WATER ON MY COUNTER. I KEPT A CLOSE EYE ON ON IT, THOUGHT I WAS OVER FILLING IT. IT STARTED GETTING WORSE AFTER 3 DAYS. I NOTICED THE WATER WAS COMING OUT FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE HANDLE. AMAZON WILL NOT TAKE IT BACK BECAUSE THE RETURN POLICY EXPIRED. CAN NO LONGER BE RETURNED. SO NOW I AM GOING TO GET IN TOUCH WITH CUISINART TO SEE WHAT THEY SAY. IT IS NOT A CHEAP ITEM AND SHOULD HAVE LASTED LONGER THAN 1 YEAR. ALSO THE WRITING ON THE BUTTONS HAVE WORN OFF WITHIN 5 MONTHS. I AM NOT A HAPPY CAMPER, I BELIEVED IN CUISINART. OTHER THAN THAT I WAS VERY HAPPY WITH IT. LOOK FOR MY UPDATE : OK GOT IN TOUCH WITH CUISINART AND THANK GOODNESS I SENT IN THE WARRANTEE POST CARD, THEY HAD IT ON FILE AND IT IS FOR 3 YEARS. SO THEY ARE SENDING ME A NEW ONE I JUST HAVE TO PAY A $10.00 SHIPPING FEE AND THEN I HAVE TO RETURN IT ANY WAY I WANT TO AND I HAVE TO PAY TO RETURN IT. WHICH WILL BE THE SLOW BOAT CHEAP WAY. WAS SATIFIED WITH CUISINART CUSTOMER SERVICE. STILL KEEPING A 2 STAR BECAUSE THIS SHOULD NOT HAVE HAPPENED.

reviews.reviewTitle: It turns on and blinks like it is heating but does nothing
reviews.reviewText: Purchased in November 2016, broke 1 year and 1 month later. I expect a premium kettle to last more than one year. The kettle broke conveniently after the warrantee had expired. It turns on and blinks like it is heating but does nothing. Water is now still cold when the kettle turns off. Wonderful kettle if you are trying to wean yourself off coffee/tea in a year. Otherwise, buy something cheaper or that will last.

this tea kettle has received excellent reviews everywhere. I had to train myself a little bit to watch the water level indicator on the glass window below the handle. I could see it better before the blue light came on. It is a very accurate measure of the water level once it begins to fill in that window. I am happy I bought it. I use it everyday. I also have a hearing loss and the beep to let me know the water is ready is noticeable to my hearing without causing me to jump.

As with most consumer products, there are good and bad reviews for this, but most of them were pretty decent. Hopefully the Cuisinart name still means something ... We have wanted an electric kettle for quite some time and this seemed to be the best bet. So far it has worked fine, no odors or issues. The only problem we have encountered has been the result of user error. We thought by pushing the temp selection button it would turn on ... nope, gotta hit the Start button. What a strange thing to have to do ...

update 1/1/2017: After 5 years of routine use, it is still going strong. The only problem we have experienced is that the beep which tells you it has reached the desired temp no longer works.
Horrible product. Breaking in couple moths

I have been using this product for over a month and all seems well. However, the only complaint I have is that the signal which lets you know that the water is up to the program temperature, which is a beep sound, is very low in volume, and cannot be heard from another room. In fact, you need to be beside the unit just to hear the beep. The only other way to know the water is finished is seeing the button a constant blue. Other than that, this product seems to work well, and has a aesthetic value of 10+......

F. Dale Contino
I loved the tea kettle at first, until it started leaking from the bottom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great electric water kettle on par with the good European ones
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant because of the $90 price tag back when I bought the unit, but at $75 is a great price. Unit is well thought out, fast to heat, and every bit as good as the good European ones. Dinged a star because its 'Keep Warm' function turns on by default, which they need to change. Because if you empty the kettle not noticing Keep Warm is on, unit takes way too long to realize it's overheating which will only shorten its life or worse. Obviously once you know to check it every time, it's not a problem, but if you have a guest, or unit is for a vacation rental or something, they won't know.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works VERY well but breaks within a few months- however, CUSTOMER SERVICE IS GREAT
reviews.reviewText:
I've purchased three of these electric kettles over the last year but each one of them has quit after a few months use. I couldn't determine whether it was the kettle or the base that was the problem. There were two situations that came up: one was that the whole system would start to beep and light up and then shut off, the second situation was that the kettle wouldn't respond at all and remained shut off.

There aren't very many products out there that are specialized for tea brewing. This kettle seems very well made but there was must be a glitch somewhere that I hope they correct. I've had other friends report the same thing with their kettle.

FOLLOW UP:
I called 1-800-726-0190 for Product Return. They are sending a replacement kettle which will arrive in 7-10 days.

Be sure to have your model number and serial number handy.

I was grateful at how easily I could get this unit replaced; although we have to cover shipping/handling I'm willing to go with this rather than get nothing at all. I will keep you posted on my new kettles once they arrive.

After about half a year of usage, my unit shut off after about 60 seconds with 5 rapid beeps while not heating at all (water was still cold). I returned the unit thinking that I might have received a defective product. Cuisinart sent out a replacement, and I was thankful for the customer service.

Now, on my second unit, after about 20 kettles, the same problem occurs: on the Green Tea setting the unit shuts down after 60 seconds, 5 beeps, cold water.

I am now thinking this is a design/technical error and hence I cannot recommend this product.
This product worked for 5 months and then stopped working and now I am stuff with it! No refund no exchange! Terrible to spend this much to only last 5 months

This is so quick and easy for making tea. Green tea is healthy and some people don't drink it (IMHO) because they don't know how to make it. If the water is too hot, or you steep too long, the tea will be bitter. By getting the water to the right temperature and steeping (I do about 3 1/2 minutes) it makes great green tea. This kettle allows temp control for various types of tea. Check the internet to get recommendations on temp and steep time for various types of tea and then experiment yourself.

I noticed one reviewer commented on a scaling problem. Been using mine for a year and haven't had a problem. However, that will be due to local water supplies. If you have hard water a water filter is not going to change that. A filter may take out an itsy-bitsy amount of minerals, but you are always going to have minerals in your water unless you use distilled (which would taste yucky - minerals are needed for proper taste). If the water doesn't taste good plain, then your coffee or tea is going to be the same. If you leave the water in the kettle for a long time on warm, of course it's going to evaporate and leave a mineral residue. That's chemistry and physics, not the fault of any particular electric kettle. I heat the water and use it immediately and don't leave it in the pot, hence after a year I have zero scale build up. Love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great experience, and it does what it claims to do!
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this product for a few months now and really love it. It is a great cook's assistant since I can do a quick water boil before transferring to a pot to continue cooking pasta, rice, etc. The 'french press' setting is also quite nice since we love our french press coffee. I'm also a big tea drinker so the special tea settings are also quite a nice bonus.

The only downsides I've found are that design wise, it's a bit 'robot-looking' and I wish it was a bit more sleek and streamlined. (The image is true to what the product looks like.) It's fairly large when you pick it up, but on the upside, it does allow you to pre-boil a good amount of water for dinner parties, cooking/etc which comes in handy! Overall we're happy with the purchase.

I liked this kettle even though I thought it was a little on the pricey side. But it had features that my old Capresso kettle did not so I thought it was worth it. My Capresso lasted over 8 years and always worked very well. The Cuisinart CPK-17 however stopped working about one year later. Major disappointment! My key pad to select temperature and turn on doesn't light up at all. Called Cuisinart, a nice operator was very helpful. They will replace it but I have to pay for shipping and then pay to return the defective item back to them. I'm going to give it one more try since I paid $99 for this item. But I'm disappointed and now feel I should have stuck with Capresso.

reviews.reviewTitle: One screw and one piece of plastic
reviews.reviewText:
Like so many of you I have been looking for a tea kettle that had variable temps and was seem-less all stainless inside. This product being rather new, the reviews were not clear on the 'seem-less and all stainless'. Now that I own one, I can assure you that there is at least ONE screw on the inside, and I'm assuming it is stainless steel as well but of most concern is the little knub of soft plastic/rubber against the handle. I haven't taken a close look at it's purpose but assume it wouldn't be there if it weren't safe to do so, even though this was something I was trying to avoid.

I have used the kettle for a few weeks now. It is pretty, it is quiet, the variable temps work well, so other then that spot of plastic/rubber, it is what I wanted. I have considered returning it due to that little knub, but have grown fond of the kettle. I ordered 2 others as gifts and am waiting to hear the new owners thoughts as well.

As far as my research goes, I have only found ONE kettle out there that is truly seem-less and stainless on the inside. It was back ordered and looked rather plain. I have had enough plain tea pots in my life so thought I'd give this one a shot, even with its knub of plastic/rubber.

A fantastic product. My daughter owned one and after I used it, I just had to purchase one. I've changed over to drinking tea and I love the way it will heat the water to the right temp depending upon the kind of tea of am brewing. Didn't realize that this would make a difference.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... a French press household and this makes life so easy! The entire pot is up to temperature very ...
reviews.reviewText: We are a French press household and this makes life so easy! The entire pot is up to temperature very quick and then stays there. The unit does have an auto shut off but there is certainly ample time to enjoy a carafe or two. Worth the price and I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Literally the best purchase I've made all year
reviews.reviewText: I'm a coffee snob. I make coffee with an aeropress and a laser/infrared thermometer to get the water temp as close to perfect as possible. It's a bit arduous but worth the effort. I bought this kettle to cut down on time spent getting water temps perfect, and I'll say it has been the best thing ever. This kettle is stainless and gorgeous, high-tech looking and works absolutely as advertised. It heats very quickly, and my coffee has never been so good because the temp is exactly what it is supposed to be (185 for me). The quality of this kettle is very high and you will just be very pleased to have it on your counter and use it. I love this thing!!!!!

I bought this because I saw a friend with a similar product and because interested in it. It brews quick and easy hot water with different settings in temperature. You can also boil water with this for sweet tea or anything else if you see fit. It also has a mode that will keep the water hot for you for about half an hour. I find that I'll fill the pot and then jump into the shower and the water is ready for my mug when I get out without worrying about burning down the house in the meantime. I used to have a kettle, but I like this a lot more. So far great product.

This is a high-quality stainless steel kettle. It has settings for multiple types of hot drinks and does the job. It keeps the water warm for up to half an hour at its pre-set temperature. Super fast, too.

Great quality. Works perfectly. I use a Melitta Filter to make one cup of coffee at a time. Nice not having to wait for the tea kettle to heat up for the next cup a bit later. The Temperature presets are very useful. The wide mouth on the top makes it very easy to fill. The spout pours smooth and evenly for a no drip operation. Very attractive on the counter top with minimum clutter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kepp warm feature always defaults on which is a terrible idea
reviews.reviewText: My biggest issue with this kettle is the fact that it always defaults to "keep warm", which means it will boil the water again when temperature drops. I don't know about others but I probably use this feature 1 out of 100 times. It's only when you are cooking or drinking tea does this feature comes handy. If it defaulted to off, then I'd have a much better life.

Love this kettle! It's quick and accurate temps, too. Update to the review- Missed this at first, but SO OBVIOUS!!! This kettle is AMBIDEXTROUS! I'm a lefty and usually the gauges are all designed for right handed users, which means when I pick up a kettle (or measuring cup), anything useful is on the wrong side for me... This kettle is wonderful - I can read all the dials while pouring or filling - and my righty family members can, too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Five years later still works fine
reviews.reviewText:
I use this for hot tea, iced tea, hot water for cooking, and sometimes hot water for cleaning. I've probably averaged two to three uses a day for more than five years now and it still works fine. I have accidentally overfilled the kettle well past the full mark a few times, but always poor out the excess before heating. It is helpful having various temp settings, although I generally only use 165, 190, or boil.

If it held two full quarts it would be slightly more convenient for me, but I seldom need two quarts. My only true negative is that it takes a bit longer than some kettles to detect that the water has reached the boiling point and shutting off. This seems to be more noticeable when heating just a cup or two of water, but that heats so quickly I'm usually still standing there when it starts to boil.

We were looking for a new kettle and found this one. I like it except for how loud it is while heating up the water. Our last kettle never sounded like this. I would like to return it but I think its too late.

reviews.reviewTitle: easy to hold handle is pretty ridiculous
reviews.reviewText: Only 4 stars because the water level window hidden inside the big, easy to hold handle is pretty ridiculous. Other than that it heats up quickly, can match temperatures from boiling down to what delicate teas need, and will keep the tank heated for quick refill service. Bonus: it feels solid and the handle grip is deep enough for a great hold even when heavy and full of water.

reviews.reviewTitle: Has worked great for over a year. So far so good!
reviews.reviewText: This has worked perfect. I just have to remember to empty completely as soon as I’m done with it, so it won’t rust. My only complaint is I wish I could fit my hand into the opening more easily when I want to do a wipe down of the inside, but I’ll get over it :)

reviews.reviewTitle: This will keep you in hot water - at the exact temperature you specify
reviews.reviewText: I use this everyday. I like that you can set the exact temperature of the water. I don't want boiling water to make tea, etc. so the temperature setting is important to me. My only complaint is that I find these only last about 3 years. We're on #3 now. But then again, I truly use it several times a day every day, so if you use it less often, I would expect it would last longer.
Five years later and I'm finally writing this review. If any piece of equipment last this long, given my lifestyle, it's definitely worth the purchase. Best electric kettle I've experienced.

After using it for about 4-5 times theres been some rust building on the bottom. I always clean it after use and can’t seem to understand why I’m getting rust, it even looks like it’s burn. Now thinking about it I have been feeling a bit dizzy and sick since I’ve been regularly using it and I hope it’s not related. I wanted to exchange but looks I passed the cut off time, I was going to buy another one for home but glad I didn’t

I loved this kettle for a year -- small footprint, keep warm feature, efficient boil -- but after 15 months it has started to leak out the base. This seems to be the failure mode for most kettles like this, but for the slightly higher price tag I had higher expectations. I'll be trying my luck now with the Aicok Stainless Steel Cordless Electric Water Kettle with 6 Preset Temperature Settings - 1.7 Liters.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a good pour - really a shame
reviews.reviewText:
Pours badly from the spout. Loved the idea of different temperatures and the "keep warm" feature. This kettle certainly looks good, but how it pours is really important when dealing with very hot water! Some hot water often misses the cup - beware!! The float is a little hard to see when filling the kettle also.

Cannot recommend because of safety aspect of pouring - a basic and necessary function.

Love this kettle!
It’s nice because it have different temperatures for a different kind of tea(green,black...)
I recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: We also got her some expensive teas to go with this gift and she tells us she could not truly enjoy the flavors if not brewed co
reviews.reviewText: This was a birthday gift for our daughter's birthday. She uses it daily and keeps saying she loves it. She is a college student and keeps all kinds of tea brewing while up studying. The different temps for different teas make the world of difference in the taste of tea. We also got her some expensive teas to go with this gift and she tells us she could not truly enjoy the flavors if not brewed correctly with different settings. The Cuisinart electric tea kettle makes sure each cup is perfect. Thank you!

I bought this kettle after purchasing an aeropress which recommends water at about 175 degrees. However I find that I am using a lot of the other temp settings as well since it makes it much easier to brew tea or other beverages at the correct temp.

I used an instant read thermometer to check the temps and it seems to hold within a couple degrees of the set temp.

The lights make it really easy to tell when the water is ready and the light on the water level makes it really easy to see how much is left in the kettle. I also like how it holds at the selected temperature is held for 10 minutes if you don't shut it off manually so you don't have to get up right away when the temp is reached.

overall I'm very happy with my purchase.

I didn't know an electric tea kettle could be so awesome! I'm a tea and coffee drinker and having the ability to heat water to the correct temperature for both with one kettle and no monitoring is awesome. It heats amazingly fast AND will keep the water at the right temp if you don't get to it right away. I had no idea what I was missing.

I had high hopes for this water kettle, but there are some serious things poorly designed with this:

1) the markings for the water temp wear off over time ( less than 1 year ). now, i have no idea which temp is which now. I only remember that the lowest temp is on the upper left and boil is on the lower right.

2) it's hard to put on the base. The portion of the base that has the protrusion for the electrical connection to the kettle is too high, requiring a vertical mount - dismount. I've had other kettles with this same mechanism that were lower, which made it much easier to put the kettle on the base. Not sure why this kettle's base needs to be so high.

3) difficult to see how much you have filled - when filling from my counter top water dispenser, it's difficult to see the markings, becuase it's behind the handle, which my hand is holding on to.

4) difficult to see how much water is actually in the kettle. you can only see how much water is in there when the blue light is on, which, if you have left the kettle off for a while, turns off. So you have to go over, pick up the kettle, place it back carefully vertically ( see point 2 ), then you can see how much water is there. The handle obsures the view of the water indicator.

5) the display panel looks like a christmas tree! so what blue button, flashing or steady, means that this thing is actually turned on ? or is it a white light that means that its turned on ?

This kettle was replacing a $30 plastic krups kettle ( which they don't make any more, but sell a stainless version for $70 ). The $30 was dead simple to use and solved some of the other serious usability problems.

On the plus side, I do like being able to have different temps of water, but that is about the only thing that this kettle does well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Six Ways to Heat Your Water
reviews.reviewText: Excellent purchase. Easy to figure out and heats water quickly. Who knew there were so many temperature requirements? The handle has each one labeled for you, so you can just press a button. It sounds like a high speed jet taking off on the runway when it heats up, so you know it is working. The "stay warm" feature is fantastic too.
Much better than the Breville that broke after 2 years. No rust spots..

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after only few months of use!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Update: May 30, 2012
I should have listened to the other reviewers...my kettle died this morning!! I use it daily to heat the water for my morning coffee. Well, I hit the "200 French Press" setting, it started to blink like always, and then the unit went black. I tried this again three more times, and again, it went black. Based on the other comments about needing to pay Cuisinart $30 for shipping the dead unit, I decided to use that $30 toward a PINO Digital Kettle Pro. The reviews are better for this one. Wish me luck!

BE WARNED--DO NOT BUY THE CUISINART KETTLE!!!

This heats up FAST and water is the perfect temp. We used to have a mm electric kettle from Costco and this model is almost twice as fast. I love the keep warm setting for making multiple steeps of tea or rounds of aeropress. I do wish it had less plastic. Plastic inside the lid, in the spout, in the filter, and in the water level gauge.

This is a great hot water kettle and I don't have any complaints so far. It does everything it's built to do and does it well. The best part is the various temperatures depending on the type of team you are making and it looks great on the counter. Is it worth $100? Well I think it's a bit over priced for what it does. $75 would be more reasonable but that is very subjective. Would I purchase this again? Yep, I would.

One other quick note. I found several reviews with mention to the beeping noise. It's not bothersome at all so don't let that hinder your decision. Enjoy!

LOVE THIS TEA POT.

I work at a coffee and tea shop and it's so much more worth it to have something at the proper temperature instead of guessing all the time. This is one of those products that you never knew you needed, but once you have it, you can't imagine life without it! I take mine with me on trips even! My mom held it hostage from me for a week, so I'm getting her one for Christmas. It's really a great product.

The fact that it's stainless makes cleaning so easy especially since my water source is naturally "hard."

We have had this kettle for more than three years now, and we use it multiple times daily and into the evening. We use it for tea and drip coffee making, so the multi-temp options really help us. Heats rapidly and fully, starts and stops perfectly, hits the right temp every time. This is the third electric kettle we've owned, and this is by far the best. We love it and will buy another if it ever breaks. Highly recommend this kettle! Can't even imagine why so many others have had such bad luck with it, such a shame to get a "lemon".

This is the best idea ever for a kettle. I love choosing the temp of my water. I've had the most exquisite cups of specialty green tea and love instantly sipping freshly heated 160 degree water. But guess what... the kettle has stopped working 11 months later.
Bummer Dude ;(

revision:
January 16 2013:
Raising from 1 star to 3
The kettle is still working. The replacement they sent had different printing on the buttons that immediately wore off. I had already memorized the temperature settings so it's no big deal.
I'm drinking 185 degree black tea as I type, mmmmmmgood.

I've been using it five days a week for a month or so and it's been a really great kettle. It feels solid and everything seems to function the way it should.

More importantly, some teas really are better at lower temperatures! If you drink a lot of green or white tea or maté you owe it to yourself to try a kettle with variable temps. I will vouch for this kettle as being quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: First look at what teas you drink! (avoid my mistake) also the outside does get hot
reviews.reviewText:
I had high hopes. This does work great, but I thought the outside would not get hot and it does get hot. My daughter loves to make tea and I thought she could use this, especially since I am thinking of tossing our microwave since I try to avoid using it. I drink a lot of herbal teas, and my husband black tea, so I'm not sure if it is worth the extra money to have all the temp settings since they recommend boiling water to steep, but I personally like the water less hot so I can drink it without the wait to cool off. Again, I'm not sure if this is worth the extra money for most of us tea drinkers. I was very surprised that the teas I drink call for boiling the water.

"The temperature at which you steep tea matters - delicate leaves steeped at too high of a temperature will burn and leave a bitter flavor in the cup. Each two leaves tea company™ tea has recommended steep temperatures, but there are a few hard and fast rules you can follow to determine what steep temperature to use:

Below Boiling Water Temperature
White and green teas have delicate leaves, and therefore require below boiling water temperatures between 170 and 185 degrees Fahrenheit. Too high of a temperature will cook the leaves and ruin their delicate flavors.

Medium Boil Temperature
Oolong teas should be brewed at temperatures between 180 and 190 degrees Fahrenheit.

Full Boil Temperatures
Black and Herbal teas brew best at a full boil temperatures 208 and 212 degrees Fahrenheit." From Two Leaves website"

Loved at first, but as all the reviewers indicated...a complete failure after a few months of use! This company used to be great to work with and products dependable...but now such poor product reliability and customer services or policies... Brought several for friend and family as a gift...they all have the same concern with fading identifiers ... etc...

Solid water kettle. I'm a tea drinker so I use all the various boiling temps. I like the lighted side water window and the buttons. It was a little confusing at first on how to turn it off (you have to press "keep warm" button off), but I do like that feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Electrical cord TOO SHORT and DOES NOT EVEN REACH COUNTERTOP ELECTRICAL OUTLETS! Very UNSAFE
reviews.reviewText: Cord is LESS than one foot and does not reach kitchen counter outlets. I have to place mine on top of a counter top flour canister to plug it in. VERY UNSAFE and the steam from the Cuisinart now has damaged the lower edges of my cupboards.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp 1.7-liter electric kettle-love at first use
reviews.reviewText: We have had the unit now for approximately one month. Heats water quickly, holds if not poured immediately. The 'beep' to signal that the water is ready, is very soft, so it is best to be within earshot if waiting for water. It is easy to choose a target temperature. The unit is just a bit tall (long), making it a little challenging to handle when full. The base is protected from splashing, so we anticipate this unit will last longer than our previous electric teakettle, in which the electronics weren't well protected. I would purchase this kettle again, without hesitation.

I love that is has specific temps for different types of teas. We drink a lot of tea at our house, so this thing is used at least once a day for my rooibos tea. I have used this thing for a year now, and I have no serious complaints! It usually heats up within 10 min. The only possible issue would be filling it and the sound. You may have to turn it on for a second to see the water level better when refilling. In a well-lighted room you can see the water level if you look closely. Also, the beep when it's ready could be louder but I would prefer an option for soft or loud beeps. If it's quiet in the house I can hear it beep from a few rooms away. If the tv is on, I just have to check on it. The Keep Warm feature works great for this as it keeps that temperature for 30 min. Otherwise this is an awesome kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's been working fine up till now
reviews.reviewText:
Had this for 6 months. It's been working fine up till now. Unfortunately, water now leaks out of the bottom from between the metal and the plastic. Seems water is seeping into another area around the element connection. I'd say that's cause for concern as it also does this while the kettle is heating.

I'll now have to start the warranty process and hope for a non-defective replacement.

We replaced our regular electric kettle for this version. I was hesitant to make the switch because 1) our old kettle still worked fine and 2) is it really worth the price? We found out that yes, it was completely worth it to make the switch. Our lighter teas are no longer bitter from water that is too hot, and our french press coffee is delicious. If you are only making black tea and the occasional green tea, a regular electric kettle will be fine. If you usually make any of the drinks with special water temperatures, then definitely get this kettle.

Kettle was not heavily used. In 10 months lid stops opening. It is hard to close lid and almost impossible to open.
I was expected more quality from $80 kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad product and bad customer service
reviews.reviewText: It lasted 3 months and sprang a leak. Cusinart customer service was very unhelpful. I spent $10 to cover shipment of replacement and haven't heard a word from them. Don't buy.

I bought this kettle when I knew I was having 3 international guests staying over this past Christmas. Everyone's impressed by its look and best of all, how fast it boils water! My guests were experiencing cold, white christmas for the first time in the lives, so keeping them hydrated and warm was very important. They helped themselves to hot water and love how easy it was to fill it up for another boiling when necessary. There was enough water to make one big cup of coffee each for 5 people every morning, so we can all have breakfasts together. Love this kettle! It's a little expensive but well worth the money!

I purchased this fabulous kettle for my dad for Christmas, and I don't think he has ever enjoyed a present so much! We are huge coffee fans, and this kettle works great for bringing water to the precise temperature needed for French press, and maintaining the temperature! We are all very pleased with this kettle, and only wish we had bought it sooner!

Love it! I use it every day! It warms up so quick. The only thing I thing I think they can improve on is the keep warm feature. Maybe I'm not using it right or it turns off after a while.. but sometimes I think I let the keep warm feature on and I pour a lukewarm cup of tea. Otherwise it's one of the best purchases I've made! I take my pot to the backyard, to my bedroom, or wherever I'm spending my evenings
Less than 6 months of using this kettle, and it has started leaking from the bottom. I have never had a kettle leak. Very disappointing, especially for the price!
Have had two of these. They worked well for a while but both broke within a year. In each case the lid mechanism failed and to top would no longer open so it could not be cleaned.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buildup on the bottom of the kettle!! Mold?
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this electric kettle as it looked nice and had great reviews. After a couple of months of normal use, my wife noticed that there were these dark spots developing on the bottom of the kettle. We tried to wash it out with dish soap and vinegar, but were unsuccessful. I'm not sure what these tiny spots are, but it looks like dark speckles of mold. Please be aware of this fact as Cusinart would only offer an exchange (Shipping/Handling paid by the consumer). I am not confident an exact exchange will solve the problem. This will probably happen again a few months down the line. I cannot recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good. It's the best pot I've had yet
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. It's the best pot I've had yet. Looks good and I like the different temps available. The keep hot feature is also great and gets used a lot. The only thing I wish it had is a little louder beep when it's done. But for most people it's probably OK. I don't hear much in the frequency range it is so unless I'm right next to it I can't hear it. Oh well, not the pot's fault.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't work out of the box
reviews.reviewText: As the title suggests, this kettle didn't work out of the box. It would turn on but not actually heat any water and then shut-off after about a minute. This seems to be a relatively common problem according to other reviews here. I followed the advice I found in the comments to one of those reviews, which suggested contacting Cuisinart. I did so via their website and they confirmed the unit needed replacement but wanted $15 shipping each way for a warranty replacement. No thanks; I will be returning the kettle to Amazon and I consider it fortunate that this happened to me now rather than after a few months of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... less than a year ago and intially it worked great. Then it stopped working
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this product less than a year ago and intially it worked great. Then it stopped working. When we turn it on and select a temperature it heats up for about 10 seconds and shuts off. I am very unhappy with this product. It should have lasted longer than 10 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: This kettle is awesome. I tried another variable-temperature kettle but found it ...
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is awesome. I tried another variable-temperature kettle but found it difficult to use, so returned it and got this one. Love the temperature presets and that it's so easy to use. I've used it every day for 6+ months and have had no problems with it. The only downside is that the spout does not pour in a thin stream, but if you can live with that, this is a great product..

We drink all kinds of teas; whites, oolong, black, herbal etc. High-end teas come with brewing instruction with different water temperatures (and steep times) for individual tea types. All we have to do is push the buttom of the one we are drinking and the water is heated to the perfect temperature. The kettle looks great on the counter top and holds plently of water in case you are entertaining. I did my reasearch and am not dissapointed in the kettle I choose. My only complaint is that the beeper (when the water is ready) is not that loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed because it just stopped working.
reviews.reviewText: I would have given it five stars if it hadn't just stopped working, with no recourse (I called cuisinart after ordering a new base, which didn't help. They said I was SOL). I had it four years, so maybe that's all I can expect, but I'm disappointed because I really loved it. Will not order another one -- I'll try my luck with another brand and hope I get one that lasts longer.

This is a wonderful product. I have been looking for this kind of unit since I lived in the UK, and have until now, found nothing equivalent. it is perfect. the unit heats the water quickly and efficiently. The variable temperature choices are wonderful, particularly in that I like my drinks hotter than my hubby. This kettle makes it possible for us to choose. I love the separate heating unit so that the kettle is not attached to the electrical plug. It makes it so convenient! It is quiet as well. The only suggestion would be to let us have a choice as to whether we have the ready indicator (beeps), on or off. As it is, it is unobtrusive to us, however the high pitch triple beep bothers our beagle for some reason. Thus it would be lovely if we could turn it off. However that is really not a problem. We LOVE this!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product for coffee and tea drinkers
reviews.reviewText: The preset options are very handy, the unit heats water quickly and quietly, and I love the small beep it gives to let you know the water is at temperature (and it keeps it there for 30 mins!).

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Had to replace the first one, but now is great and pickng your temp is a good thing.
reviews.reviewText:
Works great.
Our first one had issues after about 3 weeks and started making a squealing sound.
It still worked, but was very loud.
We sent it back and replaced it, and this new one has been working fine for 6 months or more.

Works great, you can pick your temperature, and then it holds it there for 30 minutes or so.
Several temps to choose from, depending on what you are doing (what kind of tea you are using, ect)

I'd definitely recommend it.

I bought this kettle 18 months ago. It died after a little less than a year. The warranty department charged me for a replacement, which died today.

While it worked, it was an excellent kettle. But it doesn't seem like it's made to last more than a year. I don't recommend this kettle.

Edit: Initially I gave this kettle a much higher rating. It could be wonderful. Sadly, shoddy craftsmanship has ruined the experience. The kettle I bought leaks profusely after a year of use. I recommended it to a friend, and the circuit board on his crapped out six months after he bought it. This is not at all what I have come to expect of Cuisinart products and my recommendation is now to find a different brand which will actually work for a reasonable amount of time.

Original review: I love this water kettle! I've recently begun drinking green teas and I always get the water too hot and the tea turns out bitter. The first cup I brewed with this water heater was wonderful. The keep warm feature is not as useful as I thought it would be, since I generally walk away from the kettle for more than half an hour. I also don't like the fact that the LED turns on every time you pick it up off the base. Other than those minor nitpicks, it is great. There are no funny flavors, the beep to signal that water is hot is loud enough to get my attention but not so loud its obnoxious, and it heats enough water for me and several friends to all have a large cup. The exterior does get warm as some reviewers have mentioned, but not truly hot. You might be able to burn yourself if you held your hand against it. I've brushed the outside with a hand several times and not been hurt. Also, the handle is perfectly insulated.

My daughter made a great choice for me. When I need boiling water this is perfect. When I want tea perfect product for bringing out the right flavor. I never knew that tea temperature was that important. It is!

Had this for several months now use it almost daily for coffee or tea and I love it. The build quality is nice and sturdy feeling. The temp settings are great, which is great for green tea as most people use water that is too hot. Highly recommend it.

Multiple pre-set temperatures . Very fast heating, approximately 4mins for 1.5Litres and then "holds" water in the same temperature!
Having this GREAT LOOKING kettle sit on the counter just adds to the overall kitchen and makes cooking WAY easier !
As I said, it's a must have for every kitchen that makes your a life easy !!
The kettle broke after light use of 3 years, and it just passed the warranty period. I'm expecting an electric kettle lasting longer! It's costing a lot more than the other brands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best I could find on amazon or elsewhere
reviews.reviewText: Best I could find on amazon or elsewhere. The temperature and reheat functions really simplify your ability to make a perfect cup of coffee or tea every time, especially when you're doing other tasks around the home. The only 'con' I would note is that its quite a bit heavier than my previous basic water heater, so be sure to get a firm grip on it when you pour, but it's not an issue worth losing a star over in my opinion. You will not regret this purchase.

I drink about eighteen gallons of tea a day,and can't be bothered to heat the water first and then make the tea. I have a little tea ball that I fill and hang off the lid hinge of my Cuisinart electric tea kettle. Then I add water and set to boil. Three minutes later, wah-lah, freshly brewed tea. Then I take the tea ball out and set the pot to delicate to keep my tea warm. Sure, my pot turns dark after a few uses, but that's why i run vinegar through it once every few weeks or so. Turns it back to new. Love it. This guy is a little pricey, but I made my money back within a month. Well worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Kettle with Useful Temp Selection
reviews.reviewText: One of these kettles was in a fancy pants hotel/resort cottage room where we stayed for a couple of days. I loved the kettle so much we ordered one just like it for our home. We've just ordered a new type of coffee press, and having hot water at the perfect temp very quickly is going to come in handy.

Love the variable temperatures! I've gotten very spoiled at home having different temps for all my teas. I drink primarily green tea, so having a less-than-boiling option is amazing so I don't burn the leaves.

I was extremely cautious when using this tea kettle to avoid mold spots that people mentioned in the reviews. However after a short three weeks of using the kettle they appeared. This tea kettle is not worth the extra money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast, convenient, great for tea and other hot drinks
reviews.reviewText:
We have used this in our home office daily for 1 year now. It has been a good solution to the old problem of people heating water for tea and forgetting about the pot on the range. The CPK-17 turns off when attaining the correct water temperature. Except see note below.* We are all regular tea drinkers and it's especially nice for brewing green and delicate tea types. It also serves well for French Press coffee making.

* My rating is 4 rather than 5 stars because after one year of service, on the boil setting it stopped working in regards to the beep and auto turn-off feature. We only use filtered water in it and it has never had a scale build-up so it is clearly a case of the unit simply failing with normal use. We called Cuisinart for service and were happy to talk to a real person, but a bit disappointed that the call took 30 minutes even though it should have been a simple affair of, "it doesn't work properly anymore, it is still under the 3 year warrantee, please repair or replace." After much hold time and testing their own unit's operation, they offered to send a new one out, and we send the broken one back. Customer pays shipping both ways. Other than this, it has been a great little appliance.

reviews.reviewTitle: After 1 year of use, it broke the lid release.
reviews.reviewText: I was pleased with this product, we got it over 1 year ago and the lid doesn’t open any more. The lid is plastic, and I did my research and based on the reviews decided to get this kettle, but I’m very disappointed now. Now, the warranty is over and it becomes garbage just for the lid spring.

Great electric teapot. All metal construction (except the gauge) reduces plastic chemicals in the water. Multiple temperature settings for different types of teas. My favorite feature is that it can optionally keep my water warm for up to half an hour, just in case I get distracted on my way to making tea.

It's my third Cuisinart tea kettle for the past 5-6 year. Even though functionality is still there (which I like), quality went down since I bough my first one. Buttons are now not as easy to press and plastic parts are of lower quality.
I hope it will last at least as long as my old ones - no more then 3 years :(

reviews.reviewTitle: Longevity issues... but no other real alternatives
reviews.reviewText:
I like this kettle. I like its variable temperature control. I like the fact that its all stainless steel with no exposure to BPA.

I don't like the price. I don't like the fact that the hinge on the lid broke with regular use - its not like there is an opportunity to manhandle it. For the price paid on a premium product, I would have expected it to last a long time.

I looked around for another replacement kettle and can't seem to find a good quality variable temperature kettle that's BPA / plastic free. Sigh, might have to buy another one of these...

reviews.reviewTitle: So disappointed as I have plenty of Cuisinart products
reviews.reviewText: Had this kettle for just over 3 weeks and it has ceased to work....the lights flash but it does not heat water,,,,,So disappointed as I have plenty of Cuisinart products. An expensive lesson...... I will stick to straight forward kettles ie ON/OFF types and forget the keep warm option.

Very disappointing kettle. I drink tea so I was so happy to find one that caters to the temperatures needed to brew a proper cup. This kettle, however, never worked as stated, and the hottest I've been able to get the water, no matter the setting, has been 155 degrees. As if paying $99 for this wasn't enough, now Cuisinart is making me pay them ANOTHER $10 to replace a kettle that never worked. That's not even including the money it will take me to ship it back to them. I hope I'm not throwing good money after bad by sticking with this kettle.
Ive had it 6 months, and its rusting. It does not turn off sometimes. Not happy.

I love this teakettle! It was a gift from my husband because I drink a LOT of tea and warm water. I have had it for about five months now and use it multiple times a day every day. This kettle is exactly what I was looking for! I love the different temperature settings, it's fast and it keeps my water warm if I want it to. Not many kettles have the keep warm function which I really wanted. I cannot live without this kettle now, it is a permanent fixture in our kitchen. If it died tomorrow, I would get another one immediately!
Really love my electric kettle. Heats quickly and to specific temperature of various teas.

reviews.reviewTitle: love this product- use it every day!
reviews.reviewText: We live this kettle. Unfortunately our first one died after 4 years of 1-2 per day use and was out of warranty. We couldn't find another product that met all of our needs - quick heat, selectable temptations to heat the water to, stainless steel. Very happy and satisfied with our purchase, other than the durability- but I guess that's just the world we live in - nothing lasts forever anymore!!

As an American, I know very little about "good" tea. Okay, prepare to shudder. I grew up putting the tea bag in a cup of cold water, then putting the whole thing in the microwave for a minute (regardless of the kind of tea). I learned about boiling water for tea after I moved out, but didn't get very sophisticated. I am truly amazed with how delicious tea can taste when you pay attention to how it is meant to be made (using the right temperature setting, and steeping times), and it's all thanks to the Cuisinart CPK-17, which heats quietly, quickly, and to the perfect temperature!

Beautiful design and excellent function. My only wish is that once the water has boiled and I've poured my cup, that the kettle wouldn't continue to boil the remaining water to the originally designated temperature without having to turn it off. I wish the kettle turned off just by picking it up and pouring the water.

After trying other electric kettles, I love this one because it's easy to read the settings, relatively quiet, the water temperatures seem appropriate and it looks nice on the counter. I've had it for just a few weeks, so I can't vouch for longevity, but I hope it works a LONG time because I am really enjoying it!

As a tea drinker, I love this product! it allows me to make green tea without burning the leaves, and the perfect black or herbal tea as well. And it even has a boil setting which I use to make french press coffee. It appears to shut off automatically if I forget to specifically turn it off, which is another plus!
This is a great product... makes all hot drinks to the correct temperature... I bought one and my kids loved it so much I gave each of them one for their homes.

This kettle works really great, until it works. The possibility to set different temperatures is convenient and the brushed metal finishing is elegant and modern. After 3.5 years, during which it has been used 2-3 times a week, the unit stopped working. The customer service is not able to repair it: the only thing that can be done is to replace the unit if it is within the 3-year warranty period. A good product with a short lifespan and an inadequate support.
Love my Cuisinart everything! Boils very fast and looks impressive. Con, water spots inside after boiling every two times looks yucky. Easily fixed with some vinegar tho.

Super easy to use. Heats up water quickly. Excellent positioning of buttons. Excellent functionality. Beautiful looking on my countertop, very clean design. Easy to refill. I am sooooo glad I bought this. I drink a lot of different teas, so I really like the different temperature buttons (and they tell you what teas to use for each temperature. It has been working perfectly now for several months.

One of those smart investments I made. Purchased it in December 2010.
I am a big time tea drinker. So I Boil it daily and then reheat as necessary at least 2-3 times at 190. Still looks and works like at day one. Very happy!

Update 09.01.2017: almost 7 years and counting!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the different heating levels for different teas
reviews.reviewText: Well designed. Heats quickly. Love the different heat settings for different teas.

it's almost perfect. i can specify a different temperature depending on the tea i'm brewing. brew time is fast (ok, i didn't time it...but i didn't have to wait long) and the keep warm feature is useful.

gripes? i have to move it to whichever room i'm in. hah.
seriously tho, three gripes.
1. it's hard to see the water level when i'm filling up the pot (different placement of the water level or etched lines on the inside would solve this problem).
2. the outside of the pot gets hot to the touch (the handle stays cool).
3. the cord is super short.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats fast, saves energy, wish could seal lid to keep temp and work as a thermal.
reviews.reviewText: It heats fast, not heavy,keeps heating unless you turn it off, which also saves power,easy to clean,different temps, I only wish I could seal it to keep the temp

reviews.reviewTitle: It was working fine for the first 6 months
reviews.reviewText: It was working fine for the first 6 months, then it would randomly turn off after sometime this happend for a month, and then when i plug it in , it would stay on for 30 sec and then turn off. and now finally it just stopped working.

This digital tea kettle is amazing--so many great features! This was purchased for my 87 year old mother whom we feared would forget to turn off the stove after boiling water. The teapot stays warm for 30 minutes, turns off automatically after that amount of time, and brings the water to the correct temperature for your particular tea.

This was a great purchase especially since I hate having kettles... just the thought of me not being able to washthe inside of a kettle the way I would like disappoints me, however this is easily accessible inside and it boils your water in minutes

Cuisinart PerfecTemp works like a dream. I had been boiling water for years and wondering why green tea tasted so bitter. With the temperature selection, this product has given me a new lease on green tea life, as well as letting me never worry about whether I left the stove on. I haven't tried the coffee feature so don't know if that works as well. It seems to have stayed very clean and mineral free so far with the use of filtered water. The directions are explicit and easy, and the kettle works as advertised. In addition, it arrived the day after it was ordered. It's a great gift for tea lovers.

reviews.reviewTitle: This stores more water than a typical stovetop kettle and you can easily see how much water is in it
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I was tired of boiling water on the stove and worrying about if I turned the stove off. Tea would also be way to hot to drink any time soon. This stores more water than a typical stovetop kettle and you can easily see how much water is in it. The beeping when done is not loud or obnoxious but rather discrete. I can press start, pour, press start again to turn if off and I'm out the door. This is so easy to use I am making tea at least twice a day.

I am very pleased with my new purchase. I bought it after much research, and wonder why I waited so long to buy this temperature control kettle. I drink a lot of high quality teas, green, white, or black, and the water temperature (and quality) is of upmost importance to enjoy tea to its fullest. I no longer have to wait “forever” while watching the water reaching the hit and miss proper temperature.

I splurged on this in to complete the tea set in my office. It's part of the setup that keeps me sane, and I couldn't be happier.

I heats water up very quickly, to a precise temperature conforming to the type of tea you're brewing. It looks sharp too. Cost a lot for what it is, and I'm not sure the tea tastes any better than it would with a simpler / less expensive water boiler, but I'm very happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super fast, easy to clean and use.
reviews.reviewText: This thing is amazing! Boils water to any of the mentioned settings way faster than I anticipated. I use it every day multiple times a day.

I use this for tea almost every day. Heats fast! My only complaint is the kettle gets very hot. I was not expecting that and there is no warning. I thought it was insulated. Having said that I still enjoy my kettle.
This is the second kettle I purchased and it stopped working after 2 months. Amazoncustomer service is awful. I won't buy electronics thru amazing again. Crappt warranty and waste of money

reviews.reviewTitle: Started leaking badly after less than a year
reviews.reviewText: Kettle lasted less than a year. Started leaking badly from the bottom of the kettle after boiling each time. Limited warranty, so I have to pay $15 for the cost of shipping the replacement, as well as the cost of shipping for the cord of the defective kettle back to Cuisinart.

Still using this after four years and it works great, but my only concern is that after pressing those buttons so many times, the printing on them has worn off. I rewrite it periodically with a sharpie, but it would be great if they had just engraved the temperature settings into the buttons, then I wouldn’t have to do this.

When I first unpackaged the item, I pressed the "OPEN" button and nothing happened (though I heard a click). I thought I had a lemon, but I simply pressed the open button and used my thumb to pry it open. It has since worked flawlessly since, with no signs of trouble.

I also purchased the optional 3 year Squaretrade warranty. If this thing lasts 5 years, I will be happy. My last kennel was a Krups (should be Craps), it broke within 3 years.
I am very pleased with this product. My only gripe is that it can be a bit cumbersome, but that is not a deal breaker in any way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Impressive piece of technology from Cuisinart but also very functional
reviews.reviewText:
Hi Tech Kettle with 1.7 Litre capacity, 6 heat settings, blue LED light, safety shut off and 3 year limited warranty.

This is an impressive piece of technology from Cuisinart - which looks good and functions extremely well - its a significant generation apart from the old electric kettle we replaced and now we wonder why we kept the old one so long.
I like the fact that one selects the temperature one desires. This unit works great period!

no dout tis indeed on the pricey side. you are basically going to use this for tea and cup of noodles right ? so in many ways tis a bit of overkill and $$$$ but quality and aesthetics are top notch. am personally pleased and would recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle but exterior too hot!
reviews.reviewText: Great kettle, BUT exterior gets way too hot. Only safe part is the handle. If you accidentally touch anything else your getting burned.

Once you use this electric kettle you won't want to use any other.
My wife is English so she drinks lots of tea and I drink green tea. They require different temperatures to produce a good cuppa. This kettle has six different settings to take care of that. It can also keep eater hot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not bad, but given that the temperature control feature doesn't ...
reviews.reviewText: Not bad, but given that the temperature control feature doesn't come cheap, it would be nice if it worked consistently/reliably. I've found that the kettle often goes straight to a boil (212º) regardless of what setting I press, even if it's the lowest temperature (160º).

reviews.reviewTitle: My wife and I really enjoy using our new electric kettle
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I really enjoy using our new electric kettle. Seems much faster than our old unit, and my wife likes to set the different temps for different teas. Looks good on the counter, and the "keep warm" feature is really helpful!

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks good, still using after a couple years now
reviews.reviewText: Looks good, still using after a couple years now. Only small thing is that the writing on the buttons will fade over time. Eventually, you may need to jiffy-marker the settings or get a new kettle. Would have been better if they imprinted the writing instead of just ink-coating the surface of the buttons. But the kettle does work great, and looks pretty darn good too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had two of these because I liked them for the price point
reviews.reviewText:
Had two of these because I liked them for the price point. But both lasted about 3 years and died. One just stopped boiling, the other's pop-up lid assembly fell apart.

I did use it everyday, but $30 a year is too much to pay. I will try other brands and see if I can get one that lasts longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Kettle for All Temperature Needs
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product to be able to have hot, not boiling water for cocoas, green tea, and other beverages that state to add hot, not boiling water. Perfect temperature every time.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you only drink black tea you likely don't need this but.......
reviews.reviewText: I've had this kettle for 4 months now and am pleased with it everyday. I originally thought all the different temperature settings were a gimmicky overkill but after some exposure I find myself using them all the time and have learned what a difference water temperature can make to different brews. I use RO water in it so there's not a trace of deposit and I leave the top open after I empty it so there's not sign of rust etc. Someone said the lettering on the buttons wore off but that's not happening, maybe they have really rough fingertips.

This kettle was never a favorite, as its shut-off system was irritating and dysfunctional. Still, it had accurate temperature levels, so I lived with it. Then the unit simply died, 21 months after purchase. In reading other reviewers' experiences with the warrantly, I surrendered and simply pitched it.

reviews.reviewTitle: cant leave it to rest on the hot pad indefinitely..
reviews.reviewText:
The only problem is that you can't just turn it off and have it sitting on the pad (even when the lights are off , I come back later and it's really hot!). My kitchen kinda sucks so it's a pain to unplug it all the time... (maybe it's just SO good at insulating the heat that it hasn't cooled down yet but i don't trust it to sit there any more...)

everything else about it is literally perfect.

This is my second Cusinart CPK-17. Love it. Only issue is that it gets hot on the outside. Love the temp controls and my favorite feature is the half hour warming button. Will be staying with this company and model. Can't find anything that compares.

I like this pot a lot. Be careful for the outside is metal and gets very hot.
It keeps temp well. Easy to use.
I wish it had an insulated exterior for safety.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was a good product with a few minor problems - until broke down after 2 years of use
reviews.reviewText: Overall very good product with just one little problem - when emptied just after it's boiled, filled, and put on again, it still "thinks" it's just boiled - goes on for a few seconds and shuts off. I'm used to it now, so I just press the button once again, but first few times I poured cold water into my tea thinking it's just boiled. Maybe it's just my kettle, but I can't compare with anyone else's.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent choice for a single person or a couple
reviews.reviewText:
I have been using this kettle for 3 years now. Not a single complaint. It serves it's purpose perfectly, gives me needed flexibility in brewing various types of tea. It also accumulates less residue on the bottom from all the calcium in the water, making cleaning it easier.
Now, it only holds around 1.7 liters, which is fine for a single person or a couple, but will not be enough for a family of 3+ people.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: I love my new kettle! It boils within 4 minutes. My favorite feature is the keep warm button. I love having the ability to go back for more without having to boil every time. My husband even commented on how great this product is.

Works exactly as advertised. I don't know what else to say about this. If you have a stove and a teapot, or a convenient microwave, you don't really need this, but if you want hot water in your office, this is really nice to have.

My wife loves her tea. Green tea specifically which has to brew at a specific temp for the perfect cup of tea. I don't understand the reasons why but she insists that the temp of the water has a direct effect on the taste of the tea.

Once she heard about these kinds of hot water pots, she wanted one. We settled on this model because Cuisinart is a solid name brand we trusted and we saw a neighbor who had one and they loved it.

I surprised her with this for Christmas and it was her favorite gift.

She loved it!
stopped working after 2 years

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way of heating up water
reviews.reviewText: Water level indicator is very clear. Different temperature settings are great for getting just the right temperature for different teas/drinks which until now I haven't noticed actually makes a difference but it really does. I also use it to heat up water for cup noodles. Heats up quickly. Easy to pour and fill. Easy to use. Notification beeps useful for when you want to walk away while it heats up.

Great electric kettle! I love the keep hot feature. I'm drinking lots of hot lemon water. It's great to keep you going being more healthy and drinking more water, liquids! Also, a plus...you can choose the temperature of the water you'd like to have. I didn't know I would like that feature as much as I do. Cheers!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, beware of Cuisinart customer service
reviews.reviewText: It was great when it was working. It lasted 5 years and then died. I emailed customer service and asked for their help identifying the problem (maybe the heating element died?) but they basically told me there was nothing they could do because it's out of warranty. I was not asking for a replacement, just for help troubleshooting. I guess I'll stick to companies with better customer service.

We've been using electric kettles for about 12 years now, and they usually last at least a couple of years - we do drink a lot of tea in our house, so they get heavy use. This was absolutely the worst kettle we've ever had. The first one lasted less than three months - Cuisinart did replace it,though they charged me for shipping. The replacement has lasted just three weeks. They just stop working - all the lights flash and then it turns itself off without heating the water at all. The variable temperature option may be a good idea, but next time I'm going with something simpler with fewer things to go wrong.

Works great, use it a couple times a day for tea. It speeds up the brewing process of making coffee on my moka pot by boiling water first and pouring it in the Moka pot recervoir before setting it on stove.

reviews.reviewTitle: You will fall in love with it!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Great, Fancy Looking Kettle - You will fall in love with it. Has everything you need for any type of tea. It holds the temperature very well for 30 minutes. It takes around 5min to boil the full kettle. It beeps 3 time when its ready with nice soft beep. Well made. S/S steal lid with a rubber seal. No plastic touches the water.
I recommend it for anyone that drinks a lot of tea during the day.

This is an excellent hot-water kettle. I really love being able to choose the water temperature appropriate for the tea or coffee I am going to make. And the keep-warm feature is good too -- go back and re-brew your oolong, or make another cup of whatever. It is well designed, very well thought out, easy to use, the lights let you read the water height and amount, and it beeps to tell you that the water has come up to temperature. I really like it, and I'm seriously thinking of getting one for my tea-loving brother.
Used this product for the first time while I was in an Air BnB location in Toronto. Liked it so much, I bought it for my home in the U.S. Great product. Would definitely buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for all your coffee and tea needs!
reviews.reviewText:
I love it! It heats quickly and the ability to pick from temperature settings for different types of tea are terrific, as well as being able to yes, just boil water. There also a French Press setting, which is a bit below boiling. The pot itself lifts off of its heating element with 360-degrees of Lazy-Susan- like ease, and albeit a pricey choice, this is an investment piece that I hope I'll be using for a long time.

There's been some complaint about the "keep warm" feature staying on, or how to stop it when not wanted, but simply push that button again when your water temperature has been initially reached, and the "keep warm" indicator light will go off, and that function will cease.

I can't say enough about how much I like this electric teakettle - it's worth every penny!
Probably the best kettle I’ve ever owned. Really nice to be able to heat water to exactly the right temp for the type of tea. Heats up water fast!!!
Haven't had any of the problems others mention about rust or mold so I wonder if there is a connection to the water they are using. Heats water ridiculously quick and effectively. LOVE IT!

reviews.reviewTitle: exceeded my expectations for such a low pricepoint.
reviews.reviewText: As a casual tea drinker that is trying to increase my daily green tea intake, I was looking for something that was easier and faster than microwaving the water. I did not want to break the 100$ barrier at this time. This kettle is so easy to use. you press the desired temp, and start. in just a couple of minutes, you are alerted that the water is ready. easy to use, good ergonomics, nice appearance, would recommend.

Read many reviews on the Culsinart CPK-17 and would like to add mine to the mix. Just recieved this today and love it out of the box. Good design, solid feel, minimal instructions and settings. No plastic except for that little filter element and holder but I detect no off-putting taste. Just started making loose leaf teas after a visit to Teavana in King of Prussia Pa and this machine makes that whole process a snap. Push button on handle gives the six all important tea brew tempertures plus a boil and a 30 minute keep warm. Out of curiosity I timed a full pot heat cycle from cold water (54*) to full boil (212*) in 4 min, 20 sec. More than this I could not ask for. Will post any problems encountered but this is a winner from the start. One star off because it could have been a little more reasonably priced!

reviews.reviewTitle: I loved it when it worked!!
reviews.reviewText: I had this product three months and it died. The worst part is when I called Amazon I was told I could return it, but would have to repay the original shipping cost, pay a 20% restock fee and pay to ship the defective one back. Can you say utterly horrible customer service?!?! I have bought many items from Amazon and only had to return a couple. I guess I should be thankful they arrived damaged and that I haven't encountered this dismal policy until now. I will never purchase a more expensive electronic item from Amazon again and am SO thankful I opted to buy my food processor from Costco last month instead! If I have a problem with it I know Costco will simply return the item. Thanks, but I'll stick with them in the future. On the up side... The third person I spoke with at Cuisinart, Craig, was fantastic! I made several phone calls due to troubleshooting. Craig agreed that three months was an unreasonable product life and shipped me out my new tea kettle at no charge. I'm waiting for it to arrive and will return this one in the same box. Thank you Craig and thank you Cuisinart, because I do love this machine! I have owned their standard kettle for several years and never had a problem with it. I bought this one, because Teavana has made me tea crazy and I wanted the different temps. It's a great machine - just hope my first one was a fluke and my second is as reliable as my old standby.
We love this. My husband and I are tea drinkers so we love the multiple settings. It looks good on the counter too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Low tech meets high tech and fails in 6 months
reviews.reviewText:
Very colorful and high tech looking; failed after 6 months. Seemed to work well for a short while; but, was awkward to handle when pouring. Contacted seller about failure, seller didn't want anything do with it and directed me to the manufacturer, Cuisinart.

We used to use a basic Cuisinart electric kettle for years and really liked it. Replaced it with this unit when the old one finally gave out.

First time I've had my own electric kettle and I'm sorry that I didn't purchase one years ago! We drink different kinds of tea (green, black, herbal, etc) in addition to making coffee in a French press. This kettle produces the perfect water temperature which results in perfect brews. Really like the chime that indicates when water is ready and the design/style.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, highly recommended to home tea and coffee brewers that press.
reviews.reviewText: Exactly what I was looking for. I make my own tea and fresh pressed coffee and this ended my eternal fight with boiling water and a thermometer to get the temperature just right. Amazingly fast. I can't think of anything bad to say about it other than i wish they were cheap!

reviews.reviewTitle: We use this daily for my tea and my husband's ...
reviews.reviewText: We use this daily for my tea and my husband's coffee. Saves so much time every morning. Can leave is unsupervised, so we just turn it on in the morning while we are making breakfast and come back when we hear the beep. We've also started using this to heat water quicker when we make pastas and just transfer it to the pot once it boils. Def a timer saver!
We use it all the time. It even gives a sound when the tea boils. We love it.

I bought this kettle as a Christmas gift for my daughter, a tea-drinking college student. She absolutely loves it! It heats water very quickly and keeps it warm so you can have a second or third cup of tea without re-heating the water. The variable temperatures allow you to brew all sorts of teas perfectly. The kettle itself is attractive and takes up little space (important for a dorm-dweller). We used it for a few days after Christmas and I was reluctant to see it go back to college with her---I may have to invest in one for myself!
Bought 18 months ago, and now it leaks.

I spent more than I usually do expecting a higher quality product with from a name brand. However, the kettle is leaking after barely18 months of use. My old plastic kettle lasted 10 years. Sadly it is no longer available.

I was looking for ways to make my day at work better. I love tea and try as I may, I still need one cup of coffee every morning; I love it, too. I was trying to find a way to have both coffee and tea at work without needing an entire kitchen.

After lots of research, I settled on:
Cuisinart Perfect Temp Kettle
Mount Hagen Organic Instant Coffee (the only organic instant coffee I could find!)
The Tea Spot Organic Teas (U.S. organic seller - from Colorado!)

The perfect temp kettle allows me to have it all! My amazing cup of jo in the morning, followed by whatever tea strikes my fancy in the afternoon!

No cleaning really, just rinsing, as only water is in the kettle. Also, it top rated for those on the search for no plastic. I think some of the other reveiwers said there might be a tiny piece somewhere on the inside with regard to the water level window or something...but it's basically a solid stainless steel gadget and in the big scheme of things - leaps and bounds above everything else available!

It's not a perfect world, we just try and make the best of it. And this is the best I could find! Enjoy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Been a year and a half of daily use, and is working great.
reviews.reviewText: Been a year and a half of daily use, and is working great. No rust or visual wear of any kind. I will say it is quite heavy when even half full as the actual kettle has a lot of heft to it. Not a problem for me.
It’s preset settings doesn’t allow you to adjust your the kettle to your preferred temperature.
Full of plastic inside everywhere! I can’t use this and feel good about the safety of my water.

reviews.reviewTitle: This kettle is not all stainless on the inside
reviews.reviewText: The inside lid of this kettle is plastic. Unless you are okay with your tea/coffee water boiling in contact with cheap plastic, do not buy this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: So nice I bought it twice.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this exact product 10 years ago. I used it a minimum of twice a day, requiring it to heat an entire kettle at a time for all 10 of those years. It eventually began to leak which is why I chose to replace it. It is an incredible product for the durability and price point. Easy to use, easy to clean, I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Worked great for 2 months. Stopped working. My daughter loved it very much.
I knew this purchase was a risk after reading a few bad reviews.
