This is a versatile, quiet, fast, convenient way to heat water to a variety of temps. I use it for different types of tea mostly, and often to boil water while cooking, and a few other uses. My son also has one and he loves his as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a really great kettle, when it works
reviews.reviewText:
I have bought two of these. The one that I bought for my office kitchen is going strong 7-8 months later. The multiple temperatures are great, especially for green tea.

I liked it so much there that I bought one for home. THAT one now no longer boils water. It will start to get it hot, but shut off WAY too early, when the water is barely hot. If I can get this repaired or replaced, I might increase the rating, but we've had this one for 3-4 months, so I'm not sure what my options are.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is very nice for hot water
reviews.reviewText: This is very nice for hot water, at first. We have had it since Christmas & now the top flies open when you pour hot water, but then to open it, you have to use your hand to open the top to be able to fill it with water. This is certainly a rip-off when they tell you you have to pay 20.00 to send it back & another 20 to have it returned. Hey people! This was a Christmas gift & you want me to pay $40. for a product that shouldn't have these problems??? That is certainly one way of losing customers for sure!!! and they have certainly lost my loyalty. I will never recommend this or any Cuisinart product any more. And to think of their reputation!!!

I love this kettle! I bought this primarily for heating water for my tea. It was one of the lesser priced models that offered temperature settings. It is wonderful that I can turn it on in the morning before I leave for work and the water is ready and waiting for me to pour up my tea. It holds plenty of water to fill my travel mug and iced tea container that brews while I'm at work.

Kettle is easy to fill and easy to use. Since it is stainless steel it does get warm to the touch so you can only touch the handle when it is working. When full of water it tends to be bottom heavy, so it feels a little awkward when pouring. I would like to be able to put my free hand on the bottom to help me pour, but oh well, you get used to it.

I have had this kettle for about 6 months now and have had no issues with how it works. However, the printing on buttons I use most often is starting to wear off. Bummer. But kettle still works great!

I would definitely recommend this.
This electric tea kettle was great for 3 years; then it quit. If $100 every 3 years fits your budget; you'll love this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5 Stars because I Can't Find Anything to Complain About
reviews.reviewText:
We've owned and used this kettle nearly daily for about 1 year. We use it to make AeroPress coffee and loose leaf tea. It performs like a workhorse, never requiring cleaning. The temperatures offered match our needs. Similar kettles seem to all cost more and offer fewer features (such as fewer temperatures that I want, bulkier footprint, no cord storage for transport).

Of course, it heats up quickly and beeps thrice when it's ready. Doesn't continue to beep if you aren't right there to pick it up. Will keep it warm if you want it to or it will just shut off if you don't.

The cool blue LED will illuminate the water level as soon as I interact with it, so I can easily see to where to fill it even when it's a dark morning. I store it on my counter top with most of the cord length coiled beneath the base. Only about 10" of cord is exposed. All this with full one-handed operation and a balanced center of gravity.

It's just a good kettle.

Got this Christmas 2016 and by Dec 27 2018 it’s totaly broken. Company wants me to cut the chord and weirdly send just the chord back plus $15 shipping. Can’t believe how short term this product lasted.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wears off quickly, multiple problems after a year or two
reviews.reviewText: This kettle initially looks and works great, but after about a year or two multiple problems start occurring and it's almost guaranteed to break. Maybe I just had bad luck, but now i have owned two (2) of these, and in both cases they failed after about 2 years, with different issues. I don't think I will ever get the 3rd one. Good luck if you decide to get it.

It was great while it lasted. The tea definitely tastes better with the Cuisinart water than microwave. However, the Cuisinart CPK-17 died in less than a year. I was shocked until I read reviews online and discovered this is quite common. I am not sure I want to put out the money for another electric kettle that will last less than a year.

reviews.reviewTitle: Blows circuit breakers when lifted off base.
reviews.reviewText:
Certainly heats quickly which is nice. But blows the ground fault protector (fuse) for the kitchen outlets about once every 6 times I pull the kettle off its base. I think this is a design problem - probably needs a 5 cent in-rush current limiter. Much like cheap toasters, the outside gets dangerously hot. The markings are rubbing off the buttons. Don't think I don't like the unit. It generally works ok. But for $100 I have expectations much higher than my $10 stove kettle. One year and still going.
Update 2: 2 years, and still going. On-off button is completely worn off. Still pops the ground fault circuits a few times a week. Updating from a 1 to a 2/5 star for durability. Heaters (with extreme temp cycling) are notoriously unreliable. Still think popping fuses is not a good thing.

We loved the look and function of our kettle. Recently the lid came off from its plastic base and is hard to fix. I called CSR to get a replacement. They wanted me to pay $15 for them to ship a new kettle, despite being within the warranty period. I spoke to the manager who agreed to waive the shipping but I have to bear the cost of returning the old one. Another problem is that the temperature numbers on the handle has faded away as well. Off late I have noticed that it takes a longer time for the water to get heated up. Is this worth the price?

I have owned for six months and have no major complaints.

THE GOOD:

The temperature selection feature is great for making different varieties of tea and getting the most out of their flavors.

It is around 40 or 50 dollars cheaper than the Breville BKE820XL.

THE BAD:

The writing on the buttons wears off very easily. Make sure to memorize the buttons. (This is also happening on my mothers kettle which is the same model.)

I think the "keep warm" button is easy to accidentally push.

Overall, it is a decent kettle. If you are going to be an every day user this one will work great for maximizing the flavor of fine teas. If you can afford it though, I say go with Breville.

I received this as a gift for Christmas and I have NOT been disappointed! I enjoy drinking tea throughout the day and this kettle has been a perfect addition to our kitchen. I love how quickly it heats up water and the contents stay hot in the carafe well beyond the 30 min keep warm feature. If you're thinking "do I really need this? It's so easy to heat up water in the microwave", just trust me and pick this up. I have used mine no less than twice daily for the past week and a half and have wondered on numerous occasions "how have I lived so long without it?"

reviews.reviewTitle: Died in less than a month.
reviews.reviewText:
It was very nice while it lasted. Stainless steel, not cheap looking like most of the kettles on the market.

Than it died in less than a month. Simply stopped working. I was skeptical about all those fancy buttons... and I was right. My previous Bosch kettle worked for 10 years, so it's kinda big step down in quality. I exchanged this Cuisinart kettle for a new unit. Hoping it'll last longer, cause I really like the look of it in my kitchen. Will update with results.
Worked like a dream for 6 months but then the heating element shorted out. Stingy replace policy costs $10 plus shipping the unit back--probably close to $20 in all. What a rip-off.

i got this as a gift. A friend bought it for me at $99.99 The lid quit opening with the button on the handle within six months. Within the first year, it would no longer boil water or even get hot. Total disaster. I'm glad it wasn't my $99.99.

I've had this kettle since 2011 and I use it 3 to 4 times per day 6-7 days per week. Temperature of the water has been accurate. It heats up fast and has worked as describe for a long time. The writing on the handle for the boil button (setting I use the most) did start to wear off after about 3 years, but again I use it a ton. This thing has truly been a work horse, but after 5 years it is finally starting to act up. The past month, the keep warm feature designed to keep the water warm after it's reached the desired temperature is working overtime and boiling off all the water in the pot. At first I thought I was not adding enough water to the pot, but did some trials with a full kettle and found it did the same thing. So, it is time to invest in a new kettle. I based on my experience it will be the same one!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great buy! Great Kettle! Two years in and still like new
reviews.reviewText:
I've been using this for 2 years now, probably averaging daily use or more. Its still working great, and I love it. So compact and easy to use, and still looks brand new.

My roommate moved out recently, and one of his first purchases was getting this water kettle, since he no longer had access to mine. Its a great buy!

We use our kettle everyday...a few times a day and have loved it. We love that we can program it for the desired temp for our different types of teas or coffee when we want. The one con with this item is that the temps label and the open label (to open the lid) are beginning to wear off so we will need to either rewrite them on ourselves or just remember which button produces which temperature of water. Other than that, we've been pleased with the performance.

Bought this kettle in local store for about an year ago, after a few weeks all letters on the buttons are gone... and one year later kettle died... lights are on, everything is ok, you can still choose which temp you want and press start... after 10 sec kettle turns off with 3 beeps.... idk what happenedl, hopefully costumer service will help me

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after 10 months of light use
reviews.reviewText: I loved this electric kettle for its speed, quiet operation, and temperature settings. The blue light is also fun. Then it died after 10 months of using it 1-2 times/day. Alas.

reviews.reviewTitle: The product has quite a short life....
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the product in May of 2014 and has already stopped working or to be more specific the thermostat within reads the temperature incorrectly and no longer heats to the right temperature. For its price and standing behind a name like Cuisinart it's definitely a disappointment. I wouldn't advise anyone to buy this due to it's short life.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok but not worth the extra money
reviews.reviewText:
Obviously heats water well.
Problems: blue light is annoying, the buttons' lettering starts fading...really annoying.
Gets hot on the outside...not sure if that is how they all are.

Next time I would just get a simple one that boils water. I haven't seen any reason to use the different settings.

I didn't buy it on Amazon--it was a gift, but figured I would write the review here since I buy everything else here.

I got this kettle for my birthday, and I love love love it! That was two months ago, and so far it is working just the way it is supposed to work, with no problems at all.

Our townhouse has the water heater in the garage, and it takes a long time for the hot water to reach the sink. I don't like to waste water, so when just a bit of hot water is needed, I use the kettle to warm it, and it's hot in a flash!

The differing temperatures for making different kinds of tea and coffee really improve the taste of hot drinks, especially green and white teas.

And finally, it's PRETTY! I don't mind leaving it out on the counter, because it looks so good.

reviews.reviewTitle: After fridge, most used appliance in our kitchen
reviews.reviewText:
We drink a lot of tea and eat a lot of instant noodles/oatmeal/etc. Technically, the most-used appliance in our kitchen is our refrigerator. After that, it's this Cuisinart kettle. We've had it for a little over a year and have used it multiple times a day nearly every day since we got it. It's still working as well as it did on day one; I've cleaned the inside by mixing in a little vinegar in with the water once or twice, but that's been about the extent of the maintenance it's ever needed.

Plus, since it gets water up to boiling much faster than a typical gas stove does, and I'm lazy, sometimes when I'm boiling noodles I'll heat the water up in the kettle first before pouring it into a pot on the stove.

The temperature settings are ideal for a variety of teas, and the half-hour keep-warm function is a great middle-ground between a kettle that shuts off right away and an electric airpot-style kettle that wastes energy keeping the water hot around the clock.

This is a genuinely well-designed product. If and when ours ever dies, I'll probably just get an identical replacement so long as they're still being made.

Heats water in a timely manner @ the push of a button or two. I have nothing but praise for this electric kettle. Cuisinart did it again. Excellent workmanship & the kettle does what it's intended to do. Would definitely purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... this item 2 years ago and have been extremely disappointed. Within 2 months of using it the temperature ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item 2 years ago and have been extremely disappointed. Within 2 months of using it the temperature gauge/lettering on the handle began to disappear one at a time until they all finally chipped off. Then just last week the base began to leak. It is completely unusable and I am now ordering a new kettle -- NOT a Cuisinart. Too bad. I have liked Cuisinart products over the years but this defect makes me hesitant to buy another Cuisinart product.

reviews.reviewTitle: WORKED ONCE AND DIED. DO NOY BUY!
reviews.reviewText: Worked ONCE then died. I had one pot of $87 tea because this thing never heated up again. The lights go on, but the heating mechanism won't activate. Cuisanart wants me to ship there and back at my expense. Really? I'm extremely disappointed in this product. Obviously Cuisanart's quality standards have slid- I have many of their products but won't be buying another.

reviews.reviewTitle: and well loved, Braun kettle when I received the Cuisinart
reviews.reviewText: I've had this kettle for several years now. It was a gift, and I gave away my well used, and well loved, Braun kettle when I received the Cuisinart. This kettle has been a disappointment since I began to use it. It looks great, but it - from the start - doesn't consistently turn off when it boils. It is a loud kettle, and the plastic buttons have worn off from use (I use it 2-3 times a day). Definitely not recommended, though it does heat the water to this day.

Died after about 1yr of use. I used this sporadically then for the last 6 months or so daily. Not it lights up but the start button doesn't work. The other buttons work but it is useless if it will not start. Disappointed based on the price it should last more than a year.

reviews.reviewTitle: The MOST used counter top appliance in my home!
reviews.reviewText: If you LOVE to drink a variety of different types of TEA this is the electric pot for you. I had a couple of different electric tea kettles before this one and this one makes consistent temperature for green tea, delicate whites and boils water perfectly and quickly for coffee! I've had this for over two years and have used it over 600 times.

Bought this in September 2017 and it started leaking from the bottom this week rendering it totally useless. I paid more that I usually would for a water warmer. $20-30 one I used before this never had a problem. So disappointed.

My parents always kept an electric kettle with us on our travels, for those late night child pleasing hot cocoas! Now that I'm shackled to a desk 8 hours a day, I need a little treat every few hours. For me, that treat is coffee or tea and this kettle does the job perfectly. It allows me to set different water temperatures for correct extraction of tea or coffee, and unlike cheaper kettles it's very quiet! My only complaint is the heft of the kettle itself, when full of it's 1.7 liters of water it can be a bit hard to lift for little old me.

For travel I use this awesome little kettle Bodum Bistro 17-Ounce Mini Cordless Electric Water Kettle, Black in Orange.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice when it works - but it breaks fast
reviews.reviewText: At $80 I expected this to last a hell of a lot longer than it did. I used it for a year and was pretty happy but as of a week ago it started leaking everywhere making a mess all over the counters. This sort of planned obsolescence is not okay.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ink on button fades fast--illegible after a few years
reviews.reviewText: Works great but lettering on buttons faded after a year. We have had it 3 years and can barely read the buttons. I called Cuisinart and they won't replace it. A shame they chose to use such shoddy ink for the buttons.

So far, no problems. I just got it today and am using it for gong fu style tea and it is astonishing how using the right temps can drastically change the flavor of tea. This thing is a beast and I love it very much at the moment
Very good product valued money/quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: The proper temperature for the right tea
reviews.reviewText: I love this product. For many years I used a stove top kettle for my tea. However, after being educated to the importance of water temperature this tea kettle helps tremendously! After being spoiled by this tea kettle, I wish that Cuisinart would make this exact kettle in a travel size.

reviews.reviewTitle: What the heck was I waiting for?
reviews.reviewText: This is a great addition for my morning tea routine. It's FAST and so much easier than firing up the gas cooktop. I make about 2 mugs and 2 cups of tea every morning, and this is about the capacity of this. Not a biggie if I need to refill it - since it's so fast, but it's not a huge capacity (or I drink too much tea...) I've only just boiled for black tea, so I can't say how accurate this is for other temperatures, but I would think it would be fine.

Worked just as expected for the first year, then started leaking at the bottom where the handle meets the body. As other reviewers mentioned, I'd have to pay ~$30 in shipping fees to/from Cuisinart to get a replacement under warranty. I'd rather spend that money on a cheaper kettle with fewer features that would last longer than a year

I loved this when I first received it, the design is beautiful and worked as advertised however, I have now had it a little over a year and the heating element is evidently going out. Set on high (which you can't see as lettering is worn off) it will only heat water to 120 and then will not continue in keep warm setting. Very disappointed. I was so happy to use this kettle for a year, but for the price I think it should last longer. Won't buy another. So sad.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted for a year, leaks water, poor customer service from Cuisinart
reviews.reviewText: This kettle started leaking water out of the handle after one year of use. Cuisinart was willing to replace it, but I would have to pay $30 for shipping of the new product and returning of the old one. I don't think I should be responsible for the shipping since the product was defective - especially not both ways. The kettle was great while it worked, but not worth the price for only one year of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fixed the problem of kettle spontaneously shutting off or not boiling water!
reviews.reviewText: Another reviewer stated that the kettle "simply turns off after about two minutes leaving the water cold." Mine did the same thing for a while, then as time went on it would shut off within 10 seconds of pushing the buttons. I considered buying a replacement but then thought I might as well descale it using water and vinegar first, thinking it would make no difference. It fixed the problem! I was truly amazed that that's all it took. I truly thought this unit was toast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the variable settings for different teas.
reviews.reviewText: Love it! Have had it 3 1/2 years with absolutely no problems—no rust, settings very readable. I must use it 4 or 5 times a day. I like so much that I am buying another for downstairs. Use it for teas—love the different settings available. Others in my family use it for baby formulas, oatmeal and coffee. Both my daughter and daughter-in- law love theirs..
Stopped working after less than 2 year’s use but bought more than 3 years ago so nothing to do, not to mention that this should last longer than 3 years anyway. Don’t waste your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stuck lid FIXED. Details and pictures included.
reviews.reviewText: Stuck lid FIXED. Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp. If you hold down the "open" button and then close the lid, the lid will get stuck. To fix this, simply pop off the metal top from the plastic hatch. The metal is held down with four plastic hooks, and will pop off painlessly. From there you can manually open the latches on each side.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality control is pretty suspect. My unit had a bunch of residue ...
reviews.reviewText: Quality control is pretty suspect. My unit had a bunch of residue around the power cord tongs, and was not able to power up at all. I noticed also that it was pretty difficult to clean, there is an internal spout which you need a very long brush to get out, and it is very difficult to actually dry and drain the water from this. I returned mine.

Best kettle ever! temperature control makes it useful for variouus teas, coffee, or just warm water. It is so easy to use, easy to clean and it looks fantastic

What rests some to the great product: the written numbers (temperatures) are vanishing, and there is no floating water level. Stains on the stainless? never if you dry it once you spill some water on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a very poor kettle. 2 main issues
reviews.reviewText: This is a very poor kettle. 2 main issues: 1) the 'keep warm' button activates by itself. That combined with a poor water level meter means you'll be boiling nothing consistently. 2) In time you're lid won't open. So now we have to pour the water in the spout. I've had a comparable Bosh model for 3x as long and it works perfectly. Cuisinart kettle - like the blender I purchased from them - is poor quality and a regretted purchase.

After using this electric kettle every day for two weeks, I wonder why I went so long before buying one. I love being able to set the perfect temperature for different kinds of teas in order to take full advantage of the various types of teas I purchase. I love that it holds the temperature I have set. I love that the spout doesn't drip when pouring. I love that it's easy to store in my cupboard. I love its simple design. I love that it has a safety feature that won't allow the pot to boil dry. Can you tell I love this electric kettle? I highly encourage anyone who is looking for an electric kettle to try this one!

I love this electric kettle. Just became "hooked" on tea again; and after too many times of boiling my tea kettle DRY on top of oven -- and reading how should NOT boil water forever -- I researched on line and decided this one was for me.

I love the kettle sitting on pad so cord not dangling off when pour into cups.
I love the blue LED lights and the "bing!" when done and the water staying warm and the choices of temps.
I love the larger size.
I love the push button top and the strainer.
I love the heating element NOT being exposed.

This is a great nice looking high tech easy use appliance.

The comparisons, reviews and especially the PROS and CONS list on the Good Housekeeping web site was very helpful in deciding which brand and style was for me.

Obviously, I highly recommend this cordless electric kettle -- plus I got this new model on sale! Yeah!
Purchased this product 18 months ago and it is now leaking from the bottom. Would not expect this from a product priced at the high end of this category. Cannot recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't pass this by, it's a WINNER
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical. I mean, I HAVE a stove top tea kettle why this? Well, as a tea lover this has expanded my tastes to a whole new level. The temp gauge is so amazing, that you get perfect temperature without having to wait. Example, I did not know (and granted I'm a novice to anything outside of black tea) that green tea and oolong have a certain steeping temp. I learned quickly that the minute flavor differences are all due to temp, and I love that the kettle does the work for you! Also, being this is all stainless steel was a plus with cleaning, appearance, and overall health. No toxins from plastic! LOVE LOVE LOVE my new tea kettle!!!

I have been using this item for quite a few years and love it! I really appreciate being able to set the temperature for whatever type of tea I am making. Green tea really does taste better when brewed at 175°F rather than boiling. I live in a hard water area and use only distilled water in it.
Functionality is great while it works but the letters on the temp level buttons wear off and the lid stops working after about a year. We have to re-fill through the spout.
Great product

I like it. But, it broke. Now I'm bummed.

Dear Cuisinart,
Fix my broken water boiler. It just beeps continuously, instead of boiling intentionally.
XOXO [crying]

We have owned this tea kettle and used EVERYDAY for several years with no problems. We are loose leaf tea drinkers and had a hard time finding a kettle that did not just boil the water. Love the versatility and reliability of this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Leaky kettle, high shipping and handling costs on returns
reviews.reviewText: I had this kettle for about 2 months when the bottom handle area started to leak. I contacted Cuisinart on how to return this, and the cost of shipping was high to send back. Now I went through Amazon to return and everything was seamless. I will not be buying this product again.

reviews.reviewTitle: After about three months of use, the lid would ...
reviews.reviewText: After about three months of use, the lid would not close. It still works, but I'm afraid it will not be for much longer. Have bought this twice now- if you use a kettle regularly, this will not last more than a year. Finally going to stop buying it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle - couple of minor comments
reviews.reviewText: We've had the kettle about 6 months now. Use it daily and really like. We used to use a stove top model. We've become avid tea drinkers over the last couple years and this kettle really take the fuss out of making lower temperature teas. No issues yet, not even the scaling mentioned by others. That must be water related. A couple of minor design comments. The timer on our model is like a cheap wristwatch alarm. I can't even hear it and my wife can't when she's out of the kitchen. I can hear the stove and microwave just fine so I'm not deaf yet. The other is the boil setting. We live in Colorado at 5000'. The water boils at lower temp here. The kettle really get rocking before it recognizes the boil so we seldom use it. The 200 degree setting is close enough.

Not only does the Cuisinart Tea Kettle look great sitting on the counter but, I really like the different temperature settings for different teas etc. The size is nice as sometimes I refill the kettle for two pots of tea throughout the day. Looked at more expensive kettles but, I thought this kettle offered everything for less.

The first unit had the following problems: (1) lid open mechanism fell apart, but I was able to reassemble it, (2) after about 10 months of usage the unit would either stop heating before the water was boiled, or not shut off after the water was boiling, so we had to watch it carefully or end up with a wet sauna in our kitchen. We bought this at Bed Bath & Beyond, so we were able to return it at the store for no cost. We got the same unit as a replacement. The second unit was worse than the first. Occasionally the top would open when it was heating, without us touching it. Then it started shutting off early or never shutting off, just like the first one. Again we exchanged it at BB&B at no cost. We are now on our third unit, for about 2 months and so far no problems. But we know the shoe will drop probably before the year is out. I'm giving it two stars because we like the capacity, the heating options, and the stay warm feature. Too bad it's a quality nightmare.

I loved it for 4 years. It has issues. I never liked how it kept turning on, seemed like the keep warm function was automatic. Overall, the concept of choosing your temp is brilliant, especially for a tea drinker! However, one day it just quit. I don't think four years is enough for the price of this. I'd have a different view if it was ten years. I have a chefs choice and it's at least ten years old and running well, I'm glad I didn't get rid of it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Although it works great, it gets hot enough to burn you.
reviews.reviewText: Don't touch anything but the handle if you don't want to get burned. The metal gets extremely hot, so lifting it with two hands is only possible with oven mitts.

I have been using electric kettles for over 30 years, and this is by far the worst one I have purchased. The writing on the buttons immediately wore off; unless you remembered the buttons there is no way to see which setting you are using. After that the kettle began to boil water more slowly. Then the lid became difficult to open, and then the lid mechanism stopped working completely. Finally, the exterior (metal) lid came off completely. Now the kettle has no numerals or written temperatures, the lid is stuck and won't open and the exterior metal surface of the lid has fallen off completely. This kettle should have lasted a good deal longer than the few months I owned it. Shame on Cuisinart for manufacturing such a poor product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp 1.7-Liter Stainless-Steel Cordless Electric Kettle
reviews.reviewText: This is an excellent quick way to heat water for coffee and tea. I thought it was very pricey considering its only use was to heat water, but I have come to appreciate that it is fast and I don't have a water ring on my glass top stove anymore. It looks beautiful, well made, and works great!

Bought this for a gift for someone who didn't use tea kettles previously. And they are now using! A reason thesweethome\thewirecutter recommend. Only issue is it could have a better viewing angle of how much water.

This thing is incredible! First off, it's beautiful! I love the design. The LED's are a nice touch. Some complain that the beep indicating it's done is too quiet, but I actually prefer that to some annoyingly loud beep. The fact that I can choose the temperature is really what sold me on this unit. I haven't noticed scaling as others have mentioned, but I wasn't really looking for it either. I've had this for a month now, and so far so good. I did end up purchasing a 2 year extended warranty from Sears because of the few reviewers who said theirs crapped out after a year. Hopefully I don't have to make use of it.

I bought this kettle in January 2013 and it broke after 6 months. I am not impressed. Worse still, Cuisinart failed to respond to my emailed request for help so I ended up telephoning them today. Although the kettle has broken well within its warrantee Cuisinart were wanting to charge me $10 for shipment of a new kettle. I pushed back and the associate removed the fee! Although I am glad that they are replacing the kettle, I don't expect the new one to last much longer than this one, which is seriously disappointing given the cost of the original kettle. I would look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: It stop working one month after buying it. I ...
reviews.reviewText: It stop working one month after buying it. I use to be a Cuisinart fan...not any more. The brand is going down hil. WOnder why

reviews.reviewTitle: You never know when it will just die
reviews.reviewText: I bought one and it died after a few months. It simply would not turn on. Now it will sit in a landfill for 1000 years and I will have to try something else.

reviews.reviewTitle: does not have a stand-by feature and backlight stays on ALL THE TIME!!!!
reviews.reviewText:
for tea-lovers like myself the water temperature is very important. I chose this kettle mainly for this reason, even though I was a little skeptical about its digital sophistication..
the design and technology look great. however, after trying the kettle for the first time, I realized it doesn't have a stand-by feature, which would seem to me like a pretty basic one.
you know how in most - if not all - kettles, once the water reaches the temperature, it simply turns off - both the heating system and the illumination - until the next time you want to use it? well, this DOESN'T!
the LCD display and the illumination are on all the time as long as the kettle is placed on the base. it says in the manual that after 1 minute after not using it the system switches to stand-by mode but illumination stays on anyway. I find it absurd. as many times as you can use a kettle in one day, I doubt they can justify a 24 hours electricity consumption... the only way is to keep it off the base or unplug it after every use.

sometimes it seems like the more technologically advanced an appliance is, the more it forgets about the most basic aspects of its use...

I am returning this one :-(

I've been using this for about a month now. It is just as pictured. Fairly straight forward use. The only weird part is having to hit the start button to start and to turn it off. I haven't had any trouble with it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems expensive but is a great investment
reviews.reviewText:
We have had this kettle for 3 years now and use it probably 3-4 times a week. I absolutely adore it. It is not overwhelmingly loud, it's very effective, and we have had no problems. It looks great and works just as well as it did the first day.

When ours inevitably breaks, we will be purchasing another one.

I purchased this kettle and within 3 months the text on the buttons began to wear off. I called cuisinart and the woman told me not to wash the handle!! really? Not wash the handle everyone touches in the kitchen?? The store exchanged it and the same thing happened on the second one! It functions but if you use various temps you will need to either remember which is which or use a sharpie!

I have had to replace two models as the water would not heat. The product would work for about a month and then fail. After the first was returned to the store I subsequently had to pay to have the second shipped back to the warehouse and that is my only option for the third non-functioning model. It is ridiculous that I would have to pay shipping again for their useless product. I will go back to microwave and teacup. I would strongly advise not buying this product.

Do not buy this Cuisinart kettle. It has an inherent defect. I am staring at my second kettle waiting for it to boil water. It is my second kettle because the first kettle had the same defect. It works fine for about two months, then inexplicably fails to bring water to a boil. I suspect that it has to do with the temperature sensors or the cpu. Now it is turning itself off automatically without bringing the water to the temperature setting. I'll return this one to the store, too, but I won't walk out with a new one. Fool me once . . . .
This kettle failed to function within a few months of purchase. it simply stopped heating water despite proper electrical connections. It was a terrible disappointment and I would not recommend it.
Pretty great so far after maybe 150 uses

Just got this kettle today. Am not happy with the following: 1. Measurements are in liters not cups. 2. The new Cuisinart took longer to boil water than my old old Braun electric kettle. 3. The beep that lets you know the water is to the temperature you picked is so quiet I cannot hear it just a few feet away. 4. There is condensation inside the plastic that houses the measurements. I DO like the fact that it keeps the water at the correct temperature for 30 minutes and you have all the different temperatures. Maybe if I never had an electric kettle I would be thrilled with this one. Bottom line is that it is going back tomorrow and I will keep my old one and save the $90+ bucks!

My daughter bought this for me for Christmas, at first I thought I'd never use it. Boy was I wrong, I use it everyday to make tea. I make iced tea by the gallon. This cuts my wait time for the water to boil from 5 minutes to a minute and a half. It's a great product.

I have been using my kettle for a month now and am in love with this kettle!! I have tried other kettles in the past and none of them could do as much as this one. It has 6 temp settings so i can make all my tea at the right temperature. It also keeps it warm after it reaches the right temp which allows me to get ready in the morning without having to check on the water. This is by far the best kettle i have seen and used and it is very resonably priced. If you love your tea, you will love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful Electric Kettle -- Extra Features Not Needed At High Altitude!
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautiful addition to our kitchen, but we quickly realized that could have bought the next model down (and saved $40) because we live at 8200 feet. Water boils here are 193 F, and since three of the buttons are for 190F, 200F and Boil (212 F at sea level), we never get to use these functions (the temp of the water never gets high enough to trigger the internal turn-off feature when we select these temperatures). It really is a nice-looking kettle, though, and we probably use it every day.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets a stable 80 fps on Crisis 3
reviews.reviewText:
I was looking for an upgrade from my GTX260 gpu and I came across this. While it's certainly hard to fit in even a full tower, I found the power more than makes up for it. Going for that late night coding marathon? Just pop open your case and pour out a fresh cup of early grey.

4/5, docked 1 star for limited resolution and power consumption.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not pleased with Cuisinart's customer service
reviews.reviewText: What I don't like is that the screws on the inside of the lid began to rust about 2 months in. Although Cuisinart will replace it under their warranty, I have to pay for shipping both ways (you can send it any way you want, but have to send them $15 for return postage). Why should I pay $30 for a defective product replacement? At present, I'm not inclined to pour any more money into this product. To me, Cuisinart needs to stand behind their product better. If this were 2 or 3 years in, fine, but it's not even 2 months old!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Indispensable for Tea Lovers (extensive test data included)
reviews.reviewText:
This has review three parts: (1) why you should get something like this in general, (2) specific concerns about this product not addressed in other reviews, and (3) detailed operational measurements (water temperature range)

=== Part 1: Why to get an variable temperature electric tea kettle ===

For anyone who drinks tea (unless it is exclusively black) or makes coffee outside an all-in-one, department store drip-brewer, this is absolutely indispensable. Though most recipes have been built to use only room-temp or boiling water (since those are the only temperatures to easily reach with consistency), more cutting-edge cooking as well as coffee/tea prep requires more finesse. Unless you're willing to watch the proverbial pot boil with a thermometer in hand, this is the only way to heat water on such occasions.

=== Part 2: Concerns / questions raised (and/or) left unanswered by other reviews ===

I won't go into detail about well-established pros and cons covered in other reviews, but I would like to make clear a few things I couldn't determine from reviews/specs before I bought mine:

("Hot sides/surfaces"): Yes, the sides get hot, and yes, it is startling to touch the metal outer wall when the water is hot. However, according to my IR thermometer, the surface never gets much above 130 degrees. Sure, that's hot and you should avoid contact, but for comparison many people's hot water heater is set this high and (as validated by my rather stupid intentional touch test) an accidental touch is highly unlikely to cause even a mild first-degree burn unless you actively fight the reflex to instantly pull away.

("Construction / Material touching the water"): True, the sidewall level indicator and the "frame" of the removable spout filter are made of plastic (the BPA content of which I have not conclusively proved or disproved) but the former is part of a small compartment which only a small amount of water reaches and which has very limited circulation, and the latter is removable. The entire rest of the construction that touches water is steel. Since hot water dissolves BPA from plastics, and aluminum's role in neurodegenerative disease is unclear, iron/steel and glass are pretty much the only materials I trust completely for food storage/preparation containers. In this regard, this kettle is the safest option I've found.

=== Part 3: Operational test data ===

As a tea fanatic with a minimum of four kinds of tea always on hand (black, red/oolong, green, and white) and general geek, I have meticulously measured the actual temperature of the water in the kettle for the various settings. I share them here in hopes they will provide a useful operational profile for buyers interested in temperature variability. (Bear in mind that the container you pour into will greatly affect the water temperature, so remember to preheat it by filling it with hot water right before use.)

Button | @ First Trigger Completed
Label | "Beep" Re-heat Re-Heat
--------|-------- -------- ---------
160 | 164 160 163
175 | 180 175 178
185 | 192 185 188
190 | 197 191 194
200 | 203 199 204
Boil | 214 206 214

(All temperatures are in degrees F, as registered by my probe thermometer in the top half of the water with the kettle fully-filled.)

=== - ===

I know this is half generally-relevant bullet points, and half geek-oriented test data, but I hope this review still has something useful for everyone.

I have one of these kettles and I LOVE it, so much that I bought a second one for my guest house. That's when things went bad. I got the brand new one, and it had a problem it boiled and boiled until it ran out of water. I called Cuisinart and tried their troubleshooting steps to reset the kettle. Still had the problem. Cuisinart wanted to charge me for shipping both ways for a replacement of a kettle less than a week old. They said I could return it to Amazon (who has been great by the way) and so I did. I got the replacement kettle and it too had the same issue. I tried the reset on my own and the problem still existing. I called Cuisinart and they again wanted to charge me for shipping, so I turned to Amazon again. The third kettle (second replacement) arrived today and the first thing I did was plug it in and test -- SAME PROBLEM. I noticed this time when I called Cuisinart that the recent kettles all had the same serial number I verified this because I had not returned the one from last week yet (so it's not the same actual kettle). I think Cuisinart has a bad batch 60720 O. My original kettle that I love, and also bought from Amazon, is a different batch number 41016 O.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great water boiler. One really poor feature
reviews.reviewText: It has been working great since day 1. Though after relatively few months, the writing on the buttons is rubbing off. Hopefully, one day when they are all blank, I'll remember what button does what. See the picture I took.

The reviews I read before purchasing were better than than other electric kettles, so I purchased 3 of these for my mobile tea unit. So far, 2 out of the 3 have been used for less than 2 months and both have stopped working. After the first one turned itself off after setting it to the usual boil setting, Cuisinart's customer service told me it was a defective unit and they would replace it, with me paying for shipping, both ways, sending them a $15 check with the returned unit. The second kettle has now begun to do the same thing. It will not stay on to boil. It turns itself off after less than 2 minutes. I now have two defective kettles to return. But now I just want my money back, thank you. We still have the third kettle to try and see if it also is defective.
UPDATE: I am very frustrated with Cuisinart's inability to not offer any type of refund for these two defective units. I do not want replacement units, and Amazon only allows for refunds before 30 days is up, and these units stopped working after about 2 months. I purchased these for $84 each. The Cuisinart customer service rep I spoke with this morning was less than helpful and actually scoffed at the fact that I could not read the tiny printed number on the bottom of the kettle without a magnifying glass. Wow, rude. So, I have two defective units that I wasted $168 on and the only thing I can do with them is toss them in the garbage.
2nd UPDATE: Our third unit just stopped working, a day after giving the above update!! I decided to call Amazon directly to see what they could do. Thankfully, a kind and helpful customer service person from AMAZON offered to give us a refund for two, and a replacement for one, covering all shipping costs. Happy Thanksgiving & Merry Christmas from Amazon!!

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY !!! The kettle looks nice, but not lasting long. The warranty does not cover shipping.
reviews.reviewText: I had two of this product. The first one from 2013 last a little less than three years. The letters on buttons start worn out after one year, then the open lid was jammed less than three years. Since I like this settle with various temperature settings, I decided to try another one. The one I bought Nov 2016 is worse. The lid is jammed after a few months. While I was looking up the warranty service, it says the customer needs to return at their own cost and need to include $15 shipping to facilitate the replacement. This is absolutely ridiculous. Need to pay shipping both ways to get a defective product replaced or repaired within the warranty period. Cuisinart must be kidding. I will not buy their products anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started to malfunction 1 year into 3 year warranty
reviews.reviewText:
I did extensive research before buying this kettle in March 2016. Cuisinart is supposed to be a very good brand. I wanted to love it.
For almost a year it has worked well. Now, however, it randomly fails to stop at the programmed temperature setting, and will proceed to a full boil without ever shutting off! Even if removed from the base; even if the 'start' button is turned off & no lights are on; the kettle still continues to boil.
It does not happen every time. When it does the only way to reset is to unplug the base from the wall. So, now to be safe, we can not walk away from the kettle when it is heating.
Also some of the printing is coming off of the water level window.
I called Cuisinart & they will replace it, but as others have noted, their 3 year warranty does not cover shipping, so I would have to pay to return the defective kettle AND pay for the shipping of a replacement. I am going to see if Amazon will do anything better for me.
As an aside, I've owned a Breville cordless kettle (without temperature controls) for 10 years plus & it still does the job.
Unfortunately, I need multiple temperature settings now, and I see similar complaints about the Breville multi-temp kettle.
Not sure what brand to choose next.

The one star is for the beautiful-looking polished stainless. I am comparing this to the Brefille electric kettle: their last version has a much wider opening -- so pouring water in is much easier. AND, if you were to drop anything in the kettle (like the sediment screen, while replacing it), or if it builds up sediment at the bottom -- you could NOT reach inside the kettle! This kettle's small narrow opening at the top requires you to aim it more carefully under the stream of running water during filling (keeping the electronics/ electrical parts dry); The Brefille had an unobtrusive but musical single and quiet ding when the kettle was done boiling. This one has an unpleasant, loud beeping that can wake up my sleeping baby. The WORST part about this kettle: its lid will NOT stay closed! While boiling, the lid keeps opening wide! And I keep closing it. Repeatedly. Even as you are pouring yourself a cup of tea, the lid flies open, letting out steam! i have not burnt myself yet but I don't believe that a wide open lid on a kettle full of boiling water is safe! For the ridonculously expensive price, this kettle is not pleasant to use, not very safe, and VERY annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's pretty random. I almost regret getting a fancy electric ...
reviews.reviewText:
Stopped working after about 1.5 years. It was working well up until that point. I didn't drop it or mistreat it in any way. What happens is I turn the unit on, it indicates it's heating, but it doesn't heat fully or not at all. After 15 minutes or so the unit will start making a long steady beep. It's pretty random. I almost regret getting a fancy electric kettle. Perhaps I should have stuck with the basic model of on/off. It's been over a week and I've had to heat my water with a pot on my stove...

I contacted customer support and they are processing my replacement delivery. I had to pay a $10 processing fee. It's been a week now and the replacement has not yet left the warehouse. They are requesting that I cut the cord of the old unit and ship it back to them. I have to pay the return shipping of the cut cord. I'm assuming this is to show proof that I am not a fraudster.

I'll update this review after I receive the replacement.

UPDATE 04-17-2018
The replacement finally came. The $10 processing fee and the wait time for the replacement was a bit annoying, but otherwise I'm happy. Upgrading this to 4 stars. They honored their warranty agreement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buyer Beware- read reviews before buying!
reviews.reviewText:
Cuisinart, with this name you pay for and expect quality; well I paid for a quality product however after less than 2 months of use it has bit the dust. While this pot is beautiful with many wonderful options for different types teas, it does not live up to its name.
1. The button imprint will wear off rather quickly unless protective coating is applied-not a deal breaker.
2. The buttons pop or fall off-so you can attempt to put them back in place but they never stay.
3. The buttons stick down and will not come up, hey you think, just unplug your kettle right? Until the OPEN button sticks down and you are not able to open or close your lid to fill your kettle, rendering it totally useless in your kitchen.
So this has been a GREAT DISSAPOINTMENT, after 2 wks of letting it sit on my counter I will attempt to contact Cuisinart's Customer Service and see what their response is, will post updates on this very regrettable experience.
UPDATE-Amazon Customer Service was wonderful, helping to resolve this bad purchase, thank you Amazon for you help!

I bought this one year ago (almost exactly). It worked great for a year then died. So, I followed instructions in the manual for the warranty. The good news is that it was covered. The bad news is I had to pay for shipping the replacement to me (although Fedex was used it was a very slow Fedex) and I have to pay for the broken one to be replaced. The warranty people pointed that Cuisinart only covers the product not the shipping. So, it will be around $25 to $30 to get the warranty covered (at a very slow place). The plus is they covered it. The minus is charging me for shipping to replace a product of theirs that broke. I must say I am not surprised because the reviews I read when I bought the unit pointed out that the controller for the temperature and heating unit had a tendency to break.

The unit is nice. We will like the replacement. The warranty service is poor. This review is more about Cuisinart's handling of its warranty when it produces a defective product.

Well, I got into tea, apparently, in March 2012, when I bought this kettle. It has worked extremely well for the past 7 years. The two bothersome qualities of this kettle are the following:

1) The letters will definitely wear off the kettle. Mine did so on the temperature I use the most (Black tea) within about one year or so. This isn't too bad, but if I was constantly making different temps of tea, it would be very problematic.

2) The water level gauge forms a white/black crust as though it's not perfectly sealed, and there's no way to get in there and clean it. I believe it's just water calcification but it's still somewhat disgusting and bad design. I tried filling the whole kettle with vinegar and letting it sit, but that didn't do anything but remove the scale.

I see on here that a lot of people got defective units. I may have been lucky. I feel like I got my money's worth as it's been 7 years and it's still working. I may replace it due to the water calcification, though.

After about a year of use, I would highly recommend this electric water kettle. I have tried three different brands/models, and this one is hands-down the best by far. Well made and durable, it does the job very well, heating water quickly and, optionally, keeping it at the right temperature.
Looking through various different electric kettles, you will find that there are basically two different power types - 1,500 watts (like this one) and 1,100 watts (or thereabout). The higher wattage models will, as a rule, heat water significantly more quickly. The trade-off is that, if you have an older / less robust electrical system in your kitchen (or where-ever), running a higher wattage kettle and another high wattage appliance (microwave, toaster oven, etc.) on the same circuit at the same time, may trip the circuit breaker. An easy thing to learn to live with, but something to keep in mind. I find that this is not an issue with the "keep warm" feature, which only runs the heating element for about 10 seconds. Unlike other kettles I have used, this one has not started leaking over time. It does seem to have a common defect, in that the audible beep when it has reached the set temperature does not always sound. I sent my first one of these back for an exchange when I first noticed that, but the second one has the same intermittant issue. However, while not loud enough to be bothersome, the kettle does emit enough noticeable sound while heating that it is obvious when it stops. All in all, this is a very good quality kettle.

It was useful before it rusted. The nut and bolt used to attach the plastic housing for the filter were made of metal and rusted after a week of usage. Amazon is sending replacement. Hopefully, it was a manufacturer's defect and the replacement has stainless steel fasteners or something that don't rust.

reviews.reviewTitle: High Failure Rate & Expensive Warranty Fufillment
reviews.reviewText:
Summary: This device, which otherwise works great, is prone to suddenly and inexplicably just failing. No matter how well you take care of it, how little or much you use it, one day it may just stop heating water. It will cost you roughly half the price of the product to repair/replace via warranty, and of course your replacement is prone to the same sudden failure. This has been an ongoing issue with this product for many, many years.

Like so many others that I regrettably ignored, my kettle died in less than six months. It was used infrequently but regularly, per all instructions, and was never dropped or misused in any way. One day it just no longer heated water, despite seeming to work otherwise.

This kettle has all the features I want: variable temperatures, keep warm function, cordless, attractive. Problem is, it doesn’t live up to its promise. When it works, it’s a dream. But I’ve had to replace mine twice over the past 4 years, and now I’m done. I believe that something that costs this much and is produced by a supposedly reputable company ought to work for longer than 6 months. The three I’ve owned have started acting up around 6 months after purchase: one began leaking, one stopped keeping warm, and the current one sometimes heats and sometimes doesn’t. Terrible way to start the morning. I usually have very few issues with appliances; I read the manuals and very closely follow operating instructions, so I’m confident it’s not operator error.

Cuisinart provided a replacement each time, but charged shipping, of course. The last time, they tried to charge me to ship a new unit AND I had to ship the defective one back to them. That’s crazy.

I really want this dream machine to work, but it doesn’t so I give up. Going to try to find a bare-bones electric kettle that meets my primary criterion of fast hot water in the morning.

Good: Great kettle and has worked well for me after 3 years of daily use.

Bad: 1. The button writing wearing off. I did the nail polish trick, which was a pain because I couldn't use it for the first 2 days I had it because I was being very cautious and making sure the polish had enough time to completely dry. It did the trick for a couple of years, but now there has been some rubbing off. Looks bad. I don't know why they can't just fix this.

Bad: 2. I hate how it beeps very loudly 5 times when ready. 3 beeps would be plenty, and 1 beep would be just fine for me. 5 extremely loud beeps is very aggravating. I guess Cuisinart wants people to know when their water is ready even if they're out mowing the lawn with headphones on. I'm sure some people even wish theirs would do no beeps, for whatever reason. It should be a user-configurable setting. That would be fantastic.

Bad: 3. Some rust near the lid. They really should use better quality parts to prevent this. And it can cause the lid to pop up very slowly. That happened with mine, but it was temporary and not a dealbreaker issue.

Overall still a great product but I wish the company would up the quality to solve the nagging quality issues. I'd be willing to pay more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good kettle while it lasts. Warranty sub-par.
reviews.reviewText:
I love this kettle. However, the lining has peeled off at the bottom on the kettle. It's now that I realize that Cuisinart makes you pay shipping both ways if you want a new kettle under their warranty. Why should the customer have to pay 30 dollars to the company for a product that is defective and cannot survive the three years covered by the warranty.

Update: I loved this kettle, but now I realize it was a waste of money. The lining is completely in disarray with the first layer missing halfway up the kettle and a large portion of the bottom skinned to the black material that is under the first two layers of lining. Poor quality. I expected something more from Cuisinart. Moving onto more reliable electric kettle brands like Zojirushi.

I'm convinced now that this kettle is designed to live for exactly 22 months. I bought the first one in 2015. 22 months later, in 2017, the electronics suddenly and completely failed. The lights just blinked and it was unresponsive. Customer Service wanted $15 to ship a replacement, but they eventually waived it when I protested it. Exactly 22 months after the replacement arrived, it too went kaput. This time it just doesn't do anything when I click Start, and a few minutes later it starts beeping insistently. The LED also blinks erratically sometimes. Exactly 22 months for both kettles? This is not just poor quality. This is deliberately fine-tuned planned obsolescence. Shame on Cuisinart for its greed. Do not encourage them. Buy a kettle that isn't programmed to self-destruct.

reviews.reviewTitle: Jury is still out on the Rust issue
reviews.reviewText: I love the functionality and speed of heating. The posts about Rust and customer service bother me. I purchased on 8/1/15 and already see discoloration around the bottom inside where the walls meet the inside base/bottom. (see pic). Anyone know if this is normal or if it is rust?

reviews.reviewTitle: works like a cheap water boiler
reviews.reviewText: I've only had this thing a little over 24 hours and it sucks already. When I first try to boil water, nothing happen. I just thought I forgot to press the "start" button. Then today, when I try to boil water again, nothing happens. I had to try it again before it would boil. The "keep warm" button is a joke. Once you take the kettle off the base, it goes off. The only way the "keep warm" will stay on is if you keep it on the base, which is pointless because then you can't use the kettle. The "keep warm" doesn't come back on after you set it back on the base again. It also says that the "keep warm" will keep the set water temperature for 30 minutes. It doesn't. I didn't time it but I left it on "keep warm" and the whole unit shut off after about 5 minutes. There was about .75L of water left in the kettle when it shuts off. It was enough water for me to brew two of my pu er tea on my clay pot. You can buy something half this price and it'll work the same. This kettle is a joke. I am return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hopefully, they’ve worked out the kinks...
reviews.reviewText: I would give this 5 stars except that I had to rerun the first two I received because they would not hear water or would do so intermittently. It appears that there was a quality control problem that has now hopefully been solved. I have used a Cuisinart electric kettle for at least 10 yrs. In addition to having a safety cut off, this gives you the ability to set lower temperatures for various types of tea and automatically maintains the temperature for 1/2 hr, so you can have it ready if you get distracted or want to make a second cup. The last one I ordered has worked properly for several weeks now. Knock on wood the unit will be as reliable as my old one, which is still peeking along fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after almost two years.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle March 29 2016 as a gift to my husband despite bad reviews. It worked like a charm. The buttons where you choose the temperature never got erased like it happened to some other reviewers. I payed almost a hundred dollars for it.
The performance while it worked was great in my opinion. Although I must say we only used boil and 200• for French press coffee. My husband, as much as he loves tea, he never wanted to bother changing temperature .... oh well.... that was his preference. Like I said I did not get to try the other temperatures but it worked just fine for us.

A word of caution: it does get really hot to the touch. it wasn’t an issue for us since the handle is not hot but once while cooking I touched it and it startled me but no bad burns. My husband used to clean it with white vinegar . Three weeks ago the kettle stopped shutting off. A week later it just fixed itself and started working again. Then this week it just won’t hear the water.

We used this kettle minimum of 2 times a day , 4 tops. Every single day.

I really enjoyed while it works and looks elegant. I just don’t know What else to say... is it a 100 dlls kettle supposed to work for just two years?.

reviews.reviewTitle: Weird Design Decisions, But a Good Kettle
reviews.reviewText:
Works well a few weeks in. I DON'T like that you have to wait to put the thing back on the base, because otherwise it tries to keep heating the water again after you'd poured it over your tea or coffee. The location of the water level window is absolutely idiotic, though. You can barely see it half the time until you twist and lean over to figure out where the water is at. And you can't see it at all when you hold it, really. It should be on the side, like most of these have it, but it's not a dealbreaker, just weird.

The buttons on the handle are really convenient, but so were the ones on the base of our old Breville kettle. The lights aren't too distracting, and they turn off in a decent time period. The keep warm setting would be nice if I ever used or needed it, I guess.

The lid can spring kind of forcefully, where our old one had a soft-open to stop hot water droplets from spattering out should you open it just after boiling. Granted, I now just don't open it until it's had a moment to cool down. Doesn't pour as smoothly as our old Breville, but doesn't spill everywhere or anything, either. The base footprint is nice and small. The cord has a good length. This unit feels solid and reliable, whatever weird design decisions were made in its development. And it's very well reviewed everywhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great until it falls apart
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this kettle four years ago and used it multiple times a day to boil water for tea, coffee, and cooking.

What's good:

- boils water fast
- easy to specify the desired temperature with no fuss or muss
- 3 year warranty

What's bad:

- labels printed on the temperature buttons have flaked
- sometimes, the heating element would not automatically shut off, or stay off, when it was empty, and then the kettle would sit there overheating alarmingly
- eventually, probably due to this overheating, developed a leak, so that it will drip water gradually through the bottom of the handle over the counter

The bottom line is that this kettle does what it's supposed to do but it doesn't last very long, which is frustrating given the price. Some review website said that none of the electric kettles do last long, so maybe this is as good as it gets.

Despite my frustrations I reckon I'm going to buy another one, and keep a close eye on the warranty time. I have no idea if Braun actually honors their warranty in a reasonable fashion, or finds devious ways to avoid it

I've been using my CPK-17 for 3 days. I have used it about 10x/day, various settings for various types of tea. I have also used the Keep Warm setting. It works great, but I do have one complaint: the water cools surprisingly fast inside the kettle. I used to use a stove top kettle, and could count on a full pot of boiled water remaining hot for 30+ minutes after boiling. This kettle seems to cool off immediately if not kept on the Keep Warm setting. It's a minor issue, but surprising for what appears to be a well insulated kettle. I definitely appreciate the notification beep when it reaches the desired setting, reminiscent of the whistle of my former stovetop kettle, to remind me it's finished so that I don't have to reheat, in case we get busy with other things.

Intent of purchase was to replace a Krups electric kettle that had worn out. The Cuisinart is smaller than the Krups by 0.8 liter and had expanded performance abilities on paper. CONS: The lid often sticks (button is poorly designed). The exterior gets stains on it from water and they do not come off easily. The level gauge is difficult to see, while holding the pitcher, because your hand blocks the view. The control panel on the handle is TERRIBLE; it often resets itself, will put the "keep warm" function into play without actually punching the button, or change the temperature to 160 degrees when it was set at 212 degrees. The biggest CON is that the kettle is unreliable and unpredictable. The purpose of an automatic electric kettle is to operate when you are not watching it. Fill this kettle and turn it on, then walk away only to find it has not heated the water. I have tried standing by the kettle to see what happens and it simply signals with "beeps" that it is done, when it has only been heating for less than 90 seconds. This doesn't happen every time, but frequently enough that I have to now stand by the kettle to be certain it will heat. This makes me regret buying the device (never had this problem with the Krups).
PROS: It occasionally boils water (when it feels like it). The electric pad design is reasonably functional. Aesthetically, it is pleasant to look at.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Kettle for making pour over coffee
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great kettle. I have had it for slightly over 3 years when it started to leak onto the base for some reason and needed to be replaced. I ordered the "newer version" CPK-17AMZ which is identical to the CPK-17. I suspect mine had a flaw which finally failed which resulted in water leaking through the kettle walls to exit out onto the base. Out of concern for being electrocuted, we replaced it.

The kettle has heated water to the correct temperature consistently and has always been a pleasure to use. The temperature settings are great and very convenient. I use this kettle primarily to heat water for coffee which I make on an Aeropress coffee maker. Ideally, you don't want boiling water for brewing coffee as it results in a bitter brew. We make extensive use of the "Keep Warm" option so that we can get to making the coffee when we are ready (work and kids cause delays).

I would encourage this kettle for coffee and tea enthusiasts. The temperature settings truly help achieve that perfect cup!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great (when it works at all)
reviews.reviewText: I loved this product as long as it worked, which was not very long. I purchased in November 2015 & it stopped working within a month. Amazon replaced it free of charge, but after 4 months, the replacement stopped working. The limited warranty from Cuisinart authorizes replacement, but I have to pay for them to send the new unit to me, and also pay to send the broken unit back. Reluctant to spend an additional ~$40 on a product that may only last another couple months, I'm going to try the Bonavita Variable Temperature Gooseneck instead.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probably the best electric pot for the price
reviews.reviewText: I read some outside reviews and thus bought this one. It was ranked best buy for a great operating tea pot two years in a row. I did my own checking with a digital thermometer. I ran it through all the heat settings with one liter of plain water. My thermometer has a 2% error, and with that each temp setting was only 5 degrees hotter than the setting I chose. A very consistent 5 degrees, which if you figure in my thermometer's 2% at 200 degrees, that is 4 degrees making the pot only one degree off. Or you could say my thermometer is dead on and the pot is only 2% off. Either way that is pretty darn close for a pot less than $80. It also has a very thick cord to handle the current which is very important. Too often they cheap out on the copper cord which in a high amp circuit can cause problems. One other thing to consider is that the cheaper pots us a bimetal thermal disk to shut off at one temp. My first pot was one of these types and after only a few uses the bimetal disk started to malfunction and keep the pot on far too long. This can be a fire hazard. The Cuisinart is digitally controlled and uses a solid base which also blocks the contacts so that a child can't accidently shock themselves, which my first one lacked. All in all, this is a very well built pot and doesn't look like they tried to cheap out on the important stuff. It even has two color LED lighting for the switches and water meter, at first thought it was a gimmick until I used it at night. Unless something drastically goes wrong, I would definitely recommend this pot for the tea brewer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Worth the Cost Due to Short Life
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this kettle in 2010. That may seem like a decent life for an electric kettle, but it has been failing for years. I have to keep the cord curved in a slight half circle to get it to work and, even then, it only works sometimes. When it works, it is a great kettle. I would use this multiple times daily for tea but I can only get it to work every few days. This has been an issue for years. Since its purchase, I have made sure that I never leave water sitting in this kettle when not being used, I only use reverse osmosis water in it, and I frequently run the kettle with RO water and some vinegar in it to keep it free of mineral buildup. I only use a damp cloth to clean the outside of the kettle and it has never been submerged. The kettle has always been on my kitchen counter so it never gets bumped around or hit, nor does the cord get bent. I am the child of an Electrical Engineer so I know how to properly care for electrical appliances. For what this kettle cost, I expected a much longer, episode-free life. I called Cuisinart's Customer Service twice and was told that I have had this kettle for years and I should not expect that long of a life from an appliance. Both reps expressed surprise that it has lasted me this long, despite it's sporadic performance. Both offered me a 20% discount off a new $100 dollar version. Cuisinart's temperature variable kettle is not inexpensive. I expect more quality from a product priced as high as this kettle is. If I am only to expect a short life from a Cuisinart product, I will not make the mistake of buying another. I bought a different temperature variable electric kettle as a gift for a family member at a fraction of the price of this Cuisinart unit, the gift kettle has all the same functions and none of the performance issues. I will replace this with an inexpensive temperature variable electric kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats water for coffee as fast as a Kuerig
reviews.reviewText: Having recently switched to grinding my own beans and using a press pot, I needed a way to heat water. When researching using a French Press, this electric kettle got great reviews. While you could use a traditional kettle/pan on the stove or heat a cup of water in the microwave, the electric kettle has distinct buttons for various temperatures, most importantly (for me) the 200 degree F setting for French Press. While it holds up to 1.7 liters of water, since I only make my coffee one cup at a time, so I just put that amount in the kettle whenever I want to make a cut, which results in the short heating time. Obviously heating more water will take longer, but for my situation, the water is nearly ready to be poured by the time I can measure and grind the beans. Okay, you still have to wait 4 minutes for the coffee to steep in the press pot, but at least you aren't waiting for the water to heat before you can start the timer. Having the water heated to the perfect temp every time (along with using a scale to measure the beans before grinding) ensures that you consistently end up with the best cup of coffee possible.

We purchased one a couple years ago. It gets light use. It outlived a different brand that cost more than this one that our inlaws had. The Cuisinart is still going strong.
When my mother said they needed a new tea kettle b/c theirs was leaking, I knew what I wanted to get. Mom and Dad were hesitant as theirs was the old fashioned kind. They were concerned the alert wouldn't be loud enough and that it wouldn't keep the water hot when my father was busy doing something else.
We are now 2 months later and they don't know what they did without this. They like the multi temperature selection and "keep warm" feature. They are happy with the volume of the alert.
My father went out of his way to tell me how much he likes this kettle. This is HUGE. He is a very quiet person so when he says something you listen.
I would absolutely buy this again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp Kettle - Life Story - Continued
reviews.reviewText:
Had our CPK since May of 2012 - using it 2-4x per day without a problem - just failed today not quite 3 years old. Would give it 3.5 stars but had to commit - so only 3.

Like the kettle very much - was clear what temperature you have selected, beep to indicate temperature has been reached is fairly loud but not obnoxious. Keep warm is nice but being able to have it shut down when temp is reached is very good as well. Handle remains cool even after repeated uses (we often would boil water to use for cooking / makeup of loss when preparing food for company).

Having said that there are issues to be aware of.

Less than 3 years of use before it failed (not a statistically- significant sample size of one unit - should see how many folks have had failures and withing what length of time).

Numbers/text on the buttons is silk-screened. Numbers on the most used buttons wore off in about 1 yr. After a year or so of more of cleanings the balance of the numbers and text wore off.

When hot the lid would stick shut and required a tap in order to pop open.

Never had any other issues - looking for a new electric kettle and depending on available capacity and features may buy this one again.

== 6/1/2016 Update == Bought a replacement February 22nd 2015 - this one worked until May 25th 2016. Daily use - actually 2-3 x per day is pretty typical as we are a familiy of tea / coffee drinkers. This unit's numbers stayed on - no issues. Lid also sticky hot or cold but worked better than the predecessor. Will attempt to get warranty replacement / service but will order a replacement unit in the near term as it is now an integral part of our lives... will add to this update after trying to get service. Stay tuned...

I am writing this review exactly 7 years after my purchase. The kettle does not reach boil anymore. I tossed it in trash but I have to say that I just purchased a second one because I need the various temperatures for different teas that I drink; i.e. black tea, green tea, yerba mate, ...etc. I guess they only last 7 years. At the price of $70 each, I figured it cost me $10 a year. The positives are the size, low noise level and again the variety of temperatures. Negatives: hard to clean the inside and longevity.

reviews.reviewTitle: burns, pours badly, confusing. But only product that yields water for teas
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE on NOV 19, 2014.
2-star review upgraded to 3-star

The problem with the pour I mentioned in my original review can be somewhat mitigated by completely removing the mesh screen. This improves the pour greatly if your kettle has enough water. However, the last half pint or so of water in the kettle will still pour out in a messy, multi-stream fashion. This is due the the fixtures built into the spout to hold the mesh screen in place. This mesh screen is an example of over-engineering a solution to a little problem that ends up creating a much greater problem. It should be kept simple - like the Hamilton Beach kettle.

My makeshift fix has made this much more usable so I've upgraded the rating from 2 to 3.

-----------------------------
ORIGINAL REVIEW 2-stars

I also own this Hamilton Beach 40882E Stainless Steel 7.2-Cup Kettle:
