Edit, from the son: this thing is fine... when it works. But cuisinart’s customer service SUCKS. I had my kettle fail after about a year, and I had to pay for shipping my old kettle to Cuisinart and shipping for the new one - $30 total. It’s always been treated with care and left on the counter. The replacement lasted 2 years, but now I’m out of the warranty period because it’s based on the original purchase date. What a piece of crap.

My son bought one of these and told me, "You aren't going to like this at first because it's something else that plugs in, but after you try it you'll love it." He was right. I got to take the whistling teakettle off the stovetop and I gained a burner! Plus, its' safer -- it reaches its targeted temperature and turns off (or keeps warm, if you set it to), unlike the many teakettles I have burned up by going outside to the garden or downstairs to my office where I can't hear the whistle and forgetting it was on the stove.

I knew this was the best product in its category and went looking for the best price. This is where I found it.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the Best Purchases I Have Ever Made
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle is, by far, one of the best purchases I have ever made. Although the high price is definitely intimidating, I am joyous every time I use this kettle. I was wishing to put a tea station into my bedroom and wanted something that would quickly but efficiently heat my water. This is efficient, brews tea to just the right temperature, and is safe. For any tea lover such as myself, you know that different teas have different brewing temperatures-- both to reduce bitterness as well as fully extract the flavour from the tea leaves. This kettle does just that! As for safety features, my favourites are that you can refill the kettle with cool water even if it's still hot, auto shut off if there's not enough water, and shut off after 30 minutes of no use. Additionally, it'll maintain your water's temperature for 30 minutes.

Other features I love include:
No spill spout
Can touch bottom and handle without getting burnt
Teapot swivels on its base
Large water capacity

Although I normally see at least one con in a product, this is one case where I don't. I'm truly in love with it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Make the perfect cup of tea
reviews.reviewText:
My old stovetop kettle finally kicked the bucket (left it on too long a few times and it scorched the bottom). I decided to go with an electric kettle with programmable temperatures and this one has been everything I was looking for and more! It is very efficient and heats water faster than my old stovetop kettle with a nice 3-beep chime when done. It also has boil off protection, a 30 minute keep warm setting and sleep mode when not in use.

As avid tea drinkers we use the kettle every day and after 5 months it is still going strong. We love that it is so fast and easy to use and makes water at the perfect temperature for that perfect cup of tea! It really brings out the flavor of tea when you use the right temperature for the type of tea, ranging from a more delicate white or green tea to a stronger oolong or black tea. We also make home brewed beer and this has been a great tool for quickly heating water to the right temperature for the mash and sparging steps!

This review begins in a small stone farmhouse in the middle of France. Even on chilly mornings are friends had bountiful pots of hot tea and coffee. It was all made possible by a slightly broken plastic covered electric hot pot. The thing looked ugly but made coffee and tea in a Flash. The reason, I figured, was because all electricity in France is 240 volts giving great punch to appliances such as their hot pot. When we got home I looked up this one and ordered it. To my surprise and after careful timing, I found it made up beautiful hot water almost as quickly as the European model. And you can choose your temperature. The exact temp you need for your type of coffee or tea. And when the water gets to that temperature it maintains it. What an excellent and useful product... well worth the price.

My wife uses the kettle about twice a day. The esthetics, handle ergonomics, and temperature variability is what caused us to purchase another one after our first one failed after just 2 years of use.

The most pathetic failure (and first disappointment) was the labels vanishing on the buttons (temp) from simple finger pressing. It wasn't like we scrubbed it will a brillo pad and bleach or something. Just basic use. The next thing was the lid hinge mechanism warped to the point that it was barely functional. Finally, the kettle refused to heat water altogether.

We considering getting the more costly Breville BKE820XL offering but it was hard to swallow given the aesthetic shortcomings. Functionally speaking, not sure how I feel about the controls on the base of the kettle rather than where one's thumb could easily dial in temp on the handle. The lid hinge opens lid slowly (awesome but given what happened to the metal Cuisinart version I'm not sure how this would wear over time?). The water level on the left and right of the carafe also makes more sense. Cuisinart probably placed their water level window behind the handle as an aesthetic choice.

Here's to hoping that Cuisinart at least has solved the disappearing button labels issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: The company does not stand behind its products
reviews.reviewText:
The basics:
The kettle itself is ok. It does heat water, and it does go towards specific temperatures. I have not used a thermometer to verify the accuracy of the temps.

The bad: The issue is that, within months it developed a corrosion ring at the base of the kettle between the plastic bottom and the metal side. I called Cuisinart and they will replace the kettle, at your expense for shipping both ways. This is the warranty replacement mind you.

As a break down, that was $100 for the kettle (at time of purchase), $15 from Cuisinart for shipping, and about $20 to ship it the defective unit back to them from the east coast. If the new one were to do the same, that would be another $35 spent. I have no intention of buying a product from this company ever again. This is probably the only company that when faced with a manufacturer defect, inside the warranty window, expects the customer to pay shipping both ways.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, once you get one that works
reviews.reviewText:
Update as of 01/01/2013: I have had my replacement for a little over a month now and it is still working and I love it, though I still half expect it to not work every time I plug it in. It is fast (much faster than my stove) and I like being able to set the perfect temperature for every cup of tea. Cuisinart seems to have some production quality issues, and I am still disappointed that they don't stand behind their products better, but based on the reviews of the other kettles out there, this isn't unique to Cuisinart.

Original review: I read the reviews on the various electric kettles and between the mostly positive reviews and my satisfaction with other Cuisinart products, I made my purchase.

I loved it for the first week and a half; we used it every day. Then it just stopped working. The back-lighting for the water level comes on but none of the other lights come on and none of the buttons work. I tried to "reboot" the system by removing the kettle from the base for 5 minutes then replacing it. When that didn't work, I tried unplugging the unit and leaving it for an hour before plugging it back in. Neither worked.

I then called Cuisinart. They informed me they would be happy to replace it - but that I would be responsible for paying shipping each way. I was disappointed by this (though I had read about it in other reviews so wasn't surprised). Amazon is wonderful - they are refunding my purchase.

I do plan to place an order to replace this and give Cuisinart another chance - I do understand that there are always defects in the manufacturing process. I'll update this review after the new one also stops working, or after a reasonable amount of time of continuous functioning. (For reference, this review was written 11/12/2012.)

I have this water heater for few years and love its features: the fact that I can select the right temperature for my type of tea, it has a "stay warm" feature and auto shutoff. I can lift the kettle in the middle of the heating and when I put it back it resumes. The 360 swivel cordless connector is a life saver as I don't have to waste time in fitting the kettle in the right position on the base.
Easy to wash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Owned for 2 years - only one complaint
reviews.reviewText:
We bought this product a little over 2 years ago, and have used it nearly every day since. Here is a quick summary of our experience:
1) It is well made.
2) It heats water very quickly.
3) It holds water temperature very well.
4) Depending on how you have it set, it shuts off immediately or holds temp for 10 minutes - even if you remove it from the base.
5) Temperature is pretty accurate, regardless of setting.

If you make single cups of tea, instant coffee, or use a 1-cup coffee maker such as the Melitta or Aeropress, this kettle is perfect. I can make a single cup of coffee almost as fast as a Keurig, and in my opinion it tastes better. We loved it so much that we bought one for our son, who also drinks lots of coffee and tea.

The only complaint I have is that the lettering on the buttons began to wear off after only a few months. At this point, most of the buttons have almost none left. If you remember the functions, this isn't a problem, but I think it shouldn't happen.

I read through most of the 1-star reviews, and we did not experience ANY of the problems mentioned. We have no rust, even though we don't keep it fastidiously clean. It has performed flawlessly, except for the button wear problem I mentioned. I wonder how many of the people with problems may have possibly used it incorrectly, such as over-filling it? Since we have had no problems, I can't speak to the customer support.

If you buy based on my recommendation, I hope that you have as good an ownership experience as we have had. We would buy again, ESPECIALLY if Cuisinart managed to make the button markings more permanent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Warranties don't matter with Amazon after 30 days from purchase...
reviews.reviewText: Actually, was the second one of this model I had to buy, since the first one I bought 3 months in advance of giving it as a gift, and that one just fell apart when I was removed from the box. Yes, fell apart! Besides that, it had a big dent in the top, which caused the top not to open. Amazon wouldn't allow me to return it under warranty since you can only do that within 30 days of purchase. My only other option was to ship it to Cuisinart in California with a $15 check to cover shipping and handling. Considering the amount of grief and waste of time that would have been, I decided just to take a loss on the first one and hope that another one would be fine, which it turned out to be. Now I have the old one to use for parts in case this new one craps out...

I like the temp choices, I drink many different teas. Thenunitnheata up pretty quick. My only complaint is that the outside of the kettle gets extremely hot. It can be difficult to hold one handed when completely full and i would like to be able to place a hand on the outside when pouring.. better wear a potholder if you touch any part other than the handle.

reviews.reviewTitle: it's a nice product for the exception of couple of downsides
reviews.reviewText: Overall, it's a nice product for the exception of couple of downsides. The first downside is when unit is plugged in, it keeps warming up water every few minutes. I feel it's a downside because I don't need the water to be warmed at night when everybody sleeps. So after every usage I have to unplug it from the wall. Also, when it's plugged in, all the lights on it are always lid. It looks good, but useless. Another downside is the see through glass piece. When you pour water in it, it's really hard to see the water level inside in the room light. I always have to turn on lights in order to see the filled water level. Although, It's a nice feature when the item is plugged in because the see through glass piece gets lid and it becomes easy to see water levels. There are a few nice button features on it's handle for various temperatures such as black tea, green tea, etc. We use those quiet a lot.

I got spoiled with my Breville, that i replaced with this unit. Why didn't i get a new Breville, you may ask, because they are expensive and i was disappointed overall how quickly the beeper went on the unit and the overall breakdown of the unit over time. That said, i did discover that i really needed a keep warm feature my kettle as this one has.
The pros: variable temps for different tea types, stay warm feature that even if you pour a second cup in 15 minutes, continues to stay warm for full 30 minutes
The cons: i don't care too much for the buttons on the handle, it is hard to see where the water is unless you have a light on in the room or lift it off the base and put it back down, and the opening to put water in is somewhat narrow.

I hope it lasts.

***October 16 Update ***

I am reducing this down to 3 stars because a few weeks ago, the beep and boil shut off quit working on the black tea option. If i want it to stop boiling, i have to take it off the base. If i have it on keep warm function, it will do so, but still, i have to remove it from the base to get it to initially stop the boil process and hold temperature. I am bummed about this, less than 6 months old.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Alternative to a Tea Kettle!
reviews.reviewText: I have used this multiple times a day for a few months now. I love it, and anyone who drinks tea or uses boiled water on a daily basis this thing is amazing! It offers various buttons for different temperatures, has a blue back light, and it beeps when the water is done. I will be using it to drink tea year round. It is not the most expensive one out there, but it is the most high quality. Also, this is the best one for your body since it is made out of stainless steel. Many of the high end and inexpensive ones have plastic which is a hormone disrupter. If you can afford this one I recommend it, and I would like to remind everyone that just because you pay more money for something does not necessarily make it better! Do your research and use your common sense. I do not work for and in no way affiliated with this company, I just love the product. If this stops working in a few years, I will buy another one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted less than 4 years with daily use
reviews.reviewText:
I probably drink 5-6 cups of tea a day. Two years ago I was given the Capresso 259.03 H2O Plus Glass Water Kettle, Polished Chrome as a gift. Looked great on the counter top but stopped working after a year of use. I decided I wanted an electric kettle that would last and purchased the Cuisinart CPK-17 kettle. It was more expensive than I wanted to spend but after using it for a year now, I can say that the investment was worth it (the price is considerably less now than a year ago).

PROS:
-- heats water quickly
-- different temps (I didn't think I'd use this when I purchased it but is very handy)
-- cord management
-- minimal plastic parts (filter in spout has some plastic, nothing I'm concerned about)

CONS:
-- kettle portion is heavy (due to electronics in handle)
-- stainless hard to keep clean

=================
UPDATE: May 2014

After 3+ years of use, I needed to replace this kettle (sometimes it wouldn't heat the water, beeping randomly). After looking at the various kettles and the more current reviews of this kettle, I decided to replace it with the Adagio Teas 30 oz. utiliTEA Variable Temperature Electric Kettle. Since I purchased the Cuisinart PerfecTemp kettle when it was around $100, I wish I had gone with a different kettle three years ago.

Don’t waste your money on any other electric water kettle! We tried several and this one is BY FAR THE BEST! Sure, it’s a little pricy, but you will spend more money going through several others before spending money on this one. We have had it for going on three years now and it still works GREAT! Yes, you have to keep it cleaned per manufacturer instructions, but it is a tank!

Not only does it give all the options you need for water temperatures, it keeps the water at the temperature you select, as long as you have the “Keep Warm” feature turned on. Very easy to use and looks good on your counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK for tea water when new but kettle doesn't last for long.
reviews.reviewText:
We had a plug-in water heater for our tea water and it finally gave up. Our son has one for making coffee and it works great for them so we bought one as well but for our tea water. Glad we did since it will keep the water hot for a while and we don't have to use a thermos anymore.
Well, we have had it now for 3 years and we can't use it anymore; the inside smells oil, like the smell from oil paint and the water tastes terrible. We contacted Cuisinart, which is Conair Corp., and said they could not offer any solution, replacement or whatever but offered 20% off on a new kettle. We have decide not to buy another Cuisinart kettle since reading all the reviews and our own experience it shows the kettle may not last for long and if it fails somewhere within the warranty period we may just have to go through hoops to get some results. So we bought an Aicok kettle for half the price and it works just great.

We have barely owned this product a year and have absolutely loved it....until it just started leaking from under the handle (the seam where the handle attaches to the kettle). Every time I filled it up and set it on the heating element a puddle started forming under the thing. A big puddle. I am currently in contact with Cuisinart to see what can and will be done about this situation but kind of disappointed with this model. This is our third Cuisinart electric kettle and they have always lasted us about 10 years.

I'm a little dismayed about this product, which I bought several months ago. I love all its features and was specifically wanting a kettle that would let me choose the temperature according to the tea I choose to brew. But the problem is the unit's structure. The lid - that lifts up automatically when you push the OPEN button - stopped lifting. At first, I was able to raise it manually but then it was simply not moving. I tried all kinds of ways to get it open, but eventually gave up and requested a replacement, since the unit was still under warranty. (I'll leave out how long this took, by the way.) I paid $15 for the replacement unit, plus the cost of shipping back the broken one. When the new unit arrived, there were problems getting it to connect with its (also new) base. Sometimes it would fire up, but more often it would not. Jiggling the cord sometimes helped, but clearly it was broken. I called Cuisinart again, and they said the problem was the base and - gratis - sent a new base. Two weeks later when it arrived, I had the same problem, so clearly the issue is with the kettle, not the base. As I type this, they've agreed to replace the replacement kettle and base at no charge (as they should), so we shall see what's up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, love the multiple temp settings
reviews.reviewText: Works great, love the multiple temp settings. My wife prefers her tea hotter than hot, so she uses the boil setting. I use a French press on the weekends, and use that setting. And the 160 degree button is my choice for my morning commute coffee...the perfect temp for drinking as soon as I get in the car. Haven't had any issues with text rubbing off the buttons. Heating speed and noise is fine (not too loud, but you definitely hear it as it nears a boil). The one feature that isn't as handy as Cuisinart thought is that it automatically goes back to heating after you remove it from the bottom plate. Not a big deal, we just have to hit the "start" button when we put it back to turn the kettle off. However, we've forgotten a few times and the kettle goes back to boiling and beeping. I'd have preferred taking the extra step of clicking Start again if I want to reset the kettle to boil (very rarely), rather than having to click it every time I set it back on the stand (98% of the time). Overall, great product and I'm very satisfied.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful kettle, now if they could only make it so it doesn't break less than a year after purchase
reviews.reviewText:
I got the kettle because I don't like to have the temperature too hot when I make tea and I needed something that would automatically turn itself off as a safety feature.

When it worked, it worked perfectly and I was very happy with it. Beautiful in design and execution. Every feature I needed and then some. Good solid feel to it so it even felt good.

Unfortunately, it broke about 9 months after purchase. It's not that I was using it all that much either - maybe 2-3 times a week. That's a LOT of money for not much time. From the reviews, I'm not alone. I liked it enough to think about trying it again, even though it's very expensive. I think I can live with too hot water from my cheapy kettle that I use with my stove, at least until they put a newer version of this kettle out on the market and it gets okay reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: At least then you won't feel too bad when you need to toss it 3-4 years later
reviews.reviewText:
Two years after beginning its service life, this kettle started leaking from the bottom. For comparison, its predecessor, a $50 Braun, lasted over 7.

I've noticed the warranty is 3 years, so I called it in -- it's gonna take *11* days to receive the replacement, and in the meantime it leaks more and more every day.

I'll have to pay to ship it back, too.

In short ... get something cheaper. At least then you won't feel too bad when you need to toss it 3-4 years later.

P.S. The replacement sent by Cuisinart is worse than the original. It's been over month and the smell of plastic isn't going away.

August 2011 - What a pot! Boils water so fast. If you are a tea drinker, this is the perfect pot to boil water to the correct temperature for delicate leaves, which maximizes flavor. There are different gauges/water temperatures to press on the handle. The water can reach 175 degrees in something like 2 minutes. I can't say enough about this pot. It's attractive and easy to use. A must have for tea drinkers, or for those who want to boil water fast.

March 01, 2016 - Update - After 4 1/2 years of using at least 3x per day, this kettle finally died. I ordered another one and received it yesterday. I made 4 kettles of water before it stopped working! The buttons would light up but the water would not get hot. I have the item back in it's box to return to Amazon. I'm chalking it up to getting a lemon. Now I don't know whether to buy one more to try, or just get another brand. I was fine with the first one lasting 4 1/2 years. Interestingly, my first one cost $84 and this second one was $96, but when I went to return it today, the price went down to $85!

March 17, 2016 - Update - I decided to purchase another. The way the top opens is different than the last two. It now snaps open quickly and makes a popping noise instead of opening softly. Even the one I just returned opened softly. After close examination, the product is definitely not as well made as the first one I bought in 2011. The window to see the water level is now plastic and opaque versus the old one which was clear and looked like glass. I have decided to keep it for now and see how long it lasts. I also purchased The extra 3 year warranty for an additional $6.99. The kettle went up $4 when I finally decided to buy it ($89 was my purchase price). So even with the extra warranty it came to the same price of $96 which was the selling price early March.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Ultimate Convenience! but it won't last!!!
reviews.reviewText:
I HAVE LOWERED MY RATING FROM 5 STARS TO 2:

ORIGINAL REVIEW: I finally broke down and bought this kettle after pining after it for some time. It took my old Braun actually falling apart to get me to make the purchase. I wish I had bought this much sooner!! It is an awesome product and looks great on my counter top. It holds a large amount of water and heats it up fast to your desired temperature. I use a French press (uses 200 degree water temp), and an AeroPress (uses 175 degree water temp) to make coffee and I love that now I no longer have to use a thermometer to make sure I am using the right temperature water. I also make a variety of teas; green, oolong, herb and black. This thing is just so amazing at how it simplifies something so simple as heating water! LOL!! yeah, I know...some people think that heating water is a "no brainer" and it is. But the features on this thing make it fun and even more of a "no brainer"!! Also, I love the keep warm feature because now you can walk away and come back to the perfect temp water even if you get distracted by something. It is great when I have company because now I can have the 200 degree water ready for that second pot of French Press coffee when we want it!

UPDATE: This only lasted one year and literally fell apart. Too bad because I really did like the convenience. I suspect, based on ratings and speaking to others, that all of the electric temp control kettles on the market are pieces of garbage. I have gone back to using a good solid stovetop kettle: Circulon Contempo Teakettle 2-Quart Whistling Enamel, Black

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the cozy blue light
reviews.reviewText:
I was looking for an electric kettle and this one is.
It's bulky and heavy, but keeps a lot of hot or warm water for a very long time even after being turned off.
It's noisier when heating up, than I expected, but in a few days I got used to it.
My issue with the steam: a generous amount of steam at the end of heating cycle is a bit troublesome. There is no way around it. Since I don't want all this moisture to end up at the bottom of the hanging kitchen cabinet, I found the only open space: near the sink under the window. Now the counter looks too busy and cluttered, the window glass over it - is often misty from the steam, but I always have my hot water in a reasonable time.
I am also is still looking for the way to wipe out the traces of my fingertips all over the walls of this kettle.
I like the cozy blue light, which it emits (when on) in the dark kitchen.
I bought a fancy kettle with a temperature control in case I ever serve something different than black tea or hot water with lemon, which I drink a lot.
And the most important: I don't worry anymore about leaving a teapot on the stove.

reviews.reviewTitle: Be sure to verify the water temp on your item
reviews.reviewText:
Reading the reviews, it seems I'm not the only one who received a unit where the presets are inaccurate. Mine produces 160 degree F water for the 175, 185, and 190 settings.

Also echoing another complaint about the spout / filter. When the water is low, the filter seems to block it from flowing out smoothly, so you get a trickle and then as you increase the angle of the pour, suddenly an undirected splatter of hot water from near the lid.

The promise of preset water temps is great, and I'll give this model another shot by returning and ordering another unit. But I wanted to add one more word of caution to the potential buyer.

(I bought the Braun WK600 back when it was about a third of the price it is now, and they got the pour right. I'm considering moving back to that kettle -- it's elegant, simple, and predictable over four years of service.)

UPDATE:

My replacement unit is much closer with the presets: now instead of all of them mapping to 160degF, they each produce water about 5 degrees cooler than they claim, except for boil, which actually boils. That was close enough for me to keep this unit and just calibrate with a thermometer to know what the buttons really mean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry I misjudged you, Green Tea!
reviews.reviewText:
After buying this, my first test was to brew some green tea... a tea which has always put me off because of its bitter taste. Well, guess what? Brewed at 175F, there was NO bitterness! It was delicious, and I'm a believer! It wasn't the tea after all, it's the temperature...who knew?

It's an attractive kettle to have on the countertop - nice blue-lit controls and fill window. Easy to fill, and I like that it has the removable filter screen, since I generally use water from a Brita pitcher, and sometimes it has little bits of carbon from the filter in it, which I'd rather not have end up in my drink.

Easy to operate: just press the desired temp, then press Start.

I like that it beeps when ready - though I was a little surprised at how quiet the beep is. Easy to miss. But it's ok, because the water will be kept warm for you once it's reached the preset temperature.

If you don't need it to stay warm, then you would just press the Keep Warm button and it will turn it off. The lights will then go out to show that it's off.

My one regret is that you couldn't use this kettle to heat up water to a low temperature such as you would need to bloom yeast...90 degrees or so. If it had a digital display showing the temperature as it heats, that would be one way to do it - then you could just stop it when it got to the temperature you wanted. But it's not made for that, after all, so I can't fault it for lacking that design feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: The last water kettle you'll ever buy!
reviews.reviewText:
After our 12 year old Revere 3.5-qt. Copper-Bottom Teakettle finally died last month, I began researching the pros and cons between stove top and electric water kettles. I had never owned an electric kettle before, but they appeared to be more energy efficient, faster heating, cooler to handle, and in most cases, more customizable. I was planning to purchase the same Revere stove top kettle until I read so many reviews stating that manufacturing had been moved to China and quality suffered as a result.

The Cuisinart PerfecTemp is expensive, but after having owned and consistently used it several times a day for over a month, I can say it's worth every penny - if you are an avid tea and coffee drinker. I use the kettle to boil water (in 4 minutes) for the kids' oatmeal before school, then I make two french press pots of coffee as soon as I get home from dropping them off. My wife has an entire cabinet filled with Traditional Medicinal teas, and between the two of us, we use the kettle at least four to six times throughout the day, every day.

With individual temperature settings for Delicate, Green, White, and Oolong teas, French Press Coffee, and Black (Boil), I have noticed a HUGE difference in the flavor of each type of tea from before, when we would always just boil water in the stove top kettle until the whistle went off. The 'beep' could be louder in my opinion, but the kettle heats water so fast that it is usually ready by the time I grab a mug and decide which tea I want, so I'm rarely out of the kitchen when it goes off. And the keep warm feature is great for deciding to have a second cup ;-). The sides of the kettle do get hot during use, but the handle is cool, so you won't need a pot holder or glove like you do with some stove top kettles.

Our kitchen has been full of Cuisinart appliances for years, and although they are all generally expensive, I have no doubt that we will be using this water kettle for many years due to the solid construction and fantastic customer service we've come to expect from their products.

UPDATE 08-13-2012
After 18 months of using this water kettle multiple times a day for french press coffee, hot water for oatmeal, tea, etc, it has performed beautifully without a single problem. I love that it heats the water to 200 degrees for french press in just a few minutes, and the kettle remembers it's settings if placed back on the base in under 2 minutes if you've got it set to 'keep warm'. I still highly recommend this kettle.

This is the best tea kettle EVER! It heats water to the perfect temperature for any type of tea. So far I've mainly used it for either black tea, every day, or green tea sometimes. It really does reach the perfect brewing temperature for each type. It's a very cool looking kettle and, unless you fill it with 1.7 litres of water, it isn't heavy. Another reviewer commented on it being heavy. Glad that didn't stop me from buying it because I love it. If you fill anything with almost 1/2 gallon of liquid it's not going to be light as a feather. It heats up right away, emits a low, subtle sound when it reaches the set temperature and looks impressive on the counter. When my son saw it he said, "WOW, how much did that thing cost?" For under $80 it's a wonderful addition to my kitchen arsenal. If you're a big tea drinker, treat yourself. You only live once so why buy low end when you can have all of the bells and whistles for a relatively affordable price.

What a teapot. I especially like the variable temps that are used in different tea varieties. The first teapot that I have seen that is designed this way. Then the added feature of 'Keep Warm" is fantastic for extra cups. And the lighted background for the buttons and the reservoir give it a very contemporary look. And this pot heats up very fast, makes my old teapot seem like it is from the horse and buggy era. I'm sold, I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seven years and still going strong
reviews.reviewText: This is one of my most favorite things ever. I've had mine for seven years and use it almost every day. It works great and I love it. No issue with rust. The only issue is after about five years the beep has partially stopped working ... it beeps when finished about 25% of the time. Sometimes the beep kinda sputters, and other times is doesn't come on at all. But not a big deal because I can still still tell when it's finished by the lights.

I never write reviews, but really have to for this pot. I am an crazy tea drinker... all day, every day, and after frustration with multiple other kettles falling apart very quickly, I tried this one after a personal recommendation. I did not want an electric kettle, but am over that immediately with this product. I did not want a Keurig machine because I want to brew my tea at my strength exactly and don't want to pay the incredible extra expense involved in the cups. This heats water to exactly the temperature you want SO quickly. It holds it for 30 minutes if you want it to. The settings and are very easy to use. The one concern I had when I first saw it was how am I going to clean this out. But following manufacture instructions, whenever I want it clean, I put a little vinegar in the bottom, brought it to a boil, then bring water to a boil and dump once for a clean rinse. It works brilliantly. Practically self-cleaning. I have only owned this a few months, so I cannot speak to it's longevity, but right now if it were to fail, I love it enough I would instantly buy a new one. It is more expensive than other pots and electric kettles, but SO worth the premium.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after two uses - Do not buy.
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle broke after two uses. Do not buy.

I wiped it down with a sponge, rinsed it out, filled it, and got two cups of tea out of it before it broke. The lights go on but it does not heat water.

This is my first purchase of a Cuisinart kettle. My others worked quite well and lasted for over 3 years. This kettle has a nice array of choosing the right temperature, but most of my usage is to boil, as I make my coffee per cup. Everything works as described, but I gave it only 3 stars. The first concern is that it scales quite badly on the bottom of the kettle. So you have to use Lime-A-Way and vinegar to keep it clean almost weekly.. Even with very little scale on the bottom, it makes a lot of noise when it is boiling. I never had a kettle that scaled up so fast, and I find it to be a nuisance. Another concern is the boiling temp. I really do not believe that it reaches the 112 degree boil like it says it does, as my coffee never quite gets that cream on top from the coffee grinds. I wish they had another version of this in a shorter and a bit fatter size. I think that would cause less scaling in the bottom and probably get to the boiling heat I need. When this fails, I will not purchase another like it.

New Add On: As of today 1/21/2013 the kettle has failed after less than a year. The lights all work, but will not heat the water and automatically turns itself off. I am quite disappointed, esp. for a Cuisinart item. Will see about a refund, if they are honest about it!?!
New Add On: Cuisinart sent me a new water kettle, but it only lasted 4 days! I was told I could not return for a refund! I will NEVER buy another product like this from them again!

reviews.reviewTitle: So far, so great!! --> Update --product failure after 7 months
reviews.reviewText:
Got this about a week ago. So far, it's proven to be a tea lover's dream! We just started drinking loose tea (no comparison!!) and we're loving this machine. I didn't realize how much I didn't know about tea quality until recently when I discovered the ultimate taste is largely dependant upon the temperature at which it is brewed. The "strong" flavor I didn't care for was a result of too high heat, not steeping too long. Who knew!? Anyway, now I know, and I'm enjoying many different teas already with this amazing kettle.

It's super easy to use. It heats up very quickly. And the 30 minute keep warm feature is handy! It also looks super sleek in our kitchen.

I was a little stand offish with the price tag (about twice what we usually pay). However, I'm sold! I would definitely purchase again (although I hope I won't need to for a few years).

________________
Well, 7 months after purchase, our tea kettle stopped working. So I changed my review from a 5 to a 2. While it worked, it worked great. But while we used the kettle a lot (several times a day) I still feel that 7 months is too quick. I don't I'll spend time submitting a warranty claim over $100.00. Just doesn't seem worth the time and aggravation, but I won't repurchase this product. We love our kettles. And the temp. select was a big selling point that I will look for in our next kettle. Stainless internal components are also a must.

Back to the drawing board....

reviews.reviewTitle: Owned this for THREE Years and it still looks NEW
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this three years ago and I've used it DAILY (often several times a day) since then. We drink a lot of tea and heat up a lot of water in our household.

Now, the first one I got was in fact defective (mechanical latch failure) and I was upset, but Amazon sent me a replacement the NEXT DAY and this is the one I've had for three years. It has never failed me.

It's quite simply a rock-solid appliance that has been used thousands of times and it is well worth it.

I have been using this pot to brew coffee, for about 6 months. I use the preset of 200 degrees (French Press). It works like a champ. So good I decided to test the water temperature, with a digital prob that I have. I was pretty impressed when it stopped at 200 on the dot, with a 1 degree carry over. Only downside for this pot, is that the sides get very hot, not insulated .

Two tries with this item already.

First Purchased: March 29, 2016
Died: October 6, 2016
Second Received: November 2016
Died: January 2018

First lasted almost 6 months. Beeps and Lights flicker on and off indicating "low water warning", does not heat, despite having correct amount of water.
Returning to Amazon. Don't buy this product.

Had useless warranty from amazon and after dealing with amazon customer support and getting a run around Cuisinart sent me a second one on exchange for the previous broken one. It lasted from Roughly November 2016 to January 2018 when it started to leak through the bottom of the handle.

This product is seriously defective and Amazon warranty is worthless. Don't buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a couple years
reviews.reviewText:
It worked as advertised for 2 1/2 years. Now, it will seem to start, emit a few promising gurgles and then shut off in a few seconds.
After reading about experiences with “limited warranty,” I decided not to waste my time.
Compared to daily Starbucks, $25 dollars a year is not so much I guess, but I’m used to appliances lasting a good decade or two.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfectly good and working electric pot.
reviews.reviewText: Despite really bad ratings I like it. First, it does not smell like plastic. Second, the warning sound does work. Third, the blue light turns off, u have to press start again. Fourth, there is no rust. Fifth, it is not leaking. Sixth, it is not loud, it’s an electric pot, it’s going to make some noise. Sevenths, the price went down to 60 dollars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it. Works amazing, lots of features I utilize, 5/5 I recommend
reviews.reviewText: I did a bunch of research before I bought this.. It could be pricey because there are cheap $20 ones available. However, I have not once felt like it wasn't worth the price. I drink warm lemon water in the mornings and don't want to wait for water to cool down and I also drink different teas and the settings are perfect. I also like that it has a keep warm option, that it beeps if its on but there is no water and when it is ready. I like the way it looks and I use it multiple times a day. It boils very quickly, especially when I'm making soup or need to make spaghetti, I boil it in here THEN add it to my pot because it is so much quicker. Bottom Line... I DEFINITELY recommend this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: fantastic water heater - especially if you want specific temperatures
reviews.reviewText: I have had an older water kettle for a long time and swear by it. I got this new Cuisinart one because I drink a lot of loose leaf tea and wanted to control the temp of the water more since different teas are better in different temperatures. This water kettle is brilliant. It's quieter than my old one, and faster too. I can select which temp I want from hard boil down to something more appropriate for green tea. I use it to boil water when cooking - quick head start instead of waiting for it to boil on the stove top. I use it to boil water for tea or cocoa. It's great. It's pretty stainless steel and the blue leds are cute, nice features. It keeps the water at temp once it's done heating for up to 30 min which is great because I sometimes forget it for a few minutes. All around best water kettle I've owned and I would buy it again in a heartbeat. The only downside is that this one doesn't fit under my refrigerator's filtered water dispenser as well as the old one. It works, but I have to pay close attention or else I'm getting water all over the place. Minor detail of course.

Bought this to replace the same model which I purchased about 8 years ago and use it several times a week. The original one still works, but just lots of calcification and it sometimes makes a popping noise while boiling water. Not sure where the sound is coming from, so we decided to just replace it rather than wait for something bad to happen.

Boils water very quickly and have been reliable (the original purchase; same model).

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrific kettle still working five years on!
reviews.reviewText:
Our is almost 5 years old and still working great. The induction heater is fast, so we don't have a kettle on our gas cooktop anymore. Sometimes use it to boil water fast for pasta - dump it in the pot on the cooktop after it boils - only 1.7 liters but tests show you don't get different results with 4 quarts of water. We make tea, so the pre-set temperatures for black/green/white are helpful. Looks good on the counter. No rust.

Only faded letters are on the "open" button for the lid - guess that gets pressed the most.

I have just changed this review. This is the second Cuisinart electric kettle I purchased (exact same model) because I liked the first one so much. This new one, however, has such a low sound level for the "ready beep" that I cannot hear it most of the time even when I am in the same room. I just requested an exchange for another one which I hope works fine. By the way, the one I purchased a few years ago I can hear from the next room.

Follow up: The replacement unit was exactly the same as this one; the "ready beep" is so low it is difficult to hear. I am not sure why these newer units have such a lower volume than the first one I purchased several years earlier. I even called the manufacturer to see if there was a hidden volume control, and they said no.

I really did want to love this but was extremely disappointed by the first use. Why? It leaks from the spout!! The spout is welded to the "body", so they must have not welded it well enough. I wouldn't care so much if it didn't cost $100! For that money it should be singing me a relaxing song while boiling my water, not leaking all over!! I mean I could get one for $20 that wouldn't let out a drop. The only positive compared to a $20 model would be the variable temp. Not gonna lie, I don't know if that extra $80 is worth the variable temp. I'm probably going to send it back and possibly get a replacement. Honestly though I don't even think I want to go through the hassle of getting a replacement that is going to be defective as well.

Game changer.

I bought it over 15 months ago.

I use it all the time (2-3 times a day) and the writing hasn't faded at all. (It looks BRAND NEW.)

I'm sure if you have a large family and lots of greasy fingers hitting the buttons-- the paint will fade much sooner. But that just means it's loved!

Boils fast and keeps it at temperature for a few minutes.

This is something I've learned to take for granted until I just now realized I haven't reviewed it. Truly superb.

This thing is my favorite splurge item in my kitchen. It does a great job. LOVE the different temperature controls, love that it beeps quietly when it's done boiling, love that it keeps re-heating the water to the right temperature for a while and lets you take your time getting to it. Great capacity. It's also one of the better designs out there in that it doesn't have THAT much plastic that touches the water; it's mostly steel.

I've had it for two years and use it every day with no issues yet. Makes a good cuppa.

Bonus use: the lowest setting is great for hot water bottles. Silly side use, but my husband loves it too for that one reason.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything you need - no bells or whistles needed
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle is perfect. I have been a tea drinker for years but only recently discovered the difference temperature makes when steeping that perfect cup. I never understood why teas I purchased from my local tea house never tasted the same at home and temperature is absolutely the reason.

I looked at a lot of kettles before settling on this one. I looked at everything from 15 dollar Target brand (to replace the one I'd had for years) to the 300 dollar "it'll steep it for you!" kettles. I almost, ALMOST purchased the most expensive until I read some reviews and learned that the baskets that steep the tea have holes that are too large and let loose teas fall through. Okay then, that was out, so what to do? I could have gone with another, slightly less expensive, version but then I started thinking....

Do I really need a kettle to steep tea for me? What's so wrong with setting a timer and filling my own tea ball? The clean up is easier and the difference in price is astronomical!!!

When I found this kettle I was skeptical because there are a few negative reviews about units not working and such and water temperatures not reaching the accurate heat but in the end I didn't need to be worried. This kettle is amazingly simple to use and I have gotten so much use out of in in the last two months! My teas taste better and I've actually been able to make a dent in teas that I initially thought I didn't like! It turned out I was scalding my leaves and destroying the flavor!

I couldn't be happier with this kettle! Yes, like other reviewers said, it doesn't pour perfectly when you're down to the last few ounces of water, but it's not really that difficult to fill it up a little higher to keep it from pouring beautifully OR using a wide brimmed mug. I haven't had any problems with it splashing or doing anything than just not "looking perfect." A very minimal complaint for an overall wonderful kettle.

Highly recommend to any tea lover!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice kettle, but only lasted 4 years
reviews.reviewText: We've loved this kettle-- the fact that it holds temperature for 30 min, they multiple temp options, it's great. But today it died after 4 years of daily use. 4 years doesn't seem like very long. It stopped being able to turn off the heating element, so it will just boil continuously now. This would have been 5 stars, but now 3 for lack of durability.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great kettle. Makes tea a convenient and enjoyable alternative to coffee.
reviews.reviewText:
Love this kettle!
Stainless, solid, clean, tidy, attractive to leave out in the kitchen.
Convenient "cordless" base. Nicely oversized cord suggests the designers wanted it to draw power and boil water quickly. It does! It's quick!
Quick to boil, holds its heat, doesn't come on too often when it's keeping water at the desired temperature, so it's not wasting too much energy.
We fill it with distilled water and it stays clean.
The flavor of the water is unchanged by the kettle.
The only plastic inside is a little flap that keeps the pouring spout shut, so you're not boiling water in plastic.
Clear and easy to see how much water is left inside.
Nice buttons and digital temperature control for specific types of tea or just boiling water.
Great for cleaning with boiling water, for pre-heating the cup so your tea or coffee stays hotter, longer.
Invaluable in the kitchen, it's one of the first kitchen appliances we touch in the morning and one of the last at night.

Really like the electric teakettle, however if failed after only 4 months of use. When it was functioning however it did well. It would be nice if it was insulated and not hot to the touch on the outside (for this price point), the outside will still burn you when its hot. Has a nice beep to tell you its ready and then will hold the water at the desired temperature. Am currently asking Cuisinart for a warranty replacement, so we'll see how that goes. Only advantage over a model that costs 1/4 the price seems to be the multiple temperatures and the ability to hold the water at that temp after it beeps. If these aren't important features for you a $20 model will probably do fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: SImple way to make better tea - until it dies prematurely
reviews.reviewText:
Holiday gift for my wife - she loves this tea kettle more than much more expensive gifts. She drinks many kinds of tea, and discovered that temperature DOES make a difference. This kettle makes selecting temperature super simple - for green tea, press the "Green" button.

Update: Failed after 19 months of daily use, usually making 2-3 pots per day. Now when we turn it on, lights up as usual, nothing happens for a couple of minutes, then it emits a long, sad beep. Downgraded to 2 stars - a tea kettle this expensive should last much longer. Not sure I'll buy another.

So far, so good. After having 2 other stainless electric water heaters, I am loving the varying temps for heating the water, and especially the view window to see how much water is in the pitcher. Quick to heat, easy to clean, and overall nice looking. The water here in MN is soooo bad, that even using twice filtered water, it has marred the interior surface somewhat but far less than the other models I tried. Will see if it continues or has reached a point of retaining the finish. Very happy with the purchase.

Wow, this item is just beautiful... and it would complement the decor of any modern kitchen. It also feels really solidly built. A gorgeous piece of modern technology in the kitchen. You could stare at its beauty all day long.

Unfortunately, we ended up returning this item because of its poor pouring action. As long as there is a lot of water leftover in the kettle, it will pour your water just fine. However, if you're down to the last cup of water in the kettle, the water doesn't pour properly anymore. It starts leaking & dribbling from all edges of the spout, and you end up making a mess all over your table. We thought that the optional filter was causing this problem, so we removed the filter and the same problem happened.

You could avoid this problem by always brewing an extra cup of water in your kettle that you're not planning on pouring out into your teacup. But for us, that just seemed like a waste of water and too much energy spent on something that should be a no-brainer.

[On a completely unrelated note (and this didn't affect our review): For those wondering about the inside material of this kettle, it is MOSTLY stainless steel but there are some very tiny rubbery/plastic-y parts instead as well. I don't know the exact technical terminology for what the non-steel parts are called, but if you're concerned about plastic/rubber leaching chemicals into your hot water, it's not completely stainless steel on the inside. It's about 99% stainless steel. Although now I've been reading that even stainless steel leaches some chemicals, and that we really should only be drinking out of ceramic kettles for complete safety. Anyways, this information didn't affect our review, but I thought I would post it in case anybody was interested.]

It's 2013... and it stopped working... Guess it's heater.... I still expected that 2 years life span for $100.00 product should be at lest 3.5.... so bit disappointing. If anyone looks for 'options' ... there are there.. plenty... But this time I ended up with $20.00 (the same I'd pay for new heater for Cousineart) from Hamilton Beach just from Costco - stylish, yet plane.. with no 'bells and whistles'.. but perfectly operating fine, and elegant as well (so far - just for a few days now)...
When I got Cuisingart I payed more for what I thought would be quality product (in a sense was, just not lasting though) then for all those features - apparently the extra bugs just cover those 'options' for presets/memory rather then quality - probably all those brands of heaters from China are made this days so no more paying a lot for the same overall product!.. Frankly in Cuisineart I never used all those other bells and whistles. ... I bought more expensive back then purely for lasting and how did that look comparing to similar products...

G. luck!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great while it actually works. Then it stops.
reviews.reviewText: I've bought three of these and each time after several months it's stopped working. For 70 bucks you would think they could make one that actually had quality. They're great while they work. I just didn't expect to be on the $70/year subscription plan to get one that worked.

Finally! A kettle that accomodates my myriad teas. The interior is completely clear - no coils or objects to attract scale or entangle tea leaves. The only plastic is the the frme of the small screen on the spout. It is substatial but not overly heavy. The memory allows enough time to pour the water and return to kettle to its base before it runs out.
Tea lovers interested in the history of tea before the British "discovered" it might want to check The China History Podcast* by Lazlo Montgomery; he has a fascinating ten-part series on tea plus insights on the temperatures of tea water. (*Look on i-Tunes, Podcast Addict, or your favorite service.) Amazon carries the English language books recommended on his website.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... this kettle for a couple of days and I love it! Because I brew coffee using the pour-over ...
reviews.reviewText: I've only had this kettle for a couple of days and I love it! Because I brew coffee using the pour-over method, and because I also love tea--black, green, herbal, white, being able to program the precise temperature is extremely nice. And it heats fast! Two things. One thing I learned from another kettle years ago is to not overload my kitchen circuit with kettle AND microwave. (Had to reset at the fuse box.) And I wish the cord was just a little bit longer. I get it that Cuisinart doesn't want any of us to have an accident with a long cord, but it would help me if it was 3-4 inches longer so that I could bring the kettle out from underneath the cabinets when it's on the counter. Otherwise, this is one great kettle!!! And if I wear it out, I'll order another one!

reviews.reviewTitle: works well when it works, but glitchy
reviews.reviewText: I had high hopes for this kettle since it had gotten great reviews and I wanted a metal one, not plastic, but today is the day I'm ordering a different kettle. After a couple of months of using this, I found that when I would hit start, all of the buttons on the panel would light up and start blinking, and the only way to stop that was to keep the kettle off the base so it would reset. After six months of use, I've decided it's not worth the hassle when I'm not that picky about the temperature of my water. For coffee, all you need to do is let the water boil and then wait around 30 seconds so that it's around 200 degrees F.

I bought this little piece of awesomeness two years ago based on the reviews I had read on this particular brand/model and others. When I first bought it, the reviews spoke heavily of "beware of spark fires" or "stopped heating after a months usage". I had none of these issues. In fact, I've never been so proud in the purchase of an appliance!

You have six different settings--I only use two of them for tea, hot chocolate, and the french press. It lights up blue when it's plugged in, and also for the selection you have made. It continues to keep warm in case you don't hear the beep of completion--but does turn off after a minute (which is a nice safety feature).

I've had no issues with this cool thing. If you're looking for something that is good quality, hey, I'm a two year owner and I use it year-round!!!

I was hesitant at first since I live at altitude (over 2200 meters) and was not sure if the controls would operate properly since the boiling point of water here is between 189F and 193F due to the low atmospheric pressure. The unit will boil dry and auto shutoff if I set it to the top setting of 212F for boiled water, but it is perfect if set to the 190F setting - the water just comes to a boil then the machine goes into warming cycle. If the atmospheric pressure is a bit higher that day, then when I want water at a roiling boil I just hit the boil button and it bring the water to roiling in under a half a minute. So all in all, this is working just perfectly for me, six months so far without a hitch.

great product, but you need to watch , it gets hot from the outside, watch kids and your hands.
it is fairly noisy. I cannot hear the tv when it is on.
it rusted from inside, not sure if that's expected.
it is not easy to turn on and off, unintuitive and multi presses.
it started leaking after a while. I cannot explain why, and it happens overnight (when it is cold) rather than when you boil in it.
the warranty is useless, and i feel very disappointed. I bought a premium product, but no premium service.

This is way more kettle than I wanted to buy, but it does everything right and I use it multiple times a day. I french press my coffee and was accustomed to using a thermometer to getting the temperature correct, this pot is so accurate, it is not necessary. The keep-warm feature is dead-on and convenient during a busy morning with multiple users. It even pours well, not just average, well designed. The balance is right and the handle is comfortable. It is a little hard to get used to the lighting system to make sure it is "on" when you think it is, but I am sure I will get used to it. If I could think of any complaint it would be that when filling, it is a little hard to see the water level. If you are using a thermometer to get your water temperatures accurate , I would consider it, otherwise there must to be an alternative at half the cost.

Update: After a year of daily use this kettle performs like new. The text on the buttons is almost entirely gone however.

reviews.reviewTitle: Versitale, easy to clean, heats instantly!
reviews.reviewText:
Hotcha...quick as a wink heating, many variables, nice brushed stainless steel easy to clean,stays warm for length of time, dials are lite a soft blue, as advertised:
* 1500-watt/110-volts stainless-steel cordless electric kettle with 1-2/3-liter capacity and concealed heating element
* 6 preset heat settings for steeping tea at just the right temperature; blue LED indicator lights
* 30-minute keep warm; 2-minute memory function; 360-degree swivel power base for cordless convenience
* Blue backlit water window; removable/washable scale filter; boil-dry protection with auto safety shutoff
* Measures approximately 8-1/5 by 9-4/5 by 12 inches; 3-year limited warranty

I rather like this kettle, this was purchased to replace a cheap water kettle I have had for 4 years. I love the cordless feature and the ease of obtaining the temp needed for specific tea and french press, both of which I use almost daily. The audible feature when the temp has been achieved is very nice so you do not have to sit there and watch it. The kettle will keep it just below the temp needed, or in the case of boiling, just below boiling point.

Just an update on the kettle. It is now 3 years 9 months. It is still working great. The temp is still at the correct reading and it still looks clean and free from scratches/dings. The only thing that did not last was the markings on the various presets, but I got some of my daughters expensive finger nail polish and color coded the presets based on temp. needed for tea (white tea, green tea, oolong tea, black tea) plus french press, which is just below boiling.
Despite the loss of the preset decals, I still love this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works perfectly, but there is an odor in the water compartment
reviews.reviewText: Works perfectly. But, it arrived with a screw floating freely in the area where you put the water. I also have noticed that the inside of the water compartment has this stale, almost moldy odor after using it for a couple of weeks. Please note, I use this every single day and wash it in accordance with the instructions at least 3-4 times per week. Again, works perfectly except for the manufacturing defect of leaving a loose screw in it and the slight odor.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this thing if anyone can love an inanimate object
reviews.reviewText: I've had it for a few months and use it every day. I love this thing if anyone can love an inanimate object. The water temp selection is awesome. I tried it with green tea on the recommended setting and it did taste much better than the full boil. It's really nice looking, easy to pull off the stand and put back on. Keeps the water warm for your second cup. The blue water indicator is cool looking. At first, I wished it was on the side, but after looking at it, the indicator is great hidden behind the handle. It looks much sleeker this way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Every tea drinker needs this kettle.
reviews.reviewText:
So I've had this kettle for about close to 2 years now and there's not a single issue I've had with this. I see a lot of problems from other reviews from people having experienced and I can say I'm fortunate enough to have been blessed. After 2 years the buttons has shown no signs of wear and tare and can clearly see the text on each of them.

Maybe I should have written a review when I first bought and used it but after this long, you guys will know it works. The temperature settings are a plus, I'm an avid tea drinker and I used this kettle DAILY. Having the water reached the desired temperature is relatively quick and for the most part, quiet as well. Having the keep warm setting is really useful when you're not able to pour your water when its ready and keeps it at the temperature every couple of minutes. I've had no issue cleaning the kettle, the stainless steel makes it a bit easy for it to get a bit dirty if you're cooking around it but a few wipes here and there should clean it up. I can say for certain I've had a pleasant experience with this product and I hope you will too.

**Update 10/25/2018 The Kennel still works perfectly fine and none of the print has faded away like others have happened to theirs. No stains or mold are appearing. I use this kennel daily for tea so it has certainly been put to use.

As a tea drinker I LOVE this product. I keep my cabinet stocked with a variety of teas and it was alway difficult to get a kettle to the right temperature. With this it's super easy! My team taste even better than before. Not much time to wait either. I start the kettle as soon as I get in the kitchen and as soon as I am done prepping its heated and ready to go. The removable filter is great to if you don't have filtered water. This is now used daily in the house multiple times per day for tea, coffee, and hit chocolate!

reviews.reviewTitle: First impressions of this kettle are very good. Nice size
reviews.reviewText:
Update as of 10/22/18: Originally I gave this kettle 5 stars. I was using it daily for tea and loved it. But last week it just totally died on me. The digital buttons no longer function at all and the kettle is unable to boil water. My guess is that it is an electrical issue. I am in communication with Cuisinart about getting a replacement as the item is still under warranty but the company's communication is very slow.

First impressions of this kettle are very good. Nice size, easy to work, boiled water in about 5 minutes... looking forward to making many more cups of tea with this kettle!

I have had electric kettles for many years as we use a French press daily! My last kettle had done about 5yrs and was noisy slow and I had had enough- so ran through the options reviews and sites - kept coming back to this one - not the price I wanted of course but it always comes down to ... You get what you pay for..... So opted for this one hoping for along meaning ful relationship and good hot coffee! And the odd cup
Of tea... But we have been very impressed it's fast it holds lots of water fills up my huge French press with hot water - the kettle hassle special button just for French press so I was sold and it works - the other buttons to help steep your teas at appropriate temps are also impressive - so I am hoping for along and meaningful relationship with my quiet kettle

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and quick to heat.
reviews.reviewText: Works perfectly and doesn’t make very much noise. Heats up water for morning coffee/tea in just a few minutes. The temperature control is really nice for different beverages. Not the easiest thing to clean with such a small opening. Be prepared to clean out light mineral deposits if you have hard water in your home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad quality overpriced don’t buy. Avoid.
reviews.reviewText: Don’t buy it. The steel it made from is a very bad quality. Look at the mold like looking stains on the bottom. It’s scary to drink that water now. Impossible to get rid of it. Paint on the buttons are disappearing slowly. It doesn’t detect no water and turn on while other kettles do detect. The build quality for this price is not good. Rip off.

It worked for some time until it started to have some glitches, and then it got worse over time. The main problem is that it doesn't stop after reaching the boiling (after the beep) and keeps heating. Another thing is can turn itself on even when "Keep warm" function is disabled. Safety hazard!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it! Dependable, stylish and functional.
reviews.reviewText:
This is my second of these kettles - the first of which lasted for about four years and underwent heavy use EVERY SINGLE DAY! It never had problems with rust, and was always quick to boil the water to the selected temperature. Additionally, for a kettle with so many temperature settings I was impressed that all the buttons still worked up until the whole unit died (...although some of the numbers had worn down a little!). No electronic device is designed to last forever - least of all a kettle. Considering the amount of boiling water that passed through it I am stunned that it lasted as long as it did!

A like-for-like replacement was a no-brainer. It not only looks great but works great too. Here's to another 4 years!...

reviews.reviewTitle: It Does What it Says - Makes Water the Perfect Temperature for Varieties of Tea
reviews.reviewText:
I had no idea these things even existed until a recent trip. Where have electric tea kettles been all my life? I chose this kettle because it has variable temperature controls. I can heat water to the perfect temperature for my morning cup of Earl Gray or my afternoon pitcher of white tea. And I don't have to hover over the kettle to check the temperature. Perfection! I've had my kettle for about 7 weeks now and have not noticed the type wearing off the keys. I hope the trend continues as I've seen others post that they've had problems with that.

Added 6/11/15 - I've had this kettle about 4 months now and it's still going strong. I use it nearly every day and have not yet seen the type wearing off the keys.

Added 10/19/16 - STILL working perfectly and looking new.

It worked great for three months and then it died. It wouldn't heat the water. I soaked the interior with dilute vinegar to clean off hard water deposits from the temperature sensor and it worked for another couple of weeks and then it died again and couldn't be resuscitated. Very disappointing because I don't live in an area with unusually hard water and I only used it once a day.

Most electric kettles don't allow you to adjust the temperature. This one allows you to vary the temp so that if, for example, you're making green tea you don't steep it at too high a temperature. I also like that it turns 360 degrees on the base so it's easy to adjust the handle to where you happen to be standing. I'm very happy with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still works after 2 years, but paint on buttons has chipped off
reviews.reviewText:
I have used & enjoyed this kettle for 2 years, and it has been great to make various teas and coffees at different temperatures that suit them best. However, the kettle doesn't quite look the same anymore. Despite trying to care for it well, the paint on the buttons has worn off and it is just a jarring white underneath. The chrome color on the buttons is simply painted on with some kind of silver paint. Over the years, this paint begins to just chip slowly, especially on the largest, most-used button that turns the kettle on and off. The kettle is rather not so nice to look at anymore.

Update:

After three years, the three short beeps that the kettle makes after it finishes boiling have become significantly less audible. For such an expensive kettle, it's wearing down fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: I liked this kettle in the beginning but after 5 months ...
reviews.reviewText: I liked this kettle in the beginning but after 5 months of use, it started leaking. Our previous electric kettle was a plastic one from braun which lasted 5 years and was way cheaper. I won't be buying cuisinart again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't like leaving one star reviews but this product was a ...
reviews.reviewText: I think this may be one of just a couple reviews ive left for a product on amazon. I just want people to know that mine stopped heating after maybe a dozen uses and Cuisinart would not doing anything because it was 'purchased through amazon'. Don't like leaving one star reviews but this product was a complete waste of money. Looks nice though!

I bough two identical kettles from amazon and another website. According to other reviews knew about leakage problem. Of course, after first use one of the kettles (from amazon) started leaking, so I had to return that one. The other one is working perfectly! It is the weirdest thing ever! I kept the one from sur la table, have had it for about 6 months and loving it!

The settings are amazing! If you drink just one kind of tea, you do not need this kettle, but if you drink white, green, black and other teas, water temp really makes a difference! I love the automatic "heat up" feature even though it is not good for environment and the heat bill. It does shot off after several times of heating up to the set temperature. I like that it makes beep sound when boiled for the first time. Again, if does not leak-great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Pot heats FAST and no plastic
reviews.reviewText: OMG this thing is great! I make coffee with beans I measure on a scale by grams, and a burr grinder. Then I pile them into a french press, half fill it with the perfectly and quickly-heated 200 degree water, and Voila: a perfect cup (or two) of Java every day. Adios Starbucks. Gave these to my adult daughters that drink tea. Perfect temp setting for that too. I even heat the water for pasta in this because it's so fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pulled our old electric kettle back out of the basement and still works fine..
reviews.reviewText: Stopped heating after less than 6 months. Pulled our old electric kettle back out of the basement and still works fine... bummer since i liked the option to keep the water warm... but couldn't handle being used a few times a day.

I've been using this Electric Kettle for about a month now, almost daily. I have an Aerobie AeroPress coffee making device which recommends using 175 degree water for brewing. I don't really feel like pulling out a thermometer every time I heat water, so the feature I love most about this kettle is how easy it is to pick a temperature. Getting to 175 degrees is extremely quick, while boiling obviously takes longer, but it still much faster than using a stove-heated kettle. So far, the stainless finish looks new on the outside and besides a slight discoloration in the stainless liner from the heating element, the inside looks great too. I also love having the wireless charging base. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this kettle and I feel like it has been worth the extra cash compared to the other kettles on Amazon. If you're only using an electric kettle to boil water, I'd go with a less expensive one, but if you ever want lower temperatures on demand, this kettle is sweet.

Our last kettle of this same model lasted 5 years before it stopped heating. Aside from having boiling water at the push of a button, we replaced with the same model for several reasons:
- The different temperature settings are very convenient because I drink different kinds of teas
- The interior is steel (except for a couple small plastic components) whereas so many other kettles are completely plastic
- Nice simple modern design
I just hope this one lasts longer. These are expensive kettles and I'd hate to be replacing every 5 years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Warranty claim after 2 years-love the unit and great customer service
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this unit just over two years ago and love it. It's used multiple times throughout the day and heats just as well now as i did when it was new. The only problem I've had is the lid on the unit. It was never quite aligned properly, but worked fine until this week. I called Cuisinart and told them one side of the inner hinge had broken, which doesn't allow the lid to pop up when hitting the open button, they said it was covered under warranty and are shipping out a replacement. I will have to pay $10 shipping cost and return the old one to their center in AZ. Thankful they have the limited 3 year warranty.

We've been using this boiler steadily for 1 year. When we initially purchased it, we had a bit of buyer's remorse due to the cost. I ordered another one that was less expensive with the intent on returning this one but comparing a cheap unit next to this one really made me appreciate the better product. I ended up returning the cheap one instead. This one is used daily, sometimes twice per day, and has held up solidly. I would definitely recommend. It's much faster and easier than using a traditional kettle on the burner.

I've liked this kettle, but unfortunately after two years it stopped working. Now I get to experience Cuisinart's warranty process. On the plus side it's a 3 year warranty. Unfortunately, Cuisinart requires the customer to pay for shipping both ways.

When it works it heats quickly. It's a bit hard to see how the fill level, but I don't feel the need to be too precise so do it by feel. The stainless steel plating stays pretty clean.

So again, I was happy but am not looking forward to the return process. And, in case others have a similar problem, mine is stuck in the overheat warning mode.

P.S. -- Given the likelihood that these devices will die, I'm hoping that more modular solutions become common. GE and Frog Design showed a design concept of a plate that would power a kettle, food processor, blender, pot, etc. that seems really neat.

We've always kept a tea kettle on the stove, and finally decided to try an electric one. It's amazing how much faster the water boils in this kettle than it does on the stove. It not only has settings for different water temperatures, but the temperature buttons tell you which temp to use for different types of tea.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heating water in the microwave is really painful especially taking out the hot water before pouring
reviews.reviewText: I have to boil the water almost daily for 1) French Press Coffee 2) Oat meal. Heating water in the microwave is really painful especially taking out the hot water before pouring. Also, depending upon the quantity I have to keep checking if the water is boiling if not increase the timing. Because of the inconvenience I prefer to go to the coffee shop instead making one at home. This one not only saved time but also money. Now I buy my favorite coffee bean from a whole sale store and every morning I make a fresh coffee using french press (use a coffee filter under the press to filter out any fine particle). I also boil water to add to already cooking gravy if I want to be bit loose.

This is my 2nd pot. I had my first one for about 3 years and I used it almost everyday. I think it broke when I packed it away when I had a big party. I like that I can turn it on and leave it while doing other things around the house and not to worry about leaving my stove on. It will turn itself off after a few minutes. It has a couple of different settings to choose, which is nice if your picky about your tea. It needs very little maintenance. I take a cloth to the inside every once in awhile. The outside can look smudgy after awhile, but I just take some skinless steel cleaner and it shines up new. I would give it 5 stars if my first one didn't break. But I wouldn't let that stop you from buying it.
