reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent product for the tea lovers!
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this for a few months now, and I've had no problems at all. I saw a couple reviews saying that the ink began rubbing off of the buttons. I put a single layer of clear nail polish over the writing and that has kept them from rubbing off. I love this kettle. It makes a perfect cup of tea every time (especially green tea!). I also saw a couple of reviews saying that theirs started rusting? I find that odd. I make sure to dump the water out after each use and leave the lid open so it can dry properly.

Overall, I recommend this kettle to any tea enthusiast!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Best Tea Kettle I've ever owned
reviews.reviewText:
No doubt, I rarely review products unless they are bad. However, I woke up this morning and made my normal cup of tea after spending the holidays with family and realized how much I missed this kettle. Tea doesn't taste right if you don't heat the water to the appropriate temperature. This kettle is perfect for the tea enthusiast. I drink a lot of loose leaf ginseng oolong and there's a button for that. Or for Green, Black, White, and even French Press. I love how it reheats automatically so my next cup stays at the temperature I want. Or if I just want one cup, I can turn the KEEP WARM function off. Just darn cool.

I've had this kettle for almost 8 months and it works like the day I got it. I keep checking to see when it will get dirty but I guess my water is filtered right. I rinse it every use just to be sure.

Please keep making these so if perhaps in the future it breaks, I could buy another one. I haven't said this about a product in a long time, I highly recommend this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't waste your money on this expensive product, the base will stop heating in just a few months!
reviews.reviewText: Absolute junk after 2 or 3 months once or twice daily use! I got my first one and the base stopped heating about 3 months after....called the company and had to pay for shipping to get a replacement. It also did the exact same thing in just a couple of months. There is obviously a major flaw with the base of this machine. I don't even feel like spending anymore money to try out a third one. I always thought Cuisinart was top of the line, but now I'm wary. I should've read all the negative reviews first before purchasing....a recurring problem for many.

The kettle was bought because its stainless steel, and we avoid plastic.
We live in an environment that just about everything except surgical stainless rusts fairly quickly.
This is doing better than most, as well as any domestic apparartus we've bought at keeping its finish.

I'd mark it as follows out of 5 stars.

Overall quality ****
Appearance *****
Finish ****
Function **** (it does boil fairly quickly - but not as fast as 240 volt units for obvious reasons)
Ergonimics *****
Weight ****
Scale build up issues **** (it does build up scale, any immersion heater will - I use use vinegar to clean it - just soak overnight)

If it fails, and all appliances eventually do, I'd certainly be inclined to buy another.

Used for just about everything that requires

After my Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp 1.7-Liter Stainless Steel Cordless Electricic Kettle stopped worked after a mere 14 days, I read all of the 1 star reviews to see if I was the only one having problems. Apparently I was not.

My unit did not have the stop and start problem, the numbers did not wear off (granted I owned my less than 1 month), there was no rust problem (due to its daily use), even the lid survived for the lifetime that I used it, but my whole unit simply stopped working entirely. It would not light up or do anything when I pressed any of the buttons, it merely died. I tried a number of problem solving techniques to no avail.

I returned this product to Amazon and hopefully I will get one that works for longer than a month this time.

I expect a product that costs this much to last longer than 2 weeks! Also, it would be better if it was a little easier to clean.

I wish I would have purchased this kettle last year- it's been on my "wish list" for that long. I do love this kettle but it does have one flaw that was obvious 2 weeks in of use. Water runs down the side of the kettle when you open the top to fill it, this water collects around the base which leads to rust at the bottom rim- NOT GOOD. you need to be careful not to let water run down the side and collect at the base or you'll rust out the bottom. The water condensate on the bottom of the lid will "always" run down the side of the kettle when you open the lid unless you place your finger on the lid as you hit the "open" button, keeping the lid from popping open. open it slowly and the condensation will run back into the kettle and not the outside of the kettle.
That is the only flaw I have discovered with this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... kettle to be as described by other customers and love it. The only thing I might describe as ...
reviews.reviewText: I found this kettle to be as described by other customers and love it. The only thing I might describe as a negative is the short cord. Most models I have owned previously had much longer cords. For safety reasons cuisinart chose to go with a shorter cord (maybe one foot/30 cm). It heats the water quickly and has a handy warm feature. The spout is also large enough there is no dribble when pouring. It is also very handy to have the beep to signa when the water is heated to the desired temperature.

My husband and I are serious tea drinkers so we need a kettle that can keep up with us. This is it! We love all tea and this has settings for white/green/black/delicate and french press. Who could ask for more? Had my first one for three years until it died from overuse! On my second and very happy.

There is only one thing I use the kettle for, and that is to make Black Iced Tea in bulk. At first I thought 1.7 liters was going to be a problem, but then I realized that the amount is perfect. I make 1/2 gallon at a time using loose leaf tea, so I boil the maximum allowed level and just fill the rest of my pitcher with filtered cold water. I let the tea cool down to room temperature anyway because it is too hot to mix with ice. I'd have to use more ice to cool it down, diluting the tea which defeats the purpose. This kettle is remarkably fast and boils the tea too exactly the temperature I need, which is 212 degrees for black teas. I've read some reviews about different types of electric kettles and I found some that mentioned about the difference between plastic and stainless steel kettles. About how the plastic kettles leave a funky aftertaste after boiling the water. Now, if you're not a tea aficionado, you might not notice the difference. But I have to say that the reviews happen to be correct after experiencing it myself. I happen to have a small plastic kettle I purchased a couple of years back, and difference between that one and the Cuisinart is very noticeable. It is very important though, that you use filtered water. I mean super filtered if possible; meaning reverse osmosis and so on.

One thing I do consider to be a "con" would be how hot the kettle body gets to the touch and the difficulty on cleaning the kettle if you need to get your hand inside. But they're just minor problems. You just got to be careful and not put the kettle easily accessible to children and rinse the kettle out with warm water after use

I admit I did not buy this for tea usage or coffee usage. I bought it to heat water to do face masks and steaming. Works great. My relative uses it for tea, or used to. She felt it did its pupose. My only concern is just how is it heating the water and I am not sure how healthy that is. I do tend to question some things. I still have it so obviously I am not as concerned as I sound.

What is confusing initially is that the stop button is the same as the start button. I highly recommend that you do NOT put your face directly above the opening lid when you open it after pouring out the contents. it can get hot, the steam.

I read several reviews to find the best one for about $50 bucks. What I found was that there is one thing missing from each one out there, no matter the price. I chose this one for the price and the preset handles. The carafe does get hot. I read that in an earlier review. However the handle does not and I have not burned myself on the carafe. I really like the present settings. I am very happy with the purchase. I carry it to/from work so that I can have it with me all day. The tea I drink now is just wonderful. I am very pleased with this purchase. I have no issues with the shipping or the packaging either. Actually it was double boxed and packed very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died in one month -- just outside the Amazon return window...
reviews.reviewText:
Through no abnormal or harsh treatment from us, this died after a month of use. Amazon fought with us hard about replacing it, because it was outside the 30 day return window.

Proceed with extreme caution.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for my needs. Nice looking. Works great. Nice design.
reviews.reviewText: It is worth the price. I love it. I liked it so much I bought my mother one for her birthday. She likes to refer to herself as "technologically challenged," so getting her an electric kettle, it had to be something easy to use. She loves it. If it should die, I will be getting another one. It just works great. I love the variety of settings. It is exactly right for my tea making needs. I don't need to be able to adjust temp to an exact degree. Nicely designed product. It does beep when it is done heating, but it is not an obnoxious beep, imo. I want to take a sledge hammer to my stove timer and microwave when they beep. This beep is non-offensive to me. Great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Both Kettles Are The Same - For Coffee and Tea Lovers
reviews.reviewText:
Regarding the Cuisinart CPK-17 1.7 Liter Electric Kettle...

There are two models shown on Amazon.com, but they are both actually the exact same electric kettle.
It's a 1.7 Liter kettle, with multiple temperature settings.
It indicates that the water has reached the desired setting with a series of 3 beeps. This cannot be changed so that it's silent.
It's construction feels durable and high quality.
The temperature buttons in degrees are: 160, 175, 185, 190, 200, Boil. The buttons each have respective beverage types on them; Delicate, Green, White, Oolong, French Press, Black.
For Aeropress made coffee, perfect 175 degree water can be made with ease.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice design, looks good on counter
reviews.reviewText: I have used this multiple times per day for several months to make French Press coffee and tea. Temperature setting very convenient for brewing coffee and tea at optimum temperatures. Also use to quickly boil water for pasta. Nice design, looks good on counter. I used to have Breville SK500XL Ikon Cordless 1.7-Liter Stainless-Steel Electric Kettle, which I loved, but it broke without warning after warranty expired. I then bought replacement Breville SK500XL, which broke this time within warranty period, so I got another replacement, which broke and was replaced under warranty again, worked for a couple of years and broke again, so I switched to this Cuisinart (which has the temperature control which Breville SK500XL did not have and is similar price). No problems so far!

Disclosure--I am not much of a tea drinker, but I married one.

Our kitchen has more kinds of tea than seem possible and a good kettle is essential. This kettle is quite good, maybe excellent, maybe the acme of kettles. Then it broke. The carcass went back and a new one arrived. The warranty is different is different states, but our kettle was in service daily for more than a year.

Observation-All of these kettles seem to be China made. Fellow tea fanatics and we have owned a number of them. Many of the failures are mechanical, rivets, plastic, hinges etc. These are the very parts that should not break. I suspect that it is all due to wanting the lowest cost of manufacture, but this kind of failure seems more common than it should be.

I love this electric kettle! One of the best purchases I've made recently.

The kettle is very well made, with all the controls located as convenient buttons on the handle. It heats water much more quickly than putting a tea kettle on my gas range. Even better than the speed is the temperature control - I mostly have mine set to 200 degrees (a bit less than boiling), and I find it the perfect temperature for french press coffee. The resulting coffee is noticeably less bitter than when using boiling water. Once the water is at the temperature you select, the kettle holds that temperature for 30 minutes, and then shuts off.

I basically couldn't be more pleased; I'm not sure what else I could even ask for in a kettle. I've been using it more than daily for a couple of months now, without a single problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very pretty and does the job
reviews.reviewText: Just used it for the first time today. My husband loves teas and always used the keurig for hot water before. This is such an upgrade. We felt so fancy using this tonight having our tea after dinner. So far just love it and looks so nice on our countertop.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be 5 stars but the lid broke
reviews.reviewText: I would easily give 5 stars but my lid broke after about 15 uses. That seems ridiculous to me. I love that you can set the water temp and it will continue to keep it that temp. I use it to heat my water for my french press so I know it's at the desired temp for the coffee and won't burn it. The lid breaking is just annoying.

Loved it while it worked, but it didn't last long. After just one year, it stopped working suddenly and only the boil function worked. After 2 years, it just completely died. Definitely overpriced for something with such a short life!

reviews.reviewTitle: after about a month of use, I'm liking this ...
reviews.reviewText: after about a month of use, I'm liking this; it's fast and works as advertised. my only material complaint is it's kind of cumbersome to fill--the opening is kind of small, the lid does not come off (it pops up at less than a 90 degree angle), and there's some kind of splash guard inside the mouth that can cause the water to splash out when you fill it. it's basically awkward to hold under a standard sink faucet. another nit is that you have to pick one of the predefined temperatures; you can't set a temp you want, however the ones they provide cover every kind of hot beverage i am familiar with. however these are nits and do not stop me from recommending this for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, very functional, fast-working electric kettle.

Because this is an induction heater, it's considered ok to have at work. This means I can make several glassed of tea and coffee each day at my desk. Water heats quickly, and the temp control is useful to select the right temp for different teas. Only complaint is it's a bit noisy toward the end of the cycle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 5 months... but then magically "healed"
reviews.reviewText:
Yes, all negative reviews are right, it gets hot (wasn't an issue for me, just lift it by the handle which stays cool), after about 3 months of once-a-day usage is started to take almost twice as long to boil water. Water boils for 3-5 minutes before it shuts off and sometimes I would just turn it off manually... finally after 5 months one morning it stops working at all... nothing works except for the pretty blue light. POS

Update:
OK, must give it some credit.... for some weird reason it fixed itself 2 weeks later. I kept unplugging it and pushing all the buttons and after 5 minutes of "making love" to it it started to work again. All buttons work but it still takes a long time to switch off.... water would be boiling for 5 minutes and most of times I would lose patience and just turn it off manually.

reviews.reviewTitle: which is rather annoying because the default is 'keep warm' setting so if ...
reviews.reviewText:
Considering the price of this kettle I would hope that:
1 - the writing does not rub off of the labels so you can't see the temperature settings;
2 - cuisineart would respond to their customer service!

I drink about 10 different varieties of tea so this kettle is a life saver with the different temps and it works very well. The keep warm function does not have a time cut off so if you boil the kettle and leave the house it will still be keeping warm when you get back (provided it still has water), which is rather annoying because the default is 'keep warm' setting so if you unplug it, everytime you plug it back in it defaults back to 'keep warm'

Aside from these points though, it is an excellent and stylish kettle.

This kettle lets me brew perfect tea every time with the easy to use temperature control. The preset temperatures are more than enough to correctly brew all of my green teas, delicate senchas, pu'ehrs, oolongs and black teas. I use it 3-5 times every day with no issue. I'd strongly recommend this kettle to anyone regularly drinking loose leaf tea.

Modern and interesting. I really liked the idea of fixed temperature settings for different drinks, and it really works. I used the delicate setting for one of my fruit teas, and you wouldn't believe the difference that it makes. However, it's a little intuitive. I wouldn't recommend it if you have frequent guests who'll be using it. The first time I tried, I put the kettle back on the stand once I'd poured, and it started to boil again! This rather freaked me out, as I like to use the minimum whenever possible, for one cup.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great results and very easy to use!
reviews.reviewText:
I Purchased this a month ago to replace a kettle we heated on our gas cook top. First I must admit that I am picky about my coffee or tea when I drink that. With the kettle I often used an instant read thermometer to check for the perfect water temperature (195-+- degrees). It was a pain to use the thermometer all the time so I also learned to identify the sound of the heating water when it reached my desired temperature.

This Cuisinart unit is so easy to use, for coffee I push the 200 button then start get my cup and grind the beans and a couple of minutes later I have a fresh cup! I cannot imagine going back to heating a kettle of water or another pot that does not have preset buttons for every possibility.

This is one of the better tea kettles available. The spring mechanism on the lid that breaks often on other models feels solid and the craftsmanship is great, except for the single part with the most wear and tear - the connection between the base and kettle. The conductor on the bottom of the kettle is a small metal strip that will get bent easily in time (only took 3 days for ours).

Using a tougher conductor would have made this a 5 star product but the manufacturer cut corners like so many often do.

Edit: Changed from 2 to 1 star. Replacement model went bad within a year - would not heat water despite turning on. Manufacturer wants cost of shipping + $10 for some miscellaneous warranty fee. What a joke.

I replaced my much-loved (plastic) electric kettle with the Cuisinart brand. I wanted stainless steel this time, something to last a long time. I am very pleased with it: water heats in half the time of my former one, it signals when the water is ready, it has the water level gauge which is lit with a cobalt blue light (very cool), and has several settings for different kinds of tea (we use ours for water only). My two-and-half minor complaints are that the signal is so quiet that I have to be standing next to it to hear and the kettle is rather heavy (compared to my old plastic version). I have an elderly mother and she has some difficulty lifting it. The upside to the heaviness is that I'm confident this product is very sturdy and built well. It was quite expensive for a water kettle.

Those are my up-and-down views on the Cuisinart Electric Kettle. I'm very happy with my purchase.

This is a great kettle if you like to geek out over your beverages at all. I got one because my AeroPress coffee maker specifies below-boiling water temperatures and I have come to believe that this really makes a better-tasting coffee. I like most that in the morning I can start the kettle before I shower, and the "keep warm" feature keeps my water close to the 185 degrees that I want until I'm done in the bathroom.

Super easy to use.
The buttons select 6 different temperature settings. from 160F to full boil.
I use an Aeropress for coffee and the 175 is right near the perfect range recommended by the Aeropress manufacturer.
The kettle does heat with in a degree or two of the desired selection.
element is inside the bottom of the carafe, so the insides are smooth and easy to clean.
Makes my morning coffee less of a science project with timers and temperature probes. Now start and go, selected temperature will keep unless changes by someone else in the house who seems to want to make black tea and have boiling water for it!
Buttons light up and easy to read in the dark.

Worked great for 18 months. Then broke. After a couple steps, I was given the Cuisinart support number 800-726-0190. Called with serial number, which they said was covered under limited warrantee. No questions asked about when I purchased. Because is was a "limited" warrantee, they said that I would have to pay shipping. But, after I complained, they offered to pay shipping from their end. After I gave my address, they said that California and some other states have additional terms. So, they would pay for shipping from my side as well.

Perhaps Cuisinart has corrected the design flaw on later versions. Time will tell.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice product if you're not in a hurry.
reviews.reviewText: It works well but takes a very long time to boil water. It shows 1500 W power but I doubt that it's much over a 1000 W. The reason I bought it wad to be able to boil a couple cups of water quickly and I was very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the way it boils water in minutes
reviews.reviewText:
I like the way it boils water in minutes. No waiting around and heating up the stove top. You can clearly see the water level and after awhile you learn how much water you need for your different tea pots or pans. The blue light is nice too. My only issue is that the little beep when its ready is not very loud. But the water keeps the temperature just right when you think about it in 5 minutes. A lot better than forgetting it on the stove.
Worth the price.

Received this kettle today. I bought it to replace a Braun WK600 Impressions 7-Cup Electric Kettle, which I have had since 2007. Frankly the Braun is an extremely difficult act to follow. It was simple and straight forward to use, boiled water very quickly and was robust. This Cuisinart seems light and quite flimsy by comparison and takes much longer to heat water to boiling. All the settings and colored lights should be impressive, but in use seem to be designed to get more style points than utility. Unfortunately Braun made the incomprehensible decision to not market their electric kettles in versions that run on 110 volts in the USA or I would certainly have bought one of theirs. While the Cuisinart works I am disappointed.

Works great when it works. Stopped working after 8 months. It looks nice, easy to use, I button settings are great for specific heat temperature that one needs and keeps it at that temperature until turned off or timeout. Purchased last november, stopped working last week. Lights are on, but heating element does not kick in. I really liked this product, how disappointing!

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed after barely a year of use.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased here in April 2014. As of June 2015 it's gone haywire-it'll still work, when it works, but more frequently strange electronic glitches occur. It'll beep frantically all the time for no reason, or all the lights/options will blink disallowing selecting a water setting or responding, rendering it unusable. A piece of junk-very expensive junk, if you ask me. Barely a year of use isn't acceptable for the price and/or from this supposedly top manufacturer. Fail.

reviews.reviewTitle: After a year of service it made anaudible pop, shot smoke and died.
reviews.reviewText: After using this unit for one year it suddenly made a loud popping sound, and shot black smoke out of the bottom of the pot. I turned the unit off immediately, but it kept smoking for about 30 seconds. Stuff like this does not make you feel confident about a product at all!

Have had my kettle in daily use for about four weeks now. I love the ease of setting the temperature and walking away without having to monitor too closely. In addition to beverages, I also find it boils water much quicker than a pot on my gas stove, so I've learned to save cooking time by bringing a kettle full of water to a boil and then pouring it into a pan on the stove to speed meal prep time for pasta, potatoes, etc...

Temperature accuracy was compared against a digital instant-read thermometer (Thermapen) and found to be within three degrees at every setting. No complaints on performance at all.

The only aspect that keeps me from being absolutely thrilled was the price I paid. Some less expensive (though less capable) alternatives exist, and I'm not completely confident that this hits a sweet spot on the value curve.

I bought this kettle a couple months ago after a lot of research. I appreciated the thoughtful reviews on this and the Breville and decided this was the better choice. I like it so much I bought another one for my office. I drink French press coffee as well as a lot of different teas. It's amazing what a difference the proper temperature makes.
The small footprint is great if you have limited counter space, and I like having the controls on the handle where they are easy to reach. It also looks good. Both of my kettles work perfectly and I have no complaints. It's not important, but the one thing I find puzzling is that the level markings are in liters instead of ounces.
It is troubling to hear that others have experienced problems with this product, but there are always a few lemons out there. I have many Cuisinart products and have had great results with all of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Should last a lifetime, does not.
reviews.reviewText: Loved it while it worked but even though mine lasted longer than many of the other reviewers (01/08/2012 - 12/26/2017) I just can't justify the price of this appliance for such a short life. Everything about the build quality on this kettle seems like it should last a lifetime but of course the computer inside it is now suddenly broken rendering the entire thing useless.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thought it would last longer than 4 years
reviews.reviewText:
Well, Cusinart, it's up to you now. Thing just blinks and won't boil water anymore. Will someone please contact me from customer support?

Funny but all the decals on my buttons never wore off, but now I have a giant paperweight!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a year and two months
reviews.reviewText: We bought this unit in June of 2014, We have really liked it, we use it to brew a lot of coffee and some tea. It has been perfect for heating water to 200F for coffee brewed in the Chemex, Clever Dripper or french press. My wife uses it for heating water for her tea. But the problem: a few weeks ago it started shutting off before the water was hot. We decided the "keep warm" feature was the problem and disengaged that button. The unit worked fine for a few weeks, but now it will not heat water at all to any temperature. So we were very happy for over a year of almost everyday use, but now we feel that for the price, we should have more than a little over a year of service from it.I really don't know if it is worth sending off to have it repaired.

I can't add much more to the positive reviews here. We have a gas stove and got tired of all the issues with kettles on it (you could forget that they were there, they'd get too hot to touch, the eventual discoloration, etc.). We decided to use this after seeing it used at a nice hotel we visited. It's been wonderful! Heats fast and gives us the perfect temperature for our drinks. My wife enjoys tea; I enjoy french press coffee. We're set with the right temp and get better brews as a result. I couldn't be happier. We've had it for a year now with no issues. Oh, it looks nice in our kitchen too.

Update for 2013 (a year and a half later):
It continues to work very well. We have given it as a gift too. I would happily buy again. Only con so far is that the buttons have faded somewhat. It doesn't affect performance; and we know the buttons by heart at this point....

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful for tea and coffee drinkers!
reviews.reviewText: I'm a big tea and coffee drinker so when my stove-top kettle broke I looked into temperature specific electric kettles. I am VERY happy with this product. White tea, green tea, and French pressed coffee tastes WAY better when I use the specific temperature buttons on this electric kettle rather than basic boiled water from the stovetop. Beautiful design, tucks away nicely on the counter (doesn't require a lot of counter space), beautiful lights, tap the "start" button when you're done and it'll turn off, no need to keep it on all the time. The sides of the kettle get very hot (just like any other kettle does) so be careful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Look no further. Best and smartest kettle for the money.
reviews.reviewText: Love this well designed kettle. Could not be easier to use. I timed our gas range and kettle with this electric kettle. One quart of water on gas range took 9 minutes. This electric kettle took less than 5 minutes. Plus you get lots of nice features such as kettle turns off when reaches desired temp. Electric kettle has a warm setting, and 6 temp settings from white tea to boiling temp.. For the money, it's the best at everything!!!

This is a good electric kettle. However, it is not the best-ever electric kettle. I lived in England for a long time so have had several excellent electric kettles. This is also my second model of the Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp because the first one did stop working within three weeks. However, customer service was good and agreed to send out a replacement which arrived very promptly and has been working every day for over a year. I use mine to make white, green, oolong, black and herbal teas at least twice a day.
You do have to read the instructions carefully at the start to figure out how to turn it off/not leave it on the 'warm' function or how to use the temperature memory function, but after you are used to it you don't think twice.

Pros:
-Looks good, stylish
-Love the blue light
-Not heavy when full with water
-Takes a decent amount of water at a time
-Heats the water pretty quickly
-Metal not plastic
-Enclosed heating element so you do not have to
deal with cleaning the element
-Heats it to close to the temperature you choose
-Great customer service from Cuisinart

Cons:
-My first unit failed and I had to pay a moderate amount to receive the second replacement unit
-The water temperatures listed seem a little high, I have to use "oolong" setting for green tea as the "green tea" setting is a bit too hot.
-Somewhat pricey, I really feel it should be cheaper.

I have found that the boil function is super-hot. The outside of the unit also remains hot so not suitable for those with young children.
As there are not that many models of temperature-selection electric kettles on the US market I still gave this four stars because I use it every day and can adjust the heat of the water better than if I had a regular electric kettle and had to wait for the water to cool down. It dresses up the kitchen and is pretty easy to keep clean and in good condition. I just hope it lasts!

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely love it - will update if I have any issues
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love it - will update if I have any issues. I use it for French Press Coffee (200deg) and Teas that require lower temps as well. Fits 1.7L which is exactly enough when full to make a 2QT dispenser full of tea for iced tea. I make sure to dump it out and leave the lid open a bit after boiling to try and keep it dry to prevent rust.

Heats fairly quickly, holds a lot of water which makes it heavy to try to lift with one hand. Outside of pot wall also gets very hot so use a hot pad if you need a second hand to lift and pour. Keeps water at temp for 30 minutes. An hour would work better for me but I just turn it on again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money, too many flaws.
reviews.reviewText:
We've had this kettle for about a year now. The idea of controlling the water temperature is great if you like to drink different teas. However there are too many things that are a problem here for the price point in my opinion...

First of all there is too much plastic in the product that actually is in contact with water.
The opening for the lid is way too narrow, making it very difficult to clean and if you have big arms forget it, you'll get stuck!
The lid doesn't open all the way after 4 month or so.
The lettering on the buttons fade with-in about 6 month so you can't even tell what button is for what temperature/setting unless you remember it.
Auto shut-off feature is horrible, the water boils for about 30-50 seconds after it comes to a full boil, it just keeps going and going before it shuts off, often times you'd have to shut it down yourself.
It's not bad, but we've expected much better performance and quality for the price.

I drink a variety of teas and coffees that I make by the cup and that all brew best at different temperatures, so having a kettle like this sounded like just the thing for me.

After using it for a few months I'd say it's mostly OK. According to my measurements the temperatures are reasonably accurate for a consumer device (within a few degrees of what the button says). the top no longer flips fully open. The labels have worn off the buttons I use most often, so now I just have to remember what they used to say. This should not happen on a $100 product.

And the user interface is wrong: You should be able to just press the button of the temp you want and have it start heating up, but no -- you have to first press the desired temp button then press the Start button. On the other hand if you press the Start button first it will start heating up to the temp you last used, which is fine if you always use the same temp, but I don't -- and I thought the point of this was to easily be able to bounce around between different temps for different beverages. Oh well.

If this kettle lasts many years before needing to be replaced I'll feel it was worth the cost. If it doesn't then I'll wish I'd bought something else.

Excellent design. Does everything right and is carefully designed and thought out. Feels heavy and sturdy. I don't like that it brings temperature back to the setting if you remove, pour, and replace. But that is my personal quirk and not a criticism. I would like to have an option to turn off that feature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome kettle (except for the button labels)
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this kettle for an office of about 20 people, each of whom have their own favorite hot beverages. And some are very particular about how they brew their favorite teas, so the temperature controls were the main selling point for me. So far we've had the kettle about 8 months and used it daily with great results.

The only issue is that the label for each button is wearing off, and the deterioration started fairly soon after we unboxed the kettle. For example, the "Boil" button is now blank because the ink has rubbed off underneath my coworkers' thumbs. So now I have to figure out how to re-label the buttons without making this cool kettle look janky. :)

Just putting that out there for any office managers looking for a crowd-pleasing kettle. Add a label maker to your order, and you're all set.

UPDATE: It's been a couple years, and now the lid cover keeps coming off, which means the spring mechanism is uncovered and stops working. Our accountant tried repairing it, but then the spring sprang off somewhere and we had to try to make do with a spring from a pen. It was a comedy of errors. I'm psyched that it took two years for it to break like this, but it's getting a tad annoying to keep fixing. Otherwise it's still working fine and still looks good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent kettle but broke down after 4 years of daily use.
reviews.reviewText:
I have been using this kettle almost every morning since March 2014. The build quality is good and heats the water fast and efficiently.

After few years of use I started noticing rust formation on the inside at the bottom. This should not have happened if they claimed it to be a stainless steel.

The kettle stopped heating after about 4 years of use.
Fortunately I was able to repair it by replacing the internal relay which cost me $4.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best electric kettle you can find
reviews.reviewText:
update: I bought this kettle almost 6 years ago. It is still working great. I use it so much that the temperature markings have worn off one of the buttons. I've recommended this kettle to a number of friends and will continue to do so.

I absolutely love this kettle. I bought it to replace one I bought from another company quite a few years ago that was breaking. This one is built to last and works perfectly. I use the various heat settings often and the alert that it is ready is just loud enough to hear without being obnoxious.

One of the best parts about this kettle is that it is primarily steel so very little plastic. Also, the plastic that it does have is BPA-free. They are actually paying attention to this sort of thing.

We love this kettle. It has a solid build. It's easy to clean out lime deposits. It's BPA free. It heats quickly.

But the best part are the multiple temp settings. Using the right temp for green and oolong tea is critical and I always hated having to watch our old kettle to catch it before it boiled.

The stay hot feature is also great.

We paid 100 for a cuisinart coffee maker years ago, and as far as I can tell this was a better investment in terms of quality.

Note: you can turn it off by pressing the stay hot button once, and you can change from one temp setting to another by simply pressing the new temp.

It's pricy, but if you want a nice kettle that makes different teas automatically, it is worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just to update my previous review, the second kettle has stopped working after about a year.
reviews.reviewText: Just to update my previous review, the second kettle has stopped working after about a year. I was sitting in the kitchen and could here a whistling noise, when I investigated, the kettle was sitting on the base, not heating, and letting out and odd high pitch noise. I tried it a couple of times, lights on, no body home. Seems I am not the only one with this problem, Either Amazon or Cuisinart should either pull, or fix this very expensive item. I did thank Cuisinart for the CS and replacement item, not so much now.

reviews.reviewTitle: 4 years of use (2013-17) still going Strong and Beautiful!
reviews.reviewText:
After 4-years of everyday use, still going strong and beautiful!

* I drink tea everyday, and have been using this to boil the water at least 3-6 times everyday for the past 4 years.
* It is still going very strong and very chic as it used to in the first days/months of use.
* Some wear developed around the buttons that I use the most; but of course it's very normal.
* Keep warm option still works fine.

After quite some time and lots of usage this puppy is holding strong. Takes little to maintain, I only use bottled water in it to prevent buildups of any kind, does make a difference. Temp is right on point every time and takes a fraction of what it would stove top. Maintains temp w/ stay warm function. Easy to detach from /attach to base takes no effort. Buttons and everything is very sleek has a high tech feel

Love this kettle. It is my go to for hot water. Use it to make tea every morning. Water gets HOT and that is what I need for tea.
Quick to boil about 1.75L
Only complaint, the beeping tone when reaching the right temp is VERY quiet. I don't always hear it although I am in the kitchen.
I would love to have a more attention getting beep when water is ready, otherwise this is a very good product.
I have given to a newly-wed couple and they called to say they loved it but wished it had a better beep when it reached the right temp.
(Attention Cuisinart!!)

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, love it for my morning coffee.
reviews.reviewText: I love my coffee but I hate coffee brewed to death so it is a bitter mess. This thing is spot-on. Yes there are several degree variances but let's face it... this is water we're talking about here and it is impossible to be 100% accurate when you throw ambient temperature into the equation. 185 degrees for light roast coffee and 165 degrees for dark roast coffee; no bitter taste. If you don't get to it right away, no problem... as soon as the temperature dips a few degrees it fires back up for you. I couldn't be happier with this unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the kettle, terrible costumer service
reviews.reviewText: I loved it until it broke 2 years later, but that is not a problem. The problem is the cuisinart costumer service. First, it takes them a week to respond to any of your e-mails, second (under warranty 3 years) they will send you a replacement, but you have to pay them $15 to send it to you and then you have to pay to ship the broken unit to them! Which is about 25 dollars!! And third, the whole process took them almost 2 months!! After expierience like this I do not know if i buy anything from cuisinart, and I love their products! Its a shame!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Versatile for teas and coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I'm very pleased with this unit. It is used for brewing loose leaf teas and for brewing coffee in an Aeropress (much better than drip coffee!). The ability to adjust the temperature is great. I've never measured the temperature to verify accuracy, but the settings do seem to work correctly. The boil setting is definitely boiling. It is also pretty quick to heat up the water. Actual time depends on how much water, temperature of the tap water, and what setting is selected.

It has been used at least once daily (often multiple times throughout the day) since February without any issues. Mineral buildup will depend entirely on the quality of water used, and we have great tap water so we haven't had any issues with that either.

This kettle is sleek looking and very easy to use. For those who love tea, the multi-setting functionality will boil the water to different temps to match the kind of tea you're steeping. And, it'll keep it warm in case you want a 2nd cup :). I love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is by far the best kettle I've ever owned bar none
reviews.reviewText: I've used this product daily since 2013, I've purchased a total of three: one for the office (oldest), one for the home, and one for my daughter when she moved out. This is by far the best kettle I've ever owned bar none, BPA free, and convenient for both coffee (French press), and tea drinkers....to those who have reviewed and complained about breaking after 3mo's or less -the one that is the oldest is used by multiple people several times a day without any issues, to those that are complaining about black discoloration-try filtering your water it the particles in your water that are causing the discoloration...hope this helps you with your decision.

I love the different temperature settings especially for the green tea (not as hot). Only complaint I have is that the outside gets very hot. I brushed up against it on accident (sits next to our blender) and it burned my hand.

5/23/2015

After only 3 months of use, this kettle stopped working. Will not heat/boil water. Turns on, blinks and shuts itself off after about 2-3 minutes. Called Cuisinart and was told to pay $15 for a new model PLUS I'm responsible for shipping back this piece of junk at my expense. $30 to replace a $90 Kettle that broke after only 3 months of use? Totally unfair! To those trying to reach out to Cuisinart, be prepared! Cuisinart customer service will try to sift the blame for their failure by demanding to know how often you de-calcified your kettle. We kept this thing clean as a whistle and took really good care of it. Shame.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice cordless teapot but energy inefficient
reviews.reviewText: Nice cordless teapot but energy inefficient and waster It needs an off button. The pot will automatically hold the temperature for up to 5 minutes after the water has boiled..Nice feature if your not around but problem if one immediately pours the water out. T It holds that temperature even if there is no water in the pot causing burning inside. If you put the pot on the counter and not back on the holder it burns the counter top. Needs and off button, I don't want to have to pull the plug, .

This is the fastest kettle I've ever used. I love how quickly it brings the water to a boil. I don't really use the "keep warm" function, but it is a nice feature to have. I also like that you can select different temperatures if you don't want a full boil. Well made.

reviews.reviewTitle: a kettle is pretty darn important in the home
reviews.reviewText: Being from U.K. a kettle is pretty darn important in the home. I did a lot of research before purchasing this as most of my friends here use a coffee machine or boil water on a stove. Neither of which I like! This gives you the option to boil water to different temperature which is important whilst making different types of teas. Also the ability to keep the water hot is nice as sometimes you aren't always able to get to make the tea immediately after it boils.

the thing about this product is you don't expect it to last so long. I can't help it to give a good review for this product. I mean I have been using it since I brought it a couple years ago. the quality of it is really good. This brand product is worth while.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the best kettle I have ever owned.
reviews.reviewText:
The Temperature settings on this thing are what sets it apart from the other kettles on the market. I thought it was a little pricey for an electric kettle when I first saw it, but after owning it for 3 months I can honestly say it's worth it. I have actually spent more on stove top kettles, and have always had a somewhat negative opinion of electric kettles. This kettle is fantastic, and now I want one for my office.

It's not all sunshine and rainbows, don't misjudge the kettles appearance, it's not insulated, the exterior gets very hot, just like any other kettle really. People have a tendency to assume it's insulated due to it's appearance, maybe my friends are stupid, but a few house guests have given little yelps when accidentally touching the body of the kettle. This is also due in part to the fact that when the kettle is full it can be quite heavy if you don't have enough of hand strength. Also the little beep it gives off when the water is at temp is almost inaudible if your playing music or even having a conversation, I guess it's preferable to it being too loud.

The cordless design is also great, construction is solid, if you care about how your coffee and tea taste, this is a must buy.

Update on 6-26-11: lately the boil setting has been reluctant to beep, it's intermittent, but sometimes it will boil away for a good two or three minutes before finally beeping. the other temperature settings work just fine, but I have been keeping a closer eye on it since I noticed the issue.

I drink tea daily, and have an assortment of teas be it white, green, black, or herbal from which to choose. The company from which I purchase the teas recommends the optimum brewing temperature for each and it does not make a lot of sense to pay for some of the worlds finest teas and then not prepare them so as to extract all the flavors and nuances proper brewing can produce. It is not analogous to taking a 20 year old Chateau Margaux from my temperature controlled wine cellar and boiling it in my tea kettle before serving, but you get the idea.
I like that you can read how much water is in the kettle, I like that it will hold the proper temperature for a few minutes after it is reached. I like that the kettle will swivel on the base so it is convenient to pick up. I like that the kettle will shut itself off if I forget. I like it that the kettle has been able to get me within 5 degrees F of all optimum temperatures I have thus far encountered.
I do not like that the kettle gets hot when the water is hot. I would like it better if I could hit all of the recommended brewing temperatures spot on.
I am enjoying my teas much more since I have started using the Cuisinart kettle.
I would recommend it to any of my friends or family trying to decide on the purchase.
Thanks to Cuisinart for making my tea drinking experience significantly more pleasant.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great design. Perfect for my needs.
reviews.reviewText: I use this in my office every day. There are several settings, making it quite useful. I use it mostly for heating water for coffee, tea and instant (microwave-I never use a microwave) soups. It even works well for the thicker soups with pasta or beans in them. I use the boiling setting, and then stir the soups well, cover them very tightly (I put something heavy on them so the cover is tight) and wait longer than the amount of time suggested on the package (example: some soups say 8 minutes in a microwave, so, instead, I will use the boiling water and let it set 13-15 minutes, covered tightly. I leave a little bit of room at top of the container to add just a bit more of hot water at the end). This product is very nice looking, sturdy and reliable. I have used it several times a day for several months and, as they say, so far so good. I would recommend this product and this vendor.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good quality - lasted 2 years and 2 months.
reviews.reviewText: First - The Kettle looks and feels like superior quality. We've used this Kettle on a daily basis for over 2 years, however, it started malfunctioning literally overnight. The Kettle is still under warranty, hopefully Cuisinart will assist with a replacement.

This is the third electric kettle we've owned and we should have spent the extra $$ and bought this one first.

Works fast, well, and has different temperature settings for different teas. Rugged and a good fit/feel.

The product is nice looking and works well. When I bought my first electric kettle I was disappointed with the time it took to get the water ready. This one isn't any different. It is hard to find times listed and if you do it will usually be for one cup. I usually heat up the maximum amount. It isn't that much, if any, faster than the stove. I do prefer it to the stove top kettle though.

Cons:
-The fill line is under the handle and hard to see when filling.
-I can't hear the ready "beep" or whatever sound it makes. My wife says she can barely hear it.

Pros:
-Looks good.
-The bottom stays cool.
-Different temperature settings.
-Stays warm so if you aren't ready exactly when the water is you aren't listening to the kettle whistling.

reviews.reviewTitle: We loved it until the top became stuck
reviews.reviewText:
We loved this product for the first few months. Preparing teas at their appropriate temperatures noticeably improves the quality. It's fast. It turns itself off. It's all steel, so it imparts no taste.

However, the top stopped opening after about 6 months. You can press the "Open" button as far as before, but now nothing happens. We can still fill it from the spout, so it's usable, but it's annoying. I'd return it if weren't outside Amazon's "return window". We'll have to contact Cuisinart to see about a replacement...

Two other minor complaints: the labels on temperature selection buttons have worn off in a couple of cases and are fading on the rest. A power switch would be nice, too: you either have to unplug it between uses or place the kettle on the counter off the base, taking up twice as much room.

I like this machine a lot for its convenience, and design. The reason I did not gave it a 5 starts is because I wish the the outside of the kettle did not get so warm. My daughter burned herself during pouring water to brew a cup of white tea, now she is terrified.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this for Coffee press & tea
reviews.reviewText:
This unit does one thing only...boil water. But the options it has makes it worth more than similar units that might be cheaper.
The three main features are, it has an automatic shut off in case you forget to shut it off because we can all be scatterbrains.
Secondly it has different temperatures for different teas, coffee, coffee press, just warm. Thirdly it is aesthetically beautiful with it's blue lights on the handle and side body. As soon as the kettle is placed on the power unit it lights up. I have had several units in the past, that were unsafe, cheap, and non functional. This unit it the Corvette of water boilers for the kitchen.

Worked fabulously for about 8 months. I contacted Cuisinart regarding the issue and would have had to pay insured / traceable shipping to and from to get it repairs or replaced. On top of the outrageous fortune I paid for the kettle to get a "lifetime" of use, add to that shipping to and from AND not having a kettle that works - I decided to just replace it with a less expensive kettle. I rarely used the different temperatures as I mostly drink black tea.

I am giving this five stars because it is hands down the best one I could find. I have had it for just a couple of months, but others I have owned started having problems after just a couple of months. My daughter has had hers for a couple of years. You can set it to several temperatures for different teas and such. You have the option of the pot maintaining it's temperature; which is a great feature. I use mine with a french press. It works super. Likely the best choice...

I was looking for a new kettle that didn't have BPA plastic that came in contact with the water. Stainless also looked much nicer than the one we had been using.

This one is pretty awesome...

Pros:
~ We LOVE the different heat settings as we drink a variety of teas and use the coffee press almost daily!
~ It heats up FAST!
~ It beeps so you know your water is ready, and the keep warm function is awesome in case you can't drop everything and get to it that second.
~ Stainless looks really nice and it has a low profile design

Cons:
~ The outside (not the handle) does get hot, but you don't touch a kettle on the stove, so this shouldn't really count as a con - use common sense!
~ The only REAL thing I can say is that we use it so much the letters on the buttons have started to wear off a little.

Overall, we dig the kettle. It's fast & does its job!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 2 years!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item in Nov. 2016, and since then it worked very well, and we were quite pleased. However, suddenly it began leaking from the handle, and that was the end of it. I reached out to the company via email, but have not have not yet gotten a response. I'll update this review to include the company's response; if they do.

reviews.reviewTitle: This really works well for heating water for my tea ...
reviews.reviewText: This really works well for heating water for my tea in the office. Since it's induction the unit doesn't get hot on the outside and I don't have to worry about the stray computer cord brushing up against it. When I set the temperature and press start it doesn't take much longer to heat up than it takes me to get the tea in the French Press and gather my cup. There are a lot of choices just to heat water and this is not the cheapest, but it works well.

Love the product except for the weight and handle. The kettle is heavy, and the handle awkward. My mother, who is older, can't lift the kettle if there is more than the minimum water content.

I wish I had purchased a different one, but as kettle it words.

reviews.reviewTitle: great electric hot water kettle - heats water to several ...
reviews.reviewText:
great electric hot water kettle - heats water to several temperature settings - settings for several types of tea and coffee. Will keep water at specific temperatures. very solid appliance and worth the price. Minor concerns is that the announcer for when the water is ready is not very loud and you need to pay attention when inputting the settings. At the beginning I thought I had set it correctly but needed to push one more button. Still very pleased.
I would recommend this product to friends.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked well for 2 years, then just died.
reviews.reviewText: We really like this kettle for heating water to a specific temperature and it served us well for two years. Then the kettle just stopped working. Flashing blue lights with no heating action. Probably the microprocessor that controls it gave up suddenly. We were not aware of any power surge as the possible cause. Sad! If it kept going, it would have been rated 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a really great kettle that heats water very precisely
reviews.reviewText:
This is a really great kettle that heats water very precisely. The keep warm function is very convenient, especially if you're like me and might walk away for a phone call when you're heating water, and then need to go through the whole heating process again if you have a different kettle.

However, at least on my version, the wall plug cord is very short-only about 1ft long - so I have to keep mine on the floor, as I use it in my office, and the cord won't reach up to my desk or my shelving :(

I have had this kettle about a year or so? And it's great! I can't believe how much I use it. I heat up water to Pre-heat the food thermos', I use it to make a hot water bath if I'm baking something that requires that, and of course I use it for making Tea! I originally bought it for tea making but I am happy to say I have turned it into a multi-tasker! I know others have commented on the quiet "beep" however I appreciate that, as I am usually up before everyone else and I wouldn't want it to be any louder! Plus if you miss the beep, it's going to go into the "stay warm" function for 30 minutes anyway so it really doesn't matter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value and we use it daily!
reviews.reviewText: We use this at least daily in my household and have for months. It's never failed us. It heats up water quickly and has all the perfect settings for our teas and french press coffee and even our brewed cocoa. It has a higher capacity than we've needed thus far, but it doesn't take up all that much space. I like that it has a non-irritating beep when it reaches its temperature and visual indicators with the buttons that light up. The keep warm setting is great when I'm doing multiple pots of coffee because I don't have to wait for the water to heat back up. This really works well and we can't imagine how we lived without it before!

Purchased this kettle in 2013. It gets one star for looks and another because it still boils water. But the numbers rubbed off in the first year and lid mechanism totally came apart. Also the water level indicator behind the handle can be hard to read because of it's location. I was hoping for better quality for the price. Very disappointing.

First , let me say I've used Russell Hobbs kettles for many years, as they lasted for many years and were known as an excellent product. However, my latest RH Kettle died after about 18 months of use for no apparent reason. It just never turned on again. After reading other reviews it seems the general opinion is that they were once great but not any more. Which sent me on a search through kettles reading numerous reviews. (thank you, all reviewers!)

So far the kettle is great! Some things I love:
a) The lid opens with a push button so it is no longer a two hand job to fill the kettle.
b) There are various settings for different kinds of tea! how great is that! These settings include temps for white and green tea, french press coffee and plain old boil. :)
c) There's an optional "keep warm" button which will keep the water at your selected temperature for 30 minutes and then turn off. I especially love this as I would leave the room, do something while waiting for the water, it would take longer than expected and I'd always be reheating the water.... (maybe why Russell Hobbs broke??)
d) It beeps when ready! Why don't they all? It's not a loud, annoying beep but if you're listening for it you will hear it.
e) The window reservoir window clearly shows (and measures) how much water you've got in the pot'
f) Yes, it heats quickly. I rarely fill the kettle to the top and the half kettle that I'm heating seems to take only a minute or two.

What I don't love and why I didn't give this 5 stars:
a) There;s nothing exceptional about the appearance of the kettle. Nothing awful, but i could have enjoyed a style with a little pizzazz.
b) Not sure if the cord is really going to wind up in the base as tight as I would like (haven't gotten to this yet).

The kettle arrived within 48 hours of being ordered. I rinsed it out, plugged it in and had tea within minutes. Such a relief to have a HOT cup of tea as I've been using a keurig which doesn't have a real hot setting.

I'm pleased with my selection and would encourage others to buy this kettle. It's not a cheap kettle but the features are great and I'm hoping it will last like the old Russell Hobbs used to.

reviews.reviewTitle: A+ recommended for the tea drinker in your family
reviews.reviewText: Purchased for my GF (now fiance) and she loved it. Seems lame, but it was a birthday gift. She has wanted one for a long time so she can enjoy her tea without using a kettle on the stove. It works fast and as described. Great for tea. Haven't tried it for french press coffee yet, but I will. She frequently tells me how much she enjoys it, so it must be good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Several Years of Combined from Two of These, No Complaints
reviews.reviewText: My wife and her family are from Eastern Europe-- they drink a LOT of tea (multiple cups per person every single day). We had one for over a year, brought it to the in-laws for an extended stay and it wasn't allowed to leave so I bought another for back home. It's overkill for us because everyone uses the "boil" setting for everything, but it works great, looks really, really nice on the counter (especially with the blue lights), and neither has given us any problems. If the features match what you need, you should be all set with one of these.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... had this for about a year now and I love it. Even though it is under 500W
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this for about a year now and I love it. Even though it is under 500W, it works much faster than a kettle on our stove (15k BTU). I like the programmable temperatures for different types of teas and the hold feature is great.
FYI, the exterior can get quite hot, so don't touch the stainless steel. I have two other friends that have had this kettle for a couple of years and they are still going strong.

This is a heavy duty electric kettle with more bells and whistles than I think an electric kettle needs. My husband has some disabilities and for him it's heavy to handle and confusing. I purchased it on high recommendations at a variety of sites and right now it's sitting, unused, since I broke out my old plastic kettle--easy to use--not so heavy. I'm trying to decide whether to return this kettle. If it were just me, I'd probably be using it. I realize that's not a glowing recommendation--and so it goes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Should have lasted more than 17 months.
reviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, $100 for an electric kettle is a lot of money. However, considering the features and brand quality it thought it would be worth every penny.
I was wrong.
Don't get me wrong, I liked/enjoyed the kettle and it served it's purpose. Plus, to be honest it was shinny and glowed blue! How cool!! But for $100 the lettering on the buttons shouldn't have worn off within 6 months and it should have lasted several years not less than 17 months.
Anyway, here I am posting a review and buying myself a kettle for Christmas.

Cuisinart Kettle RIP 07/31/11 - 12/21/12 Hey! Maybe this was my Mayan Apocalypse.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... I didn't give it one star is because I love it when it works
reviews.reviewText: The only reason I didn't give it one star is because I love it when it works. I got this kettle last week and it's only worked 3 or 4 times out of the 8 times I've tried to use it. I don't know what the problem is, I have followed the manual to the letter. When it does work, I have loved it! I have sent a letter to the seller hoping there is some thing I can do at the very least I hope it gets fixed so I can I use it. If not, I hope they replace it. I really hate to lose the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: so far so good, it's been only a month
reviews.reviewText:
the thing seems smart with resuming whatever it was supposed to do, remembering the last setting etc.
often these "smart" features get in the way, this one is ok

the previous kettle worked for a couple years IIRC, hope this does too

I like how quickly this heats up the water, the choices for temperature, and it keeps the temperature for 30 minutes after initial heating. Very convenient for a tea drinker like myself. It doesn't take up a lot of counter space, which is another huge plus. I had this kettle for about 6 years before it stopped heating. But other electric kettles lasted less, so I bought a second one.

I was nervous because there seemed to be a lot of complaints about malfunctions, but after a year of having mine, it still works great. I use it every day!
The selectable temperatures are nice, and the water level markings, and the easy plug-in. The minimal base is nicely done. The lid opens very easily.
It does get mineral deposits, but they don't get in the way of the function (truthfully, I've never really cleaned them out), and it does make a noise when it's heating up, but it's soft and nonirritating.
When it's hot, there's no way of telling so, so if you have little kids that get into your stuff you'll want to keep it out of reach while it's boiling water. You can open the lid fine and everything, but you can't actually touch the lid or the body of the boiler.
Overall, the product turned out to be great. I'm totally satisfied.
Took a lot longer to hear up than my previous two electric kettles. Big no for me was that the pot is HOT to the touch. Not ok. First time I’ve ever had a kettle with no insulation.

Now when you plug it in all the lights just blink; completely worthless. Not even going to bother with customer service since they're just going to turn around and try to charge another $30 for replacement. Well, lesson learned; never buy cuisinart again. One thing I'm learning is that it's better to buy a slightly inferior (but less expensive) product with better customer service than a better product that will die and be useless after a few months.

Convenient to use. Water comes up to temp quickly. Not sure how much electricity is used (I might not want to know). The only drawback so far is the automatic power-off - it is not adjustable, and seems to cut off a little more quickly than I would like. However, re-heat doesn't take as much time as grinding the beans for coffee, so it's not a real problem. The power cord is in the base, so the kettle is easy to pick up "free and clear". The base will move when plugging or unplugging the power cord (which I do every time I use it) - a heavier base (or something sticky on the bottom) would be nice.

Was good while it worked, now stopped heating, only beeps several times. The labels get lost after some use and finish in other places that are rubbed by hands is coming off too. Now shopping for something more reliable...

This is a really great item. I did not know if having different temperatures was important but being a tea and coffee drinker this pot just rocks! Now I don't burn my coffee by using 200 degrees and I can boil for use in black tea prep. Love the thirty minuted keep warm feature. Had this about two months now and my wife and I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use this every day for my tea
reviews.reviewText:
Use this every day for my tea. It has worked like a charm. Heats water quickly and to the right temperature for whatever type of tea you are using.

The only negative thing: The letters have worn off of start and green tea which are the buttons I use the most. I have written down a schematic so that I will know what all the buttons are in the future if I want to use something different since they are showing wear also. If not for that I would have given it a full 5 stars.

So far so good but it’s only been a few days. Enjoying the keep warm feature and varied temps. Very easy to use. Made sure to fill out the warranty due to a few negative reviews but have faith in this brand.

I've had an electric kettle for years that I use for my tea at home, but I finally decided that I'd love to have proper tea at my workplace as well. I have figured out how to gage the temperature of the water by listening to the boil, but I didn't want to have to deal with that at work, so with the temperature setting this kettle is completely worth it. The kettle is pretty tall and surprisingly heavy. It doesn't fit under the faucet as easily as I would like and the opening is smaller than I was hoping for as well (I actually use a large cup to transport the water to it, so I don't have to haul it around.) The water gage is nice, with the LED light very easy to read. The buttons are clearly marked with the temperature settings and types of tea the temperature is good for as well. While the water is being heated, for some reason this kettle sounds like a jet engine. It is LOUD. The stainless steel exterior also get extremely hot. The keep warm setting is quite nice and the pot will turn off even with this setting after 30 mins. which is nice. Overall seems like a great kettle so far, I hope it lasts as long as the last Cuisinart one I purchased!
Dead after 16 months, create only high pitch alarm noise can doesn’t boil anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent water kettle -- use it daily for 3+ years.
reviews.reviewText:
We use this cordless water kettle every day at least once. Before buying this I would put water on to boil and go back to my desk forgetting about the water. I ruined a water kettle and had too many close calls. This is fantastic in that it heats and water and has a setting to keep it hot. I can start water and get busy with something else. When I return, the water is hot. We've been using it for 3+ years and have no complaints.

It is a substantial kettle. It may not suit fragile Aunt Mildred. She has to have some arm strength to wield this kettle. Other than that she'll write you into her will.

reviews.reviewTitle: almost started to burn - looking at reviews seems like a common problem)
reviews.reviewText:
Updating: after ~1 year of usage the kettle broken down (it was no longer turning itself off, almost started to burn - looking at reviews seems like a common problem).

It took about a month to get a replacement from cuisinart. Also initially they wanted me to pay shipping for both replacement to me, and defective unit back to them. Also responses were slow (sometimes more than 2 days).

-2 stars for quality
-1 star for customer support responsiveness

reviews.reviewTitle: perfect for someone who drinks ALL of the beverages
reviews.reviewText: Love this thing! I drink a lot of tea as well as coffee (and lots of different teas at that: black, white, green, oolong) so I love that this kettle has settings for all those different things. It also has a setting for French Press, which, if you're a beverage nerd you'll know has a special temperature just below boiling that is required for the ideal cup. It would probably be overkill if all you ever drink is black tea, but for me this thing is great. I'm very happy with it, even though it takes up more of my precious counter space than a stovetop kettle would.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buttons are much more logical and I am very happy with it
reviews.reviewText: Returned it. This kettle is programmed, but NOT programmable. The buttons were confusing and it is impossible to change the default setting on the warming function so that it does not automatically stay warm. I turned it off when I started to heat the water, but then it turned itself on again when I put the kettle down after pouring. Also, it seemed very unfinished on the inside. I replaced it with a variable temp Breville I got from William Sonoma. Buttons are much more logical and I am very happy with it.
This is the best investment ever. Water heats up in seconds. I can have a lovely tea faster than boiling it on the stove. It also has a keep warm button.
I love this! Just got this but the size and design is very good, it’s easy to use, it’s fats, looks good in the kitchen, the heating options are perfect

reviews.reviewTitle: Gets the job done, but a bit dangerous and annoying.
reviews.reviewText:
The outside burned my hand! The metal gets way too hot. I thought it would be better insulated to only warm up the contents, without the exterior being burning hot as well. This is quite dangerous, as it is such a large item that you pick up to pour the water with.

Also, the blue lights are far too bright, if you intend on keeping this by your night stand.

This item is not kid friendly! Quite dangerous!

Aside from the above, this is a great item. It heats up the water quickly. I haven't run into any issues aside from my concerns above.

reviews.reviewTitle: and it allows for an easy to clean all stainless steel interior
reviews.reviewText: Been using this for a few weeks now without problem. The different temp settings come in handy since we're a green and black tea drinking fam. The keep warm setting has been a big bonus as well. One note; it's a little difficult to tell how much water you have as you're filling up since the level-indicator is delayed (water seeps into the indicator and the water level rises to the appropriate measurement after you've turned the faucet off). This is not a deal breaker, and it allows for an easy to clean all stainless steel interior. If I pour too much water in I either boil and pour out or our out right away.

Have used this now for several years and purchased one as a gift for my daughter. Nice product due to convenience and the fact that it is quite handsome for leaving on the counter full time. The main issue that is frustrating is that the print for the boiling recommendations on the handle wears off quickly and you either need to guess for the type of tea you are using or keep the manual handy. As most would do, I expect, I guess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice look and design but would be nice if the ...
reviews.reviewText: Very nice look and design but would be nice if the body didn't get hot to the touch and after pouring water and putting it back on the base it tries to boil again which can be stopped by pressing the start button, however it doesn't always work. I love the ability to heat water to different temperatures.**Update** A year later and the lid sometimes does not close properly and opens like in slow motion(sticking) so took another star off. Still going strong but dangerous as lid pops open when pouring and can scald yourself with steam.

This is my third time purchasing this over MANY years. Yes, they do eventually wear out, but this heats the water fast and does last many years. I'd buy it again the next time it wears out, maybe in five years.

My wife bought this for me for Valentine's Day. That's in two days: yes, I got it early. The reason being that I was confident that it would make our life easier, and I wanted easier right away. This kettle doesn't disappoint.

My schedule for the past few years has been to get up long before my wife, feed the kitties, putter around, and take my shower before waking her with a morning coffee. About six weeks ago, I started using a French Press for a superior product. But, the press played havoc with my schedule.

Before, the coffee maker started on a timer. Having coffee was therefore leisurely. However, the French Press requires me to boil fresh water, grind fresh beans, and wait a proscribed 4 minutes before pressing the coffee. In other words, I had 20 minutes eaten up just making coffee. It wrecked my schedule!

But this kettle is PERFECT for my schedule. When I feed the kitties, I just have to press the kettle's 200F/French Press button and Start, and the kettle will have the water ready for me when I get out of the shower. It holds the water at the perfect temperature, and I do not have to worry about the water boiling out. Making coffee is leisurely again.

I don't particularly care how fast the kettle heats the water; the unique temperature holding function is what I value. That sets this kettle apart, and is why I had it on my wish list in the first place.

We've also used the kettle to boil water for cooking recipes. A full pot takes about 4 minutes, using cold, filtered water.

I wouldn't say the "set and forget" feature is life-changing, but it is invaluable. It really is.

My husband was tired of waiting for water to boil in our traditional kettle that you put on the stove so I looked for one that would heat up quickly. This kettle is perfect! Not only does it heat up quickly, you can select what type of tea you are going to have so it heats it up to the appropriate temperature. I also use it for boiling water for oatmeal in the morning. I also love the blue backlit display, the fact that it's stainless-steel which matches our kitchen, and that it can be set to warm! Overall, this kettle is fantastic! The only thing I would change is to make it turn on in the morning at a set time, that would be amazing if it could do that!

reviews.reviewTitle: I use this 8 times a day
reviews.reviewText: I really like the different temperature settings because I live at elevation where water boils at 200 degrees. I use this for tea, Americano coffee, boiling water for pasta, heating water to warm baby bottles, etc. Love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: BEST RECENT KITCHEN APPLIANCE PURCHASE - SEE 2017 UPDATE!!!
reviews.reviewText:
01/17 Update: Well, after almost a year of use, I happened to, quite by accident, hear a dripping noise in the studio where I use this electirc brewer. At first, I thought it was due to condensation from the water I had just brewed, but after tracking dow the 1/2 inch of water in my trash can, I found that there was a steady bead, by bead, leak in the bottom of the handle. The electric base was sitting in a puddle of water and the water fortunately dripped down the line and into my waste basket before hitting the electrical socket.
