(That would have blown all of my equipment in my studio. Phew!). I have given it a three based on the fact that I have used it for a year, and didn't have any problems, but I have not been able to contact Cuisinart to see if they will still repair/replace this product. Will update again once that happens.

03/16: Best recent kitchen appliance I have purchased. After nearly burning up my kitchen with a conventional tea kettle (yeah, yeah, forgot it was on. Shout out to Max, my barking dog on the save) I purchased the CPK-17. I noticed a vast difference in the taste of the tea from the very first pot. As most have said, green tea tastes bitter, and hence they do not drink it. The green tea I've had for nearly a year now is gone, and I now know what green tea should taste like. I'm also experimenting with other brews now as well. Fast, safe, easy to use with multiple presets for the perfect cup of tea. Purchase and enjoy!

We got this several weeks ago and have been using it multiple times a day. We like the ability to set the temperature based on whether you're making coffee, or various types of tea. It also has a warmer feature, so if you walk away before it boils, it will keep reheating the water until you come back to use it.

Initially I wasn't enamoured with this kettle, but with time I've grown used to its quirks and find it just about indispensable. The most annoying part is the inability to empty the water totally without it dribbling and spurting out the sides of the spout. My tea and oatmeal don't care if they get dribbled on though, so no worries there.

It is wonderful, it holds the temperature even at the warming feature. The outside of the kettle doesn't get hot like some that I have tried in the past and it is very user friendly. Also you do not have to unplug the kettle after use as there is a off feature unlike some kettles that will turn back on if touched.

The only con is I do have to watch and make sure everything is wiped down so that water doesn't get on the bottom of the kettle.

I have wanted tea for years. No one would let me use the stove for tea. This Is The BEST tea pot Ever. Safe heats up quick very pretty and works great. I will never be without one again. Thank you
Love all the temps for different teas....I wish I had gotten one years ago.
The longer I have this electric tea pot, the more I love it. I am drinking more green Matcha TEA instead of coffee. Thank you Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible substandard rubbish. Burnt because of faulty lid.
reviews.reviewText: Absolute rubbish. This was my second Cuisinart CPK-17. The first performed fine for around 18 months, and then stopped working. As I liked the temperature settings I purchased a second one, to give it another try, This one is clearly made to a much lower (chinese) standard. And was faulty from the start. Since having this my wife (pregnant) has scolded her hand because of a faulty lid. Absolutely terrible product.
I put cold water in, hot water comes out. Sometimes it's hotter, sometimes it's not as hot. That's a feature, not a bug. Don't use to make soup because noodles get stuck inside.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great at first but then stopped working
reviews.reviewText: Arrived brand new with no damage. Loved it and so easy to use until 3 weeks later when it started to make a noise and than all of a sudden stopped working. I am able to return it for a full refund and will purchase again. Hoping this time nothing happens because I really liked it! I will update my review once I have received the new one and after I have had it for 6 months.

We purchased this kettle almost a year ago. It is used almost every day.

The kettle fits into its stand very well. The buttons all seem to be well constructed and the kettle has a nice feel to it when pouring.

The stainless finish is quite easy to clean and looks smart without being overly ostentatious like some kettles.

The keep warm function is nice although we rarely use it. Since we drink both tea and coffee, it's nice to have the variable temperatures available.

The only thing that it lacks is a timer to have water ready in the morning wen you awake, but this isn't really a huge deal breaker for us. Plus it heats itself quickly anyway.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great idea if I could get one that works...
reviews.reviewText: I'm in the process of returning my second one of these kettles. The first one arrived out of the box the open button didn't function and I couldn't get the lid open. I bought a second one and this one worked for two weeks and stopped heating the water. The buttons light up when I press them and they go off after one minute without having heated the water. This is mentioned in other reviews as well. I also noticed tonight as I was packing it up that it was starting to scale at the bottom of the kettle. This seems fast to me. My other kettle is a year old and it hasn't scaled yet.

After laughing at my mom for insisting on having a $100 kettle, my piece of garbage $25 kettle fizzled out on me. Read a lot of reviews, and if you're looking for something with an adjustable temp control, this is the only one that looked like it had staying power. I didn't need six different tea settings, but wanted something a little more accurate than low/medium/high. Other advantage is the top opens wide enough to get a brush in to scrub the inside down once in a while. Still feel like it's overpriced, but hopefully you get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heats quickly. Makes tea drinking easy
reviews.reviewText: Love all of the temperature options and how this looks. Heats so fast!!!! A little pricier than other options but worth it. Love this appliance.

Unit was DOA. Never try to contact Cuisinart for support.

The first person didn't even try to help me debug or fix the product, just asked for my credit card to pay $10 to send it back to them.

The second person I spoke to got angry at me and hung up when I tried to give her the serial number from the bottom of the kettle. I patiently explained what was wrong, but she refused to do anything to help me unless I gave her the serial number. The serial number that I gave her was apparently not what she wanted to hear and she refused to accept it.

I will update my review to include facts about the unit itself when a replacement from Amazon arrives. Assuming that, it too is not DOA

This is the best thing since slice bread except it breaks and then breaks some more. I ordered one, it worked for some months and then it quit working. When I called the Cuisinart folks were super nice and sent me a new one, but they wanted me to send the old one and pay to send the old one back. When the new one arrived, I loved it again but it lasted for some months and died too. If these wouldn't die, they would be the perfect hot water heater of their kind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Conked off after about a year of pretty light use
reviews.reviewText: Conked off after about a year of pretty light use. Expected it to work at least through the warranty period of 3 years. Will try their customer service number and see what they say. If it's going to cost me $30 to get a replacement (as other reviewers have noted) that potentially only lasts another year, it may be more cost effective to buy a cheaper product (and they do come much cheaper) at a local retail store.

Someone many years ago when building this house put in a stove with two burners. TWO BURNERS, and you'd consider yourself lucky if they were both working in the morning. We boil our water for coffee and tea and use this daily. We've had it for about a month and haven't had any issues. The only con, you have to click the temp button then the start button. I say it's a con because the humans (us) sometimes forget to hit start.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart CPK-17 review after using it for less than a year.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this kettle because it has no plastic and I could get prime shipping. Received it Mid December of 2012, it is now end of Nov. 2013. Pot has been boiling at any setting for a couple of months now, eventually shuts off but boils like crazy first. We use it a lot but everyone works all day, so when we are home it's in use pretty constantly. Looking into the 3 year warrantee, will let you know. Paid almost 100.00 for pot in 2012.

This kettle is exactly what I was looking for. I bought it for my work office but want to get another one for home. The beeping was a little louder than I expected when it is finished, but a great electric kettle. No chemical smells when opening like other kettles I purchased in the past.

reviews.reviewTitle: That says good things and bad
reviews.reviewText:
I'm on my third one now. That says good things and bad. I've needed to replace them but I still haven't seen one on the market that looks better.
Good: temperature settings are right at what I need for different teas and coffee; water level indicator is helpful; alarm settings are not too loud but loud enough; stainless steel interior
Bad: the text on the buttons wears off within weeks of use

If you've wondered why all your tea tastes a little burnt or why all your green tea tastes like grass, you need this. It makes it really easy to get the proper temperature for your beverages so you can taste the flavors. Plus, the large capacity is super nice. Would highly recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: I just love it so much.
reviews.reviewText: I love it. Every thing that is brewed taste a 1000x better. I never knew 10 degree can make in the flavor or tea or coffee. I just love it. Seems like it going to make the $7 warranty I bought worthless.
Simply Devine. Saw it on an Oprah advertisement. Keeps water warm for specific tea types. Don't have to keep heating water in a teapot via range in kitchen.

This is exactly what I was looking for! I love the different settings so you can steep your tea at just the right temperature. It's a little bulky, but looks great on the counter. My only complaint is that I wish there was a way to leave the base plugged in at all times without the lights blinking and it beeping at you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Starting to rust around the lid
reviews.reviewText: The features of this kettle work as advertised. We really like the fact that you can boil water according to the type of tea you are making. We also like the fact that the water stays boiled for a period of time. The water also boils reasonably quickly. What has been disappointing is the amount of rust that has developed around the lid. There are also deposits on the spout which we have not been able to remove. We don't know if these are hard water deposits or more rust.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fabulous kettle, and yes, those additional temperature settings are awesome.
reviews.reviewText: My partner wanted the "best" kettle on the market and while I initially scoffed at the need for variable temperature settings, it's been marvelous. We have had this kettle for a few months and use it many times each day (big tea drinkers) and it really is fabulous. I highly recommend it.

I have had this electric teapot for about 2 to 3 weeks. It is a cuisinart so I assumed it would be of great quality. I was fooled.The top has broken three times and I had to find a guy who is gadget savvy to try and fix it. Also, I have a difficult time getting the teapot to stay warm once I have poured my first cup of tea. It is nowhere near worth the price I paid for it. When I received it it had a huge smear on the stainless steel. I am still unable to get this out, after much work on it. I should return it. I am very disappointed after spending $100.00.
Karen bistrin

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart hot water kettle works well
reviews.reviewText: This Cuisinart hot water kettle was a gift and the recipient likes it a lot. They use it every day and it makes great hot water perfect for pour-over coffee, tea, soup, etc.

Got this for my boyfriend as part of his birthday gift... he drinks a lot of tea... he said it was the most thoughtful thing anyone could have given him. I love that you can select the temperature for a specific type of tea...and the keep warm feature is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Short lifespan, average to low quality
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful to have the simple settings for tea water, but this is very difficult to clean inside, and it has a sharp filter that scratches and plastic parts. The tea kettle stopped working right after the warranty ended. Very expensive for the disappointing quality and short lifespan, even at the reduced price it is now sold for. I won't be replacing this.

I really enjoyed using this kettle very much. However, it stopped working after 3.5 years. The electronic buttons on the handle no longer respond. It's been used carefully by one person over the years and the handle has never been exposed to water or mishandled.. I contacted Cusinart but they do not fix these kettles should they break. There is a 3 year warranty but I am just beyond it. I now need a new kettle but as much as I truly enjoyed using this one, I won't purchase again. I don't think it's reasonable for a product at this price point, $80.00, to not last longer than a few years. Othert than this fatal flaw, I thought the kettle was wonderful and even recommended it many times to friends and family. I did goggle DIY fixes and there were several people who replaced the electronics in the handle themselves. I wouldn't attempt it and would worry should it could be a fire hazard. I'd like to see Cuisnart improve on the quality and value of this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Second one we bought, love them both
reviews.reviewText:
Handy fact: you can turn off warming feature by pressing that button until light turns off when you turn the kettle on to boil. Handy if you don't need water kept at ready to use temp.

Really is worth the money, we use it for everything from flower tea to sterilising baby formula water.

The best water kettle I've owned. Use it pretty much daily.

Love the temperature control. I use the 165 or 175 degrees for green tea, a little hotter for black tea, and boil the water for my ginger tea.

We also bought one for my office after I tried this out at home for a while.

I love this and use it daily at work. I think it's awesome how it has the different settings for different beverages, and the view screen is really convenient to see how much water is left inside. I like that it stays warm for awhile, because I tend to set it and get wrapped in working on something before going to make my beverage. I noticed it has been getting scaly on the bottom inside like other reviewers said, but it doesn't really bother me, and it's easy to clean. Overall, its very attractive, works well, heats the water quickly, and is easy to hold and pour.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too expensive for short lived functionality!
reviews.reviewText: This is our second one. We bought this one on June 2015. The first one lasted a year... it stopped heating. The second one lasted from 6/15 to now, 2/18. In today's world this may be long, but again it's a seconds one, not long enough. This one started leaking in the plastic water level guide. We used distilled water to keep the sediment down. We're not getting a third, these should last 5 to 8 years at the price point.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great. I did a lot of research before I ...
reviews.reviewText: Great. I did a lot of research before I made this purchase. This was consistently highly rated - and deservedly so. I have used it now for a few weeks and it meets all my requirements - love the little window that shows water level, that it is so fast to heat up, beeps quietly when ready, has auto shut off, looks nice on counter, no mineral deposits/residue in pot. Feels solid / well made.

reviews.reviewTitle: Almost everything you need as a tea buff.
reviews.reviewText: With the choice of water temps that hold before boiling my various teas have never tasted better.Only black teas should boil - and boiling removes oxygen from the water if done before dropping to a temperature. That has been the problem with tea water holders until now -- they boiled and dropped the temp to green tea level, rather than just raising the trmp to the proper setting and holding. This also boils fast enough that a hunger for an instant coffee can be fulfilled quickly - if you can find a good coffee instant brand. Now of there was just an attachment to warm a steeping pot for water transfer.
I bought two of these style kettles. This one did cost more money but you can tell the quality is much better in the build and function.

Update: Ours just stopped working. Does not get hard work. Trying to decide if we should order this one or try something different. It has gone up $20 in three years, since we purchased ours. Loved how it worked, just wish it would of lasted longer.

If you drink a lot of tea and different types, this is a MUST have. We use this all the time. No more having to reheat water all the time and deal with the right temperature. Different settings for all your teas so all the work is done for you. Bought one as a gift and was a huge hit. Had to get one for us!

I gave this product an one star for poor performance and inadequate customer support. We bought it because we like the design and good review. But it never worked from Day 1. It was noisy when boiling water. The stainless interior discolored after each use. When we contacted Cuisinart, they would only accept return if we send it back at our cost. On the other hand, Amazon send us a return mailing label and give us refund.

Great product. Good looking, god build quality. The temperature selection is easy to operate. Just press the desired temperature and press go. The only thing I would have designed differently is that it stays in "keep warm" mode by default. I would have preferred for it to keep warm until you pick it up to pour and then be off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for using with a French Press!
reviews.reviewText: I am thrilled with this electric water kettle. I use a French Press for my coffee and had no idea that I was "boiling my coffee to death and bitterness"! This kettle has a setting specifically for using a French Press, as well as various other settings. Excellent item...I should have made this a priority YEARS ago!

reviews.reviewTitle: exactly what I wanted for making tea every day.
reviews.reviewText: This kettle is exactly what I was looking for - much more ergonomic than my previous kettle. The lid opens all the way to make pouring water in easy. The buttons are well lit for making tea in the wee hours. The water level is well lit as well so you don't over/underfill the kettle. The multiple temperature settings are easy to dabble with to try steeping at different temperatures. And it seems fast. The one thing that I sometimes forget to do is tell the kettle not to keep the water warm so it will keep boiling and beeping after I've left the room (but this is user error).

The great thing about this kettle is the intermediate temperatures, particularly for tea drinkers. It's great to have the water ready at whatever temperature we want, not just boiling, so you don't burn the tea. (Ok. there are a limited number of options, but they are plenty!) My wife and I use this every day. For the reviewer who complained about scale developing even with filtered water, you need to check into that filter - our house has ridiculously hard water but when we filter it, we never get any scale at all. This kettle has been a workhorse for us lately since we are both pretty addicted to teas, and it can accomodate my wife's taste for black and rooibos and my addiction to white, oolong and black.
If I had a complaint it would be that the paint on the "on" button has started to scrape off from our nails on it - it is just a plastic button with silver paint, not stainless like the body of the kettle. Nevertheless, it works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: As described and the best invention ever for tea lovers!
reviews.reviewText: This is awesome! I drink a lot more tea now as it's so much easier to use than the old fashioned tea kettle on the stove! What a great invention!!! Tea tastes so much better when you can get the appropriate temp for the type of tea.

Very convenient water kettle for various types of teas. You know you're getting the right temperature water, and it will stay that temperature if you want it to. Heats up surprisingly quickly and has a high capacity for multiple cups or for making French press coffee in larger quantities. Perfect for Aeropress coffee also with its lower water temperature setting. Construction quality seems good and has been working flawlessly for me.

I have had this kettle for 18 months. I love it. Love that you can choose different temperatures. Love that it keeps the water warm for 1/2 hour, and then automatically turns off. Love the stainless interior, (don't like the idea of boiling water in plastic).

The 'Beeps' when the water is up to temperature are a little soft, but I can hear them, and defiantly not a deal breaker.

A couple of times it seemed like it got 'confused' when I pressed 'start', but I just took the pot off of its base for a few seconds, put it back on the base, and then it worked fine.....maybe it wasn't seated on the base correctly, I don't know. 99% of the time, I don't have this problem.

No fading on the black lettering on the temperature settings, as another reviewer stated.....mine looks like new!

About a year ago, my mother bought one too. She is pleased as well.

My kettle worked OK for about nine months, but then started behaving erratically -- it would heat the water to a full boil, blasting steam out the top, no matter what temperature had been selected. The kettle comes with a three-year warranty, so I wasn't too concerned. However, as other reviewers have noted, Cuisinart expects the customer to pay shipping both ways -- first, whatever it costs to mail the kettle back to Cuisinart for inspection; second, the $15 fee they charge to return a functional kettle to the customer. So it would cost maybe $25 to $30 to get a replacement for a product that I paid $79 for new? Not much of a warranty after all. So we toughed it out for a few more months, guesstimating the correct temperatures at which to pour water for coffee and tea by listening carefully. Today, a little more than a year after the original purchase, the kettle stopped working entirely. Just sits there, cold, for a few minutes, and then beeps at us. Lovely. So I'm in the market for a new electric kettle, and it's not going to say "Cuisinart" on it.

This tea kettle stopped working after 3 uses. Cuisinart will charge me $30 shipping (to and from) to replace it. I do not recommend purchasing a Cuisinart product because (as stated by Cuisinart supervisor, Elizabeth) even if the item didn't work the first day, their warranty states that the customer has to pay shipping. I am baffled as to why I should have to pay to replace a brand new item. Amazon is wonderful, Cuisinart is not! Buyer Beware!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product - make the perfect cup of coffee or tea.
reviews.reviewText:
Absolutely wonderful kettle. The kettle beeps when ready and you can set the temperature fo your tea / coffee.Its also very quick.
Highly Recommend. Make the perfect cup of coffee or tea by using water that has not completely boiled (ie.e lost a lof of air oxygen) alterning the taste and not "burning" the tea.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Cuisinart cost more BUT it's great. Holds the temp until you turn it completely ...
reviews.reviewText: We had a previous brand of electric kettle that finally gave up. The Cuisinart cost more BUT it's great. Holds the temp until you turn it completely off. VERY fast in heating up, and has awesome selection of different temperature setting, all push button controlled. Friends have admired it. (We're afraid to invite them over now!)

In addition to making tea I use it to heat water to wash the dishes. The water heater is a long way from the kitchen faucet. I heat water in this, dilute with some cold water to bring the temperature down and wash the dishes. Using the hot water faucet I would waste a couple gallons of hot water every time.

I've now had this kettle for just over 2 years, generally using it 2-5 times a day (I drink a lot of tea) and it still works perfectly at every temperature setting. It takes as long as about 4 minutes to fully heat the water to the desired temperature which is the best thing about this kettle--it's so fast! The only issue I have is with my water which is ridiculously hard so I have major scale buildup but that's not the kettle's fault. I do always unplug it, dump excess water out, and keep the lid open after each use. Maybe that helps prolong its life?

reviews.reviewTitle: Large capacity!! Looks good on countertop!!
reviews.reviewText: Super excellent water heater!!! the temperature selections and lights are really easy to use and nice to have!

Although I have had this for only 2 weeks, I am sold on it. I use in my daily routine for coffee and occasional tea. The water heats up quickly and fairly quietly as advertised. I make my coffee using this tea kettle and my Areopress-Aerobie AeroPress Coffee and Espresso Maker,what a great combo. Perfect coffee in minutes. The water is at a perfect temperature 200 degrees-the water in an automatic coffee machine is almost never hot enough to enjoy fully. I love the Tech look and functionality of the temperature settings for different teas and the one for coffee-"French Press".

It is a beautiful design, and I was looking forward to the various temperature selections, but this product leaked the first time I used it. We tried it several more times and it continued to LEAK from somewhere under the kettle all over the counter each time we tried to heat it up. What a shame, it was returned immediately.

It is a really good kettle but the heating mechanism broke after 15 months of light use. It is a second one I bought and they do not last. It is ridiculous to expect to keep replacing a water boiling gadget every other year, which cost as much as this does.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for tea and french press coffee lovers
reviews.reviewText: I've had this for a few months and I love it so far. The different settings are great if you are into different types of teas. I also love that it has a french press setting for coffee. I like that it has a "keep warm" setting, although I rarely use it. The outside of the pot does get very hot to the touch, so you would have to watch out for burns (which is to be expected). But, the handle stays cool and pours nicely without splashing

I used to burn water, now it heats to the perfect temperatures for black tea, white tea, oolong tea, green tea, and COFFEE!
The kettle keeps the water warm, and the beeper alarm lets me know when it's ready. Got one for friends and they gave away their stovetop kettle. The coolest thing is the measuring marks under the handle. I use this feature when a recipe calls for an exact amount of hot water. Yippie! No more burned fingers or water not hot enough. The cord is nice and long and the heater unit is nearly weightless.

This tea kettle works fine in all respects but there are two improvements that would be useful. First, the window that shows how much water is in the kettle is under the handle which makes it very hard to see, especially when you're filling the kettle. Our old (actually ancient) kettle had the fill window on the side so it was very easy to see how much water was in it while filling it. Second, when your water boils (or reaches the desired temperature), the beeps that the kettle makes are so quiet that they're very difficult to hear. But these are relatively minor quibbles. The kettle looks good and boils water like it should.

reviews.reviewTitle: Defective Filling Lid Button Jams and Cuisinart Charged Me For Return Shipping
reviews.reviewText: I got this kettle in February for my girlfriend. It worked fine, but after about 6 months the button which opens the top lid for filling got jammed. We weren't doing anything special with it, it just jammed. We've been unable to unjam it and the filling lid rarely stays closed. I'm not usually one to return things, but at my girlfriends suggestion I called Cuisinart. They were very nice and offered to replace it, but they're charging me $15 for the shipping, plus requiring that I send the old one back to them, again at my expense. Seems like a pretty unfriendly return policy for something that is clearly a defective design. Doubt I'll buy another Cuisinart product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lid stuck in place, Open button stopped working after 5 days
reviews.reviewText: Used it 5 days, the "Open" button stopped working...lid stuck. So, although we loved how it performed, if it broke, you just can't give it a good rating. Luckily, we're Prime customers, and Amazon sent a new one right away. We've been using it over a week, and no issues. Could be a fluke. I'll reevaluate after a few months, if it lasts that long.
I was very disappointed. This is not cordless! It seems to work well and looks nice on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Good and High Quality Product
reviews.reviewText: My wife's previous Krups kettle starting leaking and it wasn't repairable. After a long investigation (to my wife's chagrin), we decided on this kettle. It is very well constructed and has some very nice features. You can set different temperatures depending on your drink or need (e.g. Green Tea, etc.). The temperature hold feature is very nice if you are having more than one cup of tea. We have been very pleased with it thus far. My wife uses it every day and it was been very reliable.
Love this so much I have bought 3 of them. Convenient and perfect tea every time. Highly recommend
It gives me the correct temperature for my tea instead of guessing. It works great and perfect for my purposes.

I like having the different temperatures for the different teas and that it will hold that temperature until I get there. But it pours badly, 3 different streams come out which can be messy and when I fill it to just the minimun for 1 cup sometimes it doesn't register right away until it's way over the amount I want and since I use filtered water that wastes it, plus when I've tried to use the keep warm feature it doesn't hold for 30 minutes. I contacted the company and they said they would send me a new one so apparently mine isn't right but they said I'd have to pay to send mine back and pay to have the new one sent! I waited for this to be on sale so I would end up not saving anything and why should I have to pay to exchange a deffective machine that wasn't my fault. So I'm disappointed in the company and will steer away from the brand for other purchases if they can't stand behind their products and value their customers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Durable, works fast, nice functions and clean, smooth design
reviews.reviewText: I bought this electric kettle to be our staple water heater for coffee and tea. It's been over 3 years now and this kettle has not disappointed. We use it a few times a day and it still works well, heating up the water pretty fast. I like the "keep warm" function which keeps the kettle reheating the water usually for about half an hour in case you're busy and can't pour the cup of coffee immediately. It's also great for heating water for tea with various temperature options. Beautiful design looks elegant on any counter. I highly recommend this.

This kettle is beautiful, easy to use and gives good results .
I use it for my morning tea, and when I have guests . I put it
in the guest-room , with a croissant or a scone. But most of
the time, I keep it for myself, in the kitchen. I did not know
what to expect exactly when I ordered it, but I wanted a kettle
which would be fast, as my mornings are always rushed. I was
not disappointed by its performance, and its looks are an
added pleasure .It's a star ! I just hope that one of my guests
does not think it's a gift and packs it when he/she leaves !

Great appliance which would be even better if it wasn't so 'clunky' to lift and pour. Even though some product descriptions stated that the outside remains cool to the touch, it's not. Outside gets quite hot!

I love this so much! I like that I can heat this to different temperatures. My parents visited me and they liked it so much they got one for themselves too. Prior to this, I had one that just turned on and off. But, this one has the different settings and a keep warm function which is really nice. It heats up very quickly. I plan to use this for heating the water up for my baby's bottle too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Tea Kettle you will find like this
reviews.reviewText: Best Tea Kettle for the money. My wife has used this almost every day for years and still loves it. Super quick and easy and has different settings for the type of tea you are going to have.

I'm trying to use my microwave less and this kettle heats water quickly, provides a great choice of temperatures, and cycles to keep it warm for a second cup. Clean design lines mean I can leave it on the counter when not in use.

This is a great kettle - when it's working.
While the "beep" that sounds when the water has boiled has always been VERY soft (can't hear it from 20' away if the TV is on), it has stopped working altogether this month, some 22 months after we purchased it. There doesn't appear to be any way to trouble shoot this problem according to the operating instructions.
I first used this at work. Later, I got to try it more through s.o. It’s pricey but very well worth it. Very easy to use and long lasting.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am a tea drinker and with the Cuisinart automatic ...
reviews.reviewText: I am a tea drinker and with the Cuisinart automatic reheat feature it works extremely well. I can have a second cup without having to reheat the water. The variable heat settings allows you a wide range of heat settings. Simply a well designed and engineered kettle

Update: after less than two years of using it once per day, it no longer always works. Sometimes it quits before it gets hot and then I have to wait a long time before it will even power up.I really only want to boil water.
This has lots of buttons that I never use. It also has a very high-pitched beeper that I only hear when I'm standing next to it. I got it because although the Capresso units boil faster (and are just plain nicer to use), it seems they fail after a few years so I thought I'd try something different.

reviews.reviewTitle: This was a pretty good tea kettle and worked well until the unit ...
reviews.reviewText: This was a pretty good tea kettle and worked well until the unit would not turn off when the temperature was set to the "boil" and the "200 degree" settings. I wrote to Cuisinart (Conair) and asked them how I could get it repaired. I was informed that the unit could not be repaired and was determined to be a throw-away item. I may try and repair it myself but am not sure that parts would be available.

This kettle was bought to replace the $30 crappy kettle I bought at the supermarket. Unlike the crappy one, this one did not fail within the year. It continues to work wonderfully. The blue LEDs are pretty, the buttons are easy to figure out. That it has a "keep going" button so that you have hot water later, but it doesn't just run constantly, is great. The beeper to tell you it is ready is really great. And it is $80 instead of $200 for the fancy one in the mall kitchen store.

reviews.reviewTitle: 1) the opening at the top is very narrow compared to my dead Breville (which I loved boiling eggs in and the Cuisinart opening i
reviews.reviewText: I'd give this 5 starts but I have 2 complaints; 1) the opening at the top is very narrow compared to my dead Breville (which I loved boiling eggs in and the Cuisinart opening is so narrow it's hard to get the eggs loaded easily), and 2) after it's run its cycle and you place it back on the pad you need to turn it off or it'll start cycling again.

reviews.reviewTitle: This feels like a luxury appliance
reviews.reviewText: This feels like a luxury appliance, and always draws lots of compliments from guests. It's so nice looking and well-made, and the temperature adjustments are a great feature. I wish the sides didn't smudge so easily, but I just incorporate wiping it down every time I clean my kitchen and it stays looking beautiful. The keep warm feature is also really nice.

I bought this for heating up my water to the optimum temperature to make my loose leaf teas. I was looking for an all stainless steel or glass kettle but those are truly hard to find so this mostly stainless steel BPA free one will do. It has a small piece of plastic that is BPA free so beware if you are picky about that. I have had it for about 3 months now and it works great just like new! It heats up fast and has easy to use buttons and a keep warm mode to not allow cooling between uses.

Love love love!!!! I am a very big tea drinker and I have been looking for an electric kettle like this one for awhile. I seen this one in a few stores but found it $20+ cheaper on Amazon so I decided to go ahead and buy it. So glad I did!! This kettle is so easy to use, just 2 buttons and your kettle is brewing at the perfect temperature. This kettle heats up so quickly. I also love the swivel base which makes it easy for us leftys or my right handed husband to pick up. I love the keep warm option so I can have multiple cups without waiting. It looks great on my countertop too! Only thing is to be aware of is the outside of the kettle gets really hot, so keep out of reach from little ones!

So I'm a coffee junkie. So much so that I have an awesome grinder, french press, pour over drip ceramic, vacuum pot, all the stuff.

For me, 90% of the electric kettles out there, fall short of the mark because they don't have the ability to adjust temperature. You get boiling, or nothing. This is the lowest entry point for that except for the Adagio Utilitea. Which has better reviews and can be had for $45 in the back corners of the internet searches + retailmenot

I chose this for two simple reasons - 1.) I'm married and my wife likes brand names for the kitchen <sigh> 2.) It has 3 yr warranty, compared to 1 yr warranty on Adagio product.

If you see all the bad reviews on Adagio - it is because of 1 yr failure rate and lack of support. I didn't want to quite risk that. It felt like for +$30..hedging my risk for 3 years was smarter.

Everything else it does fine. Something important to bring up - there is no reasonable electric kettle that lets you set temp..you get presets. (e.g. there is no 184 degrees, or 178 degrees if you want to dabble with brewing temperature of your coffee or dark/light roast)...but there is a french roast setting (200), as well as 160, 175, 185, 190 & 212 (boil)

Bought this product 2 years ago. I use it daily. It has held up perfectly, does not build up minerals quickly, is fairly easy to clean, and boils to stated temperature. I am a scientist so I nerd out about that stuff. I highly recommend it.

I use this everyday and it heats up water super fast. Nice stainless steel and easy to use. Simple design and looks great on the kitchen counter. I would say this would work great in a dorm room or office situation too. Love the filter on the spout for hard water scale. Cleans up really nice with vinegar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not purchase this item if you plan on using it more than 1 year.
reviews.reviewText:
After reading a lot of reviews, I was skeptical about this Cuisinart. After using it for over a month, there have been no problems with the opening lid like others have stated, nor have the numbers rubbed off.

UPDATED April 2017:

The kettle started to malfunction. The button that opens the top completely stopped working. The water would stop boiling and turn off, but the temperature of the water is warm. I would not recommend this product.

It works, but if money is no object, I'd much rather get the Breville that I owned previously, which is better looking and way better designed (it did bite the dust after three years, but that might just have been random bad luck). Also, the ready "beep" on the Cuisinart is almost completely inaudible. Not all that important, but still...
Love this kettle. Has multi settings for multi uses. And has warm setting to keep water hot longer for multiple use. Only con - outside of kettle gets hot.

reviews.reviewTitle: After 5 years of daily use it's my hardest working appliance and has yet to let me down.
reviews.reviewText:
I have had this since Feb. 2011 and it's going strong. My mom has one also and turned it on & it boiled dry- it then went into "error" mode and wouldn't work. My mom called the company and they were really great and sent a new one out (it was within the warranty period). That was 4 year ago and hers works like a champ.

I use it almost daily (HUGE tea drinker) and even use it to boil water for cooking pots. I have pretty hard water so I clean it about every 8 weeks to get scale out.

I have NOT had the issue of the numbers rubbing off...not sure if people are possibly using super strong industrial cleaners on it? Or I got lucky.
It makes a little "beeping" sound when the water is done- it's there but not intrusive, I don't want any obnoxious BEEP letting my know my water for my relaxing cup of tea is done :~) and with the "keep warm" feature it's not needed- it will be there hot & ready for you when you're ready. You can hear the water change composition as it begins to boil, so I've come to know when it's almost done just by that!

The lid pops open very easily and I put it down in the sink, fill it, lift it, wipe the bottom, put on the stand (makes a tiny "click-ish" sound) and hit boil!

I brew different teas, some of which are delicate and also use a french press (Bodum- REALLY recommend that also!!!) so this gets a LOT of use from me!

It does get hot on the outside (not the handle) but it's not scalding. It will make you pull away, but it's a metal tea kettle...it's going to get hot. But you won't be going to the ER.

After 5 years of daily use it's my hardest working appliance and has yet to let me down.

I know people have concerns about BPA in the plastic- it's such a small amount that I really think it's nothing to worry about. I am conscious about BPA (use Kleen Kanteens, filter my water), nonstick pans, carpet/furniture "protectors" etc also, and I don't think twice about this kettle. Of the amount of plastic we are exposed to daily, the styrofoam, nonstick pans, chemicals in our meat, I think this kettle is low on the totem pole for worries to me.

I love this tea kettle. It is nice looking, extremely functional and works great. I use it all the time. For french press coffee, to leave my husbands tea water warm (with the keep warm feature) until he wakes up and I enjoy hot lemon water through the day. I use the the delicate option and keep water warm and use it throughout the day. Love this kettle. Its new, but is sturdy and looks well made. I hope it lasts! Love it!
Worked well for 2 years and then wouldnt heat although electronics worked. Opened up the unit and couldn’t find anything immediately apparent to fix... dont want to buy a new kettle every 2 years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart needs to improve its products
reviews.reviewText: This is the second Cuisinart electric kettle I have purchased. Unfortunately, both of them have been defective. The first one only worked for a short time and the second one didn't work at all. Water was leaking from the bottom of the kettle into the electrical area which is obviously dangerous, plus when I tried to turn it on after two uses, it did not work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and still going strong
reviews.reviewText: Not sure when we got ours but we just sent one to a friend whose last kelectric kettle died, because we love ours so much. We use this multiple times a day and it's still going strong. My only recommendation is that if you have hard water, make sure to clean with vinegar to break down the calcium deposits.

reviews.reviewTitle: That's how much I love this kettle
reviews.reviewText: If my Cuisinart PerfecTemp kettle was in the way of an oncoming car, I'd sacrifice my life to save it. That's how much I love this kettle. If you are a tea snob, buy it. I use it every day and have had no issues at all.

We just bought this one for my mom, after bringing ours home at Christmas and having her adore it. It’s so simple and effective. I brew tea for myself in the morning and then brew coffee for my wife. Two buttons for perfect water temp. 10/10.

reviews.reviewTitle: JUST ANOTHER SOULLESS CORPORATION WITH DYSFUNCTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY THIS KETTLE! I bought it in August 2014. On 1 June 2015 it failed. It was irreparable. I called Cuisinart customer service. I was asked for the model number and the serial number, both in small letters and numbers on the bottom of the kettle. I was able to read the model number. The serial number, which was stamped onto the plastic on the bottom, was indecipherable. Somehow the stamp had broken up the number. The customer service person at Cuisinart agreed that the kettle was still under warranty, but claimed that Cuisinart could not replace it without the serial number. We went around in circles. I kept trying to read the number. I got a magnifying glass and tried to read the number. This went on for forty minutes. In the end I gave up. But then I wrote Cuisinart customer service. I received a hyper-bureaucratic reply telling me that even though I had proof of purchase and the model number, I still needed the (indecipherable) serial number to obtain an exchange. I was ordered to send a photograph of the stamp (impossible with my photographic equipment) and to "please reply, with all previous correspondences attached, to this email. Please reply, with history, to this email.” In the end, I'd wasted $76 on high end junk and a huge amount of precious time trying to work with a wholly dysfunctional customer service. My advice, DO NOT BUY THIS KETTLE. It may work well for a while, but when it fails--and most electric kettles eventually fail--you will find yourself confronting the Conair corporation, which owns Cuisinart, and which will not yield an inch on its cast iron rules.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent kettle with different temperature options
reviews.reviewText: Great kettle, have had it for well over a year and no issues at all. Love the different temperature choices even though I usually boil my water. It looks great and works great, highly recommend it!

Scary kettle wish I could return it
It boils by itself
Serious fire risk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice looking Kettle, but just not last long. And poor service.
reviews.reviewText:
I love the kettle. Unfortunately, it was broken after less than one-year use.

It comes with three-year manufacture warrenty, but it is hard to find detailed information about how to claim the problem. Also it is hard for me to get connected with the customer service over phone, and instead I completed an online warrenty claim form to report the problem and ask where to send the kettle back for repair. However, I have never got any response from Cuisinart after more than four months of my inital report.

Now, the broken kettle is sitting in my kitchen cabin, and I don't know how to deal with it.

I've tried many, many different pots for making water for tea. This is the best by far. It heats up quickly and offers many temperatures for the different types of teas I use. Easy to operate. Love the panel to see how much water is left and that it lights up when it's on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Kettle. No Complaints or Issues
reviews.reviewText: I have owned this kettle for 10 months and can say that it is Amazing! I can't find anything negative to say except that the stainless steel gets dirty after a while. I use this kettle everyday and it hasn't failed me to date. I was concerned about getting this kettle because I read reviews about it rusting. however, I haven't had any issues with Rusting. the black lettering on the buttons hasn't worn off either. I bought this for $100 and would pay it again. now it is around $60 !!!

I have been using this unit for about 2 weeks. The reason for the average rating comes from a few problems. The first is that I spent $88 on an average anything. Next is that the circumference of the lid opening is too small. And the filter, the filter! These filters do not last and eventually the filter screen disintegrates. It just broadcasts CHEAP to me. Other than that, the unit works fine and does not have any operating issues. The blue led lights are bright enough for you to see and the "I'm done" alert is subtle but loud enough for you to hear.

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely perfect for the perfect water temperature in the tea-steeping process
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely perfect for the perfect water temperature in the tea-steeping process. Quickly heats the water to desired temp and will hold it for 30 minutes. I chose this because I was always overheating my water in the microwave, thus ruining the tea flavor during its steep. Works well for heating water for hot chocolate too! It looks nice on the counter also. Would highly recommend it.http://www.amazon.com/Cuisinart-CPK-17-PerfecTemp-1-7-Liter-Stainless/dp/B003KYSLNQ/ref=sr_1_1?s=home-garden&ie=UTF8&qid=1444483532&sr=1-1&keywords=cuisi

I really love this! It looks good on my counter and works great! It is easy to use, and I like that clear panel to clearly see the water level. The buttons clearly display the temperature options, and it's nice that they are located on the handle to save space. It feels balanced when I pour from it and the water heats very quickly. I am so very glad I got this! I leave the lid open for awhile after each use to make sure the reservoir fully dries out. I may not need to, but it's just what I like to do.

I bought this as a gift for my husband who makes tea all the time. After a few weeks he already says he can't live without it. It boils water in record time and keeps it warm for you in case you want another cup later on. I also love all the different settings for different types of teas. My husband has now ditched our traditional kettle and uses this one exclusively.

Fast, efficient, just what I was looking for. After 10 months I noticed that inside the bottom of the kettle that erosion of the stainless finish seemed to have occurred. Didn't look right, so called the manufacturer. They were great! I provided the model and serial #. It has a 3 year warrantee. They're shipping a replacement. All I have to do is return the defective one. Well done Cuisinart!

Who knew I'd spend this much on a tea kettle?! I recently became a Teavana fan and their tea kettle for $250 is ridiculous. But this one works and I love it! It holds a lot of water, I love the buttons with a tea preset temperatures. It's a good find.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke in 10 months - warranty was useless
reviews.reviewText: Broke completely in under 1 year - warranty coverage was useless, as I'd end up spending over half the initial price in shipping/handling (Cuisinart makes you pay to ship the broken unit to them, and then pay them to ship the new one to you). After extensive research, it appears that basically all electric kettles are cheaply built, Chinese-made items. Don't buy into the hype of this fancy kettle - but a $25 version from Hamilton Beach or Secura.

This electric kettle is awesome. I love that there are multiple settings and this allows water to be ready much more quickly than on other models that just have a boil setting to turn off. I feel that the green tea setting that I use the most is so quick and I do not feel that I am hovering waiting for the water to be ready. The fact that this keeps the water warm for extended periods is also a bonus as when getting ready for work in the morning I can set it and then once I return to the kitchen the water is still warm and ready to use. Great product.
Great product! Gives the option to heat up based on what your drinking. Very quick heat up and allows to maintain temp for 30 min. Easy to refill water. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Provides water at specific temperatures for teas and coffee.
reviews.reviewText: I love this kettle. I drink green tea, and French Press coffee, so love having the ability to get just the right temperature so easily.

CPK-17 is not the best Electric Kettle.
I like the design and when it works it is a great kettle
However, I have two of them and both broken.
As results, I switch to another brand (Now
it is Epica)
Two stars due to low reliability.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great purchase for tea lovers
reviews.reviewText: I had to exchange the first one I purchased because it quit working after a few months, but I thought it was worth it. This is a really beautifully designed electric water heater, and it really heats the water to the perfect temperature depending on the type of tea you choose. I will continue to use this and exchange it again and again because I like the design and ease of use. (Cuisinart has a no questions asked policy for California residents).

I bought this for my wife who likes to drink all kinds of teas. Great kettle for heating water at different temperatures for different kind of teas. It also has a setting for 200 degrees which is perfect for coffee. I use this to make my french press coffee and its better than using a stovetop teapot and it also heats up the water much quicker. Generous size.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good kettle. It looks nice and the temperature control ...
reviews.reviewText: Good kettle. It looks nice and the temperature control is pretty good. The last one I purchased just died on me. Having owned 2 of these kettles, I think you could expect about 2 years of daily use out of it.

Water heats up fine, only complaint is that it does not stay on very long. It shuts off about every 30 mins, this item was purchased for an office so it's a little annoying to have to get up and make sure it's on or have to turn it back on before pouring a cup of hot tea. Other than that, it works great and the shipping was fast.

First one broke within a week, lid would not open. Received replacement. Works perfectly fine for a while now. I wish the "keep warm" setting was disabled by default.

Update:
Stopped working after about 7 months. Would not start heating the water. Disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: I have had my pot for a year and love it. Two friends have purchased one after seeing mine, and I have purchased another as a gift. I like the ability to see my water level, I require the ability to heat the different temperatures, and the neck is big enough that I can just barely get my hand inside to clean. A person with larger hands would not be able to do that, but it would be easy to use a brush to clean it.
Love it over all. It had mechanical issues two years later but the original warranty covered replacement. Just disappointed that something that cost over $100 would die that quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a wonderful, marvelous tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: This is a wonderful, marvelous tea kettle. I was always getting the water temperature wrong for my Green Tea and then it would be bitter. Now, this little pot does it all for me with the push of two buttons: "Green Tea" and "Start". I like it so much that it stays on my kitchen counter (in a TINY kitchen) all the time.

Love this kettle! It is stylish and looks great on my counter. The buttons are easy to depress and I love that they say right on them "green" for green tea etc, I don't have to look up what temperature is better for what beverage I am brewing! This is a perfect electric kettle!

This works pretty well. It takes longer to get a full pitcher to boiling than another boiler I had. BUT this one is all metal so I can boil multiple pitchers in a row.

I only have one real complaint:

the lid sticks. there's a button to open the lid, but the lid often doesn't open even when I push the button. Very early on the top of the lid broke off when I was trying to open it. Fortunately I was able to snap the lid back on even though one small latch broke

I have been using this for six months now and have had absolutely no problems with it. It always works as expected and brings my water to the perfect temperature. All you have to do is remember to turn it off after you use it and it stops cycling through keeping your water at a consistent temperature. This is also great for when you need to quickly bring water to a high temperature for cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wonderful kettle for making tea that has to be a specific temperature
reviews.reviewText:
I have owned this kettle for over 4 months now, and I am pleased to report that it has created nothing but delicious tea for me. It has many selectable temperatures built into its design, it beeps when the water inside has reached the selected temperature, and it keeps the water at that temperature for 30 minutes. What more could one ask for?

Since some other reviewers have commented on durability, I held off on writing this review until I had the product for 4 months. But to be honest, 4 months in, it operates just as it did when I first got it.

This is a very easy-to-use kettle that can get water to a specific temperature and keep it there. It looks good in your kitchen, but even more importantly, it does its job well. I definitely recommend it if you like to make tea.

My Wife and I are huge tea fans with cupboards full of a variety of different types of tea. We were microwaving water for the longest time until we bought this for ourselves as a Christmas gift. It heats up FAST and keeps the water right where you need it to be temperature wise for another cup. We can't wait to experiment with different tea types to get the most out of the leaves.

***UPDATE** Stopped working on 7 months to the day from buying it.

Though I've had this electric kettle for a short time, it has so far not failed me. It brews to the correct temperature for every type of tea that I drink. The only complaint I have is the signal it gives off when the water is ready is too soft. If I am not nearby or if the room is noisy I would not hear it. The other is the capacity. Since this kettle is for me, I usually don't fill it up most of the time though I don't think that is a negative thing. All and all I have not been displeased with it.

Purchased one of these about six months ago and with normal use for tea it would start but then just quit heating and let out a sad long beep.... of death. Great night light now. DO NOT BUY THIS. Even if they do replace it, it will cost you the price of half of a new competitors model that will last you...

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better than a stovetop kettle, and variable temps are great
reviews.reviewText:
Heats water quickly and efficiently. Much better than a stovetop.

pros
looks great
heats great
variable temps for tea/coffee
efficient-- much quicker and lower energy usage than a kettle or microwave
Cons
outside (other than handle) gets hot
bit more expensive than some others

The cons are easily managed I think- don't touch the outside... you can't touch the outside of a teakettle anyway, so not much different here. as for the price, I think you pay for the variable temps and the "keep warm" feature. Both of which were important to me, as this is used for tea and coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart quality, very high end love the look and small footprint
reviews.reviewText: Incredible. Love this machine. Top of the line, everything it advertisers is true. Differeing temps for different teas. Does keep warm or at boiling point for 30 mins. Light up front helpful. Small footprint. Do you need top of the line for boiling water probably not but I like cuisinart and thought this would be more versatile for different types of teas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent kettle with stay warm and different temp settings for ...
reviews.reviewText: Excellent kettle with stay warm and different temp settings for various hot beverages, perfect could not ask for more and very well made also
Works great. Dont know why I haven't had one of these around for years. Well made and great range of settings. Have had this model for several months now with no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: since then and is still as good as the day it arrived
reviews.reviewText: We purchased this teapot in Nov. 2011 from Amazon, it has been used each and everyday, more than 2x a day, since then and is still as good as the day it arrived. Great product. Thanks Cuisinart!

reviews.reviewTitle: I am VERY happy with this kettle
reviews.reviewText: I am VERY happy with this kettle. In less than 2 min I can have cold water to boiling water. I love now I can take the boiling water off of the pad and set it on the wood table and not be worried about any marks that it might leave. I have found myself using it at night when I am making dinner for the 4 kids and wife. When I am in a hurry and need to have water boil quickly I keep finding myself turning to the kettle. I would recommend this to anyone that is looking for a kettle.

I've given up coffee, and am exploring the world of tea. From green, white, puerh and black, this meets the need of our household. I love knowing that the temp is right - I just have to steep for the right length of time. It's heavy, which means my kids can't easily knock it over. It takes up less space that my Keurig and the only problem is that I'm always refilling it! But that's more a reflection of my husband than the pot itself.

I should have bought this pot years ago.

Nice kettle, but it doesn't last long. The lettering wore off the buttons in a matter of months and the kettle stopped working altogether at around 2 years.

For as much as this costs, it should be higher quality.

I was really torn about buying an expensive water kettle, but with the amount of tea and french press coffee we go through, having this thing in house has been amazing. We literally use it 10x / day, between coffee, tea, instant soups, and cooking (i.e. speeding water boiling for rice / pasta). The variable water temps are great, and it's been nice to experiment the effect of water temp on coffee - it really does make a difference, and I've found depends on the coffee bean itself.

In terms of reliability, I don't see this thing breaking for a while - it's solidly built, with a good feel behind the buttons and controls. Also, it looks great on the counter, which is necessary since it's not that easy to tuck away in our limited cabinet space.

I have owned this for 3 and a half years(purchased in 2011) and it still works great with daily use. Quick and easy to warm up water. I used a digital probe to test the temperature and at 175 and 200 degrees my thermometer said it was dead on or 1 degree off. 1 degree off is quite phenomenal and basically can be attributed to the accuracy of instruments. I would definitely buy again when and if this kettle breaks.

I have had this kettle for over a year and have used it several times a day every day since its purchase. It quickly heats water to the desired temperature without overshooting. My oolong and white teas taste perfect. The beep when it reaches the set temperature is helpful. Likewise, the blue light makes it easy to see if I have enough water every time.

For anyone who likes to have variety in their teas and take the guess work out of heating water below boiling, this kettle is worth the investment.

reviews.reviewTitle: and I like a wide variety of teas
reviews.reviewText: Exactly what I was expecting, and more. I've used this daily since I received it. I am a tea drinker, and I like a wide variety of teas, and they require different temps to brew properly. Not only does this warm up water quickly to the right temperature, it has some 'smart' features such as holding the water at a temperature for a while and remembering the last temp you used. It's well made, and works exactly as advertised. What more could you want in a product.

Works fantastic for heating water to pre-set temperatures for various types of tea. Temps are 160, 175, 185, 190, 200, and boiling. It also has a button you can press before you start that will make it hold the temp after heating until it is picked up in case you want to walk away for a while after starting (though it really only takes a few minutes to heat anyway). The only thing that would improve it would be the ability to set any temperature you wanted in a completely manual way. The presets work fine for me though with my various types of tea.

I have had this kettle for about 2 years now and absolutely love it! Very easy to use. The keep warm feature is handy, as are the different temps you can select. It also looks very nice in the counter. The blue back light is attractive. I use it often when baking, cooking when warm or hot water is required. The kids use it for hot chocolate, tea, ramen noodles. It's much safer for the kids to use than the traditional kettle on the stove. I like this kettle so much that so far I have bought two more as gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Says BPA free right on the box!
reviews.reviewText: This Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp 1.7-Liter Stainless Steel Cordless Electric Kettle says BPA-free right on the box! Wasn't clear from other reviews and the internet so I took a chance and I am very happy I did. The kettle works great! Has a 3 year warranty so I feel that if it dies just after 3 years I'm ok with that. It was $100 and is a small kitchen appliance after all. The temperatures are accurate. The kettle looks sharp with the stainless steel and cool blue lights. Love it and very glad I got one!

reviews.reviewTitle: After A Year It Still Works Great
reviews.reviewText: A little over a year ago I started looking for an electric kettle since I moved in to a place with no stove. The temp selection and stainless body were nice options. After a year there haven't been any issues even with daily use ( at least 7-12 times a week). The temp is consistent which is a plus since I burn my tongue when beverages are too hot. It could be set to my liking without having to wait for it to cool down. The body is easy to clean but gets hot so be careful when handling. The handle stays nice and cool though and feels sturdy and comfortable. The window that shows water level is also a nice touch that takes away the guess work when making small amounts of tea or coffee. All in all it's been a great product for me and I would recommend. My only negative is waiting for it too cool down before boiling again which can be a pain.

reviews.reviewTitle: All those good reviews are right on
reviews.reviewText: I bought this kettle after reading many reviews - and the were not wrong. It is a stylish kettle that looks great on my countertop and with my stainless steel kitchen appliances. It also works perfectly. I love the different temperature settings for different kinds of tea and coffee, and also the reheat setting. I'm very glad I splurged on this model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 2.5 years, leaked water all over
reviews.reviewText: It broke after 2.5 years - started leaking at the bottom of the handle, water got on the floor and damaged it. Shorted out and blew fuses in the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great when it works but it has low durability!
reviews.reviewText: When this tea kettle works it is wonderful. A top 5 stars, but it is prone to breaking down a LOT! This is why I only rate it with 2 stars. I've sent one back to get it repaired and then it broke in a few months afterwards. I bought another one and that lasted about 5 months and then it just stopped working. I'm disgusted in the poor quality of these machines.

Worth the money! Finally I don't have to check constantly the temperature with a thermometer to enjoy my oolong, green, white etc. teas or to make instantly the instant hot cocoa for my kids when they come running back from the snow play this winter. I love the alarm (which surprisingly is NOT annoying) when the desired temperature is achieved, also the fact that it does maintain this temperature for a good 20+min (did I mentioned I had kids – yeah, try to manage right temperature from boiling water when you are interrupted every minute to perform 15+min tasks. I guess that will be a very desirable feature in the office environment if an annoying boss is in presence). Thought just a suggestion for future upgraded model (which APPARENTLY I would buy) – add up a 1 to 5 min timer for the steeping.
I love the ease of use, speed to heat the water and the precision temperatures. I have a long brush to clean it but a little challenging.
This is so convenient. Looks nice on the counter and works like a charm.
Love it. Been a few months now and am really pleased with it. Shipping was a bit slow though. But am glad I waited.
This heats up quickly and with several different heating options. I am buying a second one for home...

I am generally not a big fan of Cuisinart products (I think they generally a bit overpriced), but this pot seems to be a pretty good deal. I'd like to make a few improvement suggestions, though:

The pot makes a little "peep" when the water is ready. It's not even as loud as the sound of the water boiling. I'd like it to be a little louder, so that there is some chance of hearing it in the next room.

I'd also like to see a water temperature indicator somewhere, so that one might see how the process is going.

Still, I'd be happy to buy another of these pots if I needed one.

This is the best electric kettle ever. Heats up super fast, and six different temperatures to choose for your teas. If you are a tea aficionado this is the *only one* to own. My daughter got it as a gift and when she went away to college she took it with her. I missed it so much I bought one for myself!

This electric kettle has all the tea temperature settings making it easy to brew water to the correct temperature. Once the water is brewed to the right temperature the pot mainstains that temperature for 30 minutes. Very pleased. The only slight annoyance is a slightly longer cord than 6"would be nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stops heating fast after a few months!!
reviews.reviewText: This product has stopped heating water fast. Now it takes a long time to heat up and works best if I only fill it less than half full. Replacing with another brand. Too bad it’s too late to return.

I cannot turn off the kettle when I empty it. Pushing the start button does not work, I must unplug the cord, take it off the base, or add water. This is really annoying. Moreover, pressing the start button to turn off the back lit display and reheating is NOT intuitive at all, my guests are always confused.

Exchanged the DK17 for this, newer, narrower, and taller model. Solid, heavy build...Happy with purchase. Bit as mentioned, heavy, compared to prior purchased plastic models.....50 year old male who exercises.

AL
www.NordicICEgel.com
"Prescription pain relief, without the doctor visit"

reviews.reviewTitle: The different temperatures are a great function too
reviews.reviewText: This tea kettle has made college a lot more tolerable for me. You can use it to make tea, ramen, all major food groups in my diet. It works really well and it's held up quite a bit. The different temperatures are a great function too, it really makes a big difference in green and white teas.

reviews.reviewTitle: so awesome i purchased it for myself after giving it as a gift!
reviews.reviewText: great water kettle. i understand its a bit pricier than other water kettles out there, but not many have different temperature settings. the warm up is very quick (note, it does take longer if you mistakingly fill it past the max line). I actually use the 185 setting a lot to brew my coffee in an aeropress. Theres no boiling and waiting for it to cool down. it gets your water to the right temp and it makes your teas and coffees taste so much better since you are not burning the tea leaves or coffee grounds.
Love the degree changes. Only thing I do not like is that because it stays in the Warming Mode, does not auto shut off when done.

Worked great for awhile, but suddenly stopped working for no apparent reason. Apparently the inner coiled burned out. We owned the product for less than a year I believe. While we loved the preset temperatures, we're looking at other brands for replacement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, but does have rust now....
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this for almost 2 years now, and it's one great kettle, except it has rust spots in it. Started appearing about a year into use. Now the numbers (temperatures) on the buttons are starting to wear off. I use the "200" for French Press coffee the most, and the "200" is almost gone, and the "Boil" is faint, as well.

But other than those 2 things, this thing is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... my mother-law a couple weeks ago and we both love it. It cost a little more money but ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my mother-law a couple weeks ago and we both love it. It cost a little more money but it is worth every dime. I bought a second one for myself. I had original bought another brand but it didn't work as well as the Cuisinart and I will say they make great products. The speed of heating water is just wonderful. You can never go wrong with a Cuisinart. I would highly recommend this product.

The temperature settings are so nice to have for different kinds of teas. As far as durability, my husband, not knowing how to open it, pulled the top cover trim piece off. He repaired it, and it still works perfectly!
Kettle started leaking water where handle connects to kettle itself. I wonder if that’s an issue with this particular model, never had this problem with electrical kettles before

This kettle works just as advertised, giving me 200-degree water that makes for smooth, tasty coffee. Controls are intuitive, i.e., reheat goes off when you are done, but only if you press it. Allows you to keep water at the selected temp for a while, before auto shut-off, but shuts off if you forget when done pouring. Handle is easy-grip and water gauge easy-read. Nice looking. Decent price. Recommended.

This kettle is straight forward and easy to use. I wish that I could turn on the light to see the fill level when I'm actually filling the kettle... other than that it works perfectly. I really appreciate the temperature settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: but my teas are coming out great. I'm confident it's in the ballpark
reviews.reviewText: Love-love-love this kettle. It's attractive, heats water relatively quickly, and keeps it warm for that second cuppa or whatever. I still fumble with the Keep Warm button from time to time, but that's my own inability to remember how the thing turns off. I've not tested the temp settings with a thermometer, but my teas are coming out great. I'm confident it's in the ballpark.
Great Teapot. Alittle difficult to dry the inside and it leaves a ring in the bottom. Makes great hot water quick.

This is our second Cuisinart cpk17. We loved the first one but it pooped out after a few years of continuous use. But this replacement has issues. When filling it up there is a delay the water level so you have to put the kettle on a flat surface and count to ten before you can see how much water you've put in. Generally the quality seems to have dropped.

reviews.reviewTitle: I knew nothing! Now I have perfect tea!
reviews.reviewText: I would buy this again! In a second! Amazing electric kettle. My tea is perfect every time! I did not even know the temperature was such an important thing for Tea until I bought this. Now all the research that I see online shows that I knew nothing! I would buy it again if mine broke today.

reviews.reviewTitle: Convenient, works well, and looks good to boot
reviews.reviewText:
When I get up in the morning I want a good cup of coffee with the least amount of fuss before my long commute or just relaxing on the weekends.

The 200 F feature works well for French press.

I prefill the night before, and press the button in the morning : great for bleary-eyed early wake-ups when still dark outside.

The lit up buttons are easy to see and work with.

The outside of the unit does get hot, so you have to be careful.

This is a solid good quality unit - despite made in China pedigree.

So far so good.

I make my French press coffee with this. No plastics touch the heating water. Pouring is not as easy as with a Hario kettle but this has the wireless heating element built in so I don't have to fire up the stove. Plus it has tempurature settings for various teas when I drink those.
Love this product. Works so well and I always have hot and warm tea/ whatever I need at the moment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle, except for the faulty lid that breaks.
reviews.reviewText: I'll keep this short, because who needs to read a novel? I really like this water heater, and find it works really well...BUT...whatever the part is that internally opens the lid (when you press the button on the handle) has broken shortly after purchasing two of these, leaving the kettles useless. If they fixed this issue, I'd definitely give it five stars. But, since it seems to be an issue, I won't be buying another, for obvious reasons:)

The kettle had worked very well for one year but suddenly it has one very annoying problem. The cap can not close. Once we push the open button to open it, the button stucks, making the cap retain in opening mode. It take about 45 minutes to recover. So once we open the cap to pour water in, we have to wait for almost an hour in order to start cooking water. We are busy working people, so this problem is very annoying to us. I will not recommend the product to the others.

Awesome electric tea kettle. Temperature is accurate. Heats water very quickly, and the feature to hold the temperature is very useful for multiple steepings of tea leaves. I have had 1 for home and 1 for work for over a year and they both still work great. I use for heating water for my Aeropress (for coffee) as well.
awesome! not even going to the big box stores anymore! just pick this one its top quality!
Replacing a kettle that was leaking. Easier to choose the perfect temp on this model for different teas. Heats up quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: One great item worth every penny you spend
reviews.reviewText: Got it today ! Tested it real great product works great and looks great . Highly recommended seller is great will recommend him to all

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this kettle. That is all
reviews.reviewText: Best kettle I've ever had. Very nice looking and very functional. I don't have the desire to test the various temp settings with a thermometer to see if the advertised temps are within acceptable +/- of my thermometer. It does however boil quick. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for one of the best if not the best electric kettles I've ever used. It would be nice if had a retractable base for the cord instead of the manual wrap function. It's nice that it is a feature though.
This thing is great I got it for my mom but I use it more for myself nowadays

This is the bet kettle I’ve found. Automatic. Convenient. Cordless device. Fast boiling.
Love it!!
