I LOVE THIS KETTLE! I'm a singer and the water stays at the temperature I set it to for my entire warm-up, 30 minutes! I don't have to keep turning the stove on and heating up the water over and over again. I also don't have to keep mixing hot and cold water to make the temperature I like.

I make the statement in the title based on having owned the Breville SK500XL, which was sturdy, beautiful, and had a great lid/button combo. But, what the Breville DIDN'T have are the features why we all bought the Cuisinart: variable water temp. and the 'Keep Warm' feature.

The Cuisinart is lighter, has a flimsier button, and the blue light in the water level display looks slightly tacky (why the need to pretend that this thing is from the future?).

So I give it a solid 4 starts for doing what it is supposed to do, even though the more brutish Breville is a better aesthetic addition to the kitchen.

Although I've had this kettle for a little over a month, I am extremely satisfied with the product thus far. It is intuitive, convenient, and heats up in a matter of minutes (depending on the temp. you choose. I love having the variety of temperature controls as I am primarily a tea drinker. I also love the lighted controls, the keep warm setting that automatically shuts off after 30 min., and blinking light that turns off once the water has reached the desired temp. This was definitely a worthwhile purchase.
It heats water quickly and is easy to use.
We only ever hit start and boil, but that function works perfectly! Has been reliable for the last few years. No issues

Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my husband, and WE love it!!! Much faster and more convenient than a kettle on the stove. I read quite a few reviews for similar products, but felt like this was best for what we wanted. Really like that you can set the temperature, as we use it to make a variety of teas and also coffee. Definitely recommend it to others.

This is the best kitchen purchase I've made in the last few years.

It's so convenient to just add water, press a button, and walk off -- knowing you're not going to burn the house down if you forget about it.

The temperature settings are really what sold me on the unit. I didn't want to have to program values in like some of the other devices require you to do. I just wanted to be able to put water in and press go. I get a cooler 160 degree setting and my wife gets her "remove the flesh from your hand" setting.

Everyone's commented on how nice it looks as well. I'm really loving this kettle.

I love this kettle! My first one lasted more than 2 years of multiple times a day use. I got very spoiled by it. I strayed and purchased a different kettle to replace it to save $30 but ended up very unhappy and had to process a return because it didn't function as nicely as the cuisinart kettle.

I love this kettle. I've had mine for a almost 2 years now. I also have bought it as a gift and they like it a lot also. I drink tea a lot and this fits my needs perfectly. It heats up quickly and gets to the right temperature and keeps it there. That's really nice when I want something other than black tea so I can heat to the right temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy, fill with water
reviews.reviewText: For a tea drinker who likes to drink a bunch of different varieties, this is the bomb. I don't claim to have the world's sharpest palate, but brewing the teas at the appropriate temperature really makes a noticeable difference. Quick and easy, fill with water, push the temperature, heats up quick, pour into your infuser cup. And since it has blue light, it looks cool on the counter lol...
This has literally changed my life!! Its so convenient and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: I agonized over which brand to buy and I love this one
reviews.reviewText: I agonized over which brand to buy and I love this one! It looks much neater and cleaner than some of the others and works perfectly. It only takes about 60 seconds to heat water for green tea. I haven't timed the higher temps because I don't drink those types of tea, but if anyone specifically wanted to know, I'd be willing to time it.

This is great! So much easier than using our stove/tea kettle, The temperature control and keep warm function makes it fast and easy to get the best results for my black tea and my husband's french press coffee at different temps. Really thoughtful design and excellent quality. We actually bought another one for our office after loving this so much at home!
Great tea kettle! Use it every day!

This kettle is indeed expensive, but you get what you pay for. It boils fast, the different temperature settings are a huge benefit when making various hot drinks and the 'keep warm' feature is superb. The fact that it is able to protect itself from dry boiling so effectively is also a major selling point.

I never would have thought that an electric kettle could be such a life-saver in the kitchen. You may ask, "Why do I need an electric kettle when I have a stovetop or microwave oven to boil water?" Well, put simply, this kettle boils water faster than either the stove or microwave (at least in my home). I use it every day. It's durable stainless steel throughout and a beautiful design. My only critique is that the audible signal that the water is boiling, or has reached it's desired temperature, is a pleasant, subtle tone. I would prefer a loud obnoxious one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was good for a while, but just stopped working after less than a year
reviews.reviewText: This seemed to me to be the best thing for heating water for my coffee. Then, after like 9 months, it just stopped working. It would not heat up water at all, but was still lit up as on. I junked it. Moved back to heating water on the stove with a thermometer to get that perfect temperature.

I've had other good electric hot water kettles in the past, but this is definitely the best I've had! I love how you can select different temperatures depending on what you are using the water for. The blue LED lighting lets you know quite clearly that it is still on. It maintains the temperature if you leave it on, which is great for those of us that get distracted. I have used it for a couple months now and have never noticed a plastic or chemical taste at all. Love this kettle!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... a year and a half and already at least horribly from the handle
reviews.reviewText: I’ve only had this for a year and a half and already at least horribly from the handle. I’ve tried filling it only halfway when I put it on the base, and I come back to most of the water being on the counter. No luck with customer service yet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Button fade and bottom of pot discoloration
reviews.reviewText: Use this exclusively everyday for making tea, testing with a thermostat and it is off by +/- 5 degrees it doesn't seem to rust but the bottom on the pot seems to have some discoloration and the button will fade fairly quickly. But overall it is fairly fast for boiling water to the correct temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: I loved my kettle but it didn't last a year
reviews.reviewText: I loved my kettle but it didn't last a year. I bought this in March of 2015 and here it is December 2016. The numbers have all rubbed off the buttons (minor irritation) and the spring to open the lid doesn't work. I'm super disappointed.

I bought one 4 years back and it was working like charm. A year ago my wife "washed" it and it went dead (honestly don't know what exactly she did). :)

The only con is the screws are non standard and I none of my screwdrivers opened it. I kinda wanted to check what's inside and maybe fix it.

Bought another one and happy with the product.

Works great and boils water in a decent time, but there are probably ones that do it a little faster. The Temperature settings, LED's and clear volume indicator are great. Does not retain the heat as well as I would like perhaps, but is otherwise a great kettle.

It just came today, and I made some a nice cup of green "gunpowder" tea, steeped at the perfect temperature! I can't imagine waiting there with a thermometer in scalding water for it to reduce to the optimal temperature for each specific type of tea I drink. It works great, looks great and is really a no-brainer. They couldn't have made it much simpler to use. Since I only just received it, I have nothing to add as far as down-the-road dependability, though there is a 3 year limited warranty.

One of my favorite and most used purchases in years! I use this every day and it has never given me a reason not to continue living it. It's easy to use, doesn't leave any metallic taste, heats fast, keeps water hot for a half hour, lovely on the counter, and holds a good amount of water. Overall I'm very pleased with this kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as advertised but buttons rub off and it takes a while to stop
reviews.reviewText: The temperature buttons have rubbed completely off and they are not textured so my mother is now going off memory for which button is "black tea" temperature and which button is to "boil" the water. It also seems to take a while to stop after it boils the water, I am not sure if it is a setting to turn on or off since I can not see the buttons. I wonder if cuisinart would replace this thing?

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the best tea kettle EVER
reviews.reviewText: This is the best tea kettle EVER! You cannot go wrong. It has different temperature gages for a variety of tea and different purposes. It will boil water rather quickly. Loved this product so much bought a few more as gifts.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Kettle, had mine for 4 years...
reviews.reviewText: Bought this 4 years ago and to date have had no problems. It's great for tea aficionados as it has settings for the different teas i.e. white, green, delicate etc. A total of 6 settings and there is also a setting to maintain the temperature for 30 minutes, this setting can also be switched off. I read it was one of Oprah's recommended products for 2013.
Very easy to use and refill.
we love this kettle, have had it for about 2 months now and it still going strong. Down side is the opening is kinda small so its hard to stick your hand in to clean it ...

I use this kettle every day for french press coffee and tea. It works great and gets the water to the right temperature. It's helpful to have the selection of water temperature presets. The right temperature actually makes a big difference, especially for french press coffee. It takes less time and energy than boiling water on the stove, and the beep is much better than the whistle of a regular kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: wouldn't know what to do without it
reviews.reviewText: It's difficult to remember what we did before we had this. My wife uses it mostly for coffee and I use it mostly for green tea. We use it a few times a day and having the different settings is great (and we use the boil setting for cooking). We might have to start bringing it on vacation because it's a big adjustment to be without it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is our favorite product for an e-kettle
reviews.reviewText: After less than one month the lid barely opens. This is our favorite product for an e-kettle. Bummer. Our old one lasted many years.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a good kettle but a waste to me
reviews.reviewText: It is a good kettle as others wrote. But I am not a tea lover so the different temperatures function makes no difference to me. And I hate the keep warm function. Because I have to press one more button to shut it off. I would rather use my old kettle (Aroma Hot H20 X-Press 1.5 Liter (6-Cup) Cordless Electric Water Kettle, Stainless Steel) which is half the price only.

Bought this for a Birthday gift.
He loves it. Uses it daily.

reviews.reviewTitle: My sons are in love with tea kettle.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because my teenage sons are in love with tea. We have a conventional stove-top kettle, but this is faster and more precise. When the package arrived my 13 year old tore into the package as if it was Christmas morning. He immediately made tea for the whole family and has every day since. The kettle is easy to use, clearly marked, and the various temperature settings make it so easy to prepare water for specific teas. This is a terrific product.
Great product great value

reviews.reviewTitle: We only put in filtered water (to reduce potential of ...
reviews.reviewText:
We only put in filtered water (to reduce potential of rust as some have noted), use the water as soon as the ringer goes, and empty it out/unplug it right after use. If you want to avoid being one of the few on here that have reported burning, then please do not return your kettle to a plugged in base after you pour the water out. The kettle will try to keep the water at the set temperature, but if there is no water left then your coils will just heat themselves.

Pour in water - > plug in - > heat up - > unplug -> use water
Perfect for all day tea drinker, and the fact that it is stainless love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the different temperature settings and the filter
reviews.reviewText: Love the different temperature settings and the filter! Much nicer than my last glass electric kettle that also created terrible white residue (minerals) that weren't filtered

reviews.reviewTitle: Arguably we have only had it about a month but we are very pleased with its appearance and its performance
reviews.reviewText: We have used this electric kettle every day, sometimes multiple times a day, ever since we received it in the mail. It has worked flawlessly so far. Arguably we have only had it about a month but we are very pleased with its appearance and its performance!!
Tea at a drop of a dime! super impressive how quickly it boils the water to the right setting. Easy to use and clean. Love it!

I love Teavana teas and they all have specific temperature instructions for brewing. This was my Christmas gift to myself to have just the right temperature for the tea I feel like. It is simple to use, and there is a warming feature that will keep your water at a certain temperature for that next perfect cup. Easy to clean and looks nice enough to leave out on the counter.

I am on my second kettle and the second one died after only 9 months. Looks nice but does not last. I can not get one of these kettles to last more than one year. The first one had a lid that broke and the second one has a panel that just blinks and cannot be set to heat the water. Better quality control is needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: and I also let the water cool to have sterilized water for my neti pot
reviews.reviewText: Oh yes. I have had fabulous tea all winter, and I also let the water cool to have sterilized water for my neti pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for quick heating of water
reviews.reviewText: Great for quick heating of water for tea. Can also be used for cup noodles and other foods that require hot/boiling water. My only complaint is that I wish it kept the water hot for longer before the auto shutoff.

For a tea lover, this is a wonderful product. No more guessing as to what temperature is required for a variety of tea choices. All easily there on the readout side panel. A friend whose husband loves green tea, marveled that with this acquisition, he'd actually tasted for the first time, what it should be. No more boiling for a gentler leaf need. My household is extremely happy with this.
I’ve had two in one year, one an original purchase and one a replacement. Both were detective.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have had this for almost 2 years. It ...
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for almost 2 years. It works every time I turn it on and does exactly what I ask of it. I make different types of teas and require different water temperatures. I also sometimes ask the pot to keep the water hot for upto an hour and it maintains that temperature. I rarely give 5 stars. This product gets one.
Good quality and good price

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. The lights make it easy to view and ...
reviews.reviewText:
Works great. The lights make it easy to view and select options.

The metal sides of this kettle get very hot when in use, so keep plastic bags and little hands away from it!

This is not a quality product. It does boil the water and keep it at temperature, which is why it gets a 2 star rating.

Initially this product was great, and invade no problems. However, lately the product has been introducing debris into my otherwise clean water. This was not as noticabke in tea as it was in my coffee. No matter how much I rinsed the product, even with filtered water, the debris did not cease. I believed this was from some piece that was loosening. Hopefully, it was just some harmless glue and not like caulk or something because, as I said, it wasn't very noticeable in tea and initially I mistook this for some issue with my milk. Then some little black pieces began to show and I knew that this was going back.

Cleaning was not very easy. The instructions say to wipe down after very use. I, however, had to let it air dry because my hands and several of my co-workers hands were too big to fit inside the unit. The scale filter obviously doesn't work either seeing as though those particles would make their way into my tea and coffee as evidenced by simply looking at the water in a clear glass, such as a french peess.

There are also lots of piece that are inside of this product and most of them are plastic. Some plastic glass looking thing covering a screw I guess. Plastic housing for the scale filter, plastic line fo something inside the unit. Plastic top inside, plastic holding the top inside. It seems far too complicated. There are also clips or fastener s that hold the base together at th bottom.

Very disappointed in the product.

It's also very loud. Even when not boiling water I can hear it clearly over the TV from 15 feet away.

reviews.reviewTitle: I suspect like most thing it is flashy but not designed to ...
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle lasted about 5 years of mostly daily use. About 6 months ago, it started not automatically shutting off and would boil dry. Then the over-temp sensor would kick in to shut it off. Now the element no longer heats.

I think getting 5 years out of is a decent value. I suspect like most thing it is flashy but not designed to last. I am going to try a different brand as a replacement.

I bought this to replace my other Cuisinart coffee/tea/hot water maker that had a tray where the water goes. It started to leak so I needed a new one. I got this because it's stainless steel and didn't take up much space. I love that I can pour the water directly into it and it doesn't take long to heat up the water. Also it keeps your water hot until you turn it off. I bought another one for work. Such a great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to boil water for tea!!!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this after I found out my folks had one & use it to boil their water for tea even though we both have a tea kettle for our stove tops as a backup. I think the buttons are a great feature & simply add the amount of water you need then select boil & start then before I know it's beeping which lets me know it is done. I do love this more than my stove top tea kettle as I do not have to worry about the water overflowing & pouring out onto the counter like I would using a stove top tea kettle. Definitely worth the money & was lucky to find it on here to purchase as I wasn't able to find it in my local store.
Works as advertised

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this automatic tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: I love this automatic tea kettle. I confirmed with a thermometer that it does heat the water to the temperature shown on the buttons. My only complaint about this is that I can't set custom temperatures but the ones they put on the device seem to be sufficient.
No complaints and having the variable temperatures is awesome! Looks good on the counter as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5L minimum water level requirement so if I'm only having a personal cup it can feel wasteful but the joy of having oolongs and w
reviews.reviewText: As a tea lover, this has been one of my most satisfying splurges. It does have a 0.5L minimum water level requirement so if I'm only having a personal cup it can feel wasteful but the joy of having oolongs and whites as easily as I can blacks has really been wonderful. Incredibly simple to use and it works very quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick boil, multiple temp settings, great product
reviews.reviewText: This is great for coffee and all types of tea. It has six or seven different temperature settings, unlike cheaper models, so you always get the right temperature for the tea you’re steeping. It’s also way faster than a stovetop kettle.
Keeps water hot. Easy to use. The different settings is great

I've had mine since 2011, and use it multiple times a day, unless I'm out of town. Green tea and coffee perfection temperatures. I really can't believe I still have the same one - no maintenance, no problems. Works great forever and ever, i guess. :)

Update: November 2017, this thing is finally kicking the bucket after 6 years of heavy, daily use. Numbers never wore off, so I'm thinking they starting making it differently after I bought this one. Worried a new one won't last as long. RIP Perfectemp, you served us well.

My husband uses this several times a day and loves it. It replaced a plastic one we had and I much prefer the stainless steel. However, it is a bit loud, but only bothers me if I'm trying to listen to something else. It heats up quickly so I don't mind it too much.

The Cuisinart is definitely one of the more sleek looking electric kettles on Amazon.com and it's function matches it's form. The keep warm function is especially helpful for making tea in the morning while getting ready for work.

When I submitted my order, I couldn't believe I actually spent eighty bucks on a kettle to warm water. However, as an avid tea drinker (of all sorts) and french press enthusiast, I have to say it is worth every penny. Very nice to have your water at just the perfect temp for what you need. This was a splurge and a birthday gift to myself - zero regrets! :)

This product is a total failure. For this price you should expect to use it for years and years but it's a shame I used it only for 2 days and it won't boil water anymore. It gives this hissing sound. I have bought cuisine art products before without any issues but this one is an epic failure.

Purchased as a replacement for a traditional looking Cuisinart kettle that I had for years. Actually two kettle since Cuisinart sent me a new one when I experienced problems with the first with no questions asked. I love the look of this pot, the settings and the less space it takes up on my counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a quality hotwater pot
reviews.reviewText: Great for tea or instant drinks or to heat up water fast.

Kettle leaks from the base just like other reviews indicate (from day 1). We contacted Cuisinart and the only option given to us was to return it for evaluation and replacement, including a $15 shipping and handling fee.

This worked great at first. Now it just barely heats the water to a boil. After it heats up the water it no longer maintains its temperature. Just shuts off after a minute or so. Really bummed I thought i would use this forever. I am just going to go back to a normal metal electric pot with one switch to turn off or on.

reviews.reviewTitle: The stainless steel (or whatever the outside is) collects fingerprints and streaks easily. Also if you empty it of water there .
reviews.reviewText:
Way overpriced.The stainless steel (or whatever the outside is) collects fingerprints and streaks easily. Also if you empty it of water there is always water left trapped at the bottom. Not sure if that's an issue but I leave it with the top open after attempting to dry the inside to avoid weird smells or mold...

Despite these irritable aspects, it does its job.

I've had this kettle for over a year and am very happy with it. It is both functional and beautifully styled.

Even better, I can report that Cuisinart stands behind their product: just recently, my kettle has developed an issue where it starts heating as soon as it is placed on the base - whether or not I pressed the start button. I just got off the phone with Cuisinart who guarantees this product for three years. They are shipping me a brand new kettle for the shipping cost of $15, and then I will return the old one at my cost. I think this is very fair. (My biggest concern was that they would make me ship the old kettle first, which would be extremely inconvenient, since I use it constantly.)

Between the functionality, style, and customer service, you cannot go wrong with this kettle.

After just a month of use[8 times max] this dont work as expected. And when I try to return the same they say its no longer eligible to return. I hate this product and would advice everyone not to buy this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... an electric kettle for some time now and am glad I bought this one
reviews.reviewText: I've been wanting an electric kettle for some time now and am glad I bought this one. Heats up quickly and holds the temp. The cord wraps around the base when not in use and looks great on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's easy to use and great!
reviews.reviewText: It's great.
Best product for tea lovers. Fast hearing and you can choose the temp for your water.
Very accurate and user friendly. Keep warm function is great. Eclipses other pots I have tried.

We use this for coffee, tea, hot chocolate and anything else that requires hot water! Well-built, stylish, it has numerous push button temperature selections, water level gauge, beep notification when the temp is reached and the ability to keep water warm as long as you want. The induction base is great so you don't have to unplug the AC cord to fill the pot or dispense hot water. Just remember to press the start button after you select the temperature!

This is truly a wonderful hot water heater for coffee and tea. I really like that it has the temps directly on the pot for perfectly brewing your beverages. The water level indicator is easy to see. It also has a nice feature of reheating the water at the selected temp automatically until you turn it off. Easy to use, easy to clean, works beautifully.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't last as long as it should at this price.
reviews.reviewText: It worked perfectly but here we are less than two years later with a kettle that has died. At this price, I'd expect it to last much longer. When it worked, it was great but, my big complaint is that here we are on on the market again.

We've had this product of a couple of months. It is used to make two 24 oz french press coffees every morning and it has made that task a pleasure. The 30 minute temp hold is fantastic as it allows my wife and I to go about our business getting ready for work without having to keep an eye on the water. The water heats up quickly, especially when I remember to fill the container with water the night before.

When my old tea kettle finally had enough, a friend recommended I invest in an electric kettle in order to save time and energy. Although somewhat skeptical, I have found this kettle to be a life saver! It saves me a ton of time in the morning (I make my own coffee via a pour over) and allows me to boil water in a snap at any time. Also, I really like that this kettle allows the user to select the temperature for the water. A great investment!

reviews.reviewTitle: This one is wonderful and simple and sturdy and it looks nice
reviews.reviewText: It heats quickly, and it works well with minimal maintenance. I will never buy a regular electric kettle again. Come to think of it, I will probably never use a non-electric kettle either, unless I'm camping or the power grid goes down for an extended period of time. This one is wonderful and simple and sturdy and it looks nice.

I love this! I am not a tea fanatic, but to have the right temperature for the different types of tea does make a difference. I like that it is so quick and I know it's much faster than a tea kettle on the stove. I also use the temperature feature for water for my bread machine and for cooking! Previous reviews didn't like the keep warm feature...hello...read the directions! It explains how to disable this feature if you don't want it. I will take it with me when we go camping. I use it at least once a day. It looks great setting on the kitchen counter and is easy to use. Definately a thumbs up!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great, but remember to turn it off!
reviews.reviewText: Great hot water heater, with two temperatures and a warmer. My only complaint is that as far as I can tell, it doesnt have an auto shut off. It goes to a warmer mode after it has boils. This is not terribly bad, and because of the light when its on warm and the low hum, It has never caused problems.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it. It's makes a small amount of sound ...
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of research before purchasing this item. I love it. It's makes a small amount of sound while heating, but it heats very fast! Several people had commented about the letters rubbing off on the control panel. I thought maybe it was because pouring would be awkward if your hand was below the buttons, but that is not the case. They may still rub off at some point, but I'm sure a permanent marker would take care of it. Great product.
Awesome

Works quickly and efficiently. It is quite heavy though by the time it is filled with water. I like the way it will hold temperature and it comes up to temp very fast. Attractive stainless steel with nice blue lighting including the water level. Recommended although expensive it is well worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Kettle for Tea and Coffee
reviews.reviewText:
I loved mine so much, I bought two.

The best feature is the ability to control the temperature of the water. I use mine to make cafe americano's from my espresso maker (200 degrees) as well as an assortment of teas, from green to black. Makes getting the right temperature very simple and the "Keep Warm" feature is perfect when drinking multiple cups of coffee in the mornings.

reviews.reviewTitle: It boils water very promptly and several temperature choices are amazing I love coffee
reviews.reviewText: I ordered it after I used it at my friend' home. It boils water very promptly and several temperature choices are amazing I love coffee, black tea & green tea as well as Chinese tea but I had never changed the temperature of hot water before! Now I can rely on this pot. I will keep using it, thank you!

I love this kettle. Easy to set 6 different temperatures, works quick, can be used for a small amount of water. Only drawback is the ready bell is not loud enough if you go into another room. Looks beautiful with its blue glow when turned on. I would recommend it to anyone.

1. The kettle is too heavy. I used to own a different brand all stainless steel kettle it it was much lighter.
2. The opening is too narrow to be able to clean the inside of the kettle - I'm a petite woman and my hand would not fit in

reviews.reviewTitle: The kettle has settings for everything- it's so nice to not have overheated water
reviews.reviewText: This kettle has features I would have never thought to wish for. We drink french press coffee and make tea every day. The kettle has settings for everything- it's so nice to not have overheated water. Also like that it keeps the water warm when you inevitably forget about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beep me when my tea is ready.
reviews.reviewText: This is a very high quality product. I can digitally select the temperature to bring the water to and it beeps when the water is ready. I use if a lot for making tea.
Super fast and quiet and versatile.

I've gone through two of these now--the first one was replaced through the warranty. They last about 4-6 months before they stop working. The first one had electrical problems and wouldn't heat--the second one started leaking out of the bottom when it did heat.

They work well in the beginning and I was happy using them almost everyday for coffee or tea. But I would not recommend them to anyone due to the consistent problems. Especially not when you're spending $80 or more.

Look elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: High quality, efficient, and quick water boiling
reviews.reviewText: I use this on my desk to boil tea, it's extremely fast at boiling water (takes only a minute or two). I love the keep warm settings and it looks super fancy as well. The entire thing is metal so you don't have to worry about plastic melting or anything like that.

Loving this kettle! I wanted something that could heat the water to several different temperatures, for brewing different types of tea. This definitely does the trick! It heats up the water quickly, and the keep warm feature is very useful. My only regret is that it is not completely 100% free of plastic. It is pretty close, however- most of the plastic parts are above the water line.

I have always wanted a kettle as I drink so much coffe and tea everyday while studying and I was hesitant to drop so much money but I'm glad I did. It boils water for a cup of tea extremely fast. Totally blown away. And the best part is that it is not made of plastic. I just don't feel comfortable with mixing boiling water and plastic. Since I bought this I stopped using my Keurig which was not cost effective for me as a student. And besides, french press coffee taste better than any of the coffee Keurig makes. Overall, very satisfied and it looks really good on my counter-top which sounds stupid but still is an added plus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, can be hard to clean.
reviews.reviewText:
We use it twice a day. It takes around 5 minutes to boil 1.5 liters of water.
I wish it was easier to tell how much water was in it while you're trying to fill it up and it is off the base.
Not the easiest thing to clean though.

It does it's job. I don't like that I can't place my thumb on the top of the handle without pushing buttons... it gets heavy to carry without thumb stability when it is full. But it is only a minor issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the best item I have ever gotten
reviews.reviewText: This is the best item I have ever gotten!!!!! I love tea and the different temps are great...It boils up very quickly and is very easy to keep clean. Just wipe it out with a paper towel. It is well worth the price if you like tea

Amazing tea kettle, after my induction burner quit working I purchased this as a replacement. I only used it for heating H2O in my kettle anyway. This is remarkably efficient, much faster heat up than induction burner+precision heat control+safety features.

reviews.reviewTitle: We especially love being able to choose the water temperature!
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle seemed gimmicky at first, but I've used all the features and love it!

The advantage of setting the temperature is really noticeable when making green tea (although, it doesn't prevent you from over steeping!)

It is easy to keep clean and aesthetically is a welcome addition to our kitchen counter.
Almost 5 years running, with multiple daily uses. Will definitely buy another when it eventually quits.

It works well enough, but we've been through 2 kettles in less than 3 years. The lid on the first one broke after about 6 months but was still usable. It started leaking water (so it lasted about 2 years). So we got another one and it's leaking after only about 7 months. So either I'm very unlucky or it's just not that well built.
I really like this water heater. The temperature control is handy when brewing teas which require a lower temperature. Keeping the water hot for 30 minutes is another plus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ideal for making a variety of teas
reviews.reviewText: We make a variety of teas -- white, green, black, oolong, rooibos -- all of which require different water temperatures. It was a big pain trying to use a stove-top kettle to get the right temperature. The Cuisinart electric kettle operates quickly and produces the correct water temperature to within 1-2 degrees. We have been using it daily for over 5 months now without any problems. The only (very minor) complaint I have is that the beeping when it reaches temperature could be louder.
We love our electric kettle and wouldn't be without it. Reluctant to give five stars until I know it will last more than two years, previous purchases of other brands always conk out too soon!

reviews.reviewTitle: still working fine, since I got it (forgot when)
reviews.reviewText: still working fine, since I got it (forgot when), been awhile. Only problem is me, I always set to highest boiling setting for all my tea drinks. Makes this pot pointless, but that's me, I drink different kinds of tea and have no idea what they are.
It's perfect quality, style, design and color. It's being almost 2 weeks that I am using it, but I can tell it's satisfactory.

reviews.reviewTitle: I did not know such a thing existed
reviews.reviewText: I surprised my husband with this for a gift for us on Christmas morning. $ is exceptionally tight and I was not sure this was the right thing to do as we were not even going to buy gifts for each other! We did need a new water hotter so I paid about $40 extra for this then I have for the others in the past. GREAT investment! we are daily French Press coffee drinkers and it is PERFECT. This is also excellent for making hot cocoa for our children as we can make it a much less hot temp with the lower temp buttons. We have noticed a difference in our coffee in the a.m. I cannot tell if it is the new French Press my mother in law get me for Christmas, this Cuisinart or a combination. GREAT investment. AND I got it at a discounted price:)
Fast hardly any waiting time

I had put off buying this for 2 years because of the expense, but finally did this year. I couldn't be happier that I did! I use it so much more than I imagined and it is a great product!! I use it for a variety of teas, I love the temperature varieties on it and now my green tea taste great!!! I use it when I drink some warm lemon water. I had a terrible cold and I was using it non stop to make warm lemon honey water and lots of tea. I use it to make coffee when I just want a cup and I even use the boiling function to sterilize samll items - such as tooth brushes. It has been simply great!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Only issue is that I like to nearly always empty out the kettle in-between heating ...
reviews.reviewText: Performs reliably and quietly. Only issue is that I like to nearly always empty out the kettle in-between heating sessions, in order to not have standing water at room temperature for any prolonged period of time in the kettle, in order to prevent microbial growth. The interior design of the kettle makes completely emptying the kettle of water challenging because of the many crevices and fissures in the kettle. This is a rather personal and unique issue to myself which most likely wouldn't affect or bother anyone.

I bought this from Amazon, and it started having the plastic smell.
I'm being told that I need to pay for shipping both ways to get it replaced!!!.
Barely lasted 12 months and died. Unacceptable for what's considered the best electric kettle on the market, no?

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent unit, well made, spot on temperatures
reviews.reviewText:
This was like the 4th water kettle I tried. I like it and i am keeping it. Works very well.
Good and solid. Easy to use. Sound electronics. Perfect temps. Tea tastes very smooth and has more flavor. Coffee is full and rich with no bite.
Handy tool for any dish where you want to preheat water.
I hope it lasts for years and years.
Gone are the days of waiting for the boiling tea kettle and spilling all over the kitchen. This is user friendly and faster than usain bolt. What an outstanding product. High tech but easy to use.

This kettle works well and is very attractive. It has a bunch of different temperature settings if you are a tea nut like me. Only problem is that if you don't manually turn it off after the water has boiled it'll keep reboiling until you do so.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would have given it five starts if it kept working...
reviews.reviewText:
This was used in my house several times a day, every day, for a little over two years (Purchased in Nov 2011).

And then it stopped working (Jan 2014).

I have no idea why, and I can't seem to find a place to repair it. It's pretty infuriating.

UPDATE: I contacted Cuisinart shortly after this review and they sent me a replacement a week later. The replacement has been working great, (thankfully! because I use this daily) - but I'm wary about the shelf life of this.

Bought it in December and 9 months later it stopped working. Talked to Cuisinart customer support and they said they will replace it, but it cost me $17 shipping plus a $10 money order made out to Cuisinart for return shipping.

Must admit that I loved the thing when it was working. Amazing for green/white tea where temperature is very important.

Also loved that fact that there is almost no plastic on the unit ( the see through part is plastic, but I don't think it was exposed to the heating element). This is relevant for people who are concerned about BPH.
Quality and ease with multiple temperatures
I'm must've gotten a good one. I use this to heat water for Green Tea and comes out perfect. No problems yet. I love it.
With the proper temperature, our coffee is now consistently delicious! Love this tool! Easy to use with the perfect functions.

This is a perfect kettle for avid tea drinkers like myself! I drink all sorts of different tea leaves that call for specific temperatures. This is why I picked this lovely device with the preset temperature controls! I absolutely love it! Heats up fast and I love how it doesn't contain any plastic in the product. 10 times better than my old plastic electric kettle that only boiled. Awesome - Awesome!
We love this kettle! It takes just a couple of minutes to heat water for tea, instant cereal, etc. Good variety of functions, different temps for different types of tea.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle. There are multiple different settings for coffee ...
reviews.reviewText:
Great kettle. There are multiple different settings for coffee and various forms of tea. The kettle will keep the water warm as needed.

The outside of the kettle is very easy to clean.

Had this for a month now and use it every day. Not showing any wear inside or out. No scaling or other issues. Granted I don't have hard water or water with a lot of minerals in it either. I occasionally hit the buttons on the handle while pouring but most of the time it has not been an issue. This thing heats water very fast and I love the fact it will keep it at the desired tempurature once it is heated.

Used this for about two weeks and meets my expectations so far. Used to be a breville stainless steel fan but the quality has gone down (you can see my review there). The most recent breville unit I received developed rust within a week on the top part where the lid rests on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Three separate failures immediately after warranty expired
reviews.reviewText: Purchased in March 2014. In the spring of 2017, the hinge developed a problem so that the top of the kettle wouldn't open fully. Then, it developed a small leak. Finally, it stopped heating water altogether. All three of these problems occurred within six months of the end of the warranty period.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bit expensive, but this is a must-have product for ...
reviews.reviewText: Bit expensive, but this is a must-have product for fans of hot drinks. It heats incredibly fast and without any effort at all; as well as keeps your drink at the temperature you want from it's selection.

My wife uses this daily for tea and just loves it. She's been using it for several months now and it works extremely well. It is a well built, high quality item and as an added touch, it also looks nice.

Although I have only had this kettle a short while, it has become one of my favorite appliances. I drink tea everyday nad brew 2 to 3 pots per day of different types. This kettle looks great, heats quickly and to precise temeratures for the different tea types. The kettle is easy to use and I believe it will provide many years of service. I was a bit skeptical about spending this much money on a tea kettle but so far I agree that it is worth every penny spent. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who enjoys the fine qualities of tea and drinks different varieties of tea.

I've had this product for a good while now and its been working perfectly. I use it frequently on a daily basis with no issues whatsoever. Its very easy to use and does the job for whatever kind of tea you may want to brew.
My sister had one of these and when I'd visit her, she'd make tea for me, I got one for myself and really enjoy it. Haven't had any issues with it in the time I've had it so far.
Works well. Loses a star because it should probably be better insulated; the outside gets too hot to touch.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was told kettle was in perfect condition but that's not the case
reviews.reviewText: Packaging was awful, kettle did not work. Tried every temperature setting and water was always room temperature. Was told kettle was in perfect condition but that's not the case, it's being returned.

reviews.reviewTitle: since I liked it so much
reviews.reviewText: I owned this kettle for several years till the interior got so much sediment that I decided to replace it (it still worked/works perfect). I also over the years bough this kettle several times as a gift, since I liked it so much. The one I bought last month obviously was a lemon. After two weeks of using it none of the buttons would work, so I had to return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Daily electric kettle user for 6 yrs. This unit is awesome.
reviews.reviewText:
Impressed with every aspect. I really like the temp control settings and stay warm button. The spill proof top is nice and it pours so precise and controllable. The ergonomics of the grip make it easy to use even when full.

Only possible improvement would be insulated, but that would drive the cost & weight.

As an avid tea-drinker, let me just say, I LOVE this thing! It is well worth the money spent. It heats up fast and is so handy. I use it practically every day. The only con I would say would be that the handle is a bit big to hold and a bit heavy when full, but not a big issue. I would definitely buy again.
I bought this kettle due to multiple temperature control. It has not disappointed.

Bought mine in May 2014 - As of January 2018 It has quit working...
It got very light usage and remained unplugged most of the time.

It is really sad to see how manufacturers do not have repair programs
that permit affordable/practical repair when something breaks beyond warranty...

The industry concept of disposable electronics should be a crime.
This kettle is attractive and easy to ease... a nice addition to my kitchen.
We have one for our home kitchen and one for our camping trailer. Excellent electric kettle! We've also given these as wedding gifts.
Only a month after this product was purchased, it started to leak from the bottom. Completely useless now and 3 days after the return date. What a waste of money.

This is great! I am renting and used to instant hot water in previous home. It takes a few minutes and does the job. Worth the price.

I loved this until today! I have used daily for six months and now it has just stopped. Currently looking for something else with longer shelf life!
Excellent. And works exactly as advertised. Need more honest sellers like this company

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for.
reviews.reviewText: We drink a lot of tea in my family. We are very happy with the Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp because it allows us to achieve the ideal taste of the tea while also saving energy. With our old kettles we boiled the water every time then letting it cool down to the temperature, which we estimated was correct. With this product we get our tea quicker, cheaper, and perceivably better.

reviews.reviewTitle: great kettle (both in quality and size)
reviews.reviewText:
I love this kettle, it's full featured and high quality...Only negative is it's very large (up to 1.7l; think about the 2l bottles of soda and you get an idea how large this is.) I'd pay the same amount for a kettle half the size with the same build quality and features.

The beep is quieter than the noise of the water boiling, so don't fret about the beeps.

I have used this product both at home and in the milking parlor for well over a year and find it to be powerful and convenient. Its metal construction means I do not have to worry about broken glass, and its 'Keep Hot' feature is an extra convenience. Con: we use it so much that we have worn the printed temperature legends off of some of the keys. Oh, well.

I am certainly enjoying my new Cuisinart CPK-17 electric kettle. I can fill it, and start it and it keeps the right temperature for 30 minutes. I don't have to deal watching a thermometer in a saucepan to get the right temperature for my green and white teas, either. The only problem I have is getting the right 2 cup amount of water for my little tea pot, as the measurement is in the metric system, and two cups is just above the access hole to the water gauge section. I have found a way around that, though. I use a measuring cup to transfer water from the tap to the kettle. No biggie. The lid is very easy to pop up (unlike my former electric kettle, which had a very difficult lid to secure). It also holds enough water to fill my big teapot, too. One kettle does all!

Use this for tea all the time. So much easier than a traditional kettle. Very easy to choose the correct water temperature for each kind of tea. It also keeps the temperature at your chosen level even after it beeps, so that you don't have to run over when it beeps. Also has a safely shut off.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... twice as long as the last brand at a better price.
reviews.reviewText: So far it has lasted twice as long as the last brand at a better price.
I owned this less than 15 months and it stopped heating properly. It warms the water but does not boil. I am very disappointed in Cuisinart, the quality has really slipped.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it. It would be GREATLY improved by making ...
reviews.reviewText:
This works exactly as intended. I love it.
It would be GREATLY improved by making it so you can select any temperature you want. Also the window should be on the side, or in the front so it is more visible. I'm very happy with this product despite these pretty obvious design features/bugs.

I wanted to drink tea, but it never tasted right. I always read "you have to cook tea at the right temperature to unlock the flavor," but I never seemed to get it right on my own. With this, I just select the kind of tea I'm making, and I know my tea will taste better.

LOVE this water pot! We use it every day, several times a day for coffee, tea, hot cocoa.... It heats up amazingly fast and maintains the heat. We mainly bought this to heat the water for the AeroPress that we recently bought. We like it so much that we use to heat water for a lot of different things! Well worth the money.

I waited for a year to write this review. This cattle is used every day and it works like a charm!
And half a year later I decided to get another one for my other home!
Still working great
Heating water
Works so well you forget what life is like without it. What is this microwave thingy and why did we ever warm up our water with it!
GooooD !!!

This Cuisinart kettle is powered by fifteen hundred watts and has a stainless steel exterior. Cuisinart is known for making the perfect kitchen products and this one is no different. It features 6 preset temperature settings to brew the perfect cup of tea or coffee. And it comes with a 3 year limited warranty.

It's extremely simple to use. The kettle has nice blue LED lights to indicate what setting is active and whether or not the water has finished heating. It can keep your water warm for up to 30 minutes, then it has an auto shutdown.

I've used it for more than three months and I can report that the quality is top notch. It never leaks, never pours incorrectly, and never fails to function. Don't waste money on a cheap kettle that will break in a few months. I highly recommend the Cusinart Electric Kettle.
Don't waste your money! Worked well for slightly over 3 years (just past the warranty cutoff...) now it boils water to a scalding lukewarm. For what I paid it should last longer than this.

Pro: Heats water fast, which is all I need.

Con: It keeps reboiling unless you remember to turn it off and there are multiple heat settings, so heats the water to a lower temperature unless you select the right button. ( It has eventually reset so that it usually defaults to boil, rather than 160°.) This gets irritating.

If you just want to hit a button and get boiling water, buy a simpler kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: the lid fell apart upon 1st opening
reviews.reviewText:
the kettle's lid fell off and apart upon first opening using the 'Open" button. The metal circle fell off and little spring and two plastic pieces flew astray. Such a combination of a Premium price and cheap Chinese quality leads me to conclusion to never again even try a Cusinart product.
My 5+ years old T-fal Vitesse still operates perfectly, it was just thew stainless steel look that I wanted instead of white plastic for the remodeled kitchen. Will look into other brands...

I make about 5-6 cups of tea a day. This works fine, but isn't durable enough. The writing on the buttons starts wearing off quickly. I had one replaced under warranty because stopped working after a while - the lights just blinked on and off. The second one had a jammed lid after a while and I was told I voided the warranty when I pried the lid open so I could use it again. So I burned through two units in about 18 months.
Love this for my tea and hot water for soups. I have 2 of these for both homes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Drinking more tea now that we have this. And ...
reviews.reviewText: Drinking more tea now that we have this. And purchased a french press since buying this as it heats to french press temp. Don't have to think about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: This product is amazing. I don't know how I managed without a ...
reviews.reviewText: This product is amazing. I don't know how I managed without a kettle before. I love making tea, but I also love pasta... I hate waiting for water to boil. I have found its much easier to boil the water in the kettle and transfer it to a preheated stove top pot when it finishes boiling :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Temperature slections wear off so quickly.
reviews.reviewText:
I won't buy another one of these kettles. I thought by paying a little extra I would get a good product and that it being Cuisinart.
Nope, It has often just stopped for no reason when in the process of heating to boil. No, it's not because it has reached its desired temp.
I have to keep looking a picture to remember the different temp settings.
It's an OK kettle when it does work but overall I am disappointed.
Great Christmas gift
My son loves this.

If you occasionally need to heat water and care mostly about appearance I would rate this product 4 stars for you. However, my family drinks mostly tea. If you also drink tea this product has 2 stars. For following reasons:
It is way noisier then my $20 GE cattle. It has poor interface design as a result buttons are often pressed inadvertently which sometime results in the kettle keeping the water hot through the hold day or till the water is gone. In the boiling mode my kettle boils the water for good 2 minutes that results in filling the kitchen with vapor and damaging the cabinet doors. At 170 degree it seems undershoot the temperature. The buttons sometimes stop working properly. I usually just remove it from the base and put it back to bring it back to a reasonable state.

So it is a nice kitchen furniture which can be occasionally used as an overpriced and overdesigned kettle.

Great for heating water for one or two people. I live alone, so it's ideal for me. Heats up quickly, maintains temperature well, and there are plenty of settings to choose from for a variety of hot beverages. I only use the Boil setting. You do have to descale it regularly, but that's to be expected. I just boil half vinegar/half water for 10 minutes and rinse. Easy. There is a bell/sound when water reaches temperature, but it's pretty quiet.

I don't drink tea very much but got this idea to use this product off Jamie Oliver's 15 min meals, always has hot water ready and saves time in prep work for cooking, have gotten many complements from people in my home that go in my kitchen think it is the best looking coffee pot they have seen,sorry to tell them not for coffee but hot tea

reviews.reviewTitle: This works marvelously. I am a teacher, and ...
reviews.reviewText: This works marvelously. I am a teacher, and it takes only a fraction of time that a coffee pot does. To me, time is everything.

So, this is probably one of the most interesting contraptions by Cuisinart. I am an avid tea-drinker, so this was the perfect choice. It is fairly easy to operate, and is very sleek in its design. However, the only reason I don't give it 5 full stars is that when I first purchased this, it did not work: it wouldn't heat the water properly. However, Amazon made it relatively simple to exchange it for a new one, and the new one I have now works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I completely love it! It's fast to heat up the water ...
reviews.reviewText: This is my first electric teapot. I read all the reviews and settled for this one because I could select different temps based on my tea. I completely love it! It's fast to heat up the water and keeps it warm. And the design is nice enough to leave it on my counter.
Excellent product! Heats water fast. Easy to use too!

Really good product except it only lasts 2 years. Bought this for my parents for Christmas 2011. As of Christmas 2013, it is not working and the parents have asked for another (different) electric kettle for Christmas. For reference, I have a more basic electric kettle that still works great after 4 years, will be getting one of those for the parents.

This kettle was great until it completely stopped working after about 5 months of use. Cuisinart was entirely unhelpful when I called as the manual suggested. I'll try online and through Amazing and hopefully have better luck.
Extremely fast, easy to use. So I hear the print wears off over time, that'll be a bummer it this is a fantastic product. I expected excellent and it exceeded.

I loved this kettle at first, but 6 months later it was rusted! The hinge on the inside the allows the lid to flip up is rusted. Once the water boils, condensation forms on this piece and drips back down into the kettle. The last thing that I want is to drink rusty water. I contacted Cuisinart and they said that they would only replace the kettle if I paid $15 to ship it back to them. I think that it is ridiculous to have to pay to ship a defective product back!

This was a wonderful product for 14 months. We alternate between Green and White tea with an occasional Black. We use to take the temperature of the water and let it adjust so that we could brew each tea at the proper temperature. This kettle was a godsend. Worked well but now it boils water on all temperatures and is two months out of warranty. We may call American Express since they add a year to the guarantee but we really do not want to take advantage of them. Most reviewers place reviews early in their experience, and we too would have rated it at five stars as many have, but seeing so many failures in the reviews accompanied with 20/20 hindsight one must purchase this item with the realization that they maybe replacing the kettle frequently and this becomes expensive.
I purchased this on 5/27/14 and it still heats up the water but it lost its bell that tells you when the temp reaches your setting.

This pot heats to the perfect temperature and keeps the water there for enough time to have a second cup. I love the blue light and the design which looks great on my countertop. It is, of course, heavier than the plastic models and does require some strength to lift, especially when full. I liked it so much I gave one to my mother as a gift!

reviews.reviewTitle: Make the perfect cup of tea
reviews.reviewText:
Make the perfect cup of tea. I never realized that brewing tea at the ideal temperature made a difference in the taste and overall experience.
Thank you.

This is a great kettle. However, I was looking for an all stainless steel kettle with no plastic components. It appeared to me that this kettle fit my requirements and it does not. There is a plastic piece on the inside of the spout that holds a small mesh filter in place. All water has to pass through this plastic. So if you are trying to avoid plastic, don't buy this kettle.
Works as advertised. Boils water fast. I love that the bottom is not hot and I can put it on any surface.
I had this kettle for one year and 3 months. It was great while it lasted. The lid broke recently and now it won't close. For the price, it should be more durable.
Worked great once I read the directions!!!! This is an upgrade from a $30 Aroma electric kettle. I felt decadent getting this, but I have really enjoyed its bells & whistles.

I've now had this for three years and it's amazing. If you use the aeropress which requires a lower temp water this is perfect. I drink a lot of tea and it's nice to brew it at 175 so that it's not too hot to drink - overall great purchase and if it ever dies I will buy another without hesitation
Wonderful product that performs as promised and looks good

reviews.reviewTitle: The keep warm feature is incredibly useful.
reviews.reviewText: I thought this was an impulse buy and that my wife would chastise me. After several months, I asked where this ranked on my hierarchy of purchases. It was darn near the top. She LOVES it. As do I. The keep warm feature is incredibly useful.

I liked this product, but gave it only 3 stars because it quit working after only a couple years of average usage. Boo. To be fair, my sister has the same model bought at the same time and hers is still working. I just didn't have the same luck.

Heat water for tea! Heat water for coffee (French press)! Heat water for ramen noodles and cook ramen in the microwave a lot quicker (to afford this, haha)! But love it! I even made a video of it and shared it to Facebook.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it for french press coffee and the temperature is perfect! Worth the money for me
reviews.reviewText: Quality product! Heavy duty cord. I first bought the Hamilton Beach version of this for $37. I lasted about 5 mouths :( . I've only had this a week but I can tell it will last for a long time!. I use it for french press coffee and the temperature is perfect! Worth the money for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: This a very quick and easy to use source of hot water for teas and ...
reviews.reviewText: We got this from Amazon to replace same model that died after 10 years use. This a very quick and easy to use source of hot water for teas and Aeropress coffee maker.
Love this product. Bought it for my sweetheart because I loved mine so much

It's quiet and quick, what else is there to say. Oh, water level can be monitored.
Very pleased with purchase.
Four star due to outer body temp gets hot too, and nothing is perfect.

Yes it has a lot of setting, BUT if you overfill the container, it will never boil. Also beyond the 3/4rds point this could take a while as well. Small glitches, but Cuisinart needs to address them for a perfect kettle.

Both myself and my wife are huge fans of Cuisinart items, own quite a few and never had an issue. One item broke down, we spoke with customer service, got it repaired and its good as new.
As soon we did see this electric kettle- no regrets, immediately bought it (we needed a replacement anyway).
Working nice and without an issue.

The kettles worked great for the four months before it broke. Furthermore, Cuisinarts "Limited" warranty means it it breaks, you are responsible for the shipping to and from their wear house which is almost a third of the price of the kettle to begin with. Buyer beware!

reviews.reviewTitle: Only lasted two years, I expect better from Cuisinart
reviews.reviewText: Great little unit except it died a little over two years later. I pay extra for quality so it will last longer than the cheap stuff. It was great while it worked, but disappointing it only lasted 2 years. I went with another brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: My wife love her new Cuisinart kettle
reviews.reviewText: My wife love her new Cuisinart kettle. It is sleek, efficient and functional. The fact that it lights up to show water level is very useful and we love the various temp/brewing temperature options! Highly recommend.
have been using it everyday! it's awesome

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Kettle - love multiple temp option - shuts off automatically.
reviews.reviewText: I use this kettle every day - several times a day for tea- drip coffee, baking, etc. Dependable and looks great on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: The only kitchen appliance that stays on my countertop every day.
reviews.reviewText: Heats water quickly, has all the required preset temperatures for tea and coffee. The only negative is that the fill indicator is only in liters so you need to be able to convert to cups. Not enough of a problem to take a star away.

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing gets really noisy when it's boiling the water ...
reviews.reviewText: This thing gets really noisy when it's boiling the water. Mine lasted two weeks before it started leaking water in the base. Returned for full refund.

We use this every day and usually many times a day! We use it for tea, soup, even boiling the water to cook pasta. The water boils super quickly - and it's fantastic to be able to heat the water to lower temperatures!

This particular purchase was a gift - we love ours so much that it has become our go-to gift for Weddings/House-warming/etc.
We loved it but it died 1.5 years after buying it. We've had $25 kettles last for years longer.
First experience this electric hot water pot my sisters house fell in love with it makes the best iced tea. Quick and efficient. sS glad I made the investment.
Constant beeping. Never warms correctly. Returned to buy a REAL Kettle.
It works and works fast. When I brewed a peach white tea I've brewed many times before I could tell it was a lot smoother.

I read a TON of reviews before I purchased this one. I'm completely satisfied. I use it a couple of times a day. The temperature settings are really cool, no, I have not stuck a thermometer in my tea to see if it's exactly 175 degrees, etc! Also, it's very pretty and that's important if it's going to be sitting out on my counter!

reviews.reviewTitle: Have been used it for less than two years, ...
reviews.reviewText: Have been used it for less than two years, it's out of order. The problem: 1 minute after hitting the start button, all LEDs went off and no heating at all.
I love it , very useful

I love this kettle with it's programmable modes for different kinds of tea. However after using it on a daily basis for more than a year it started malfunctioning. Contacted Cuisinart and they replaced it with a brand new one about 6 months ago. The new one works great so far.

I use this at least 5-6 times a day. I love the temperature buttons. I have not had the issue of writing wearing off the buttons. I have owned this for over a year. Well worth the owning if you drink alot of tea and are wanting to ensure the water temperature is right with no fuss.

The best tea pot made. Waite until I used it awhile before leaving a review. My very favorite kitchen appliance. I drink tea everyday
And this has made my life so simple. I highly recommend this to others and know you will love it too. Just perfect...

nice to be able to control the temp. of the water for different types of tea. Water stays hot for a long time. I don't usually want it to continue to reheat the water for 30 min. to keep at requested temp.so I have to remember to shut it off. I had a plastic one before this, after it died I decided not to get plastic again, the disadvantage is that the outside of this pot gets HOT, you can burn yourself if not careful.
I mainly use this to heat water for my French Press. It does everything I want!
This was very nice while it lasted, but it lasted less than a month. Darn.

So far we've been very happy with this kettle. We had the PerfecTemp stovetop kettle, which I liked, but had some issues. This is much better, and has been a great addition to our kitchen. It looks nice, it heats up pretty quickly, the capacity is good, and it pours well. We use it every day for coffee (Aeropress and French press) as well as tea and general cooking.

I bought this for my mom for Christmas and she loves it!! It works great, but you have to be careful not to touch the pot after you are finished boiling water and remember to push start to get it going. All in all, this is a great product and I would buy it again for myself in the future.

So I have had this kettle for about 6 months (purchased on Amazon). It is now broken and will not heat water. It was not dropped and handled very safely its entire (short) life.

I reached out to Cuisinart for help but never heard back so I figured I would warn others.

Other concerns...

The temperature settings are not entirely accurate. The setting for 190 degrees would only be 180 degrees when it poured into the mug, even with preheated mug, etc.

The labels for temperature settings wore off in a few months. There isn't any etching or imprints, just delicate paint that will wear off after you press it about 100 times.

Unless you press a button to cancel the "keep warm" function, it will constantly reheat which is just a waste of money. My wife could never remember to cancel the reheat.

Sounds like others have really great experiences but ours would be considered average when it was working and now that it is broken, abysmal.

Thanks.

7/24/13 - I did hear back from Cuisinart. They will repair it but I have to pay shipping. Not really please about the prospect of investing more money in a product if it may only last me another 6 months...

Does not last a year depite one easy job this device should do. I am beginning to think CuisinArt is only onvesting on SS bodies and uses cheap components inside. Happened with their otger stuff too so never buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great kettle. It heats up the water quickly and ...
reviews.reviewText: This is a great kettle. It heats up the water quickly and accurately. I have tested the temperature and it heats withing a degree or two of target. The only downside is the small opening at the top, which makes cleaning a bit difficult.

Clearly, the buttons were designed by someone who does not drink tea. Nevertheless, it's a good kettle with enough flexibility to make you shut up about the water temperature for your sensitive Biluo Chun and Longjing and Mao Feng.

The spout could be re-engineered to not pour like a drunk man pissing off a balcony.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wanted to love it, and even returned the one I got ...

This Cuisinart kettle has worked exceptionally well for all types of teas, for hot chocolate, and for my French press coffee. It has been a great purchase that was used constantly with our guests over the recent holidays.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is absolutely the best kettle I've ever owned
reviews.reviewText: This is absolutely the best kettle I've ever owned. I drink tea all day long everyday, and I love that I can fill it with water and just keep re-boiling it each time I want a new steep.

reviews.reviewTitle: I am a tea drinker and I love the different settings available
reviews.reviewText: I am a tea drinker and I love the different settings available. This is a really nice appliance. Works great and looks great on the counter.

I wanted to wait till I used this for a little bit before reviewing it. I love it so much. We had tea that was being wasted because boiling water too hot. This is perfect!
Ok we've had the Cuisinart Perfec Temp for two years now and we STILL LOVE it. I've never had any problems with it.

I hesitated buying this pot. Seemed to have too many options to fool with. Boy, was I wrong! I use all or most of the different heat settings for different teas & other beverages. Heats extremely quickly and can hold the temp well. Highly recommend this one. Well worth the price.
The most expensive water boiler and the worst, had it replaced by cuisnart 3 Times.. until the warranty ran out and it’s dead again after one year!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great improvement over our old single-temperature kettle
reviews.reviewText:
We're very happy with this kettle and can definitely recommend it.

Pros: easy to use, heats water quickly, easy to specify different temperatures for different kinds of tea (the tea types are written on the buttons), very sturdy, signal indicator is helpful, metal is safer than plastic, thick handle.

Cons: metal gets very hot so have to be careful to touch only the handle,
narrow opening means you need a tool (e.g., bottle-brush) to clean scale inside (we'll try vinegar as some have suggested).
super great item

reviews.reviewTitle: great quality, looks awesome and it is not the ...
reviews.reviewText: there is a reason for this kettle to be number 1, great quality, looks awesome and it is not the most expensive one

I loved it at first but in one month the button labels rubbed off, so it's a good to have the instructions handy in a drawer so you can refer to them if you need to get the water to a certain temp. The lid also is cheap, I have a problem getting it to open and close, seems to be off the hinge or something but it takes some effort to get it back on.

Would I buy one for someone else? No. Would I give this to a friend? No. I will just use it until I find a better one, more research. It works, but it is very flawed, and I do not think a tea kettle for just over $100 should be flawed.

EDIT: Bought this in March of 2013, today, September of 2014 I woke to a wet kitchen.
Come to find out, the kettle has a leak at the bottom by the handle. Water everywhere. Do NOT recommend
Best kettle I have owned. I love the ability to select water temperatures. The design is sleek and attractive to leave out on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really sleek looking and works as i imagined,
reviews.reviewText: Really sleek looking and works as i imagined, but I think the term "cordless" is an overstatement considering you still have to keep the base plugged in

reviews.reviewTitle: We love this! It has made a difference in our ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this! Great addiction to our family
reviews.reviewText: Love this! Great addiction to our family. My husband can get the water to temp for his coffee and I can get the water to temp for my hot tea. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

I love this kettle! Bought it because the reviews were great, and I am glad I spent the extra money! The various temperature settings are a real plus, and I appreciate the timer and warmth settings as well. Looks fine on the counter when you want to leave it out. Great product!

Going on a year now of almost daily use and I love it. I use it to heat the water for my french press and on occasion to heat water for my hot water bottle when I have a bad headache. So far the numbers have not worn off of it

This is a very efficient kettle. Boils quickly and turns off (or optionally keeps temp) once heated to the target temp or boiled.

Allows several temperatures to be selected for different types of tea.

Cuisinart have corrected some of the base station problems that existed with the product this replaced.

The kettle is great for making various types of teas that require lower temperstures. Unfortunately the quality is far from perfect. The mechanism which operates to top cap broke within a month of service and after 1.5 year the kettle died completely...
I love the many features and how quickly it heats up the water. Top quality!

What a device. You would not believe that someone actually spend some thought on designing it's functionality.
And i am still wondering if they have, or if it was a sample product manufactured on blueprints from a 7th grade student project.
First of all: Who likes his kitchen being light up by blue light if your water boiler is plugged in? Hands up please! I count zero.
Unless you dont have lights in your kitchen - (a problem in it self, i guess) this may be a useful device.
Secondly: A memory function to continue boiling my water as i left it off? Please! I take it off, i want it to cool down. I want it to re-heat: I push the button to re-heat. I don't like (super dumb) artificial intelligence in my water boiler.
Third: look at all these nice stains you get when touching it! A criminal scientists dream - but not mine.
You may be able to handle the device without fingertips - if you are good with your elbows, have supernatural powers or wear gloves all day.
Me - none of the mentioned - hence i spent more time cleaning the damn thing than using it.
Fourth: after you have done your water this ingenious device keeps lighted. Is it a sign of pride of having done such a great job of boiling that water? Must be - because it completely beats me why anyone would want his kettle light up after use. (Ok - the folks without kitchen lights maybe).

Oh Fifth: The thing actually broke after day 4. It would continue boiling after the water was heated, and beep like mad because you actually used it for what you have bought it for - boiling water and using the water, once it is boiled. I understand that this is a use case the designers of this
ingenious masterpiece clearly did not have in mind (Kitchen lamps were haunting their minds!) - so maybe it wasn't broken but it worked as designed.Now this could again be a design feature - i simply call it broken. And am extremely happy to have returned this piece of
completely useless junk.

After all - it did actually boil water. But i just cannot be asked to give it a second star for it, as there are so many products out there that do
that for a quarter of the price - and they actually work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smart electric pot for the Tea Drinker
reviews.reviewText: What's not to love about a water heating pot that you can select your temperature based on the type of loose tea that you are drinking. reviews.reviewTitle: I love it. Even if it would break I would ...
