Stains easily

reviews.reviewTitle: Great if you're an Aeropress user
reviews.reviewText:
I asked for the Cuisinart CPK-17 for Christmas because I've taken to making coffee with an AeroPress. If you're enough of a coffee nerd to make coffee with an aeropress or a French Press, you're almost certainly enough of a coffee nerd to be concerned about the precise temperature of the water you're using.

You can of course boil water either on the stove or in a microwave, but then you have to wait for the water to cool to your target temperature, which can be slow and annoying. Neither the stove or the microwave is going to maintain your water at your desired temperature either, so if you're making several cups with an Aeropress, there's the additional inconvenience of re-heating the water to the right temperature with each batch.

Enter the CPK-17. It heats the water to a precise temperature, selectable from 160, 175, 185, 190, 200, or boiling, and it beeps and stops when it gets there. It keeps the water at that temperature for as long as you might like. It's fairly fast - it took just under 3 minutes to heat 1 liter of water 80 degrees F, from tap-water hot (105) to 185. I've found this so much more convenient than boiling water and then watching a thermometer.

Another reviewer complained that it 7.5 minutes to boil 1.5 liters of cold water. The point of this kettle isn't to be the fastest, it's to reach a precise temperature and stop, rather than going all the way to boiling. You can also save yourself some time overall by starting with hot tap water instead of cold. In any case, I'm finding that I'm never really waiting on the kettle. Other stuff like grinding the beans and getting out the Aeropress always seems to eat up enough time that the kettle is ready before I am.

When I first got this, I loved the different temperatures. But as time went on, I realized I never used the other options. The thing that gets this a one star rating is the fact that less than a year in, it's leaking water from the bottom of the kettle. Everywhere. And while it's covered under a warranty, I don't want to pay shipping to "rent" another one of these for 10 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle that could be improved
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the metallic cherry red one a year ago and it has not missed a bit. The sheer number of reviews is testimony what a great kettle this is so I'll pass quickly through why this is a great kettle then focusing how it could be the greatest. Firstly this works as advertised, it's safe all around to accidental touch. The excellent temperature control ensures the water gets to the right temperature, the boiling water makes a fair amount of noise but it switches off just before spouting out steam. The spout is the best is the best I've seen without a dribble, my unit's wet area components are all all stainless steel with no rust traces. Boiling anti-scale agents leave an as new interior and the spout scale filter is effective & easy to clean.
Now the the missing 5th star reasons:
-The handle is unnecessarily chunky, I am big guy but that handle is a handful making it less user friendly for ladies and kids, if the circumference was juts half inch less it would have been a perfect handle.
-The short power cord is extremely stiff relative to the light base, the random shape cord is unsightly and impossible to "train" into a new shape. Flexible similar rated cords do exist and it would make it easier to tuck the excess into the base while shaping the visible bit into something less conspicuous.
-The control buttons outlines are lit but not the text/functions. During the day it's no problem but in a darker space it's impossible to identify the buttons unless their locations are learned. Other kettles light right through the button's text indicating clearly the selected function, however those kettles were poor performers in supplying hassle free hot water (over boiling, steam, spout dribble, hard to clean).

This kettle stopped working. It makes a loud noise like an alarm. I contacted customer service and asked for help. I offered to pay for the repairs and they said they can’t repair it or do anything about it.

I have been using this kettle every day for about three years now. As a tea enthusiast, it's essential that I control the steeping temperature. This kettle has never let me down. It heats water faster than the microwave, and relieves me from having to figure out the best cooking time for desired temperature and amount of water. It is built to last; I have had zero issues with it.

This unit would be more perfect if the minimum fill level were one cup. If I'm only making one cup, the excess amount of water that has to be heated can waste a lot of energy over time. However, the minimum fill level is exactly enough to fill my Contigo mug, so only heating one cup's worth is a rare occurrence for me.

Do not hesitate to buy this if you are a tea drinker! If not, it's a tough decision. If you're a coffee enthusiast, you may appreciate some of the settings. It also comes in handy for hot cocoa, allowing you to mix at a lower temperature than boiling, so your cocoa is ready to drink faster and is arguably safer to hand to the kids. It's a judgement call on your part.

reviews.reviewTitle: After two years, labels started to fade...
reviews.reviewText: I was expecting this product to be "pristine" after at least 4 years of mild use (I've used this kettle just once a day as much). However, most of the labels printed in the buttons are fading (and I have not used any chemical to clean it). Check my customer's image.

It's nice water heater with one significant drawback.

Once you've heated your water and it beeps and you place the cooker back on the plate, it continues to boil the water as if the task isn't complete.
There's no off button so you have to take it off the dumb plate to turn it off.

This is a pretty big deficiency from my 3 year old one that doesn't do this.
I'm wondering why we took such a big step backwards.

It was a gift and I won't return it for an exchange because it's an otherwise good water heater but I'm really confused why they thought the product was adequate with this problem.

After booking water, if you leave the water in it, its outside temperature is more than 180F. The photo shows 174F because I couldnt hold longer, I then saw 183F. Also it is not by any means faster than T-Fal Vitesses kettle I bought 10 years ago. It boils 1.5 liters in 6 min 35 seconds, versus T-Fal boiled in 6 minutes 10 seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not quite a perfect tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: Up until two weeks ago I would have given this five stars. It is very convenient and easy to use, with recommended temps for various teas and one for French press coffee, plus boil. I use it strictly for coffee, my wife for tea. It is very quick. French Press is 200 degrees, but I prefer the setting of 185 degrees, which I find perfect for easy sipping without having the first few sips too hot. I use a thermal,mug which keeps my coffee the perfect temp from beginning to end. After using it for about 8 months the hinged lid fell completely apart which kept the lid from staying closed on it's own. We needed to place a weight on it to get the water to heat. I called Cuisinart and they informed me that they would replace it if I would pay them $15 for postage. They also wanted me to return the broken unit in the same box that the new pot was sent in. I received it today and discovered that they expect me to pay the postage on returning the broken unit. I also discovered that the new unit assumes the warranty of the original pot, while I assumed the new pot would have it's own warranty. If you have no problems this is a great way to get the perfect temperature for a hot beverage. I so prefer the ability to brew my beverage to an accurate temperature. If you have an issue though, consider the added expense of replacing it for the limited time of your remaining warranty.

I have used only the highest temperature almost 2 years. One year after I used, the characters showing on the button had started blurred and eventually gone after a year. At the exactly 2years, it started beeping and did not work at all. I unplugged to try to reset it though; it did not work any more. It is supposed to last only for 2 years? Some people experienced the same problem way earlier than mine. So I might have been lucky than them, but definitely I was unluckier than most of people who have gotten the good piece.

However, as far as rust goes, this piece remained very good condition inside. It was still beautiful and was no stain after 2 years of use though,,,
Oh well, it did not work any more. What was a waste!
It is still workable condition at the kettle side, but it seemed to me the inside connection of the plate got electric short or so. Does anyone know how to fix it? Oh, well, I have to dispose this unfortunately.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Only Source of Hot Water For the Past Month
reviews.reviewText:
This kettle has been my only source of hot water for the past month. Between moving into a place that wasn't fully ready, Mardis Gras, and the previous occupant of my house having damaged the gas lines I still haven't gotten my gas turned on. I originally bought this to use with my french press and to make tea, but it has turned into an impromptu bath and shaving water heater for the past month. It's brought about 4 or 5 gallons of water a day to a rolling boil, 1.7 liters at a time, every day for the past month and it is still working great! I don't know if what I'm doing to it counts as abuse or not, but it's definitely beyond what it's designed to do and it still holds up and still heats water to the right temperature on lower settings for when I want to make tea.

If I do manage to break it I will definitely be buying another one. It's a household essential for me at this point.

I drink tea on a daily basis and been using this tea pot for years. I just got another one as a Christmas gift so I had to comment.
I am very happy in the time it takes to heat. The temperature settings are very close to the selected button, (within a degree or two). S you know many teas have a different temperature for optimal taste and brew. This tea pot has lasted far beyond any other I have bought.
It is a bit higher in price but well worth it.
I love the fact that I can plug it in and set it anywhere, the footprint is very small so it was easy to leave it sit on my counter.

This kettle is a serious fire hazard! Although I purchased it because I am a senior and it made sense to not worry about forgetting a kettle on the stove,the last couple of times I used the kettle I noted a mild smell of electrical wires burning. I couldn't identify the source and thought it must be my imagination. I'd used the kettle successfully for two months. Two days ago I boiled water for coffee. I DISCONNECTED the kettle from the base and UNPLUGGED the base because I was uneasy about the smell. I went out to clear ice off my car. I returned fifteen minutes later and the fire alarms in my house were all sounding. The house was filled with toxic smelling smoke. i went into the kitchen to see the plastic handle of the kettle shooting flames with flames coming from the plastic along the base of the kettle! I doused the flames but had I come in 60 seconds later the fire would have spread. Clearly the interior wires in the handle must have been smoldering when I went outside and later ignited the highly flammable plastic. I have looked up Cuisinart products since, and discovered that is a serious problem with some of their other electric kitchen appliances. The house was so smoke-infested that even when I opened all doors and windows, the alarms continued for 15 minutes! I had the strange ash the burning plastic produced all over surfaces - my books - my windowsills. And what I worse, I am coughing and coughing still from whatever I inhaled.

THIS PRODUCT NEEDS TO BE TAKEN OFF THE MARKET! It is unsafe! Even if it worked well for a few months, its life is short and unpredictable. I could have lost my house!

I looked at several kettles before purchasing and decided that I wanted one that was stainless steel and had variable temps for my different teas. I chose this kettle because it was a bit more reasonably priced than the competitor. There were only a couple issues raised in other reviews that I wanted to address.

1) Some reviews state that this kettle will boil the water for a minute or two before beeping and turning off. My kettle boils for only a few seconds, maybe 10 seconds at most, before it beeps and turns off. I live at sea level. I think perhaps the elevation at which you're using this does make a difference since the kettle senses the temp, but at higher elevations water will boil at slightly lower temps ( ~208* above 2000 ft elevation) and therefore will boil for a minute or two before reaching 212* which triggers the sensor to turn off. I would think this would be an issue with all kettles for anyone living at higher altitudes and is not unique to this kettle.

2) Many reviews state that the water pour is funny for the last cup or so. This is partly true. It does trickle the last tiny bit of water out, but only a fraction of a cup, nowhere near an entire cup. I have not removed the scale filter to try it without because this is not bothersome for me.

I have been very happy with this kettle so far and definitely recommend it. My jasmine pearl green tea has been even more delicious at the proper temperature without any fuss. It is easy to use and does everything advertised. If that changes in the future I'll update this review to make sure it's accurate.

The kettle is great because we can choose the temperature. I am a tea drinker so this is a fantastic feature and on top of it, it stops cooking after reaching a certain temperature. We have had this item for a year and it is still working. Sometimes it doesn't work smoothly and turns off by itself which is annoying but I just press the temperature button again and it boils the water again. One major flaw which is why I'm giving it (3) stars instead of higher, it has RUSTED on the bottom. Unsure how safe it is to drink rust water?

reviews.reviewTitle: Before Buying This Adequate Kettle, You Need to Know This:
reviews.reviewText:
The programmable tea kettle works as advertised. The issue raised by other reviewers that the markings wear off the buttons is correct. That said, the kettle deserves at least four stars, so what's my problem?

Cuisinart's customer service, that's what. After a year and a half-- the kettle carries a three year warranty-- the lid would no longer open and was unrepairable. Contacting Cuisinart's customer service, I received a prompt reply requesting more information from representative A. Shortly received a duplicate request from representatives B and C. Responded the next day with requested information. A few days later, received a short form letter from representative C stating that since I'd not attached previous emails, they were unable to continue processing the claim as they "...delete emails at the end of every day to save space on our server."

'Scuse me? Emails, even hundreds of them take very little space and IMHO it would make much more sense to file emails (many email clients already allow viewing emails by thread) in such manner as to render them easily searchable and retrievable to facilitate easy continuation of a warranty claim.

OK, my eclectic, logic-addled viewpoint aside, I cooperated and provided an email with all requested information, previous correspondences. Sent that and heard nothing back from Cuisinart-- neither representative A, B, or C-- for 48 hours.

Attempting to call, one is greeted with an extended explanation of where one might find the serial and model numbers on a variety of Cuisinart products, after which the caller is presented with four choices, none of which applied in my case, so chose number five, causing a repetition of the instructions on finding the serial and model numbers followed by the helpful information that customer service representatives were busy and that wait times "...currently exceed five minutes."

Quite frankly, it seems like the runaround-- like Cuisinart is not genuinely dedicated to after-sales service of their products, despite their apparently generous warranties. The politician is brought to mind, who, once elected, promptly forgets fervid campaign promises to constituents. Here we have the first tea kettle elected to public office, apparently.

Quite a contrast to a recent exchange with Bonavita about one of their teapots wherein after providing them with serial number, model, and so on, by filling out an online form, they quickly provided a replacement. (Oddly, our office pot developed a similar issue to that of our home kitchen Cuisinart kettle-- namely that the lid stopped opening properly.)

It seems that Cuisinart is not as dedicated to customer satisfaction as their guarantee would imply as their response to inquiries falls far short of the mark when it comes to expediently addressing after-purchase concerns. There is a lot of room for improvement here, Cuisinart.

I'll amend this post once (if) I receive a response to my most recent request for a repair or replacement of the broken kettle. As it stands, two stars for the quality of the kettle, which is generally good, and minus three stars for the poor followup by Cuisinart's customer service department.

Stay tuned, fellow tea drinkers, for further developments in this case...

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a good product while it lasts, which is not very long
reviews.reviewText: My wife bought from Teevanna for me a cuisinart kettle CPK-17 for Christmas, 2014, which lasted about 3 months when it started lighting up without heating anything. My wife did not keep the receipt. So, the warranty period started from the manufacturing date over 9 months prior to the purchase date, putting the kettle outside the one year warranty period. Even in the warranty period, you have to mail back the kettle at your own expense to get a new one. In any event, I would not have really wanted a new replacement, since too many reviews give the same litany: it's great while it lasts, but it does not last very long. The customer service person was very nice and professional, but she could not help me with my essential problem of having paid $99.00 for a product that lasted three months. It would be a great product if it did not have a durability problem, according to my experience and many online reviews. I would have researched before buying but did not have that option as it was a gift. My impression with Cuisinart on the phone is that if they can pull a technicality on you to save money, they will. I don't think Cuisinart cares much about its goodwill regarding the quality of its products. Cuisine should not be so technical when a product has some sort of general problem. From my experience, I will never buy a Cusisnart product again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was very happy with all its functions
reviews.reviewText: I got this product as a gift and have been using it extensively for two years. Was very happy with all its functions. But yesterday it suddenly stopped heating the water. The lights are on and blinking as usually, but water is not heating at all. I called Cuisinart to check if I can still repair it on the warranty (it's 3 yrs manufacturer warranty), but since I did not have a proof of purchase (it was a gift) they had to go by the date of manufacture, which is conveniently just over three years now... So, my suggestion to the prospective buyers - make sure you keep your receipt for 3 years! It's pretty expensive product for such a limited useful life!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... years and have used it almost every day for excellent french press coffee or loose leaf tea
reviews.reviewText: I've had this for four years and have used it almost every day for excellent french press coffee or loose leaf tea. I also use it to heat the water for hot cereal, baby food, etc. It's just great, a real pleasure to use. I love the ease of it, that you can choose the temp you want, that it heats quickly and then holds your water at the proper temp until you can get back over to the kettle. When mine quits, I'll buy another one. I can't imagine having a different kettle anymore...my mother has a fancy stove top one that was way more expensive than this, but this is so much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mediocre kettle, happy about long warranty, not happy about rust for the price
reviews.reviewText: Most expensive kettle I've owned, more than double the price of the last one, and within 3 days it had rusted on the inside. While the discoloration isn't poisonous, I'm surprised something this "premium" is built with the poorest materials. My previous Ovente kettle looked this rusted after a year but started to leak from where the bottom of the handle was attached thus the replacement. Other than the rust, the Cuisinart looks and boils alright, and the "keep warm" setting is useful for people like me who get distracted and remember much later that they started making tea. I'm happy that it comes with a 3 year warranty, which is more than most, just in case I have issues down the line.

Pros: - The temperature variety was nice, as we have both a tea and a french press drinker in the family.
- It feels pretty nice in the hand.
Cons: - The filter and filter holder caused the water to pour out in two or three streams, not one uniform stream.
- It regularly didn't sense the water level accurately. When this happened, it wouldn't activate then would beep and flash to indicate there was not enough water. The only way to restart the process was to unplug and re-plug.
- It took quite awhile to boil (a lot longer than our previous simpler Cuisinart kettle), and a good bit of water boiled off.
We ended up returning it and getting a Chef's Choice 681 Cordless Electric Kettle.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVED it. It quickly warmed my water to a ...
reviews.reviewText: this product *almost* got four stars. I LOVED it. It quickly warmed my water to a variety of temperatures for my beverages. The beep was not obnoxious. Everything was wonderful. Until, 70 days after purchase, the hinge broke. I can no longer open the lid to add water. I contacted Cuisinart for a replacement. The item is well within the one year manufacturer defect. However, I cannot get a replacement unless I pay $15 for shipping and handling. I would think a $100 item would at least enable me to return it without penalty, especially for manufacturer defect.

A lot of good reviewers already touched base on its key features. So I'm just adding my rating, as an owner of this kettle. I've had it for about 8 months. Usage include daily black tea and sometimes French press and green tea.

For cooking (heat large amount of water), this gadget is indispensable! I often heat up a small amount of water on the stove and with this thing heating up a whole pot of boiling water at the same time -- cutting down the time it takes for the stove to work solo.

Girlfriend's sister also bought one per our recommendation. She loves it too.

UPDATE: This morning my girlfriend says -- this tea kettle is acting weird. I took a look, the auto shutoff is broken. That is, when tea kettle is plugged in, it will boil the contents regardless if you have selected a setting or not. Ghost... Anyway. It is STILL the best kettle around. I ordered it on 12/27/2010 and today's date is 3/7/2012. Cuisinart's product page [...] specifies a 3 year limited warranty.

I had mine for some time, the decals worn off....no big deal, but eventually it developed a leak at the bottom of the handle where it connects to the kettle and that eventually caused something to short and now it is kaputz. also surprisingly though stainless I got some rust on the bottom inside. Looking into fixing it but few parts are available . I sure did enjoy its functionality while it worked. I'm considering buying another.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart is now owned by Conair/ Warranty stinks
reviews.reviewText:
I hardly ever used my Kettle, maybe once a month to boil water for jello, it stopped heating 30 months into the 36 month warranty. CS wanted $15 up front, then they wanted me to pay to ship it to them, I said no way, we haggled, they waived the $15, I check'd the postage fee $8.90 so decided it was worth it, got a brand new Kettle a couple days after sending back the old broken one...Imagine my surprise when I read the invoice & the NEW Kettle is warranted by the old Kettles 3 yr. warranty which expires this Dec. 2013. This makes no sense, it is brand new, not refurbished, came with all the warranty papers, even let me register it online. I called & CS said that is their policy, so I said well if I went to a store & bought the same Kettle, then returned the one you sent in it's place it would have a different serial # and then the 3 yr warranty would be ok right,....long pause & she did not answer me.
I didn't do that cause I have had enough grief from this company, but that is the way around the new vs old warranty.

I love the features of this kettle and it boils very fast. However, after 5 months of use the bottom started leaking where the stainless steel meets the plastic base. Could not return to the retailer I purchased it from since I didn't have the original receipt. Contacted Cuisinart and they said they would replace it but I must pay for shipping both ways. Disappointed since this is a pricey item to begin with. I had a Chef's Choice kettle that was much cheaper for over 10 years and it still worked as good as they day I got it. Unfortunately I gave the Chef's Choice one to my sister. Wish I still had it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lid busted off and now the whole thing is garbage.
reviews.reviewText: It worked great till I spit out a little black plastic thing while drinking tea. I eventually figured out that little piece was holding the lid in place. I could have easily swallowed the damn thing. Also, the kettle is now garbage now the lid does not go down. It looks fancy but the quality is not.

reviews.reviewTitle: but seemed like too much effort to return
reviews.reviewText:
Lid didn't open correctly, but seemed like too much effort to return. Otherwise, worked fine for a year. Now it just blinks impotently.

I also had a garbage Cuisinart coffee grinder I had for a year before it died. I'm starting to sense a trend. More chinese garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice kettle, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this from another vendor over Black Friday. After using it for a few days, I must say I am impressed. The design is very nice. The blue lighting makes it beautiful. The push buttons are soft and the settings for various tea options are great. It is even lighter than an Aroma kettle that this one replaced. All steel looks is neat. Now having praised this, it better last. This is a pricey model and I don't want to throw it away after just one yr. I will return to edit my post if it fails to work sooner than expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: It served us well more than 6 years
reviews.reviewText: We bought this kettle more than 6 years ago and I had a lot of fond memories of it. We are tea drinkers and this kettle had a lot of daily use as well as some abuse like running it with little water in it. Finally low water sensor gave up three days ago. I started to look for a replacement, got Oster temperature programmable kettle at local Target but I just couldn't get used to it. I really like that this Cuisinart kettle has a conveniently located button to open the lead with a thumb while holding the kettle and using the other hand to pour in water. The outlet of this kettle is very wide so you can pour out boiling water quickly. Also unlike other temperature programmable kettles which have annoying red LEDs to light up temperature buttons, this kettle has soothing blue light LED. Finally, this kettle has nice shape and design unlike some boring cheap kettles.

I noticed after a few uses that water had collected on the heating base. I thought maybe I had splashed some water when filling. It happened intermittently, and then it didn't happen for a few months and now happens all the time. I realized I had been wrong to blame myself - there is a small leak from the bottom of the unit. I threw away the box, but I intent to contact Cuisinart because $100 kettle should NOT leak. I reluctantly gave it two stars because I liked being able to brew to a precise temperature for my French press and for the various teas my husband and I drink. But this is badly made unit and I would avoid it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't Hold Up to Cuisinart Name
reviews.reviewText: I really like this kettle and used it a lot over the last 3 years. It came with a 3 year limited warranty -- my starting date was 9/15/13. After about a year, if I overfilled it even a little, it would leak. Starting this year, if I put more than about a liter in it, it would leak. The leaking is between the inside cylinder and the view window that shows water level, so not something I could get to. On about 9/22 of this year (yep, about a week after the limited warranty ran out), it stopped heating the water. Lights come on, but no heating action. So disappointing and for the price I was hoping it would last longer. My other cuisinart equipment has lasted a lot longer. My food processor is 33 years old and still working well.

Do not buy one of these, and really ask yourself if you ever want anything from Cuisinart ever again. I had one of these delivered to me in February of this year. It was great at first. Worked quickly, and did what I would expect. Then, after maybe 50 uses, I would press the button to turn it on, and after a couple of minutes, it would beep and turn off. No hot water at all. I contacted Cuisinart about the warranty, but it is going to cost me to mail it to them and to have it mailed back. The customer service was very slow and disrespectful. When I told them I ordered it through Amazon, they said they will not honor anything purchased through Amazon at all. So, a defective product with a three year warranty that cost me $100 is now garbage after only a couple months.

reviews.reviewTitle: We got this as a replacement under warranty for an ...
reviews.reviewText: We got this as a replacement under warranty for an older model. We much prefer the older model. This one has lots of temperature settings, which we don't use, only the one for boiling water. The lid doesn't stay closed, and pops up when we pour the water, or sometimes when it's still heating. The Keep Warm button is poorly placed, and can be pressed accidentally when we pick it up. Then, it won't shut off, and we have to put the kettle on the counter, not the heating pad, until it cools. Basically, it's too complicated. We just want to heat water to boiling for tea and coffee.
Love this kettle. We have one currently - works great and love the features. Needed one for our guest quarters, so bought the same again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I received a new one and it worked great! Loved it
reviews.reviewText: If you use loose leaf teas and drink different varieties then a tea kettle with different settings is a must. A few years ago my friend and I both bought this tea kettle. Out of the box mine did not work so I had to return it. I received a new one and it worked great! Loved it. Now its been about 5 years and it is going crazy. It will water warm but does not boil or it beeps like it does when its ready, does nothing and then shuts off. Like the other reviewer said when it works it is the best kettle on the market. Now i'm debating on do I take a chance with Cuisinart again (it did last a few years) or just order the Breville? I so loved this tea kettle :-(

My kettle just failed to heat after about two years. I am very disappointed for such expensive kettle. There are too much electronics in such a simple appliance. I thought it would be very good to be able to make different teas with different temperature water. Not a very good experience from such a reputable company. I have gone back to a simple kettle with an on/off switch. KISS!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Save your money and buy something else! Seriously, you will thank me later.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this kettle, I really did. The first two weeks I used it every night to make tea and it worked as advertised. After 2 weeks the lid started to get stuck but eventually opened after the kettle cooled off. After 3 weeks the lid stopped opening and I had to re-assemble it to fix it! OK, I thought, if that is all then I'm good. Well after 4 weeks the heating base stopped working! There was power going to the kettle but it just didn't do anything and after a few minutes of waiting it would beep constantly! I can't believe this "top of the line" kettle broke after 4 weeks of use! Absolute garbage! Save your money and buy another brand. I'm done with Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it while it worked. So sad now
reviews.reviewText:
I got this tea kettle as a gift last November. It was awesome. Heated water fast; different temperature settings for different types of teas. Kept the water warm in between cups. I didn't love that there was still some plastic that comes into contact with boiling water, but it had less than most. Then, 1 year and 2 months after I got it...it just stopped working. I don't know if the thermostat went out or what, but it no longer heats water. For this price....seems like it should last alot longer than one year + 2 months...just long enough to be beyond warranty. So...I'm off to search for a new electric kettle...hopefully one with NO plastic touching the water this time.

Update...I replaced my broken Cuisinart kettle with a Hamilton Beach that has no plastic inside (but does have plastic on the lid). Have to say that I really miss the Cuisinart's feature of keeping the water warm for 1/2 hour. When the Hamilton dies, I'm going back to the Cuisinart...wish it had lasted longer but I love that "keep it hot" feature!

reviews.reviewTitle: DIsappointingly Short Life for the High Price Tag
reviews.reviewText: I loved the multi-temperature feature of this tea kettle - for all of the 6 weeks I had it before it started leaking every time I used it. Back to WalMart it went. Now I don't know what to buy, since I really want the variable temperature selection. I see some cheaper ones that may be worth a try, and likely they'll last like a plain kettle I received as a gift in January 2003 that still purrs along happily.

A nice kettle while it worked, although very loud. I am unfortunately in the growing list of people whose kettle died after just a few months. We used it once a day and were very careful with it. Then one morning it died complete;y unexpectedly. As with all the other reviews the warrantee requires $30 to use or in my case 40% of the cost. BUT now I have no faith in Cuisinart and so won't be replacing it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't poor water cleanly. Flips out at you after boiling if you've left 'keep warm' on. Bad choice for just boiling water.
reviews.reviewText:
Three things I dislike about this kettle:
1. It doesn't pour water in a nice stream and doesn't pour out all its contents. I can never get out all the water I put in, and at the end of pouring, two little extra streams are coming from the edges of the spout. Seems like pouring water is kinda a key feature of a kettle.
2. My typical interaction with the kettle goes like this: Put water in. Press Boil. Press Start. Wait for water to boil. Pour water out. Put kettle back. Keep making breakfast. Two minutes later, be startled when kettle starts flipping out, BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP, because it doesn't have any water in it any more. Apparently reading the product description this is because 'keep warm' is on so it's trying to keep itself warm while empty. There was no way to find that out except by reading the product description. Terrible design.
3. It annoys me that I have to press two little buttons to get water boiling. I know that's a tiny complaint, but the fewer annoyances that I have to deal with before I'm caffeinated in the morning, the better. Give me a kettle with a simple switch at the bottom.

reviews.reviewTitle: The next phase in tea making...
reviews.reviewText: After my last cordless Philips kettle started to make funny boiling noises and very occasionally leak during the pour, I figured it was about time to replace it. I put it on my Christmas list last month and was happy to have received it as requested. The tea making process has vastly improved. The boil time has been cut by 66% and it is really super quiet which I was curious about considering the extra power they threw into this thing. The varying temperature settings make it great for different types of tea. The keep warm function is great for me as I can't always get to the kettle in time. Having to press the "Start" button to stop the keep warm feature after I have lifted the kettle from the base seems a little odd in my opinion, considering the fact it seems to be quite intelligent in knowing that you've done so by turning it's lights off etc. Other than that, this is definitely a five star kettle in my opinion. Also has a very clean boiled water taste, not at all metallic which you can get sometimes with other heating element kettles.

Worst kettle I ever purchased.
I purchased 2 of these blunders, the first one died after 6 months, the lettering on the handle disappeared within 3 months.
The 2nd one, the lettering on the handle disappeared within 5 months and then it started leaking at the base of the handle.
Cuisinart never stands behind their product when it is faulty. Do not buy this kettle!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great kettle with two killer features
reviews.reviewText:
This is a great kettle! It's clean lines complement any kitchen the design, or shall I say the aesthetics, is not the greatest selling point.

Their are three killer features to this kettle. The first is a lid that opens all the way vertical, so you can fill it easily. The second feature, is so simple, I am not sure why it is not on every other kettle, it bleeps when it is boiled, and is quiet while it's boiling. The third feature, is it keeps the water warm for up to 30 min. after it boiled.

This was a present, and I was very happy with my old capital, it's having given sterling service for over seven years. But these three simple things have changed my mind.

Shows what good design and good execution can do to a simple household item.

Had this produce for about 30 days when the bottom seal started leaking. It hadn't been dropped or anything, the drip just became worse and worse until it was unusable and we returned it. Its too bad, b/c it looks nice and worked well except for leaking water everywhere. Its chinese made and just clearly crummily put together. Why can't we get one electric kettle made in the USA?

Have had 2 of these kettles over the last 7 years. First one was a gift, and when it stopped working after 3 1/2 years, I loved it so much that I bought another. The second one just died today and I cannot bring myself to buy another. They just don't last as long as you would expect an appliance whose SOLE job it is to heat plain water. When the kettle works, it's perfect for AeroPress coffee and teas that need less than boiling water. It's easy to set the temp you want, and it heats the water quickly. But at almost $100, it's just too expensive, knowing that it has a fairly short life span. I found a much less expensive stainless steel variable temp kettle here on Amazon.

As others have mentioned, it works very nicely... until it just stops working. Ours did not even make it to the 2-year mark with using it about once a day, maybe a bit less. Also, the markings on the temperature selection do wear out very quickly. I doubt we have any paperwork for the warranty, but after reading reviews, it is worth checking. Darned Planned Obsolescence!

reviews.reviewTitle: It will start water leaking on your counter.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought couple years ago, I liked almost everything,how it looks and works.
I have some issues with the cover to close it, but my main problem is, it starts leaking.
I never ever have this issue with any electric kattles, I was actually shocked.
Not buying anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: nice kettle -- the SECOND one -- first one water tasted awful.
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: Bought a 2nd kettle of the same brand/model and the water tastes fine. The other one must have been a lemon. Taking it back. Heats quickly and works nice for presentations/meetings. Different water temperatures for different types of tea is nice. I find the lowest setting -- 160 degrees -- is plenty hot for tea. boiling is too hot for a non-insulated cup. Surface of kettle gets hot when in use so you may want to make a caution sign if using it at a meeting or with people who aren't familiar with it.

I am concerned about the reliability over time...check out some of the 1-2 star ratings. Keeping my fingers crossed...

Original Review:
Just bought this and love the way it heats and the features, but the water tastes TERRIBLE!!!! Cuisinart suggested boiling white vinegar and or/lemon juice as many times as it takes to make the taste go away.

I have read this about other kettles but not this one. I am very disappointed as I bought it for a meeting I am hosting tonight. Hopefully the taste will go away or it will be going back for an exchange or refund.

Will update review if taste goes away.

I bought this at Bed Bath & Beyond for $79.99 with a coupon...still pretty pricey. Bought it because it appeared to be the best-made one they had!

Got this kettle so I could dial in a 175 or 185 f temperature to brew my aeropress coffee. It works perfectly, quietly, and quickly.
2 complaints. I wish it were smaller. It'd be great if they made a half size "personal" version of this kettle. I never need more than .5L of water, so I hope I'm not doing any damage by only filling it to the minimum line every day.
Second complaint is probably common to all metal kettles. The pour lip has a small bump inside where the lip is welded to the body of the kettle. It seems to make the water dribble unpredictably as it pours out (I'd much prefer a smaller, more focused stream). But worse, I can't fill the kettle from my filtered water spout on my refrigerator directly without the water hitting that little lip inside and spraying all over the floor. Maybe I can grind it down sometime when I get the energy.
But otherwise, it's great, and the water seems perfectly heated.

I had high hopes for this "stainless steel" kettle, but alas it does have plastic parts. The lid on the inside, the hinge for the lid, the plastic holder for the filter (where the water exits) - all plastic. If you are concerned about boiling water coming into contact with plastic, do not get this kettle. I washed the interior and rinsed it before use. I poured my first cup of tea and found there was an extremely strong chemical odour. I decided to boil another pot to see if the smell would go away, but it was still there - just less intense. It's going back tomorrow.

This kettle is awesome!
I got this for Christmas, and I loved it from the start. Very easy to use. Just pick your type of tea and push start. The water line is lit up when on the base, so you know how much you have. There is a built in keep warm feature that remembers your last tea choice. The no water safety feature is need too. It will not heat if there is little to no water in the kettle. I keep mine plugged in, but just hit start twice, and it turns off. Just great quality over all.

Kettle works, though I have no way of knowing if the temperatures generated are accurate. It quickly gets the water hot enough to steep my tea.

My problem, as many others have reported, is the lettering fading and disappearing over time. This despite gentle use. And *all* lettering disappears, not just on the button I use. I just rewrote the temps on the buttons with a sharpie. Time will tell if the sharpie lasts longer than the original lettering.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best gifts I have ever received -- Perfect!
reviews.reviewText:
I am a big fan of top quality oolong teas, and needed a tea pot that heated the water to the precisely right temperature. This one does the job time after time. And it remembers the settings you use!

When guests want boiling water or French Press coffee, it works great for them too!

Pros:

Beautiful, reliable (I've had it for over a year, no scaling, no leaking, works great), easy to fill, easy to pour, great handle.

Cons:

If it gets unplugged, it forgets the settings you use.

Highest recommendation possible!

I love it!

Worked perfectly nicely for 3-1/2 years. It gave up the ghost suddenly this morning. Just checked--warranty was for 3 years. C'est le vie....

However, after searching for a replacement, we've decided to get this one again and assume it has a 3-1/2 year useful life.

reviews.reviewTitle: It worked great but it only lasted 10 months
reviews.reviewText: It worked great but it only lasted 10 months. It wouldn't power on all of a sudden. I tried everything but it still did not power on. Good Product but for sure the lifespan of this product is way too short. I tried to return it & get another one since it was purchased less than 1 year ago but Amazon doesn't does not consider this item a returnable item after 30 days.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... be a lovely kettle if it were put together better. Unfortunately
reviews.reviewText:
This would be a lovely kettle if it were put together better. Unfortunately, after having had this a while, it is corroding around the spout, the labels on all the buttons have worn off, and the lid sticks in both the up and the down positions, requiring me to essentially pry it open.

Just generally not as well made as I wanted it to be.

Edit: Further update; Eventually, it got sick of me prying the lid up and pushing it down, and the whole lid came apart for good. Not impressed.

Within one week of daily use, the inside bottom has a rust spot. We have been diligent about emptying the kettle and leaving the lid open after every use and have only used filtered water.
Functionally - we love this kettle, but clearly the stainless used in manufacturing this is sub-par....good quality stainless should not rust.

-UPDATE- 2/1/2013

We decided to give this another try and we loved using this kettle. No rust on the new one...BUT it suddenly tanked after just under one year. It will not heat water anymore. It died without any warning signs, just stopped working.

reviews.reviewTitle: and were pretty happy with it
reviews.reviewText: We bought this about 2 years ago, and were pretty happy with it. But it then abruptly died this week, all i does now is giving a steady beep and flashes. We have to resort to using the $15 one that my mother used to use for 20 years. I'm not sure what broke, but my hunch is that the temperature sensor on the inside. If all you're using this for is to boil water, then you should consider one that doesn't have this temperature sensor inside, might last longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've had this electric water kettle for 3 beautiful years and now it's leaking water
reviews.reviewText: I've had this electric water kettle for 3 beautiful years and now it's leaking water. We've always used it to standard so not sure why it fails now but it IS convenient that the warranty is also 3 years. :(

I am not really a specialist of the topic. This is the first electric kettle I ever owned so keep this on mind. The kettle is very quiet, looks very cool, is super fast and I can say there is nothing bad about it. I own it for 2 months now and until now everything is working perfectly. Therefore I agree with most reviewers.
If you want a beautiful and reliable kettle seriously consider this one. It s metallic style goes better with more modern kithens though. If your kitchen s style is more traditional and colourfoul it might look a bit off. The blue light might be a bit cheesy but in the correct kitchen it can look great!

I had been looking for some sort of kettle-boiling the water in a saucepan for my French pressed coffee each morning was getting old. I got interested in these about 2 months ago but there were none, anywhere. I even contacted Cuisinart and they said they would have them in stock on May 15th. This didn't make sense, but since just reading the review about the fire issue, I'm thinking (don't actually know) that they recalled them. I finally got one a few weeks ago and it is amazing. My coffee tastes much better (the water is below boiling for French pressed) and it is very quick to boil. We have very hard water and even having a built in filter at my sink, I can still get build up. I am appreciative of the small replaceable filter on this unit. I really like good quality small appliances: I have a Zojirushi rice cooker, a kitchen aid toaster and now this. I'm happy!
Broke days after the warranty and they did nothing to help me. I thought Cusinart stuff was worth the extra money because it’s built to last...guess not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tea and coffee lovers need this!
reviews.reviewText: I love this product. I am a huge tea lover and I french press my own coffee. My boss had this water boiler in the office and since the first moment I've used it I fell in love with it. I got it as a gift a year ago and it has served me so well! I love the different settings as well as the "keep warm" function. After a while it also shuts off in case you forgot to turn it off. So it is absolutely perfect and I would not trade it for another one. Thank you Cuisineart!

I love this electric kettle. I received this as a gift and have used it daily since. It heats up in under 5 minutes and beeps to let you know it's done. It is hot to the touch but if you use the handle like your suppose to, it won't burn you. The only downfall is that it's a little noisy when heating the water. I originally intended to take this to work but decided against it due to the noise. I would recommend this product.

Just got my Cuisinart teapot and used it for the first time. I LOVE IT!!! The water heated up sooooo fast and it had the perfect choices for what temp to brew my tea. We had originally bought the Zojirushi from the Teavana store, but after reading the directions we immediately returned it!! (It sounded as though you'd need to decided you wanted tea about 2 hours in advance if you were going to use the thing. Huge downgrade.) But the Cuisinart pot is just the opposite. I know I'll be using it every day and may need to get a second one for work.

This was a disappointing purchase. First of all the pouring spout is terrible and un-precise! Trying to pour into a small cup or bottle and the water spills everywhere. I haven't even had this kettle for two weeks and the Open button no longer works, and the top section fell apart. I am returning this for another kettle.

I use this wonderful kettle every single day. I drink lots of different kinds of teas and even a some coffee every so often. This smart kettle allows me to adjust the water temperature to suit each beverage and ensuring that the tea is brewed correctly. This means no bitterness and a perfect cup of tea every time.

I also love that it will keep the water at the set temperature for you. The automatic turn off after 30 minutes means I don't have to wonder and worry if I forgot to turn it off.

I cannot imagine a better kettle! I definatley recommend this product

reviews.reviewTitle: Looks like this kettle will last about 18-24 months depending on ...
reviews.reviewText:
We purchased ours from Bed Bath and Beyond.

There is a fundamental defect with this kettle that is causing it to leak at the bottom. When it happened the first time we were able to get a new one. Last night the replacement started leaking again so there clearly is a problem with the product. We will see if Bed Bath and Beyond will replace but even then I expect the replacement to leak over time. Looks like this kettle will last about 18-24 months depending on usage.

We've had this for a few months, and we're pleased with it's performance. My spousal unit is British, so we know our electric kettles. The only issue I have with this product is that it's described as a "Cuisinart CPK-17 PerfecTemp Cordless Programmable Kettle" when there is absolutely NOTHING even remotely programmable about it. All of its programs are preset and cannot be changed by the user. This seems like a significant misrepresentation to me.

I have this kettle and since my friend warned me that her kettle button lables were wearing away, I put clear nail polish on the buttons when I first got the kettle. This has worked great! I do see that after over a year of use that the majority of the inside bottom of the kettle is stained black (burnt looking.) I've tried cleaning with vinegar; no luck.

reviews.reviewTitle: but it's been great. I use it for a variety of teas ...
reviews.reviewText:
A bit expensive for an electric kettle, but it's been great. I use it for a variety of teas and french press coffee. It works every time and seems to make things taste better (especially delicate herbal teas).

The only complaints are that the stainless sides do get hot (careful) and also show fingerprints/cleaning easily.

Received this as a belated xmas gift from my mom. Now, after about a month of use, it is leaking! A lot!! My mom bought it on Amazon and I think we're out of the allotted return window so will have to put in some effort to try to get a replacement (either through Amazon or Cuisinart). Happy to give it another try because of all the good reviews out there and because it was recommended by wirecutter whose reviews I trust. Fingers crossed that I can get a replacement... Sigh.

Worked great for about 2 years. It's very nice looking, and I used it all the time with no problems at all.... Until it just completely stopped working last week. It will not turn on at all. Waiting for Cuisinart to respond to my inquiry for a replacement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good kettle with a couple of flaws
reviews.reviewText: I really loved this kettle with the different temperatures available but there were two things that I didn't like. First, the numbers wore off as other reviewers complained about. Second, I accidentally turned mine on without it being filled with water. It fried and killed my kettle. It would be nice if there was a sensor to prevent that happening.

reviews.reviewTitle: beautiful but it leaks after several months of no frequent use
reviews.reviewText: I bought this kettle in January this year. It is nice and of style, but it begins to leak while water is added up to 0.75L after several months of use. Water leaks drop by drop until it boils and when it boils, it is accumulated on the bottom and overflows onto my table. It becomes a painful thing to use it from that time, seeing water flows drop by drop from the transparent blue part all the way while it boils water. I decide to buy a gastop kettle instead of using this electric one. I don't want to replace it with a new one from manufacturer as I am an international buyer.

This is a great electric kettle and wonderful for heating up water for tea and my french press. However, after 6 months it just magically stopped working.
I emailed amazon about this issue--- clearly I'm not the only person who had this problem. I hope they refund my money or I won't be buying this type of item on amazon anymore. Not to mention this is the 2nd cuisinart appliance to stop. I don't think I'll buy their products in the future.
** update, Amazon replaced it for free with no hassle. Which is awesome and why I shop here. But, I hope it doesn't break again.

Loved it until it quit. Lasted 1 and 1/2 years and the best it can do now is keep the water luke warm. Is there a guarantee? Checked with Cuisinart about it and yes their is a 3 year warranty. And without any hassle they will be replacing my Cuisinart CPK-17 perfectemp. It will only cost the $10 for the shipping fee. So it does pay to follow up on any warranties,

I love this thing! I use the boiled water setting when I need water to scald tomatoes when canning them. And of course there are the usual uses of tea, hot chocolate, oatmeal, theraflu, cuppasoup, etc. I've had it for three years so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money. Broke already
reviews.reviewText: This was a gift. I liked that you could control the temperature. Not worth $75. It broke in less than a year. If I left it plugged in it would turn on by itself in the middle of the night. Sometimes it just wouldn't turn off. Then today it just stopped turning on all together.

This is a very elegant looking kettle with touch buttons that is tea specific. Stainless steel frame gives it a very sturdy look BUT, and this one is big, the kettle leaks from the base when tilted at about 30 degree angle. The bigger question is not why I tilt the kettle but WHY it leaks from the base???
I called cusinart but the customer rep but he seemed least bit interested in trying to learn about the problem. His only suggestion " send the product back to manufacturer ". Thanks for the insight genius.
I will be returning this kettle. Anyone else experiencing the same issue?

reviews.reviewTitle: Once you get it you will wonder how you lived without it
reviews.reviewText: This is a great product, the second one we have purchased. The only issue we have had is after heavy use the print on the frequently used buttons are starting to wear off, so they can not be read. We know what they say, but it would be nice if they were more durable. I would have given it 5 stars except for this one issue - but it obviously did not bother us since we bought a second one to give as a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: What is this bluish discoloration on kettle bottom?
reviews.reviewText: After using this kettle for 1 week, I have noticed that there is some weird bluish discoloration on the inside bottom of the kettle that goes about 3/4 of the way around it (see photo). I am wondering if this is a defect.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, BUT hold temperture feature breaks
reviews.reviewText: I like the function and features of this kettle very much, but I've had 2 in less than 2 years and they both have had the same problem. Once the kettle reaches the desired temperature, it beeps and then holds the temperature for a while, at least 30 minutes. I really like this feature, but it stopped working about 2 months into use of my first kettle. I exchanged it for a new one at the big box store where I purchased it. Now it has broken again, about 15 months later. IT does have a 3 year warranty, so I will take it back to the store for an exchange.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not your average tea kettle!! It's better!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: I cannot tell you how much I love this kettle. I'm not a huge tea drinker but it is so good for heating up water for a cup of soup, hot chocolate, and the occasional cup of tea. The speed with which it heats is amazing! Worth every penny.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 2 months, Poor customer service
reviews.reviewText:
Below is the text of the letter I wrote the company. Hopefully they will decide to be known for good customer service.

Cuisinart
attn Phil Schwartz
150 milford rd.
East Windsor NJ 08520

Mr. Schwartz,

Recently we purchased a Cuisinart CPK-17 tea kettle from Amazon for almost $100.. After only 2 1/2 months the kettle stopped heating water. We fill the kettle and push the buttons to turn it on. The lights flash like normal but after a minute or so the kettle beeps and turns itself off. I've tried it several times and it's clear that it's broken. I've checked the online reviews on Amazon and almost 1/4 of the reviews list this behavior. It's pretty clear that this is a known problem (or at least a consistent one) with the CPK-17. Is it a design fault? A supplier/construction issue? Hopefully you are reading the online reviews and taking appropriate action to fix this issue.

I called your customer service line and your representative informed me that I would have to pay shipping to return your faulty product. When I told her that I had a problem with this, she said "check your warranty, you agreed to this". Now, I understand that the fine print may state anything at all, and technically this *is* the letter of the legal agreement, but in light of the fact that many other companies eat the shipping for their own faulty products, and that so many customers have the same issue with the CPK-17, I strongly feel that you are taking advantage of your customers. True, it's only a measly $7, but it's almost more insulting that the amount is so low. It seems extremely short sighted to sell your reputation so cheaply. Did some bean counter with no thought of customer service or the long term reputation of Cuisinart come up with that number? If so, he or she has done much damage to your reputation for nothing in return.

So I am writing to let you know that I will no longer be purchasing Cuisinart products. You have treated your customers shabbily and I do not feel that I should reward your company with my patronage.

I hope your reconsider your actions and decide to become a company known for good customer service. It may cost a little more up front (specifically, it may cost you $7), but in return you will be known as a company that values its customers, treats them fairly, and converts them into "Raving Fans".

*UPDATE*
Someone at the company contacted me and offered to ship me a replacement unit at their cost. So far (2 months) the replacement is working fine. I am updating my rating from one start to 3 stars (neutral). I'm sorry that I had to go through so much trouble to get the company to do the right thing (and be so public about it), but I'm glad they did so in the end. Here's hoping they do away with the silly $7 self-destructive nuisance fee.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... electric kettle as a Christmas gift and we absolutely love it! We love all the different temperature settings
reviews.reviewText: Got this electric kettle as a Christmas gift and we absolutely love it! We love all the different temperature settings. We use a french press every morning and drink tea throughout the rest of the day. The keep warm option is fantastic too so we can heat it up in the morning and walk away while we get ready for work and still have hot water up to 30 minutes later! Definitely recommend.

It is important to brew teas at the right temperature. This pot gives me choices so I can get the best flavor from various types of tea.

Since it takes a while to get hot water to the kitchen spout, I frequently boil a pot of water to get a head start on getting a sink full of hot water for washing dishes.

I have used this pot at least six times a day for a year and a half.

Definitely will purchase another one.

This is amazing. Quick. Efficient and easy to handle. We use this for just about everything, from coffee to oatmeal it heats water at the right temp faster than a microwave or stovetop kettle and it keeps the water the right temp for 30 minutes! We LOVE it!

reviews.reviewTitle: This was great, but be warned that it's a disposable item ...
reviews.reviewText: This was great, but be warned that it's a disposable item as soon as it's out of warranty. The buttons stopped working on my kettle (and my family and friends have had the same experience). I called Cuisinart and learned that they do not repair this item and don't sell any repair parts. The only option is to replace the entire unit. Buyer beware! This is not a durable item.

reviews.reviewTitle: The "open" lid release no longer opens the top which is annoying.
reviews.reviewText: rec this christmas 2015, i dont use it that often but it works well when i do. The "open" lid release no longer opens the top which is annoying.

The good:
+boils fast
+push buttons are great... perfect french press, green tea, etc at the push of a button
+looks great
+1.7 L is plenty for most uses.

The bad:
- interior bottom surface rusted almost immediately. (Full disclosure the manual says to empty completely and allow to dry after each use. We didn't do this and after 2 weeks of intermittent use it rusted significantly. Pretty disappointing for stainless steel (clearly a low grade or not stainless for that component) and for the most expensive electric kettle I've seen (~$100 at the time))
- stopped working after about 3 months. I took it apart and it seems like every wire inside is 1/16" too short and one had spontaneously disconnected. Worked fine after reconnecting. Once again pretty disappointing for something 4x the price of the basic all-plastic boil-only models.
- going in the trash after I've finally decided I don't want to drink rust water (no taste issue, just seems like best practice)
I only got one year out of this until it pooped out. I used it at least 5 times a day so maybe it couldnt handle that? It worked great until then.

reviews.reviewTitle: You know what WOULD be great though? A fill line on the side of ...
reviews.reviewText: I've had mine for 3 weeks now. I wish I didn't have to fill it all the time-but that's my fault for drinking so much tea. You know what WOULD be great though? A fill line on the side of the kettle. The placement underneath the handle is awkward to see while you hold it under the tap, but I guess the nifty sci-fi blue light makes up for it!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great buy for coffee aficionados
reviews.reviewText: Using boiling water to make coffee is like wearing socks with sandals--it is probably okay for the general population, but it is not right. That's why you should get this little puppy. There are few buttons that allow you to preset the desired temperature and an alarm that tells you when the water is ready. My coffee has never tasted so good.

We received this kettle as a wedding gift about six moths ago. Before this I had a cheap plastic kettle that was working perfectly fine for over 3 years but I wanted a cordless and larger capacity kettle. It worked fine for 6 months and we liked different temperature settings. Recently I began to notice that it is taking much longer to boil the water. The kettle would start boiling, pause for a few seconds, work again and pause again until you hear the beeping. I thought it was just my imagination but once my husband noticed the same thing I decided to call Cuisinart.

The customer representative was very rude and disrespectful. I explained him the situation and he just cut me off to read through the pre-recorded limited warranty crap saying that I have to pay for the shipping both ways if I want a replacement. When I asked how would I know if this is not going to happen again after paying $30 for shipping, his response was "this is an electronic machine, this can happen anytime, this is an electronic machine" he must think that I am an Amish who is using an electronic device for the first time in my life.

Long story short, I got him to a point where he agreed to waive their shipping cost but I was so upset with the way he treated me that I am not sure if I want another Cuisinart. Cuisinart should understand that customers do not chose a brand and pay a good amount of money because they are idiots or naive. We want to be treated with respect and kindness since we chose you over so many competitors. I am confident that just like me, many people switched over to another brand because of the way you handle your customers. I rather pay another $60-70 and buy another brand than pay $30 to replace my Cuisinart. Shame on you.

This obviously cost about 5 times what a normal electric kettle costs. Within 2 months the top lid broke. Thats when I discovered that the fabulous customer service at Cuisinart makes you pay for shipping BOTH WAYS!! OK, well it was just the lid. Now 5 months after that, the Kettle just stopped working completely. Done with this, done with Cuisinart. Ill be replacing this with a 15$ kettle. At least when that breaks, I wont feel like a total chump.

I've owned this now for three years. And there is only one reason why I can't give it five stars. The lettering/numbering is applied merely with paint and have worn off over time from use. Now I have to write them on with a sharpie every month or so. Would it cost that much more to emboss or etch the letters in the button? What makes it great is that it is preset temperatures but not so great when they aren't on the buttons anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to operate and is efficient
reviews.reviewText: Easy to operate and is efficient. I was loyal to my tea pot on the stove but have given it away for my Cuisinart. I have had mine for over a year and use it several time per week. Works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Button decals rub off after a few months
reviews.reviewText: This heats the water quickly to temp, working well even 3 years later. Only complaint- the decals on the buttons rubbed off after just a few months. I’ve since written the temps on the buttons in permanent marker.

This product was great while it worked. It heats up water quickly and to an accurate temperature.

The trouble is, it doesn't work anymore. It doesn't heat water. The kettle is quite useless to me sitting on my counter-top, taking up space, not heating up water.

2 stars because it works well when it....works. Reading reviews, it appears that I am not an odd case. The failure rate is high enough to consider the product defective. I'll try a different brand/model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing - lasted only about a year
reviews.reviewText: Ours served us well for about a year. Then it stopped heating. It did not measure the water temperature properly anymore and concluded the water was already at the requested temperature. If this happened to a $30 kettle I'd think you get what you pay for. But a $99.95 kettle should last longer.

reviews.reviewTitle: As per many of the other 1 star reviews, ...
reviews.reviewText: As per many of the other 1 star reviews, this unit worked really well for about one year. Then broke. Now it does not work at all. I suspect whatever electronics they use are not properly shielded from the heat. Disappointing.

Bought this kettle (not on Amazon) about 9 months ago. Worked great until a few ago when it started leaking at the base of the handle. No response from Cuisinart customer service. Would not recommend.
Bought this kettle two times. Each time it lasted less than 2 years. Never again.

reviews.reviewTitle: but I can't recommend this enough for tea
reviews.reviewText: I bought mine from another vendor, but I can't recommend this enough for tea. Water temperature is almost as important as good leaf. The water boils amazingly quick, and it stays hot inside long enough for you to take your time drinking the tea.
This was my first and it didn't last long - less than 6 months. I've seen the reviews about the temperature labels rubbing off - my didn't last long enough for that.
Leak at the bottom after 3 month of use!!! Never buy again this brand!!!

Product worked OK - very noisy and slow but got the job done. Worked for 5 months and then suffered a serious short which blew the breaker in the house. Cuisinart customer service informed me that they would replace but I have to pay for shipping to and from ($35 total). So in short they build a cheap product that stops working after 5 months and I have to pay half the price to replace it. The cost (not price) of this product is around $15 by the time they get it to the US so they give me a new one and I cover the most expensive part of the exchange. The question is what is driving this company to improve its products if the customer carries the bulk of the warranty? Shocking way to treat your customers and a poorly designed bad quality product. Had enough - I will never buy Cusinart product again. They give me a very limited warranty - I give them no future business.

Given to me as a gift. Really liked it, especially the variable temperatures and automatic shut-off. I use it at least 3-5 times a day. Unfortunately, it has only lasted a year and a half. The markings for the settings wore off within months, and now the hinge for the lid doesn't work properly and jams, difficult to close. I now fill it through the spout to avoid fighting with the lid. Also wish it were marked in cups, but I can do the math.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glue in the bottom of the kettle??
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this kettle a few weeks ago and noticed what looks like black glue or epoxy in an area on the inside on the bottom where the heating plate is attached to the inside of the kettle. I called Cuisinart to ask how the plate is attached and the person I spoke with said she did not know but would have someone in "upper management" contact me. I'll update my review when I hear from them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent quality. I received it as a gift about ...
reviews.reviewText: Excellent quality. I received it as a gift about five years ago and we have gotten so much (almost daily) use out of it and will probably use it for years to come. It works perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: I received this as a gift- I really love it. It's compact
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a gift- I really love it. It's compact, attractive, and easy to use. I love the keep warm feature. I hate to admit it- but the folks at the tea store are correct. The temperature at which you brew your tea really does affect the taste.

I've had this kettle for about 3 years. I love that I can bring water to a lower temperature if I am brewing green tea. It is pricey, and it's not the fastest kettle I've ever seen but it's good-looking and it works well.
I love this Kettle. Works incredibly well.
My Cuisinart is rusting on the inside... this is quite an expensive kettle to be rusting!

This is a nice looking product but I have one big problem with it. Once the water boils, it makes 3 quiet beeps. If u have music or your vent running, then this is hard to hear and you're not quite sure if the water is done. The stay hot feature is nice but I'm energy conscious and I boil when I'm ready so this feature is kind of a pain for me because u have to remember to shut it off after u pour.
Also, the stainless is one more thing to maintain in my kitchen which already has all stainless steel appliances. I had a white one before and I didn't have to do too much to that (no water spots on white)
Also, we had a much cheaper Braun white one before and I don't see this boiling water much faster for the price, if any faster. It lasted us 8 years. Hope this lasts as long,

However, it would benefit from a polished steel interior, like the less expensive version that Cuisinart makes- the water mineral deposits are greatly reduced in a polished interior. Also, the top opening could be larger, in order to facilitate cleaning. Otherwise this is excellent.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything you would ever want from a tea kettle
reviews.reviewText: Although I did not buy this on Amazon, I can attest that this kettle is a great balance between price, quality and the ease of use. The features that I liked the most were: one-click temperature selection, 30-minute "keep warm" mode (you can also turn it off if not needed), and (believe it or not) integrated lid (less parts to handle). Very happy with the purchase!

I received this item as a gift. It was about a month before I got around to using it. I first time I hit the open button the metal part fell off, taking the plastic clips that held it on with it. Now it won't shut. I'm not sure why they would make the locking mechanism out of such cheap plastic, while spending the money to make the aesthetic parts metal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broken in Less than a year!
reviews.reviewText:
I was on the fence for awhile between this kettle, the Breville Temp Select or a Zojirushi Water Heater/Dispenser. I was previously using a stainless stove top kettle, which made it a bit tricky at times, to get the water to the right temperature for the tea I was brewing. I decided on this one because it does everything I want it to do; boils water quickly and provides various water temperatures for different varieties of tea. It was also at a reasonable price point. I brew whole leaf tea and this makes brewing a fresh cup an absolute breeze! Easy to use, aesthetically pleasing and so far, nothing I would change!

Update 4/29/11
Purchased this Kettle in 10/10
It is now going to hit the trash.
It no longer heats up at all and I contacted Cuisinart.
They will send me a new unit if I pay shipping both ways, no way!
Not heavily used at all and very disappointed!
Thankfully, I have a traditional stove top kettle to use in it's place.
Everything made today seems to be so disposable and not made to last.....sad!

I did pretty extensive research before buying an electric kettle. The CPK-17 appealed to me on a few different levels. I liked the design, the materials used and the functionality. Although it's nice to have the option of different temperature settings, it's really only useful if you drink a lot of tea, which I don't. I generally use the "French Press" and "Keep Warm" settings, and there's also a Boil option (which is the next setting up from French Press). On the design side, it's a great looking appliance made from mostly stainless steel. Of course a big concern of mine is the use of BPA-leaching plastic in many kettles on the market, but there appears to be none on the interior of the CPK-17. The water level, as far as I can see, is covered with another sheet of steel. The only non-steel component I see on the kettle's interior is a silicone nub near the bottom, which nearly all kettles have and which are also heat-resistant. Another thing I like about the CPK-17's design is the 360-degree swivel capability of the kettle while resting on its heating element. And of course, the illuminated water level (on when the kettle is in use) is very attractive - a nice soft blue color. The pouring spout is perfectly-shaped which makes for a fool-proof pour every time. In terms of functionality, the CPK works exactly as advertised. Heat-up time is quick and the controls are responsive.

The major complaint I have with the CPK-17 is the fact that it's already scaling at the bottom and I've only had the kettle for 2 weeks. To me, this is crazy - especially considering I use filtered water by Multi-pure (one of the most advanced filtration systems available), so the water is as clean as it gets before it even goes into the kettle. No chlorine, no calcium, no lime -- so what's with the scaling deposits already? It's annoying, and I wonder if other owners have had similar issues. Anyway, I'm giving this product 4 stars. To recap...

Pros:
- great design, little if any interior plastic
- smooth functioning, fast heat-up

Cons:
- Scales easily after only a few uses
- Pricey

reviews.reviewTitle: Help our environment, stop selling these kettles.
reviews.reviewText: This kettle keeps heating water for 30 minutes after you start it. It is the default settling, what a huge waste of energy.
